story:
We need you!

Help us spread the word about Haight Ashbury Psychological Services. 


We need a better website to continue offering low-cost, sliding-scale therapy to our community. 


This is our current website:


As you can see, it's a bit...outdated

We need to redesign it to spread the word about the counseling services we offer.


Currently, only 6% of referrals come from the Internet and our website. 

Help Us Serve Our Community by Making our Website More Accessible

Our plan for the redesign involves hiring a web designer with SEO skills who can make a website that is easier to use and easier to find on the Internet. Having a web designer with search engine optimization experience will make it easier for people searching for help to find HAPS.  


Haight Asbury's Psychological Services Mission:

Founded in 1979, our mission is to improve the lives of people in our community by providing low-fee sliding-scale psychotherapy to those in need, and education, training, and supervision to those who serve.  

In our community, psychotherapy is easily affordable for the affluent, and publicly funded programs exist to serve the very poor. But between these two extremes are many who do not have insurance and whose incomes cannot quite meet the cost of psychotherapy. Haight Ashbury Psychological Services (HAPS) was created to fill that gap, so that everyone in our community can have access to quality professional care. 

Why is HAPS so Important? 

With so many San Francisco residents in need of mental health services, and so few low-few counseling centers still in operation, HAPS provides vital counseling services on a compassionate sliding scale. Whether a client is in crisis or looking to reduce anxiety or improve his or her relationship, the trained counselors at HAPS provide affordable counseling every month. In addition to direct therapy services, the program also works with therapists in training to grow their practice and gain the experience they need to become skilled, fully-licensed therapists. Support these essential community programs today. We train between 14 and 18 interns per year. That's close to 600 trained therapists over the years.  

We Were Voted San Francisco's Favorite Charity by 7x7 magazine

      

 

But who are we? 


We are a group of passionate individuals who serve on the board of HAPS:


We are also trainees and interns, working toward licensure as psychotherapists and psychologists: 




What do YOU get?

Perks! We have tons of perks that you can claim!  Look to the right to see the perks we're making available.


That great feeling of making a difference in the world!  HAPS operates on a tiny budget, so your small (or large) contribution makes a huge difference to us!


At the $10 Level: An Assortment of HAPS stickers and a wristband

 


At the $15 Level: A Handmade Holiday Watercolor Card

                                                     




Other ways you can help

  • Spread the word about our campaign! Forward campaign emails, share on Facebook, and use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Volunteer for HAPS: http://www.hapsclinic.org/support-haps/voluntee...


Have questions? 

Emails us at: hapsclinicsanfrancisco@gmail.com

story:
Short Summary

  • Cheshire's Herbals is seeking to open a retail store and herb school in the historical town of Wailuku, HI.  Wailuku has recently began to be renovated and become alive again with local business booming, especially in the areas of natural healing, yoga and health foods.
  • Cheshire's Herbals began in 1999 by owner and professional herbalist, Traci Miller, with the product The Original Healing Salve.  This product brought healing to many people's cuts, scrapes, burns and dry/cracked hands and feet with testimonial after testimonial.  The Original Healing Salve inspired a product line to expand to high-quality natural and certified organic herbal teas, salves, and other natural herbal remedies.  Cheshire's Herbals moved to Maui, Hawaii in 2004 and has offered herbal teas and remedies to local stores at wholesale costs and on-line retail sales.  Traci is now ready to open a physical location retail herb store emporium and wellness center in Maui, HI.
  • Traci Miller is a professional herbalist that attended Northwest School for Botanical Studies, Widsom of the Earth Aromatherapy School and Everglades University with BS in Alternative Medicine.   Traci managed The Dragon's Den Herb Shop in Maui for 6 years and has 11 years experience with natural supplement retail sales.  Traci has successfully owned Cheshire's Herbals since 1999.
  • Contributions to this campaign go towards start up costs of rent, deposit, utilities, insurance, interior furniture, and retail supplies of a new herb shop.   
  • Please help me make my dream come true and offer Maui County affordable natural herbs, teas, and healing modalities in a central location.
  • Feel free to contact me with any questions or info.  808.214.0866

What We Need & What You Get

  • $8000 Goal goes towards:  $3600 rent and deposit, Electric deposit $300, Insurance (Renters and Liability) $500, Internet/Phone set up $300, Interior Furniture $2000, Supplies (Jars for bulk herbs, paper bags, and office supplies and register) $1000, store sign $300
  •  After managing the only upcountry herb shop on Maui for 6 years, Traci Miller, owner of Cheshire's Herbals noticed a need for an herb store in a more centrally located area to serve more of Maui county.  With expertise as an herbalist, retail management of natural supplements and healing products, and existing business and reputation of product and knowledge, Traci feels confident that a new herb store and wellness center in the historical town of Wailuku, HI will be successful in the year 2016.  Cheshire's Herbals also offers herb classes and use the store as a place of education for natural healing.

    The "Wellness Center" aspect of the business consist of offering healing modalities to on-call professional practitioners, such as massage, facials, acupuncture, chiropractic, homeopathy, nutritional counseling and herbal consultations. 

  • All "Perks" from donations will be sent out regardless if our goal of $8000 is met or not.

The Impact

  • This herb store and wellness center will be a place for Maui community to buy organic natural medicine at an affordable price and a place to learn about herbs and a healthy lifestyle.
  • Cheshire's Herbals offers high-quality herbal teas, healing salves, and herbal bodycare products.  The future focus of Cheshire's Herbals is to have a retail space to expand the product line and also sale the herbal products of other local companies, offer a space for natural healing modalities, and offer Chinese, Western, Ayruveda, and Hawaiian herbs and herbal classes.  
  • The retail space is a place where local community can come to learn an alternative natural approach to a healthy lifestyle.  This store would make natural medicine more available to local community and those in need.
  • Future products include expansion of herbal tea line for specific ailments and seasons.  The future development of Cheshire's Herbals is addressing the common trends in the needs of the local community for healing and demand.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please feel free to share this fund raising campaign to your friends, family and those you think would like to help see an herb store open in Central Maui.

story:
Short Summary

Here at Center Line High School, we have developed a new technology known dryly as the "Multi-purpose Modular Structural Unit" or MMSU.  It is comprised of a base cube structure with integrated mounting points for a variety of attachments, ranging from basic wall sections, to propulsion modules, to robot arms. all of which are intrinsically safe and sealed from the harsh environments it may encounter.  The cubes can be attached in an infinite variety of ways and with as many attachments as one can imagine.  Currently our design will be put through proof-of-concept testing as a robotic submarine, where it's homeostasis and functionality will be tested with extreme pressure and high corrosion environments in the ocean.

What We Need

From contributions within the team we've been able to accrue most of our supplies without spending a dime.  What we need is funding to cover the costs of raw materials.  The structure will be largely built from "Ultra High Molecular Wight Polyethylene" or UHMWPE and partially 3D-printed.   Later, after the prototype phase is complete, we hope to construct our final working robot from 316 stainless steel.

The Impact

The largest concept in our invention is modularity; start with a base structure, and give it the ability to become more useful by networking with its neighbors.  May it be other cubes, or cameras, or a robotic appendage.  

The basic concept has application in most fields of engineering, and has been exploited in many fascinating ways.  We hope that our design will shape the future of connected and modular design.

Specifically we will be working in the ROV (Remotely Operated underwater Vehicle) industry, which sees its largest use in ocean research and hydrocarbon extraction (a multi-billion dollar industry).  Our submersible connected cubes will be able to adapt to any task required, from small observation work to large assembly by simply adding and changing the configurations of cubes.  This would allow companies to buy a shipment of cubes and build a robot to fit their needs at that moment, then change it the next day for another mission, instead of buying many highly expensive robots for each different task. 

Risks & Challenges

With any R&D project there is inherent risk in the design process.  In this particular process we will be working with high pressures at operating depths up to 200 feet underwater.  This, among other design challenges could lead to a failure, and a need to replace parts, all of which puts our finances in jeopardy.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren't able, or don't feel comfortable giving a monetary donation any other form of help would be  just as welcomed.  Whether it be tech. know-how, advise, or materials, please do not hesitate to contact us!

story:
CareerCortex: Join the Movement to Easier Employment

In our uber efficient society, HR seems to be the last business component to catch up. We can have an international meeting with the click of a button, we can mass message potential clients, and we can have live streaming video almost anywhere we need it, but when it comes to the hiring process, the answer is not so simple. The hiring process includes posting job criteria with daunting details to be proactive and then reviewing potential candidates, interviewing (sometimes up to five times) then of course hiring and hoping for the best. And when all is said and done many employee positions have a very high turn around.

                     


Overview

Our popular culture also reinforces the idea that the hiring process is dated, daunting and extensive. We're out to change that fallacious idea one digital recruiting program at a time! The age of modern recruitment has arrived and CareerCortex is at the heart of this fast-paced, interactive and digital era. Our aim is to empower and invigorate recruitment practices like never thought possible. Help us establish our process for HR departments everywhere. A small donation to this project gets you access to our website and can change your ideas about what you can accomplish for the rest of your life through hiring accomplished and trustworthy employees. Empower us to break the hiring stereotype with a donation to this project today!

 

The average cost of a bad hiring decision can equal 30% of the individual’s first-year potential earnings. (From the US Department of Labor and Statistics) – This fact prompted us to dig deeper into a solution. This is where we started to envision CareerCortex and all the possible benefits:

  • --We know resume writing is challenging so we want to aid in applicant’s ability to extenuate their unique personality and ability to contribute to their prospective employer.
  •  -- We understand what it takes to hire great talent and we know that nothing can replace a face-to-face conversation, but we also believe that modern technology has radically changed the way a first-time meeting should happen. That’s why we want to create virtual interviewing and resume solutions that save time and money but still maintain a personal, authentic experience.
  • --We also encourage users to take the initiative and post their background check info along with their resume to take pride in showing that they have nothing to hide. This gives them a chance to prove their education or employment history.
  • --We want to encourage applicants to make a video of their resume to add their personality to their page and application.

We feel these features make us incredibly qualified to succeed. This paired with attention to detail, and quality service will make us the leader in the industry.

                    


 

Our company is passionate about creating a great hiring platform that’s easy, up to date and efficient. More times than not when companies design new products they contain preliminary flaws, but our goal is to stay dedicated to quality because we know your business and employment is at stake! We have engineered a unique method and user-friendly results that are second to none. Not only that, but they are more efficient and time effective so do not have to worry about it being wasting time or money in getting your next all-star staff member. Help us make this product a reality and let’s get your business staffed properly today!
 

                    


For us to bring CareerCortex to life, we need your support!

Your generous funding will help us get things started to realize our product. It will assist us with the cost of further development, marketing, and production of the first prototype. More importantly you get the chance to be one of the first users of CareerCortex.

We will also be using the funding to improve functionality continuously and to create ancillary programs.

CareerCortex needs pledging but above all it needs your attention and interest! If you love this product as much as we do then please take a moment to click on one of our social media buttons (Facebook, Twitter and YouTube at the bottom of the page). Help us spread the word and get things started!

How We'll Use the Funds

We need about $60,000 in order to break CareerCortex onto the market. That will include marketing, materials, labor and related expenses for production.


Final Thank You and Links

We are so grateful to everyone who has taken the time to read our campaign and for those who contributed what they could to make a difference and to help us spread the word. We have spent the last few months working hard to bring our vision to life in this campaign, and it was worth every minute thanks to all our generous supporters. Please know your efforts, even the smallest, don’t go unnoticed. We will continue to keep you posted on what your donation helped us achieve. You are part of our CareerCortex family.

 

          


If you cannot donate, but you are interested in helping, please contact us so we can find a way to work together. You can still help us a lot just by spreading the word!

If you have thoughts or would like to discuss a collaboration, we would love to hear from you, please feel free to contact us!

story:
We've all had a craving that hit's us harder than a ton of bricks and in no time flat we find ourselves staring at this window on James St. North. Thank goodness Mex-I-Can was there in your time of need. We are now asking you to help us in our time of need to raise money that will help Mex-I-Can relocate and rebuild. 

After 21 years of serving the Hamilton community, we are hoping to make it another 21 years and with your contribution, we can! Donate today to help us set up a new location and be able to offer the same level of dedication to authentic Mexican food!

Update:  We will be adding perks soon, we will keep you all posted.  Thanks all who have already contributed!

story:
“For whatever we lose (like a you or a me)
it’s always ourselves we find in the sea.”
—E.E. Cummings


For summer seekers, wave catchers. For those who feel right at home in the middle of the ocean. For the ones who never stop hunting for that perfect wave. Who appreciate a labor of love, and support businesses built on passion and perseverance… this is your surfwax.
   

Based in sunny Charleston, South Carolina, Viscid Surf was brought to life based on the idea that there’s a value to something being made by hand with love and authenticity and care. And that’s exactly how we make our surfwax.





Developed and used by Kevin Schmoll, a Charleston resident and surfer, Viscid Surfwax is a hand-poured, organic blend made with no harsh chemicals from locally sourced ingredients.

Traditional surfwax is made with petroleum-based ingredients that can harm the environment, but our unique eco-friendly wax is non-toxic and biodegradable. Plus, it features a bumpy texture and added stickiness that traditional petroleum-based waxes simply don’t deliver.  

At Viscid, we’re proud to offer a homegrown surfwax that provides an unmatched grip and lasting traction. And we hope you’ll be proud to call it your brand.




Other Ways You Can Help

To learn more about Viscid Surf visit www.ViscidSurf.com.

If you’re unable to support us monetarily, that’s ok! You can still help by spreading the word about Viscid Surfwax and our campaign. Use the Indiegogo share tools and social media to help generate support for the campaign.

Don’t know what to say? Well then, use one of our pre-made sharing posts! Just copy and paste into your favorite social media network.

·  Apply. Surf. Repeat. #ViscidSurf (http://igg.me/at/viscidsurfwax)

·  For the love of surf. #ViscidSurf (http://igg.me/at/viscidsurfwax)

·  Stick to your passion. #ViscidSurf (http://igg.me/at/viscidsurfwax)

·  Stick with it. #ViscidSurf (http://igg.me/at/viscidsurfwax)

·  Charleston’s Only Organic Surfwax. #ViscidSurf(http://igg.me/at/viscidsurfwax)

·  Love of earth. Love of surf. #ViscidSurf (http://igg.me/at/viscidsurfwax)

·  Surf tested. Earth approved. #ViscidSurf (http://igg.me/at/viscidsurfwax)

Thanks again!

Your Friends at Viscid Surf

Huge and Special THANK YOU to the following:

Genna S. for writing this campaign. 
Check her out at writeamuck.com

Jonathan H. for the video editing and production. 
Check them out  at Certified Evil Genius.

Bryant T. for the surf footage from Folly Beach, SC. 
Check them out at Thomas Brothers Productions

—E.E. Cummings
For summer seekers, wave catchers. For those who feel right at home in
the middle of the ocean. For the ones who never stop hunting for that perfect
wave. Who appreciate a labor of love, and support businesses built on passion
and perseverance… this is your surfwax.
   Based in sunny Charleston, South Carolina, Viscid Surf was brought to
life based on the idea that there’s a value to something being made by hand
with love and authenticity and care. And that’s exactly how we make
our surfwax.








Developed and used by Kevin Schmoll, a Charleston resident and surfer,
Viscid Surfwax is a hand-poured, organic blend made with no harsh chemicals
from locally sourced ingredients. 
Traditional surfwax is made with petroleum-based ingredients
that can harm the environment, but our unique eco-friendly wax is non-toxic and
biodegradable. Plus, it features a bumpy texture and added stickiness that
traditional petroleum-based waxes simply don’t deliver.  
At Viscid, we’re proud to offer a homegrown surfwax that
provides an unmatched grip and lasting traction. And we hope you’ll be proud to
call it your brand.






Other
Ways You Can Help
To learn more about Viscid Surf visit www.ViscidSurf.com. 
If you’re unable to support us monetarily, that’s ok! You can
still help by spreading the word about Viscid Surfwax and our campaign. Use the
Indiegogo share tools and social media to help generate support for the
campaign.
Don’t know what to say? Well then, use one of our pre-made sharing
posts! Just copy and paste into your favorite social media network.
· 
Apply. Surf. Repeat. #ViscidSurf (http://igg.me/at/viscidsurfwax)
· 
For the love
of surf. #ViscidSurf (http://igg.me/at/viscidsurfwax)
· 
Stick to
your passion. #ViscidSurf (http://igg.me/at/viscidsurfwax)
· 
Stick with
it. #ViscidSurf (http://igg.me/at/viscidsurfwax)
· 
Charleston’s
Only Organic Surfwax. #ViscidSurf(http://igg.me/at/viscidsurfwax)
· 
Love of
earth. Love of surf. #ViscidSurf (http://igg.me/at/viscidsurfwax)
· 
Surf tested.
Earth approved. #ViscidSurf (http://igg.me/at/viscidsurfwax)
Thanks
again!
Your
Friends at Viscid Surf


Huge and Special THANK YOU to the following:
Genna S. for writing this campaign. Check her out at writeamuck.com
Jonathan H. for the video editing and production. Check them out  at Certified Evil Genius.
Bryant T. for the surf footage from Folly Beach, SC. Check them out at Thomas Brothers Productions

story:
First of all, just a little info about me: my name is Jamie, and I am a 4th year Science student at the University of Alberta, with the intention of entering Dental school in the summer of 2016. It surprises many people to learn that I have dreamed of being a dentist since the age of 13 (because who would want to work with teeth all day, right!?).

I have been an active volunteer in my community for a number years now, and decided that working with Projects Abroad would be a perfect opportunity not just to volunteer internationally, but to also gain a unique perspective on Dentistry, and life in general, in a developing country.

During my time in Tanzania, I will be working in the dental ward of a hospital, helping with basic dental procedures. I will also be participating in community outreach programs, educating children about the benefits of oral hygiene, and how to maintain proper oral health. 

Being a student, the cost of traveling half way across the world is proving to be a major obstacle. The money you contribute to this campaign will be used to cover the cost of flights, and the cost of the program. Any money raised above the campaign goal will be donated to the hospital I am placed at.

Thank you for your kind support.

story:
Yeboah International Farms is 607-acre farm that grows mangoes, cashews, and maize. We are prepared to put 4,000 Ghanaians to work growing and harvesting the crops that grow right here: the crops that the world wants. We believe this is the most sustainable way to bring long-term employment to Ghanians, and help our country as a whole.

Mangoes are one our biggest exports thus we have developed 20/607 acres and we simply can’t produce enough to keep up with demand. It’s got to the point where one of our biggest processing and production manufacturers is having to airlift the fruit in from Brazil, Mali and South Africa at a vast cost just to keep going and that is where we want to change the game.

Yeboah International Farms owns more than 607 acres of prime farm land in a country that has several weather ecosystems. This allows us to extend our growing season beyond normal, thus increasing our output. We have 100 acres earmarked for cashew nuts, 200 acres earmarked for mangoe and we also plan to plant at least 6000 bags of maize every single year. We already have the updated technology to help us achieve this.

What is the demand for mangoes and cashews? 

Mango-growing nations exported over five times as much mangoes in 2010 as they did in 2001. This owes to a growing global population, and increased demand from nations where the mango cannot be grown, such as the United States and European countries. As for cashews, Nigeria and Côte d’Ivoire are among the top five producers of the nut worldwide. These countries are Ghana’s neighbors. The only thing keeping Ghana from joining these countries is viable farmland, which is exactly what this campaign seeks to develop.

  How has Yeboah secured its farmland?

The equipment secured by this campaign will be available for use by small producers of mangoes, cashews, and maize. This allows us to cover more climatically diverse territory, and put more money back into the hands of these farmers. As it stands now, we have over 607 acres of prime farmland slated for this project. 

Who will be served by this campaign?

Over 4 million people in Ghana’s rural population live below the poverty line – some 39% of the rural population, and 28% of the nation. Life is hard for these people. Many have been making a living by processing fruit that has been airlifted in from other countries. These circumstances have existed because not enough local farmland has been developed for agriculture – until now. 

What will be the effects of growing more mangoes here in Ghana?

Ghana is essentially paying to stay in business as a mango and cashew processor. To meet orders from our buyers, we make up the difference by airlifting in fruits from Mali, South Africa, and Brazil. Though this practice helps us keep our clients, it’s not a sustainable long-term solution. Getting Ghana to produce more of the food it processes benefits the farmers, the producers, and the national economy. Employing local growers and processors means bringing Ghana’s rural population out of poverty – something we are prepared to do on a large scale.

Why crowd funding?

Though we think our idea has merit, resources from organizations which give large grants are limited, especially at the local and national level. Getting small contributors to work together is the business model for our farm operation, and, we believe, will serve us well at this stage too.

What makes Yeboah different from other farms?

We have superior maize production technology that can allow local producers to increase their output. We cover more ground with our land holdings, so we can custom-build a season’s crops according to what grows best where. We are a culturally-aware and technologically-advanced company with the good of the country in mind, and know what can be done when we put our resources together.

We are seeking your help to set up; to help the people of Ghana survive poverty and bring the world the best fruits and nuts from a country that grows the best but cannot keep up with demand. We need to raise $150,000 and this will be used to purchase:   excavators, planters, harvesters, and seeds.

Breakdown of Cost

11,000 for four head Tatu planter from Brazil.

13,000 mini corn harvester from China

11,000 corn shelled meant to shell corn from the cob

15,000 for mango and cashew nut seedlings sold at $1.00 per seedling. 

5k cashew nut seedlings sold will be planted on a 100 acres in 2 years 

10k mango seedlings will be planted on a 200 acre land within 2 years 

$100,000 earmarked for caterpillar excavator 320DL model. Since Ghana has a 

tropical climate the land for farming is mostly forrest with a lot of big trees, which 

need to be uprooted to prepare the land for planting. That is the most challenging 

aspect of the farming project. 


     The excavator will be offered to small holder farmers in the community to expand 

the acres of land they usually cultivated averaging from 5 acres to about 20 acres or

 more.  Yeboah International Farm is in with 300 small holder farmers who will 

expand their farm lands to 20 acres or more to cultivate mangoes and cashew with 

maize since land in this farm area is good for these crops, covering 6,000 acres of 

farm land. This will provide part time and full time jobs for jobs for the youth in 

these communities including women. Thereby increasing their income and food 

production for the poor. 

Through the value chain over 3500 people will be employed from planting, 

nurturing to harvesting processing and selling. 

The harvest timeline for maize is 3 months within the year. There are 2 farming 

seasons:

First season-starts in May and ends in July,

Second season starts. In August and ends in November. Since 3 hundred acres will 

be used to cultivate maize for every 100 acres of land, it is anticipated over 2,000 

bags of maize will be harvested to making 6,000 bags every year. 

Yeboah International Farm will be employing about 500 workers in the field both full 

time and part time from planting, nurturing, processing and selling. 

Mangoes and cashew nuts mature to be harvested during the fourth year after 

being planted from seeding. 


The contribution will help establish our goals and also donate maize to 100 

orphanages selected across Ghana. Yeboah International Farm owns 607 acres of 

land through purchasing it. 



Yeboah International Farm is a subsidiary of H.F.F.L a non profit 501 (c) (3)

story:
Presentation

‘Conscience studio project’ has been existing over a year now. From our (almost) and very modest studio spot we have, that is my garage, we have produced some jingles, talk shows and dramas (from our computers) to raise awareness for the oppress working class and poor people specially those living in rural Nigeria who unfortunately don’t have a voice that echoes to our political leaders and live with fear because of some serious and dangerous groups. This situation makes us   being keen to struggle even more to change the actual conditions of nigerian society and reach all the rural-poor people and oppress working class all over        the world. One society that is also your society, since we live on the same Planet.

Now we are lacking space to keep our ‘studio’ ongoing and we reach to a point we wish for real to put into practice our dream to change our Planet and impact people’ lives.



Our campaign description and what you will support:

‘Conscience studio project’ used to consist on a voluntary studio platform basically to compose and produce a clear message to bosses and the ruling class across the world to stop all their gimmicks and tactics of oppression.  In the view of the above the ‘Conscience project’ is planning now to start a Radio Station with a protracted social media works. The name of the radio station shall be called CONSCIENCE RADIO. Our operating frequency cannot yet be announced until we are registered with the Broadcasting Commission of our country.We plan to operate a Radio Station with an online radio that can be streamed on across the world. We also plan to operate a standard website to cue in all our audience from any path of the world. We shall also centre our radio station work on campaign for love and end racism.


The magnitude of what contributors will help us achieve:

With the above mission and vision enumerated we wish to say that the CONSCIENCE RADIO station will be a groundbreaking News-radio station that will encourage progressive journalists, trade unionist, progressive Non-Governmental organizations, progressive foundations, all strata of oppressed working class and the poor across the world to report ongoing corruption, oppression and government malfeasance in the world. Using text, phone calls, e-mails, photos dynamically, the radio station with the website informs and prompts concerned the citizens of the world and activist globally to act, denouncing officially-sanctioned corruption, oppression, the material impoverishment of its citizenry, defilement of the environment, and the callous disregard of the democratic principles enshrined in the constitution. The radio station is to be formed in the spirit of Article 19º of Universal Declaration of Human Rights, comprising of ordinary people with overriding commitment to saying the truth and broadcasting it without fear or favoritism!!!



What We Need & What You Get

CONSCIENCE RADIO’s mission is to provide trusted sources of information, politics, social, economy and entertainment for curious and thoughtful people         in efficient, sustainable ways that meet the needs of the oppressed people in the world while strengthening the civic and cultural life of communities across the world that we serve.

Because the working class and the poor people that are creator of the wealth cannot take it anymore. For peace to reign in the world injustice and corruption must end because injustice to one is injustice to all. 



The Impact

As a voluntary radio station that didn’t depend on bosses or big corporate support, the CONSCIENCE RADIO’s  vision is to be valued, vital and vibrant service that is indispensable to listeners’ lives, inspires people to look at the world in different ways and capitalizes on emerging opportunities to serve our listeners/communities across the world.  Our campaign values are again against oppression and corruption, being totally keen on building a peaceful society free from rancor, our communities and world in general, lifelong learning by providing a service accessible to all. 

We have manpower that is professional and responsive. They are committed to creating engaging and appealing programs and services in ways that reflect values of civility, respect, integrity and individual responsibility!



Challenges

Overtime the corporate and political establishment has taking over the media but the oppress working class, youth, the less privileged and the poor has been left with no faith.  For the this reason we call on progressive journalists, trade unionist, progressive Non-Governmental organizations, progressive foundations, all strata of oppressed working class to place make a generous donation to this good step towards attain a stage for all ranks to voice out their voices.

The donation will be use to get a complete Radio Station package with a building complex in our location to kick start the good work for humanity. The complete Transmission equipment will cost about $10,000 with shipping and other contingency. Processing of licence with the National Broadcasting Commission will cost about $100,000.

We promise to be faithful and itemized details of how the financial assistance raised for us is been spend:


Complete Transmission Equipment: 

$10.000

Licence*: 

$100.000

Money required for renting 2 rooms or build a small place to get Conscience radio available**: 

$5.000

TOTAL:

$115.000

*Please check www.nbc.gov.ng/licensing.php

It is Category A and FCT means the Capital which is Abuja and the project belongs to Category A, since we are from Abuja. Taking into account that $1 = N198,950 (Nigerian Naira),  N20million=$100.527,80

(based on http://www.xe.com/pt/currencyconverter/convert/?Amount=20000000&From=NGN&To=USD)

**We thought we can build ourselves a modest spot with only two rooms. One room is for our studio equipment and CONSCIENCE RADIO transmission per se from there. The other one is for one bathroom and a small kitchenette for our folks contributors on CONSCIENCE RADIO or even participant inviters. We thought building this modest place since renting an apartment/house here in Abuja is quite expensive. Actually it is more expensive renting an apartment than building one place. You can check what I am saying just by google’ling the actual prices in renting market in Abuja. As for us is more important to get the Licence and Transmission Equipment to make the project available for our community and world community by giving them a voice, a place where they can express their thoughts, opinions and experiences they face every day. And, so we are more concerned to build the place for this to happen. Because we know it could be too much for you that are just like me and my peers, as university students, to also contribute with this amount of money for us to have a place for our radio station.

We shall be glad if you generously contribute to this project to promote and serve humanity by helping us to make CONSCIENCE RADIO a reality and not just a dream.  You will help our community, our rural people, i.e. our society from every corner of the world. 


Please just remember, you folks, that information is power and so we need more information to change the world!

Thank you,

Conscience Radio Team

                                                                  on picture: Fela Kuti


If you have any suggestion to make this project reach his best, please we invite you to write us to conscience.radiong@gmail.com

Our facebook page is also available, please take a look, folks:

https://www.facebook.com/conscienceradiong

We also invite you to be our friends on facebook:

https://www.facebook.com/conscienceradio

story:
Three Amigos Burritos was started in early 2015 with the dream of sharing authentic Tex-Mex cuisine to the population of Taiwan.   Together, Brian (from Texas), Tony (from Taiwan) and Marc (from Canada) opened a small food stand in a local night market in Linkou, Taiwan.  

A few months later, we moved our operation into a small shop nearby so we could be open all day and share our delicious hand-rolled burritos with even more people.   

So far it is a great success and the people who try our food love it!

 

Now we are looking to expand our small shop into a much larger operation.  We are looking for capital to buy addition equipment to expand our menu and also to purchase a delivery/food service vehicle.  

We are asking for your support to help our small business  grow.

In exchange for your kind support of our business, we will be producing t-shirts with our cool logo to show you are a burrito aficionado just like we are!

Another very cool opportunity, our partner Marc left for Canada, so now there's a spot open in our logo for an honorary third amigo!   During this campaign, the top donor over $10,000 will be included in the final logo that will be featured on the t-shirt, print ads, and all store signage.  Your image will become a lasting image in the world.

story:
Visit www.MICPGH.com/Sanctuary for answers to all your questions about MIC.


WELCOME TO 

THE MIC PGH PROJECT

                           

              


MIC PGH stands for Music Industry Connected, Pittsburgh -- we act as a “startup incubator” for local musicians to turn their hobbies into careers through research, consulting, and connecting them with the resources they otherwise wouldn’t have access to.


We develop the IMBM, the “Indie Music Business Model” in real-time by constantly doing music projects so our advice is never outdated.


We’re not a label, we don’t own musicians, we educate them on how to make money off of their music, and find success in Pittsburgh so they don’t have to move away, because now this is all possible right here in this technology-driven music era.


We’re a totally new concept to the music industry – during our public debut these past few weeks, we’ve taken the chance to break down some of the barriers and misconceptions about music careers. We’ve been all around town and online talking to people, meeting people, and sponsoring events -- and the reaction has been overwhelmingly positive.


The money we raise here will allow us to do the following things:


  1. Next IMBM Project: Great Oaks. We will launch our next Indie Music Business Model project (Great Oaks) so we can further our research and staff a team of local freelancers at living wage salaries.

  2. More Relationships/Resources. We will continue to develop and cement the relationships with more resources our musicians need (like publishers and distributors) through that Great Oaks Project.

  3. Book. More details coming soon. (Secret status!)


Along the way you’ll get more Sanctuary video/blogs as behind-the-scenes explanations of everything the MIC team is doing. Transparency is important to us. (Visit www.MICPGH.com/Sanctuary)


We’re an unconventional startup in a tech startup city, and so finding investors has been incredibly hard. I’ve been actively seeking them and if you’re out there, please talk to me!


No one else is doing what MIC PGH is doing:  we don’t want to own musicians, we are here to educate them, at a low cost to them.  And we will not give up on this mission. MIC is going to help so many musicians not give up or move away from their hometowns and families.



And to the awesome MIC Lovers who already pitched in (and those of you that are about to!): thank you.


I’m Emily Plazek, the founder of MIC Pittsburgh. Much love, and peace.



Special Thanks to...

Interns Eric Praniewicz, Joe Pileggi and Lucia Vento; editor Eric Schwartz - and, of course, the whole MIC Team of interns & freelancers,

Crystal Sounds Management & the #CraftMusic Campaign,

And our long-time mentor, Kellee Maize -- the video featured her song "Anyway (feat. J. Glaze)".


MIC PGH, LLC ©2016





This is how we planned to allocate the funds raised here for our original 5 deliverables -- but now any money raised will be reconfigured into our strategy pivot:









...and wait, what are the #CRAFTMUSIC Mystery Bags?


#CraftMusic is a campaign run by another creative company in Pittsburgh: Crystal Sounds Management (CSM). We're featuring it because we believe in their mission to shift perception of the value of local music (which is currently undervalued!) Here's the idea:

Think about your favorite local brew. It's unique, delicious, and doesn't have that "tastes-like-everything-else" manufactured quality. It's probably a little more expensive, too, isn't it? Well good. It should be!

It's a unique product that is unbridled and the brewery that makes it isn't lorded over by some larger overbearing entity telling it what to do in order to make it sound... I mean, "taste" like everything else. 

"So, you mean we can get a quality, unique product when it's made locally!?"  Why yes, that's exactly what we mean. 

That's exactly why local music should be treated the way we treat local brews. It's unbridled, bold, different, and free to be a breath of fresh air in an industry where a few big names run the market. 

#CraftMusic encourages Pittsburgh to look at local music the way it looks at local craft beer – bold, unique, and uninhibited. 

So, our main prizes are #CraftMusic “Mystery Bags". 

These bags feature local music products, and craft brewery coupons/prizes for music listeners and musicians alike – so MIC PGH can support the Crystal Sounds Management vision for #CraftMusic.





OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Of course raising our goal amount will help make the MIC PGH mission come true — but you know what’s also super valuable? Spreading the word!

Here are some actions we recommend:

  • Pick out a cool prize like that “Mystery Bag” and get pumped for the mailman to deliver it!
  • Follow & support & meet that local musician! (They’re probably just as awesome as you are!)
  • Buy a megaphone & shout “MIC PGH RULES” from atop Steel Tower!
  • Tell the guy standing next to you on the elevator!
  • Follow us on social media! 
  • Sign up for the email list! 
  • If you see any of the MIC team, ask for a hug. (We’re incredibly grateful for every little bit you help us out.)

And most importantly: Support your local musicians by going to their shows, buying their CDs and merch, listening to their music, and recommending them to your friends!


PGH is a most livable city, a sports nation, a foodie paradise, a tech city, an education city, and we are also a music city with a ton of talent – here’s our chance to break the norm of letting our musicians move away or give up.
To the MIC PGH Mission to help musicians.
To Pittsburgh’s music industry hitting its mini-hub potential through the successes of our own musicians.
To You.
THANK YOU!!!







COMPANY/CONTACT INFO

MIC PGH, LLC (Music Industry Connected, Pittsburgh) is “Where Music Careers Begin,” and was founded in 2013 by University of Pittsburgh graduate, Emily Plazek. Since then, MIC PGH’s mission has been to identify current and relevant ways for local musicians to have stable, full-time careers in music without moving from Pittsburgh.
MIC PGH, LLC 

PO BOX 81714
Pittsburgh, PA 15217

EmilyPlazek@MICPGH.com 
(412) 592-5633
www.MICPGH.com

CSM (Crystal Sounds Management) is a creative marketing and branding company that serves musicians, music businesses, and other creatives. CSM will help you “Do it Different.”

Jodie@CrystalSoundsManagement.com 
(412) 215-8827
www.CrystalSoundsManagement.com

Reach out to Emily Plazek or Jodie Ball for questions, donations, and interviews!



CREDITS

Thanks, so many thanks, to all the awesome people & businesses that support this project. We know this is a cliche, but it's true: we couldn't do this without you.

The MIC team of Interns: Andrew Haran, Nate Patton, Joe Pileggi, Eric Praniewicz, Sara Ruben, Mike Ujevich, Lucia Vento. (And a special thanks to the past interns during the startup years! Casey Abramson, Dori Fella, Alex Lucas, Amber Washington.)

The MIC team of Freelancers:  Keven Chambers, JP Embrey, Eric R. Miller, Ethan Willing, Francesca Zito. (And more special thanks to the freelancers of past projects! Jeff Altman, Shane Dreisdadt, Holly Karnes, Becca Keener.)

The #CraftMusic Artists/Bands we already know & love:
Kellee Maize, with her song featured during video are "Anyway (feat. J Glaze)"
Alex & Ayesha of Two Tall Twins
Max Somerville of Wreckloose
Nick Barilla 

The Local Companies/Events we're working hard alongside:
Creatives Drink, MIC & CSM are sponsoring the #CraftMusic Table at CD5 on 5/5

Cody Baker (@tehbakery) & Chance Humphrey (@KeepPittsburghDope)
Dave Rabin & Kathryn Fantauzzi, Rustic Justice 
The first music social networking app, Heardle 

Andrew "dErs" Haran, On Tap Productions   

Angela DeCario, Wink Styling  

Mifflin Hills Music Publishing  

Larry Luther & Nate Campisi, Mr. Smalls Recording and Mastering   
Amanda Narcisi, BOLD Pittsburgh

Mac Miller - https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:The_Space_Migration_Tour_London_Music_-_Mac_Miller.jpg

Christina Aguilera - https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Christina_Aguilera_Sanremo.jpg

story:
In the U.S. almost one in ten infants is born before 37 weeks, the natural pregnancy term.  A preterm infant, or preemie, may suffer from a number of neurological ailments including visual impairment, hearing impairment, or cerebral palsy.  Complications from premature birth is also the leading cause of death among infants according to the World Health Organization. Although the U.S. possesses some of the finest neonatal care facilities in the world, many parents of preemies are overlooked.  These parents often spend days, weeks or, even, months alongside their infant in an Intensive Care Unit.  This can create an enormous amount of hardship for families; many have to forego their jobs, live off of cafeteria food and ignore household responsibilities.

A new foundation entitled Preemee Powers intends to aid these forgotten parents. Preemee Powers will provide food, clothing, hygiene products, and counseling to young parents as they await the fate of their newborn. Founded by Byron Franklin and Chandinee Segobind, the mother of four preterm children, Preemee Powers will strive to help young parents as they endure through this unforeseen ordeal. 

While Preemee Powers can make a lasting difference in the lives of numerous families, it needs your assistance to begin its mission. Chandinee and Byron have sponsored a fundraising campaign on Indiegogo to secure the financial support to procure initial supplies, build a website, obtain insurance and organize a fundraiser.  In return for supporting this historic project, you can obtain a discount on tax preparation services through Chandinee’s firm Perfect Taxes.

story:
Welcome, Sir! Ma'am!

(Youkoso, Goshujinsama! Ojosama!)

My name is Renee (you may also know me as Little Wren or NOW Maid Michiko)  and I am NOT Japanese, but I do enjoy many aspects of Japanese culture, like anime, manga, and cosplay. So much so that I planned my first Maid Cafe event in December of 2015 and would like to continue these adorable, interactive, and delicious events throughout the year! 

This next chapter of what is now Peachy Maid Cafe has new ideas for upgraded desserts and popular drink options, plus a temporary new space! The theme is "Cookie Fantasy," occurring March 5 and 6 at the Atlanta Sci-Fi & Fantasy Expo, and will feature a weekend of cookie dough treats, coffee, tea and an overload of sweetness like you don't often see!

Planning is underway and will be documented on the Peachy Maid Facebook and Instagram Pages!

What We Need & What You Get

I'm asking for up to $1200 to manage the following: 

  • Coffeemaker and grinder (Hamilton Beach brand ~$115) OR
  • Commercial coffee machine (Bunn brand ~$500)
  • Portable cooler (Rubbermaid or Coleman ~$50-100)
  • Milk Frother/Heater (Epica brand ~$20)
  • Vinyl wall stickers (~$60)
  • Other wall and table decoration (~$50)
  • Cups, dessert plates, serving and eating utensils (like toothpicks, straws, and long spoons) (~$150)
  • Entertainment for guests like simple board games, manga, comics, and books (~$50 or may be used or donated)
  • Food and drink ingredients for initial testing (Baking supplies, storage, baked goods, candy, etc) (~$60)
  • Cleaning services (~$75)
  • Printer paper and ink for photos (~$40)
  • Maid costumes and accessories for sizing and styling (~$75)
  • Miscellaneous equipment (milkshake blender, cocktail shaker)
  • Miscellaneous licensing and documentation

 

The best part of the food testing stage is that it allows us to post photos of our dessert progress (and possible epic fails), and hopefully get you excited for Cookie Fantasy treats!

If by chance the goal is not met, that's OK! All donation will be an investment towards this and future Cafes! I hope to be able to use pre-sale RSVP tickets and day-of sales to reimburse the extra expenses like food and drink supplies. A worse case scenario is that we have a limited amount of the really pretty desserts to serve, but the experience will still be available for anyone wanting to visit the Cafe. 

The Impact

The very first event was the Hot Cocoa Maid Cafe and featured 6 Maids, 1 Butler, the back room of a game store, and a LOT of cocoa mix!  I invested my own money towards food, drinks, and equipment, and was thankful to have the owner of Challenges Games & Comics donate space and a printer (for the adorable cheki pictures). 

Though a bit hectic, customers told us they had a great time and would be willing to see a Maid Cafe as a regular occurrence in the area. I loved completing the first event and hearing the feedback, and it's fueled my fire to make the next event exponentially better!

While I may be far from the level of professionalism of Akihabara Maid Cafes, my overall goal has always been to give fellow fans in the community a place to enjoy a little piece of Japanese culture with local comforts and originality. Your contribution will boost my vision to turn an abandoned mall space into a functional cafe with blossoming decor, hand-crafted dessert and drink options, and interactive fun. The equipment and knowledge I can procure for this event will help ease the pressure off future Maid Cafes.

Risks & Challenges

I have a 9 to 5 day job. It's convenient because I am always in front of a computer and able to constantly research and plan, but the real planning can't happen on the internet. From today on I'll be touring the aisles of Asian markets, visiting pastry shops, destroying my kitchen, learning to dance and sing in Japanese, auditioning new Maids, cleaning and decorating this new temporary event space! PHEW!

The original goal was to be able to lease the space next to Challenges Games & Comics at North Dekalb Mall and to run a daily cafe with the Maid theme. Rent, time, fees, and market research still make that dream a little ways off--but still burning! I would like at least a year to understand the needs of a fully-functional coffee shop before committing to a permanent location.

What's great about this location is that it's not only next to a busy comic book and gaming store, it's near the mall's movie theater, the food court, and the mall is a shuttle stop for Emory University students. Location, location, location!

I have help from those close to me and I'm open to recommendations from those who have industry experience I could use! I've seen the idea blossom in other parts of America and it gives me so much hope, but any dream takes getting dirty to make it real! I don't expect things to go smoothly and I'm scared of my own procrastination and possibly money loss, but I'm too deep in this idea to back out--and the ideas I have for these desserts MUST come to life!

Other Ways You Can Help

If donating just isn't for you, we would still love to see you at the event on March 5 and 6! Check our Facebook page for updates and ticket pre-sales!

If you are a coffee shop owner, coffee barista, or food service professional, your knowledge is as beneficial as your donation, and both are welcome during this campaign!

If you are a fan of Japanese culture and media, American small businesses and entrepreneurship, or new possibilities to have your cookie fantasies unleashed, help spread the word anyway you can! Please follow Peachy Maid Cafe on Facebook and Instagram to get first peeks are all progress! Thank you for reading and I am SO EXCITED for future of Peachy Maid Cafe! 

Thank You Very Much! 

Arigatou gozaimashita!

*~Renee C. {AKA Maid Michiko}

Miscellaneous licensing and documentation


 

The best part of the food testing stage is that it allows us to post photos of our dessert progress (and possible epic fails), and hopefully get you excited for Cookie Fantasy treats!

If by chance the goal is not met, that's OK! All donation will be an investment towards this and future Cafes! I hope to be able to use pre-sale RSVP tickets and day-of sales to reimburse the extra expenses like food and drink supplies. A worse case scenario is that we have a limited amount of the really pretty desserts to serve, but the experience will still be available for anyone wanting to visit the Cafe. 
The Impact
 

The very first event was the Hot Cocoa Maid Cafe and featured 6 Maids, 1 Butler, the back room of a game store, and a LOT of cocoa mix!  I invested my own money towards food, drinks, and equipment, and was thankful to have the owner of Challenges Games & Comics donate space and a printer (for the adorable cheki pictures). 

Though a bit hectic, customers told us they had a great time and would be willing to see a Maid Cafe as a regular occurrence in the area. I loved completing the first event and hearing the feedback, and it's fueled my fire to make the next event exponentially better!
While I may be far from the level of professionalism of Akihabara Maid Cafes, my overall goal has always been to give fellow fans in the community a place to enjoy a little piece of Japanese culture with local comforts and originality. Your contribution will boost my vision to turn an abandoned mall space into a functional cafe with blossoming decor, hand-crafted dessert and drink options, and interactive fun. The equipment and knowledge I can procure for this event will help ease the pressure off future Maid Cafes.
Risks & Challenges

 I have a 9 to 5 day job. It's convenient because I am always in front of a computer and able to constantly research and plan, but the real planning can't happen on the internet. From today on I'll be touring the aisles of Asian markets, visiting pastry shops, destroying my kitchen, learning to dance and sing in Japanese, auditioning new Maids, cleaning and decorating this new temporary event space! PHEW!


The original goal was to be able to lease the space next to Challenges Games & Comics at North Dekalb Mall and to run a daily cafe with the Maid theme. Rent, time, fees, and market research still make that dream a little ways off--but still burning! I would like at least a year to understand the needs of a fully-functional coffee shop before committing to a permanent location.
What's great about this location is that it's not only next to a busy comic book and gaming store, it's near the mall's movie theater, the food court, and the mall is a shuttle stop for Emory University students. Location, location, location!
I have help from those close to me and I'm open to recommendations from those who have industry experience I could use! I've seen the idea blossom in other parts of America and it gives me so much hope, but any dream takes getting dirty to make it real! I don't expect things to go smoothly and I'm scared of my own procrastination and possibly money loss, but I'm too deep in this idea to back out--and the ideas I have for these desserts MUST come to life!
    Other Ways You Can Help If donating just isn't for you, we would still love to see you at the event on March 5 and 6! Check our Facebook page for updates and ticket pre-sales!
If you are a coffee shop owner, coffee barista, or food service professional, your knowledge is as beneficial as your donation, and both are welcome during this campaign!


If you are a fan of Japanese culture and media, American small businesses and entrepreneurship, or new possibilities to have your cookie fantasies unleashed, help spread the word anyway you can! Please follow Peachy Maid Cafe on Facebook and Instagram to get first peeks are all progress! Thank you for reading and I am SO EXCITED for future of Peachy Maid Cafe! 
Thank You Very Much! 
Arigatou gozaimashita!
*~Renee C. {AKA Maid Michiko}

story:
Remember Rocky Point Park?

From 1847 to 1996 Rhode Island had an amusement park to call its own… Rocky Point Park was a wonderful place that still holds a special place in the hearts and minds of the public here in New England. For more than 18 years that park has been gone, leaving the public of Rhode Island with nothing to do for summertime recreation.

In 2010 the people of Rhode Island voted to save the land at Rocky Point for future generations – unfortunately the cold truth was that this Vote was about saving the land, NOT about bringing the amusement park back. 

Ultimately the park has become an “open space coastal park” with no attractions. It will never truly take the place of immersive and involved recreation that New Englanders desire.

NOW is the time for the people to speak up, to take action to build something we as a State can enjoy in this generation and for future generations to come. Our program is in place, the business plan is sound, now we need YOUR SUPPORT to make it a reality.



Where Will The Park Be?

As the saying goes “when one door closes another one opens”. We are happy to share that the very forward thinking Mayor of Woonsocket opened that door!

Mayor Lisa Baldelli-Hunt made us aware of locations in her city that supply us everything we need to develop a successful water park.

Not only are the sites excellent, access is exceptional. The sites are easily reached from both RI and MA by I-95, I-295, Rt.146 & Rt.146A plus I-495 and Rt.99 as well as from I-195 via I-95. In Woonsocket we have finally found all the requirements in one place and are working with the administration.

We have been in further discussions with the Mayor and will supply you more details as they unfold.

Please share and consider donating to our indigogo campaign to help make this a reality.


How many attractions?

The proposed water park will feature 12 slides including a children’s interactive area. The slides will all be of superior height and complexity compared to its competitors. The park will also include a 20,000 sq.ft. wave pool and a lazy river of at least 900′ x 16′ wide. Also featured at the park will be a 50′ diameter Children’s spray pad and a 60′ diameter Children’s interactive play unit with water cannons, slides, dump bucket and more…


The Local Impact

This WaterPark will attract about 100,000 visitors or more from MA into RI, who would not have any other reason to venture into RI. The RI economy will be stimulated by this new visitorship spending from MA., at local area RI businesses. Jobs will be created to build the park and jobs created to operate the park. Yes, we understand that these may not be year round jobs yet, but the long term plan is to make the water park a year round destination.


What We Need

We have already invested the funds for two feasibility studies, site plans, pro-formas, site development budgets and research & engineering. We have to raise funds to perform the same work over again; a new feasibility study and to create the proper business plan to attract the equity investors. 

What we need are funds for legal work, accounting work, and general soft cost funding such as architecture, and engineering, since we have had to move the proposed park. 

This is where you, the people of New England can make a difference and donate.

Our committed investors are firmly behind this plan and will not put their money in until the project is shovel ready. This means that we have to complete all the above mentioned work and be ready to start construction. We are closer than we have ever been, and want to continue this forward momentum to help bring the park to fruition.

story:
Llama Lloyd due north! 

I've biked south, from Sweden all the way to Portugal on a foldable bicycle to emphasize how smart it is to combine this kind of bike with other modes of transport! After three weeks I am now heading home and will open my culture cafe Llama Lloyd in Gothenburg's archipelago, on the island of Hisingen on April 5th! (FB EVENT) Now I'm heading back, ride sharing and couch surfing! Follow the adventure on Instagram and tell your friends about it! Use #llamalloyd! 

So, who am I and what's all this about?

I'm Robin, I think bicycles are the best mode of transport, especially in cities. I run a tiny cafe called Llama Lloyd where I encourage people to bike simply by giving people a discount if they arrive on a bicycle. Now I want more people who commute longer distances to mix modes of transport with a foldable bike. To promote this idea I've biked south on one of these bikes and I've tried to go with as many modes of transportation as possible! I still want to know of your favorite places along the way back north, in these fields for instance: specialty coffee, brutalism architecture, modern art and bicycle infrastructure! What shouldn't I miss?!

You had a chance to put your money where your mouth was and decide when I should re-open. You chose April 5th!

You can still buy tote bags, coffee cards and pre-rentals on the foldable Brompton bike as rewards, but the date is now decided. Yes, you will be able to rent the bike and try it out in your daily commute! 

So, what's Llama Lloyd?

March 1st 2015 I opened up Llama Lloyd, my little culture cafe that encourages people to bike here in Gothenburg, Sweden. Right now the building the cafe is being renovated so there's scaffolding around and will be so until the middle of the summer. For this reason I kept the cafe closed during the winter months but will re-open again this spring. I'm still paying rent so I need to kickstart the cafe again with a little cash from you guys! Together with local designer Kurt Lightner we've designed a new limited edition tote bag! You can either buy a tote bag to have me continue biking or a tote bag to have me turn back home and open up the cafe already! There's also ten cups of coffee cards Drawn by Nina – why not buy one for a friend? 

If you want me to continue biking, the cafe would then open April 5th:

  • Buy a tote bag (April). 
  • Buy a card that gives you ten cups of coffee (April).
  • Book a rental of the Brompton bike (April).

If you want me to open up the cafe as soon as possible, the cafe would then open March 29th:

  • Buy a tote bag (March). 
  • Buy a card that gives you ten cups of coffee (March).
  • Book a rental for the Brompton bike (March).


You wanna bike too? Rent the bike!

When I get back back to Gothenburg you will be able to rent a foldable Brompton bicycle, the same kind I'm using on this trip. Maybe you're commuting by car into Gothenburg and want to try how it would be to bike to the train, fold up the bike, take the train and then continue by bicycle? My main goal with the cafe is to get more people on bikes – that's why everybody who arrives on a bike get 10% off food and drinks! So this campaign is for the people that live a little further away from their work places in Gothenburg and get them to bike a bit of their way to work! Would you like to rent the bike when I'm back? Simply book a rental. The rental period would be Tue-Thu, Thu-Sat or Sat-Tue so you will be able to go back and forth to work on a weekday. We'll set up a schedule when the campaign is over and I'm back home.

The bicycle is the simple solution to a lot of complex problems. 

So why do I want more people to bike? I feel that the bicycle is the answer to so many of today's problems and on top of that biking is a sense of total freedom, you can go anywhere by bike! If you commute by bike you spend the same (or often less) time of your day getting to work. You get a little exercise and you save money since there's no congestion charges on the bike lanes and your vehicle runs on fat, not oil! And another thousand reasons!

Participate in other ways.

So how will I travel south? Will I do bike all the way? Far from it, the idea is to combine the bike with as many modes of transport as possible. Let me know if you know anybody heading south, by helicopter, by car or whatever! Also, my main interests are smart solutions to every day problems (like bikes!), specialty coffee (where's the best pour-over in France?), collaborative economy (I will couchsurf and ride share a lot!) Follow this adventure on Instagram! 

Sharing is caring.

I would love it if you could share this campaign and be sure to follow me on Instagram, Facebook or Twitter and pop by the cafe when I've opened up again!

story:
Timu is an Uber like platform that shows you where unemployed or unschooled individuals are, who they are, whether you can trust them and helps you collaborate with them. You can now safely recruit someone who is willing to help you complete a specific task or participate in an opportunity which you might have. It can be as simple as recruiting someone to help you carry your grocery bags, wash your car, repair your bicycle or help you find your missing dog. 

Every user is given their own trust profile where important information like reviews, referrals and skills are summarised for other users to see. After you collaborated with another user on Timu, you can rate the experience and help them build a reputation for themselves to prove their trustworthiness and unlock more and better rewarding opportunities in the future. 


Timu is also for people and organisations who are looking for specific individuals they’d like to recruit, train, educate, help, fund or collaborate with. The platform guides opportunity givers and opportunity seekers through a 10 step feedback loop which we designed to ensure easy, efficient and safe collaboration between strangers.

That’s why we need you to support our Indiegogo crowd funding campaign! We have designed a platform that can help thousands of unschooled an unemployed individuals win trust and gain access to mainstream opportunities for personal growth, development and much-needed prosperity.  


The good news is, through Timu it no longer takes years to build trust.  Our users can sign-up in seconds, and start winning trust immediately.  By getting involved, they will meet a community of people with localised job opportunities, find educational programs that are close by, connect with brain boxes who have the solutions to their most pressing challenges, and even identify trustworthy do-gooders to help them through a crisis.


Let’s face it, we all need someone to trust and to be trusted in return, don’t we? Learning to trust used to be one of life's most difficult tasks - til Timu. Now you can meet your individual or organisational needs, prove your trust-worthiness, get people to vouch for you, and discover interesting ways to build relationships that open more opportunities for you.


We believe that Timu can help solve the massive education and unemployment challenges we are facing as a nation, so please support our Indiegogo campaign and help us to finish building our online platform. Together, we can help thousands of people to help themselves.  You can make a real, tangible difference by bringing Timu into the world.  We have the vision, conviction, skills and determination to make Timu a resounding success but we lack the financial resources to realise our full potential.  This is where you come in.  By joining our Indiegogo campaign, you can help us to cross the finish line.  We’re almost there.  Almost!  But we just need that extra yard to deliver the final product.

All our development work is done by a team who are passionate about enabling people to get ahead in life.  For this reason, we engineer our platform's features to meet real life requirements and we test them on ourselves constantly. Our team works together effectively and efficiently despite having very little resources.  We are driven to complete the game because we are totally committed to our cause. We know Timu can change people’s lives. It can and will enable people with little market access to get the foothold they so desperately need to enter the mainstream economy.  This is our calling, our purpose, our mission. Timu is a game, yes, but we take it very seriously because we know people’s livelihoods are at stake. 

We cannot begin to express our gratitude to everyone who support Timu.  We simply wouldn't be where we are today without them. Thanks for believing in us, and for getting behind what we are doing to change lives and make the world a better place. Here is all our supporters who have already pledged a $100 or more. 

"Timu has the potential to change how we educate and do business in South Africa and the world at large. I believe that a small contribution in the early stages of this project will act as catalyst, and allow the Timu team the opportunity to really improve the world that we live in today. Keep up the good work!" - Richardt Benade

"I believe in the management team of Timu. They have the right skill set, passion and Africa perspective to do great things." - Johan Marais

"Timu's innovative way to quantify trust and use it to get things done will most definitely unlock potential in places that not even the founders can jet imagine." - Tienie Grobler

"I like to invest in potential. Timu is a mustard seed that has only just been planted." - Franus Winterbach

"This platform has a million different ways to creation jobs, innovate and collaborate." - Armand Fourie


Help us kill our beta version and bring Timu to life for real. We are very close to finishing these amazing features:  giving you the freedom to decide when and where you'd like to play by managing your location settings via geo-location, finishing the full loop to guide you effortlessly through your collaborations with other players. $20,000 will ensure these features are ready to be used by players who wish to get ahead in life.

Help us to expand our service offering and reach more people. $50,000 will enable us to facilitate financial transactions between players inside the game, introduce new levels, load more opportunities, add more player types, and significantly improve our impact.

We want Timu to be open to everyone. If we raise $100,000 we will be able to open a portal (API) to our game environment so that organisations can link their services to our trusted network and allow our players to continue building and ensuring trustworthy interactions in different marketplaces. 

Thank you for considering supporting our crowdfunding campaign.  Rest assured, Indiegogo is one of the world's leading crowdfunding platforms. You can have full confidence in the security measures they take to ensure the safety and integrity of your information. You are very welcome to contact Timu CEO, Hannes Heyns, to discuss the various ways in which you can get involved - hannes@timu.co.za.  You can also visit our website at www.timu.co.za to get a taste of Timu.  No, it’s not fully functional yet (that’s why we need your support), but you can sign up to access the beta version and follow our development on the road to success.

story:
Buy a $10 Cruise Ticket for 2017 and help to save the M.V. Fintry Queen, an historic 325 passenger ship and tourist attraction located in the scenic Okanagan Valley of British Columbia. Our goal is to restore this 70 year old ship and provide a transportation link between the communities, parks, wineries and resorts situated along the shores for thousands of travelers and local residents.  Ticket purchases will go towards renovating and recertifying the ship and building support with local communities for landings sites throughout the Valley. We have a deadline of July 31st to prove to City Councils and Provincial Government that we're a viable business and that people want us.... or we're just scrap metal !!! 

If we don't sail, we'll refund your purchase.

The history of navigation on Okanagan Lake dates back over a hundred years to 1893, when the C.P.R. commissioned the first ship, the "Aberdeen" to service the growing number of agricultural and mining settlements along the shores of the 80 mile long lake.  Over successive decades, larger and faster ships were built to accommodate the growing numbers of passengers and cargo, becoming a way of life in the valley until the mid-1930’s.

The Fintry Queen will service the estimated 350,000 local residents and 4 million travelers who visit the South Thompson Okanagan region of British Columbia each year, packaging with resorts, restaurants, wineries and travel tour operators.  Daily sailing schedules will capitalize on local community events and seasonal travel patterns, providing 1-2 hour cruises, hosting families, groups, weddings and banquets.

According to a tourism study on visitors to the Okanagan, 83% are traveling in a car and the most popular activities are water based, followed by visiting orchards, farms and wineries.  Respondents indicated their most important positive image of the Okanagan Valley was the scenery, landscapes and the climate, while the biggest negative was the traffic.  The renewal of transportation on the lake will be a positive catalyst for tourism in the region. 

The Ship

Today the Fintry Queen lies idle, tethered to large pilings in Sutherland Bay, waiting for the next chapter in her life story. For more than 60 years, she has been a part of Kelowna's downtown waterfront, carrying an average of more than 28,000 passengers each summer.

Originally named the "M.V. Lequime", the Fintry Queen was built in Vancouver in 1948 and shipped by rail in sections to Kelowna, where she became one of three car and passenger ferries crossing Okanagan Lake. 

In the the 1960’s, the Lequime was transformed into the "Fintry Queen" to transport travelers and tourists to the new development at Fintry Estates.  The ship was built as a paddlewheeler to reflect the sternwheeler tradition on Okanagan Lake.

The first version of the Fintry Queen was all open deck. Passengers were issued with raincoats for the first few years. Fortunately, times have changed and today the ship can carry up to 325 passengers in comfort year-round. The enclosed Main Deck is both heated and air conditioned, featuring a commercial galley, an indoor forward lounge that seats 80 and a rear main dining room with a bar and dance floor for another 120 seated guests. On the Upper Deck, there is a covered outdoor area, open sun deck, barbeque, snack bar and kids fun room. The ship formerly held a food liquor license for 280 patrons and a pub license for 225 passengers, where minors were permitted.  Two fuel efficient turbo diesel engines power the vessel at an average cruising speed of 6-8 knots. Initially designed as an all-season car ferry with an extra thick hull for breaking through the ice, the Fintry Queen's unique hull and bow shape, enables her to get close to shore where she can utilize her bow boarding ramp to safely load and unload passengers where there are no docking facilities.

When last operated in 2008, the ship was in excellent mechanical condition.  An estimated $800,000 had been spent in the immediate years prior to completely refit the mechanical systems.  Engines were rebuilt, new shafts and propellers added, fire control systems, kitchen equipment, all the electrical wiring panels and breakers were replaced.  What is required is a new coat of paint on the exterior and renovations to the interior to give her a better theme appeal.

The new moorage site in Penticton will be located at the foot of Main Street, adjacent to the existing Kiwanis Pier, in the heart of the downtown core.  Design plans, engineering for utilities and environmental permits have all been completed.  The dock could be built and the ship readied for Summer 2017 if this crowd-funding program is successful.

The first phase of the funding will go towards a new coat of paint and general preparations. A second round of funding would go towards building the public pier and installing the utilities. Anyone interested in becoming a shareholder and ship owner should contact the Company directly. There is currently a program being sponsored by the BC Investment Program for "Eligible Business Corporations" where investors can receive up to a 30% BC tax credit on their investment.

The Fintry Queen is a landmark tourist attraction that will create lifetime memories for thousands of residents and travelers for years to come.  Without your support, she may soon become scrap metal and the opportunity will be lost forever.  There will never be another.  Buy a ticket, become a crew member, charter the ship or join us for some special events. Come and enjoy the spectacular scenery and experience the Okanagan.

story:
As a teacher, I have quietly spent the past 20 years feeding, clothing, and caring for children.  I now, humbled by life's challenges, ask for help for my own child.

Recent events have turned our lives completely upside down.  I am asking for your prayers and much needed help.  I have no family, save my child who is the love of my life.  After much prayer, I found this site.  

I was financially secure, but then had to make a choice between my own well being and that of my son's- I chose him!

Without help, we will lose our house and I will have to declare bankruptcy. Two years ago I was diagnosed with severe arthritis (doctor visits once or twice a month, plus medication) and can no longer work a second job.  My child has a diagnosed disability and cannot work. My retirement and life savings have been totally exhausted trying to take care of my son and get help from his father, but in December, after a three year wait,  we were not allowed to present our case in court.  I am now trying to find the money needed for the appeal.


I am gently asking for your prayers and help.  I promise to share your love with others when I am able.

Thank you!

Christi
