story:
Short Summary

National Stop the Violence Alliance, Inc. is a nonprofit organization committed to nonviolence and social change. Their motto is "Saving Lives One at A Time." Keeping with this motto and paying close attention to the rising concerns in the country, National Stop the Violence Alliance, Inc. (NSTVA) has established the What About YOUth (W.A.Y.) Male Initiative, an all-male program for junior high and high school students. In this program, the young men work together on various projects while collaborating with other community leaders, agents, and law enforcement officers. 


What is the W.A.Y. Male Initiative?

The W.A.Y. Male Initiative was created to address the growing needs of the community, especially regarding young males. The participants in the W.A.Y. Initiative will participate in a workshop setting to discuss various issues, such as youth and gang violence, education, college preparedness, entrepreneurship, physical and mental health, conflict resolution, media and arts-based education, and building a relationship with the law enforcement. 

In this program, we provide:

  • Community service activities and opportunities
  • Opportunities to collaborate with law enforcement officers and other entities
  • Free breakfast each meeting
  • College tours and the ability to interact with others in a collegiate atmosphere
  • Mentoring opportunities with other men in the community serving as mentors
  • Educationally fun and stimulating trips
We also teach:
  • Leadership skills (such as being on the W.A.Y. Council or contributing to the Embrace Magazine)
  • College preparedness
  • Public speaking, research, and writing skills
  • Math, science, and technology skills
  • Bullying prevention
  • Cultural diversity
Our goal is not to only curtail the societal perception of young men, but we also seek to address the educational and performance challenges of this demographic. We ensure that our students are college-ready upon high school graduation and thus far, we have a 100% high school graduation rate and college acceptance rate. Yes, 100%.


What We Need & What You Get

What we need is actually simple: we need assistance with the cost of regular programming as well trips and a male conference. As a part of our regular programming, we provide breakfast and lunch for our young men. We also plan many trips for the young men, such as museums, college tours, arts programs, etc.

Perks depend on how much is donated, but we promise that the perks are worth it!


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, that's okay. There are other ways that you can assist. You can become a member of NSTVA for the low cost of $25.00 ($15.00 if you're in college and $10 for youth). You can also register as a volunteer. We do nationwide programs and are always looking for helping hands!

story:
Our Story

It all started with a promise I made to my grandmother,  that one day I'd make a million dollars selling her cookies. Haha.. a pretty bold statement!

In 2009, after working about a year in the 'big city' of Birmingham, AL, I moved back to my hometown of Selma, Alabama and decided to give entrepreneurship a try.

I took a lien against my car, got $7,500, and started the Selma Good Company and the G Mommas' Cookies. For the next few weeks Gammy(Gmomma) taught me everything there was to know about baking the cookies. I was 24 at the time and had no clue what I was doing. 

I found an abandoned restaurant with a 400 sq. ft. kitchen in downtown Selma and started baking cookies. I started with 3 stores and grew it to 35 over the next year and half. Things grew so fast I couldn't keep up.  So in late 2011 I was forced to put the business on pause in order to find another way to grow. In 2013 we were finally able to re-launch with a re-vamped brand and also a contract bakery to help with production.

Outsourcing the baking was the key in getting the brand exposure and distribution we needed, but it's now time to bring production HOME...to Selma, Alabama. 

You can see some more detail of the story HERE 



Selma

The business is about more than Cookies. It's about my hometown. Selma is the 'Queen City' of the Black Belt and is one of the richest towns when it comes to hospitality and southern culture. It's still one of the 'jewels' of the deep south, but it has struggled economically for the last 50 years or so and is now located in one of the poorest areas in the country.  

My dream and passion is to see my hometown as well as this area make a comeback and to see all people here prosper economically.

The next 10 years in Selma are the most important time in the life of our city, and although we've struggled economically, we believe there is a Revival starting to bubble up here. 

The Impact

To start, we will hire up to 6 employees and will hire the majority from a program called the *Fatherhood Initiative Program. 

*The Fatherhood Initiative Program is designed to not only help young fathers become better fathers but also help them find employment. The program exists to help them get going in the right direction. 

We've already had success partnering with the program by hiring more than 16 guys on a part-time basis. We will hire straight from the program once we get up and going.

Our goal is to ultimately be a piece to the puzzle for bringing economic growth here in Selma. This facility will also give us the ability to contract bake / pack for other 'up-and-coming' brands and in turn driving more positive attention and economic dollars to Selma.


Capital Needed:

My goal is: $50,000+ 

In order to put the bakery in Selma it will take purchasing equipment, inventory, and renovating the building. I'm selling cookies and putting on a launch party to help fund the Building Renovations ($50,000+)

Perks are explained Below:

4 Bags




Launch Party


When we get ready we will have party to officially launch the bakery. Live Music, Cold Beverages, and other Selma made products. 

Poster Set (12" x 18"):

G Momma Sayings and A Poster for Selma:




See more about us at our website here: GMommas.com



Check out our mention in the Wall Street Journal: 

           ------>    Click HERE


Other Ways You Can Help


Spread the good word.

story:
Who are the Rebel Vegan Crew?

A bunch of vegans cooking tasty vegan treats and neccesities and delivering it direct to your door!  If thats not reason enough to sign up now heres a few to get you excited!

Bear in mind, we are only offereing 30 memberships (26 left) for our startup period..... Heres a usefull old phrase, the early bird gets the tofu worm ;)

Note - We are scrapping Soja from the menu, we will now make our milk from rice and sesame seeds in a delcious creamy unique recipe.  Tofu will be from a wonderfull burmese recipe using chick peas and pea flour! yum yum, healthier and tastier ;)

We promise you
  • Tasty Vegan Treats - every week!
  • All our produce is organic and fairtrade!
  • We will only ever use re-usable packaging - ie milk delivered in re-usable glass bottles
  • We will try to cut out all packaging in our supplies, and eventually grow our own beans and grains
  • We will - always Deliver by Bicycle
  • We will give atleast 20% of our profits to grassroots, community minded projects
  • We will pay all our workers an equal share of the profit
  • We will eventually try to make all our products from sustainable, green power
  • We will within ten years be completley non profit
  • we will Strive to create a safe, progressive work enviroment - challening social norms and restrictions on every level we can find the little pests!
  • To be completley Transparent - We will share our books and our meeting notes with our members
  • Be open to critique and helpfull suggestions


Sounds Absolutely my Cup of tea, how do I join?

You sign up for a trial to the right - Whichever one seems tastiest to you and suits the size of your household or buisness.  We got different packages, from collective size deliveries, to just a few litres of milk every week. 

Heck thats easy, I love the project, how else can I help?

Loads and loads of ways - Share the campaign all over your social network site, tell your friends, write to a newspaper. Or even better, why dont you apply for a job with us? Whats more, if you work with us, your a Rebel too and share the profits

  • Promoters
  • Cooks
  • Bicycle Delivery Persons
  • Researchers
  • and much much more - write to us for details!

Ive done that - What else?

umm shucks your sweet - Any ideas are greatfully accepted, You could also sign up as a patron - supporting buisnesses and organizations get their names all over our website, buisness cards and posters - But only if we like you ;)

Im not in denmark, can i still help?

Absolutley!! We have lots of cool things we ship internationally in return for your love and support - Fx the communal cookbook, our poster, our sticker pack, our t-shirt and much much more!  Also if you fancy having an activist hour, you could share our page, write to other vegan groups, or even write to a famous vegan celeb and ask them to get on board.


Umm, Im not vegan, can I still be a vegan Rebel?

Absolutley! Do you like tasty Vegan food? Do you want to consume less animal produce? Do you want tasty treats direct to your door? Do you wanna participate in great social events and learn more about veganism in the process.  Then your a rebel, perhaps not 100 percent Vegan, but heck, jump on board and lets see what happens ;)

    I dont have any other questions I cant Wait for my treats to come flying through the door!

    Yup! We cant wait either! See you In the summer!  If you have any questions, hit us up! We will also be keeping a blog!

    Horray!

story:
Short Summary

What it's all about:  I'm a teacher and my partner is a student teacher.   Our piece of the world is Chonburi Provence, Thailand.  

Creating a safe space for kids is an adventure we started by accident, six years ago.  It quickly became something we're passionate about.  Six years ago, we took over the rent of a small shop here in Thailand.   The kids soon followed!

Over the years, we have happily become a safe haven for children that need it.  At any given time, on any given day, you can expect upwards of fifteen, twenty kids to be here.  They're here because they need us.

For the kids, it's pretty amazing what happens here.  Many of our kids simply have no one available at home or nowhere to go.  Here, they are safe, eat if they're hungry, shower if they're dirty, play, get some basic medical care, talk to someone, learn their math and languages, do homework, learn football, maybe get some toys, clothes or shoes and sometimes just take a nap if they need it!  Whenever we can, we load them up and get them out and about for an adventure.

Thailand, like many countries, continues to struggle with poverty.  Poverty breeds a cycle of neglect, alcoholism and abuse.  We are asking you to help us break that cycle for a few kids.  The most important things we provide are attention, safety and kindness.

We need you to help us fund some repairs.  We desperately need the repairs and both medical and school supplies.  Without your funding, these repairs and supplies are beyond our reach.  We need you.

What We Need & What You Get

Here's the plan and the perks:

  • Our campaign hopes to exceed our goal of $5,000 funded in 30 days.  We can do it if you are willing help us now.  The repairs and supplies we need are more than we are able to do alone.
  • We want you to know everything!  Our plans are exciting and we want you to get excited along with us. (REMEMBER TO SHARE THIS CAMPAIGN WITH OTHERS)
  • Our bucket list includes; a fresh coat of paint, repair and replace windows and mosquito screens, ceiling repairs, better lighting and ceiling fans to cool things down, install awnings to protect them from the heat and rain, restock the first aid box with supplies, a new trauma supply box for more extensive injuries, tables, chairs and whiteboards for learning, basic school supplies and books, bathroom repairs and some more outdoor tables and benches for the kids.
  • The list is long but we can get through it on budget, we listed only what we really need and we are not shy to do a lot of the work ourselves.
  • Our funding perks are pretty awesome! We want the kids involved, we want you to see and feel the impact you have when you help.  To feel the gratitude coming directly from the kids is be pretty cool!
We have faith, we believe people like you,  support what we are doing for the children here in Thailand.  If you share our campaign, more people will come and support us with you.
If we fall short of goal, that's ok.  We can take any amount and turn it into something special. But please, help us to exceed our goal!!  Contribute today and please, please share, share, share this campaign with others.  Help people to care about safe places for kids!

The Impact

You have already had an impact.  It's important to us that people become aware of how valuable a safe, healthy environment is to a child.  You've done that for us already.  Just by reading this far and then sharing with others is a big help.  

The impact of the contribution you make today:

  • The impact of the contribution you make today will be enormous!  We provide children and young people with a safe and supportive environment, with education, with care, with food and a lot of happy time.  Without this safe place, many will be lost. Imagine how scary it is, to be a child that nobody sees.
  • Our funding project is unique.  We are asking the kids to reach out to the people that fund us.  We want you to feel the difference you're making.
  • As a teacher, I can't resist the opportunity for the kids to actively participate in making their world a better, happier, place.

Risks & Challenges

People value transparency.  We want you to hear the the truth.

  • We can't cure poverty and we can't promise that every child crossing our doorstep won't get lost.  But we can promise they will be seen and heard.
  • We can't promise we will be here forever.  We're here now and every single person we reach out to has the potential to reproduce what we do.  We hope to see people doing what we do all over the world!

Other Ways You Can Help

Maybe you just can't donate, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • If you believe in what we do, please help us get the word out.  Share this campaign with your friends.  Make noise about it, so they to can see what we are doing and maybe help us to exceed our goals.
  • The Indiegogo share tools make it easy for people to share our message, please use them all!
  • If you are local and would like to contributing clothing or supplies, please contact us on facebook.

If you haven't done it already, take a moment to help us.  Check out the perks for funding us and choose one!  We promise you, it will feel right!

If you are local and would like to contributing clothing or supplies, please contact us on facebook.   If you haven't done it already, take a moment to help us.  Check out the perks for funding us and choose one!  We promise you, it will feel right!

story:
Rev Project

Imagine a place where you can leave daily problems behind, somewhere you can be whatever you want to be, you can create your own world, you have no limit to your imagination, a confortable seat you don't want to leave, a big screen where you see your dream bigger. A place like nowhere. We are building a place like that for those millions of haitian who don't even know what a Movie theater is.

We are young and passionated Haitian entrepreneurs and professional, REV entertainment, a team dedicated to entertainment structures such as movie theaters wich are inexistent in Haiti. 

We start  with 3d theaters with small capacity.

  • We are entrepreneurs, economist, engineers, architects, movie producers,  and specialists in purchasing, in electronics, computer sciences.
  • After so many years without a single movie theater, we have a generation that doesn't even know what it is. The world is moving forward in the cinema, 2d 3d , passive and active even 4d but Haiti is still late, we are not even touched by those technology improvements.
  • Now for the first time  we are starting Haiti's first 3d standard cinema Theater. The first one, with the profit we will open more others around the city and extend the experience to the whole country. The dream become bigger.

  • Here is the final result expected


  • Where are at that point now



What We Need 

  • Now we need money for the materials and the snack. 
  • We intend to improve the Theaters, fully automatic. Having a membership system, you can book your place on the internet and even select the seat you want to have By using our  REV App (on developing phase now ) on android and IOS. Where ever you are in Haiti you can get on our app information like our schedule, the nearest Rev theater, you will be able to pay via App, Credit Card...
  • In Case we don't receive the entire amount . We will start anyway by according priority to the most important needs and improve the installations after generating some profit. 


The Impact

How many young haitians don't know what is a movie theater? more than 80%.

This project, that movie theater, will allow  people to see the world in a whole new different point of view.

Never forget that nothing is  as good as a big screen.

The bigger screen will make people dream bigger.

Rev will create jobs, happy people. Also a better Haiti, because Haitians deserve better.

Risks & Challenges

We are facing challenges like financial support. Illegal downloaded movies on the internet, and maybe challengers who want to do the same thing with us.

  • We are solving that financial problems with you with your donation.

Other Ways You Can Help

Donate to help that project. Its not only ours anymore it is also your REV. Help Haiti put some of you in it and be proud to know that YOU Build something that will grow in the future. It is Everybody's REV!!!

  •  DONATE to Help us, make noise share links like our  Facebook  page invite others to contribute. We accept feedback, critics, if you have a company that can help us in the project contact us info@rev.ht.
  • What ever your contribution is, it will get us get Haiti doing a step forward. Your donation is important for Haiti.
  • With your donation even smaller it could be you encourage others to do the same. When you donate you receive. then DOnate
  • And don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Hi, My name is Ron Menne. I have been working on Barf Buddy for a number of years now, as of this date I have sold approximately 15 to 20,000 Barf Buddy buckets. Barf Buddy is a novelty item with a purpose. For kids Being sick is no fun, throwing up on yourself is less fun. Barf Buddy provides a piece of mind for the child as well as the parent. There is nothing worse  while traveling 70 mph down the expressway with your family than to hear "I don't feel well" coming out of the back seat. Lets face it, kids give you about a 3 second notice that they are going to throw up. So as your panicking try desperately to get off the road, risking your live and your families lives, as well as the well being of other drivers, when you finally make it to the side of the road where is semi safe by the time you do your child throws up all over the back seat. And lets face it, that is a smell you are never going to get rid of. Barf Buddy comes with a handle and lid, to contain the mess and the smell.

Barf Buddy is also great for the home as well. Kids are great at throwing up,(mine where) but horrible at making it to the bathroom, they throw up in every room in the house but/except the bathroom. Barf Buddy is there very own personal barf bucket. My kids knew as early as two years old what Barf Buddy was for. I always knew when my kids didn't feel well. All my kids had a Barf buddy in their rooms I knew, when they weren't feel well they simply would go to the closet and get it. Barf Buddy has saved me many times from having to clean up vomit, not to mention the stains in the carpet, cloths, furniture.

To be able to bring Barf Buddy to parents, grand parents, hospitals, schools, or who ever, costs money. Barf Buddy is a simple product but it costs a lot of money to do. I have spent probably over 20,000 dollars. With the moneys I hope to collect, that will go towards a second run of Barf Buddy buckets, which a minimum order is 15,000 at over a dollar a bucket, now that's just buckets. Now the more I order the less  they will cost, but real discounts only happen when I sell over 100,000 buckets. The monies will also go toward supplies like advertising, shipping supplies, Barf Buddy products, t-shirts, sports bottles, ball caps etc. etc.

I believe in Barf Buddy, other parents believe in Barf Buddy, the hospitals that carry Barf Buddy mainly in pediatrics, believe in Barf Buddy.  I hope you believe as well. thank you!

story:
Founder- Steven Raikes

Administrators

Brett Cline

Chris Soxfather Brown

Marc 

Sarah Koster

Matthew Dickens


Power Rangers Universe is a growing Fan Group in which plans on making merchandise and a possible video game and Potential Comic-Con known as Power Unicon. The funding we are asking for is $400,000 to put toward getting our projects started as we can not do it alone. We want fans to know that we are doing this just for them.

If we do not reach our entire goal we still plan on going forward, there is no failure to be known. We will make this vision happen.

The impact to the world and contributors is to make something that once and still is popular continue further for generations to come. Not only will funds go to merchandise or a video game, but also toy drives.

We know many can not contribute much but every dollar counts and we will make it worth something. Every success has bumps in the road but anything is possible. If you can not donate spread the word, Facebook, group pages, twitter,Instagram, classmates, parents. Anyone can help make this possible not only for us trying to run it but as well for Power Ranger Fans everywhere.

story:
Club GSA 

Our Mission Statement

We are committed to providing a more accepting environment for all individuals regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity. We will provide a safe, non-judgmental space as a support for Lesbian/Gay/Bisexual/Transgender/Queer and Two Spirit youth, through education, social action, and advocacy.

Our Goal

Our goal is to get to OUTShine 2015 which 'is the 2nd annual national Gay-Straight Alliance Summit. The weekend will bring together youth and educators from across the country to discuss LGBTQ inclusion in schools, creating and sustaining Gay-Straight Alliances, sharing best practices and celebrating LGBTQ & Allied experiences!' OUTShine takes place from May 15th-17th and we need your help getting there! 

What We Need & What You Get

  • To get to OUTShine 2015, our group needs to raise approximately $1000 which will pay for registration, transportation, hotel, and some meals.
  • Your donation can will get you some cool swag! We have buttons, bracelets and  t-shirts all made by our GSA!
  • If we don't reach our goal the money will go towards making a big impact at the GSA's spot in the Sioux Lookout Blueberry Festival!

The Impact

OUTShine 2015 is Canada's largest Gay Straight Alliance summit for youth and educators across Canada! Why do we want to go?

  • To have the opportunity to meet other students and delegates just like us
  • To bring resources back to Sioux Lookout for others who want to know more about LGBTQ communities
  • It is hard enough being a kid in high school, but to feel different and not have somewhere you can be yourself makes it even harder, this group is for those kids who just want to live and feel that they belong 

Risks & Challenges

“It takes a tremendous amount of guts to live outside of the box and be honest and open. By being ourselves we change ourselves, the people around us, and sometimes we change the world.” –Jenna Mackay

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone has extra money to support all of the things they wish they could, here are some other ways to help us out:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Hello!

Hello! I'm Éirinn, artist, floral designer, retail aficionado, and entrepreneur! I am opening sásta, an art & flower boutique, in the heart of historic Pawtuxet Village, Rhode Island. I am very excited, as soon the doors will be open and the shop filled with things that make me "sásta," happy! My campaign team and I have put everything we have into this project, but now we need your help to make it a reality.

The Dream

Over the years I have dreamed of owning and operating a specialty boutique. However, it wasn't until recently, that I had the opportunity to take some time to formulate my business ideas into one clear, solid, and cohesive vision.

This is what I envision:

I see sásta as an intimate and friendly independent retail shop where I can share my skills and passions with others by creating & displaying original art and helping customers choose beautiful flowers & thoughtful gifts. I also see sásta as a very special boutique in that all merchandise, flowers and packaging will be purchased with care keeping in mind the impact and sustainability of the environment. This is especially unique with the floral aspect of sásta, as unlike most flower shops, I will be practicing "green floristry" by not using any chemically based products, flowers that have to be shipped across the world, or wrapping materials that are not recyclable and/or biodegradable.

Synchronicity happens!

 Not long after my vision became crystal clear, a small vacant retail space appeared only a short walk from my home in the"up-and-coming" Pawtuxet Village! Suddenly, my dreams of wanting to open a business highlighting my creative talents in an "eco-friendly" environment are literally "just around the bend"! 

So now, armed with a clear vision, an empty shop waiting to be filled with happy things, and loads of experience as an artist, floral designer and retail manager, I believe it is my time to go forward and open sásta! And with your help I can reach my goal and share a little happiness and beauty with others!


The success of sásta !

The success of opening sásta relies on two very important factors:

  1. Crowdfunding by contributors like you, who believe in the vision and success of sásta.
  2. The love and support from my campaign team of family and friends who have been a tremendous help with editing, multi-media & business advising, and initial funding! They are: Ricardo, Emma, Aaron, Pauline and Al.


So what do we need?

       Our goal of $4000 is what we need!

  • Part of the funds will go towards fitting the shop with basic retail necessities such as a point of sale system, fixtures, displays and packaging. 
  • The remaining portion will go towards the initial retail inventory of art, flowers, candles, greeting cards, and other tidbits to bring a smile to your face!

What's in it for you?

We've got some really nice perks in return for helping us out!


Your contribution matters!

The success of our campaign is so very important, as it will provide a livelihood where I can blend my talents, passions, and work experiences into an environmentally friendly space, which I believe will bring happiness into the lives of many, while contributing to the well being of the earth.

So thank you in advance for your contribution! 

I will be forever grateful for your generosity and belief in sásta!

Other ways you can help...

We understand that some of you won't be able to help out with a contribution. Even so, we really appreciate you taking the time to learn about sásta. 

If you want, you can still really help us in the following ways:

    • Share, share and share our campaign on social media, using the buttons below.
    • Email your friends, family and work colleagues with the link to this page! 
    • 'LIKE' our Facebook page and posts about the campaign!
    • Talk to people about it! Word of mouth is the most powerful form of marketing.

With your help, we will be able to make our goal a reality and you'll always be welcome to come down and see us at sásta!

I'm Éirinn, artist, floral designer,
retail aficionado, and entrepreneur! I am opening sásta, an art
& flower boutique, in the heart of historic Pawtuxet Village, Rhode Island. I am very excited, as soon the doors will be open and the
shop filled with things that make me "sásta," happy!
My campaign team and I have put everything we have into this project, but now
we need your help to make it a reality.






The Dream
Over the years I have dreamed of owning and operating a
specialty boutique. However, it wasn't until recently, that I had the opportunity to take some time to
formulate my business ideas into one clear, solid, and cohesive vision.

This is what I envision:


I see sásta as an intimate and friendly independent retail shop where I can share my skills and
passions with others by creating & displaying original art and helping customers choose
beautiful flowers & thoughtful gifts. I also see sásta as
a very special boutique in that all merchandise, flowers and packaging will be
purchased with care keeping in mind the impact and sustainability of the environment. This is especially unique with the floral
aspect of sásta, as unlike most flower shops, I
will be practicing "green floristry" by not using any chemically based products, flowers that have to be shipped
across the world, or wrapping materials that are not recyclable and/or biodegradable.


Synchronicity happens!

 Not long after my vision became crystal clear, a small vacant retail space
appeared only a short walk from my home in the"up-and-coming" Pawtuxet Village! Suddenly,
my dreams of wanting to open a business highlighting my creative talents in an
"eco-friendly" environment are literally "just around the
bend"! 


So now, armed with a clear vision, an empty shop waiting to be filled with happy things, and loads of experience as an artist, floral designer and retail manager, I believe it is my time to go forward and open sásta! And with your help I can reach my goal and share a little happiness and beauty with others!







The success of sásta !

The success of opening sásta relies on two very important factors:



Crowdfunding by contributors like you, who believe in the vision and success of sásta.


The love and support from my campaign team of family and friends who have been a tremendous help with editing, multi-media & business advising, and initial funding! They are: Ricardo, Emma, Aaron, Pauline and Al.








So what do we need?
       Our goal of $4000 is what we need!



Part of
     the funds will go towards fitting the shop with basic retail necessities such as a point of sale system, fixtures, displays and packaging. 




The
     remaining portion will go towards the initial retail inventory of art,
     flowers, candles, greeting cards, and other tidbits to bring a smile to
     your face!





What's in it for you?
We've got some really nice perks in return for helping us out!










Your contribution matters!

The success of our campaign is so very important, as it will provide a
livelihood where I can blend my talents, passions, and work experiences into an environmentally friendly space, which I believe will bring happiness into the
lives of many, while contributing to the well being of the earth.
So thank you in advance for your contribution! 
I will be forever grateful for your generosity and belief in sásta!







Other ways you can help...

We understand that some of you won't be able to help out with
a contribution. Even so, we really appreciate you taking the time to
learn about sásta. 

If you want, you can still really help us in the following ways:



Share, share and share our campaign on social media, using the buttons below.

Email your friends, family and work colleagues with the link to this page! 

'LIKE' our Facebook page and posts about the campaign!

Talk to people about it! Word of mouth is the most powerful form of marketing.



With your help, we will be able to make
our goal a reality and you'll
always be welcome to come down and see us at sásta!

story:
Common Grounders Unite!

In short, we are looking to raise $30,000 for hostel renovations in exchange for some great deals on a dream vacation to Thailand (think of it as pre-paying for an amazing trip to Pai, while helping us tremendously)!

Everybody wins.



What We Are Building

Reaching our goal of $30,000 we would be able to build:

  • 7 new dorms (almost doubling our capacity)
  • 2 beautiful private rooms (2nd story with balcony)
  • a restaurant (to serve yummy/healthy Thai and western food)
  • a renovated bar & communal space (our guests and musicians deserve it)

If we are able to accomplish these goals, we will be able to:

  • Hire 6 more Thais, pay them great wages, and help their families & the local economy
  • Begin paying off our mortgage, so we can focus on our next project
  • Bring Common Grounds to the next level

Once Common Grounds is self-running & sustainable, we hope to start a co-op with earth-ship eco-homes, communal living, and organic farming — stay tuned for that :)

Our stretch goal is $50,000.  If that is accomplished we can completely renovate the entire hostel as well as pay off a sizable chunk of our mortgage.  That means you could be visiting our permaculture collective in a few short years!




What We Are Offering

We wouldn’t be asking without offering some valuable and exciting perks in return.  Accommodation, food, drinks, Thai massages, Thai cooking classes, and much more — please check out all of our perks & support levels.

Common Grounds has been successful and profitable and is at full capacity every night.  The thing about a hostel is accommodation is cheap, so we really need to expand our capacity in order to make enough money to sustain.  We are looking for the support of the people we love and strangers that are inspired by our mission to help out now in exchange for love, karma, great perks, and an amazing vacation later.




Who We Are

Common Grounds Pai opened a year ago and has exploded in popularity.  Based on art, music, and community, Common Grounds has become the second home to thousands of travelers and the starting point of hundreds of friendships and even the start of one marriage.

We are looking to improve our home and are looking to do it through crowdfunding.  We want to build a massive bar, build a restaurant, renovate the communal space, build more dorm rooms, and completely renovate the hostel.

We are offering great perks for contributing (merchandise, accommodation, food, drinks, personal guide to Pai, personal guide to Thailand, massages, naming rooms, etc).  Most of the perks are valued the same as your contribution (think of it as pre-paying for your vacation while at the same time helping us out tremendously).  If you have been planning on spending some time with us in Pai, this is a great way to do so in style!  Perks can be used in parts as well (so if you get 2 weeks free stay you can redeem 1 week this year and 1 week next year).



Why Stay @ Common Grounds

Why would you want to stay at Common Grounds?  Well, besides the hundreds of people that have said it is their favorite hostel in the world, check out our reviews:

Facebook Reviews (5/5)

TripAdvisor Reviews (4th out of 107)

HostelWorld Reviews (best rating in Pai)



Where We Live 

Pai is a small, alternative-lifestyle town in Northwest Thailand.  The local population is an interesting mix of Ethnic Thais, Burmese Immigrants, Thai Rastas, Hippie Westerners, and Backpackers/Travelers that decided to stay.  Pai has an amazing Music & Art scene, renowned Bamboo Tattoo artists, first-class Western & Thai food, a lively Night Market, and plenty of Bars to wind-down at after a long day of doing nothing!

A Day in the Life

A normal day in Pai might look something like this–wake up early to soak in the beauty of the sun as it creeps above the surrounding mountains and sheds light on the beautiful Pai valley.  Enjoy a wheatgrass shot & nutritious breakfast at Good Life cafe, in time to participate in their group morning meditation.  Rent a motorbike, and cruise through Pai Valley, the surrounding mountains, and the endless rice fields, visiting some local Village Tribes and the Chinese Village.  Grab a few Changs and spend the hottest hours at the Mor Paeng Waterfall, sliding off the rocks into the swimming pools.  Head over to the Elephant Camps, and feed them some bananas and maybe go for a ride.  Relax for a bit at the nearby Hot Springs.  Drop in for an afternoon Muay Thai class, or enjoy an afternoon traditional Thai massage.  Grab a few Leos or Singhas and enjoy the sunset at Pai Canyon.  Wat Prathat Mae Yen or Sunset Restaurant are also great places to enjoy the sunset.  Enjoy street food and a fruit shake at the Nigthly Market, and buy some souvenirs and art.  Head back to Common Grounds Pai for the best Happy Hour in town, and then enjoy Pai’s amazing music scene by bouncing around all of the great local bars.  Most bars close down at midnight, but Follow Me Bar, Bamboo Bar, Don’t Cry are usually the spots for a late-night party!


Meet Our Team

Mitchell is the captain of the Common Grounds ship, living and managing the hostel for 1.5 years.

Fai is the navigator, keeping Mitchell & everyone else out of trouble

Taylor is the resident BBQ-er, party-starter, and pool-shark

Thai changed his name to show how much he loves this country

Walter is Common Ground's construction manager & overlord

Zak is the bronze, tough guy, fire spinner

Hasan is our Middle Eastern brother, bringing sweet tunes & jams to the table

Fraser can be found frying up fish n chips and sipping tea

Marc is our German brother, pretty face, and style expert

Theodore is our musical generous, playing sweet, sweet gypsy jazz

Pablo is our mexican counterpart, whipping up great burritos for famished guests

Charisse has been promising to come for a long time & this is her chance

Same with Gina and Jared

Derrick is our resident security guard and all around bada$$

Estaban is the best bartender and guac maker in the world

And the rest of our amazing mob:

Kyle, Chris, Cy, Emily, Mikkel, Matt, Flossy, Hermit, Fredrik, Jennie, Kim & Dan, Danouck, Jessica, James, John, Marie, Tyger Lily


Accountability & Transparency

We purposely made the team massive for accountability & transparency purposes.  Some of the team are owners, some are friends, some are former guests, and some have nothing to do with Common Grounds.  With this many checks and balances, you can be ensured that at whatever level you support this campaign, you will get what is promised.  You have thirty something individuals from diverse backgrounds guaranteeing that.

story:
Short Summary

We are Jana and Hafiz, a German-Malaysian couple who live in Nipah Beach on Tioman Island in Malaysia. Hafiz was born here and has lived here most of his life; Jana is a biologist who worked in Malaysia and moved to Nipah after falling in love with the nature and with Apis. In 2013, we opened a hostel on a cliff behind the beach to run a homestay in accordance with the exceptional natural beauty of the beach.

Nipah is a stunningly beautiful beach, backed by a mangrove-lined lagoon and untouched mountainous rainforest. It is a very small, close-knit community  consisting of traditional livelihoods and tourism. Apart from our hostel, there are two other homestays. It is very simple living, and there is no mobile phone coverage or internet connection, and it can only be reached by boat.

On December 29th, 2014, Nipah was devastated by an unprecedented flash flood which broke through the small river coming down the mountain. In its wake, many structures were destroyed, the mangroves, vital to a healthy ecosystem, were demolished, and most boats washed out to sea. The flood carried huge amounts of debris such as fallen trees, shrubs and rocks which are now littering the area.

We are trying to raise funds in order to clean up Nipah and support the locals to continue their businesses and maintain their livelihood. At the moment, life has come to a complete standstill, and most locals struggle to find the funds to get back on to their feet and cover their losses.

We need money to clean up the debris, rebuild the houses, buy boats, replant the mangroves, pay for food, clothes lost in the flood and various everyday essentials. Whatever money we will raise, will be implemented in rebuilding the community - whether it reaches our goal or not or goes above it.

Please note that we cannot stress enough that we do not try to raise money for our own hostel but to get the local community back on their feet! Most people have lost their livelihood and we try to bring the beach back to its former glory.

For you to get an idea on what your contribution may be used for, here are some examples:

10€ will pay to bring in local people from other villages to help clean up the beach and replant the mangroves.

15€ will buy one set of clothes for one person.

100€ buys most basic essentials such as gas, pots etc. to be able to cook again.

500€ pays for a carpenter to rebuild a hut.

Even if you cannot donate any money, please spread the word. Nipah is so remote that we depend on you to make our case known. The Malaysian government has promised funds to help with the damages the monsoon brought this year in the affected areas of Malaysia, but it could be years until it reaches Nipah if it reaches us at all - by then, it might be too little too late for Nipah.

story:
When Mayowa Bamigboye and his family left their home in Abuja to visit his parents for the Christmas holidays, their house was broken into and all their property was stolen, including the children's clothes.

Mayowa has his own business, however his house and contents were not insured, so they have to start again from scratch to make their house a home.

They urgently need clothes for a 9 year old boy and for two girls aged 6 and 4.

These are some of the images we were able to get from Mayowa showing some of the extent of damages, and how the burglars broke through the children's room window to access the flat despite the metal burglar proof.


Everything in the lounge was stolen, 42" TV, Music player, DVD Home Theatre, Satellite TV box set, Voltage stabilizers, Dining set and chairs, Children's games etc, only 1 couch and photographs were left behind

All the children's clothings and school uniforms, the wife's clothings, shoes and jewelries, all of Mayowa's shirts, trousers and shoes were all taken away and the house was left turned upside down.
All the kitchen accessories were stolen such as Electric kettle, Iron, Washing Machine, Electric Generator, Pots, Cooker etc.
All of Mayowa's wife business goods that were kept in the store were all stolen.

Please, we implore everyone to help in this funding so that Mayowa Bamigboye and his family can start a good life again.

Fundraising Update - 21/01/2015

We want to give an update on the fundraising being organised for one of our brothers and his family. So far we have raised £315 (£300 online and £15 offline) out of our £500 target. On behalf of this brother we will like to thank the brothers and sisters who have donated so generously, may God continue to bless you all.

Also for brothers and sisters who will like to contribute to the course, can we urge you to please do so before the end of the period of this campaign, because the Indiegogo account will close by 8th February 2015. For the benefit of those who still want to donate please click on the link - CONTRIBUTE NOW below.

Once again many thanks for your generosity.

story: After 17 years of cutting hair and using grooming products of all kinds known to man, I was always interested on what was in the product and had all the questions of who and what , why were these ingredients used and for what. After not knowing most of these answers off the knowledge I had it was time to do some research and it was time to start all my trial and errors, I got right to it mixing all different ingredients to see which ingredients meshed well and worked well together and most importantly worked well on the person using them. I got to a point now were I have a few recipes which are being requested more and more every day and its time to involve a manufacture and a laboratory to make each item professionally made and packaged. All of my product which took years to come up with are about 88% organic and vegan free. So to get me rolling in the right direction some money raised will help to research more then what has already been done to have the highest quality of ingredients that go into the products to keep our products as clean an simple as possible but yet give you the best outcome for any of your grooming needs. Some money raised will go into restructuring the foundation that has already been built because we have out grown our packaging and need to upgrade the look and feel to give you not only the best quality products but the best looking products with knowing image is a big selling point in this industry of men's grooming, we also have out grown our in take of orders and now need manufacturing.

I got to a point now were I have a few recipes which are being requested more and more every day and its time to involve a manufacture and a laboratory to make each item professionally made and packaged. All of my product which took years to come up with are about 88% organic and vegan free. So to get me rolling in the right direction some money raised will help to research more then what has already been done to have the highest quality of ingredients that go into the products to keep our products as clean an simple as possible but yet give you the best outcome for any of your grooming needs. Some money raised will go into restructuring the foundation that has already been built because we have out grown our packaging and need to upgrade the look and feel to give you not only the best quality products but the best looking products with knowing image is a big selling point in this industry of men's grooming, we also have out grown our in take of orders and now need manufacturing.

story:
The Super Quick Pitch:

- Vinyl is back in a big way!

- The Vinyl Countdown will be the only place in Downtown Charleston to buy new and used vinyl.

- We already have a huge record inventory and a fantastic sound system, and we have great ideas to make The Vinyl Countdown your favorite record store ever!

- Help us make The Vinyl Countdown the place you and your friends will want to hang out and shop!

- Awesome Contribution Perks include stickers, T-shirts, LP frames, gift cards, record players, limited edition merchandise, music lessons, a free concert and more!

- If you like what you've read, and you're excited about what we're trying to accomplish, read on for more detailed information.

- Alternatively, if you like what you've read, and you're excited about it and want to help, but don't feel like reading any more, just check out the perks on the right side of the screen and choose your level of contribution. 
                          
                          Thank you for being a part of The Vinyl Countdown!!

The Longer Pitch:  
The Vinyl Revolution Comes to Downtown Charleston
Vinyl is back, baby!  In 2007, fewer than 1 million new LPs were sold, in 2014, that number was over 9 million, and that upward growth is expected to keep rising exponentially.  In the last year alone, sales of new vinyl were up 40.4% over the same period last year.  

But where can one go in Downtown Charleston to get one's hands on a vast selection of quality new and used vinyl?  The current answer is:  nowhere.  The Vinyl Countdown intends to remedy that problem.

With a wide selection of classic used vinyl, The Vinyl Countdown will be the only place on the peninsula where you will be greeted and helped by a friendly and knowledgeable, record-focused staff.  You'll actually be able to examine with your own eyes and ears that vintage copy of Zeppelin 4 or Abbey Road that you've been considering buying online, but have been hesitant to purchase, because, when buying online, you can't touch it, visually examine it up close, or listen to it before making your purchase (You also can't smell it online, which, believe it or not can be super important!).

We will also carry new releases on vinyl from indie record labels such as Merge, Matador, Sub-Pop, Rough Trade, etc., as well as from major labels.  

Used CDs and DVDs as well as T-shirts, stickers, memorabilia, etc. will be for sale as well, but, as the name of the store implies, the primary focus will be on vinyl.

Additionally, we will host in-store performances and have DJs spinning on a regular basis.  Our goal is not only to simply sell records, but to create a communal gathering space where people can listen to music (using headphones, over the stereo system, or live), discuss music and feel comfortable finding a place to sit down for a while, have a free cup of coffee, and enjoy the vibe.  

I have personally been in the music business in one capacity or another (performance, teaching, songwriting, etc.) for my entire adult life.  Now it's time for me to enter a new phase.  Additionally, I have experience working at two record stores and an almost encyclopedic knowledge of music from the 1960s up to the most current artists.

With your help, The Vinyl Countdown will be more than just a record store.  It will be an opportunity to build and connect a community of music lovers, vinyl collectors, and musicians.

What We Currently Need & What You Get In Return When You Contribute

At this point, we already have:

-  a decent inventory of both new and used vinyl, as well as used CDs

-  some display fixtures

-  a PA system and stage lighting for in-store performances

-  a high end stereo system upon which to play records in the store.  

But, there is so much more necessary to make this store a reality.  

Quite a bit more inventory is still needed.  Additionally we need more fixtures, a cash-wrap and point of sale system, office supplies, a dedicated work computer and a killer website.  

We also need to make sure that we have enough cash on hand to pay rent and utilities for the first few months, as well as to purchase records and CDs from customers.  

By donating to The Vinyl Countdown, you will have the opportunity to receive a wide variety of rewards, based on your level of contribution.

You can check out all of these rewards on the right side of the screen.


What We're Up Against (And Why We're Not Scared)

By all accounts, retail isn't an easy business.  That being said, if I didn't believe so strongly in this project, I would not be doing it.  I am following my heart and am excited about being able to do something I love and that I have dreamed of for many years.

As a recorded medium, vinyl has outlasted every other format:  reel-to-reels, cassettes, 8 tracks, Minidiscs, etc. have all gone the way of the dinosaur, while vinyl continues to be a sought after format.  Even CDs are experiencing a long, slow decline that will ultimately lead to their demise as an audio format.  

According to an interview with industry expert, Josh Bizar, who works as sales director for Musicdirect, "The forecast is for the eventual demise of CDs, but 50 years from now, there will still be new vinyl albums being made. Vinyl will outlive us all."


Is $15,000 Really Enough To Open a Record Store?

No, not really, but we already have a lot of what we need to be up and running, and $15,000 seems like an attainable goal.  Plus, if we don't reach the goal, Indiegogo takes a lot of money from us, so please help us make it there!  If you see that we've reached our goal, please don't hesitate to continue donating.  Perks will still be available, and with more funding we can create an even better experience for you.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know not everyone can make a financial contribution, but that doesn't mean you can't help make The Vinyl Countdown Charleston's premiere community-building record store.  Tell your friends, tell your neighbors, tell musicians who want to have their products stocked in our store.  

And don't forget about the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Bootyland opened in 1996 in the Chester Building on E. Pine St in Seattle. In 2005 we moved two doors down in the same building to our present location. Bootyland was conceived by two moms who realized that there was no neighborhood shop where Capitol Hill parents could procure out-of-the-mainstream parenting goods. So Bootyland was born, a kid's shop featuring vintage, urban, non-commercial clothing, kid equipment, and a few new handmade items.

Ellie Cassidy was working at the shop but she saw the potential for Bootyland to be so much more. She envisioned a shop for modern, city-dwelling families where all of the goods would be ethically made using sustainable materials, would promote healthy ideas, and would be hip, cool, and full of style. She took ownership of the store in 2000 and began cultivating her vision.She created and implemented ethical guidelines to ensure that Bootyland would only stock items that are good for people and good for the planet. Today we are an award-winning independent retail shop. Noted as one of the best clothing shops in the city as well as the most awesome kids clothing store. Bootyland provides a thoughtfully curated collection of items from a wide variety of designers and makers. Thank you AlelaPhotography for these lovely images.

Bootyland is on the look-out for a new space. After over 18 years in the Chester Building we are looking for a space that will better suit our customers. Capitol Hill has seen much growth and redevelopment over the last few years, significantly changing the face of the neighborhood, and Bootyland must change too. We are asking for your support and participation. This is what we are about and what we are asking from you:

  • Help us continue to do what we love...all ethical all the time

  • A curated collection of local made, small designers that merge design with sustainability.

  • Our focus on baby clothing, soft goods, and toys that are kind to the earth and the humans who make them

  • Shout-out for toddler and kids clothing and toys that have style and creativity

  • For all the ladies, clothing focused on function and style

We will continue this tradition and with your support, you will be an integral part of it! We need $5,000 to $10,000 to complete our transition into a new home. Your funds will enable us to cover the cost of moving and setting up an amazing space full of vibrant, creative goods. Your support will help us put the word out about our new digs and our passion for design and ethics. 

Your help right now will make this transition smooth. Since we always have sustainability in mind, we will reuse what we can from our current location. Of course, we will have needs for new fixtures made from up-cycled materials and we are hoping for bamboo hangers. Your support may also allow some new collaborations with local makers and artists, such as creating a mural in the new space. We are also considering the viability of earlier opening times so parents can meet and have discussions or baby & toddler playtimes. We even hope to have more baby wearing and cloth diapering classes. The more support we have, the more we can give back.

With all this new space in the works we are celebrating! We are celebrating the past 18 plus years in an amazing community. We celebrate all the connections we made and all of those to come. We will have a Party on Feb 13th at our current location at 1317 E. Pine Street.

Here are some other ways you could participate and support us:

1 Shop in the store this next month

2 Create a gift registry for your next special event

3 Purchase a gift certificate for yourself or a friend

4 Tell your friends and family about our campaign

5 Come party with us

Thank You from the Bootyland Family!

story:
Short Summary

We cannot emphasize enough the importance of supporting local artists and artisans!! As a start up manufacturing business, we hope y'all feel the same. 

Who "we" are:

Emily- seamstress, musician, business woman

Chad- artist, craftsman, musician

Together our shared passion for, well, ..Passions.. blossomed into a small, home grown business.

What We Need & What You Get

Plain and simple.. We need to generate revenue. The least bit of contribution would give us a leg to stand on. We hope to generate $2,000 while we get our bearings and finely tune this business. Any contribution would be considered a sale and "perks" would reflect this.

The Impact

...The irony! But in all sincerity folks, this cannot be gauged. Any support would give us the opportunity to keep plugging away at this endeavor which we so love and have invested so much in. While we understand our product may not mean world peace, it may allow some of you out there to express and explore your own love life. And love, that's a beautiful thing.

Risks & Challenges

Other than a red bottom, we dread hurt feelings. But with so much at stake and so much invested it is humbling to ask for support. Never the less, we understand the risk and challenges well. Convincing those around you of the importance of small business, and competing with pricing from mass produced, low quality products.. Well there in lies the problem. We believe in quality hand made products. We work with leather y'all, that's an old timey trade, nearly lost, that we love. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Maybe you don't enjoy the kinky side of life, but we guarantee you know someone who does. Share the word and we promise all the good karma you can handle!

story:
Welcome to the Cannabis Community Project;

a weekly broadcast-podcast high-up in Denver Colorado;

exploring the business side of the newly emerging economy, while living the lifestyle.

The Cannabis Community Project - Radio Show aims to investigate every aspect of Cannabis as an avenue to create businesses, fuel economic growth, and locate career opportunities. This is NOT your SON’s STONER SHOW! 



CCP was founded after my brother passed away a few years ago from a hard fight with Leukemia. He lost that battle, but was able to inspire me to carry on his life work in cannabis. He was a top grower from the emerald triangle in Northern California. I was able to see his operation and listen to his passion in person just weeks before he passed. I am not a grower, but I am passionate about cannabis. I took my three most passionate topics, cannabis, media and business, and formed CCP - Radio Show in memory of him, hence, the term cannapreneur. I am a cannaprenuer with life experiences as well as high educational achievements, a passion for cannabis, and a profound understanding of emerging media platforms in the digital age, the CCP aims to be the media platform that grows side by side with the expanding cannabis industry of the United States.


                  


 At  www.cannabiscommunityproject.com, we focus on the intricate details associated with starting a business in the cannabis industry. As a result, we highlight everyone across the cannabis spectrum:  From the patient, to the user, to the retailer and the consumer, even to the geek in the garage creating the next innovation in cannabis. We are THE media platform to help our fellow cannaprenuers build sustainable and profitable business models. Together, let’s build a podcast that focuses on the issues at the front of the industry: Health | Legal Issues | Food | Art | Music | Growth Techniques | Technology & Innovation | Business.

                       


I want to crowdsource this show, and together we're going to discover thousands of different businesses from which individuals have obtained employment and opportunity.  www.cannabiscommunityproject.com There is going to be thousands of business opportunities once hemp production begins,together we can help each other get up and growing, or get in business, and living life again.


             


Do you have a great business idea but struggle with the basics of formation and marketing?  www.cannabiscommunityproject.com I can help. Together with my guests and correspondences we'll cover everything cannabis; through the basics of marketing, websites, finances and prototyping . There is money to be made through a legitimate industry so we might as well get people legitimately employed in it.


                            


Are you Formerly a criminal because of pot? Turn it into a cannabis career. Let this show help you grow a garden to save money, or how to take that idea you had when you were deep in thought and turn it into a business. There is one industry that can save the Colorado economy,as well as the US economy. Like many across the US that live in rural farming towns, they have known for years that their industry is dying. It is now time to do something different, but using the infrastructure already in place. We can bring back the new age of agribusiness 3.0. Just in time to bail out so many that are depending on it for their retirement. Make it happen.  www.cannabiscommunityproject.com This is just as much an issue for those retiring as for those newly entering the workforce. it’s time to get involved and show the world how to shift that money from jails, courts and hospitals ­ to shops, farms, and fabrication, all taxed, and positively industrialized.                   

Join me! My name is Brainstorm and I am a cannapreneur building a show for and by like minded people. I am changing the lives of individuals by helping them find opportunities as entrepreneurs. I believe in the saying “You are what you do & think about most of the time(Earl Nightingale).”  I created The Cannabis Community Project - Radio Show to find like minded people whom have a similar story and desire be an artist, and in business on their own terms.   www.cannabiscommunityproject.com 


The donations from the CCP_Campaign will be used towards the following:

* Equipment (up to $1500)

  http://schoolofpodcasting.com/equipment/

* Media/website hosting - site & app / ($600 Year) 

 https://www.libsyn.com/

http://www.weebly.com/link/y7EUOu

* Domains/emails ($50 Year)

https://www.hover.com/

* Audio mastering ($150 Year)

  https://auphonic.com/pricing

* High speed Internet ($600 Year)

   http://www.xfinity.com/ 

* Editing software ($100 Year)

http://hindenburg.com/shop/

* Business Fees/insurance/accounting ( $1000 year)

http://www.sos.state.co.us/

https://my.waveapps.com/

* Promotional materials - cards, clothes,flyers ($1000 Year)

http://www.vistaprint.com/


These are some of the perks you'll get back as gifts and  when you donate.

* Media/website hosting - site & app / ($600 Year) 
 https://www.libsyn.com/
http://www.weebly.com/link/y7EUOu


* Domains/emails ($50 Year)
https://www.hover.com/


* Audio mastering ($150 Year)
  https://auphonic.com/pricing


* High speed Internet ($600 Year)
   http://www.xfinity.com/ 


* Editing software ($100 Year)
http://hindenburg.com/shop/


* Business Fees/insurance/accounting ( $1000 year)
http://www.sos.state.co.us/
https://my.waveapps.com/


* Promotional materials - cards, clothes,flyers ($1000 Year)
http://www.vistaprint.com/

These are some of the perks you'll get back as gifts and  when you donate.

story:
Growing up I was always a fan of anime. Being a 90's kid, Dragon Ball Z has always held a special place in my heart, and recently a friend of mine got me a very special gift, a four-star Dragon Ball. I'm a collector, so I had to ask what shop she bought it at so I could go get the rest of them and make my wish.  She laughed and said that there aren't shops around that sell stuff like that, you can only get merch like that at conventions.  Being a resident of Greensboro, and attending a few con's around North Carolina, I know that there are a pleathora of other people around here who love anime and Japanese Moe culture like I do, and my "wish" is to create a shop where people can come to share their love of anime, games, and Moe culture, and to find the things they can't find anywhere else.  Since we'll have all 7 Dragon Balls, we can really be a place where people's wishes come true.

Our names are Cruz and Cory, and we've been working over the last few months to make this dream, a Little Akihabara in Greensboro, a reality. Both of us coming from years of corporate retail jobs (Gamestop, HHGregg, ect...), have seen both sides of the retail industry, both as employees, and as customers.  We are striving to create a place where people want  to come to get the products they are looking for, and leave knowing that they are appreiciated and always welcome back. Little Akihabara is a place where people can come to events that interest them, and get the merchandise that can't be found anywhere else.  If there is something you are looking for that we don't have, let us know,  and we will work our hardest to find it and get it to you. 

Our goal is to raise $50,000, which we estimate is the total startup costs for opening and running this shop. If that goal is not met here, we will use the funds towards a loan for the rest of what we need. We are pretty far along in the process, and plan to be open by April 2015. The Moe community is still growing, and we need your help to create an outlet for not only the physical products you want, but an outlet  for our community and the people in it to grow as well.

story:
Short Summary

Sonoma County Wire is a Video Magazine about the commerce and community of Sonoma County, California. We've all seen tourism magazines with glossy pages filled with fun things to do, but those media outlets have a limited reach. The professionally shot and edited videos from Sonoma County Wire can reach the world!

Last year, Hannah Gart and Edward Seaton posted 40 videos to the Sonoma County Wire youtube channel. Those videos covered natural beauty, new businesses, creative activities, and things to do and see here in this beautiful region of Northern California. This year Hannah and Edward would like to post 40 more videos.

You can watch all of our videos for free on the Sonoma County Wire youtube channel and blog.

What We Need & What You Get

We are trying to raise $12,000 so that we can make another 40 videos in 2015. That works out to be $300 per video, a reasonable price for high quality professional Micro Documentaries.

In exchange for your generous donations we like to offer several levels of engagement, some interesting incentives, and gifts to choose from.

$25 - You'll get our deep, heartfelt thanks, and we'll list you, or your Business name on the Sonoma County wire Fan Page.

$75 - We'll send you a Sonoma County Wire T-shirt and we'll add your name or a Business name to the list of contributors on our website.

$150 - Sonoma County Wire will edited your name into the credits of an upcoming video, and you get the T-shirt, and you get added to the Fan page.

$300 - Our highest level of contribution gets a graphic, picture, and personal message added to the end of one of our Video Segments.  

The Impact

Why is this kind of video content so important? Sonoma County California relies heavily on tourists visiting our diverse region from all over the wold. Those people plan their trips by gathering information online. The beautiful videos of Sonoma County Wire can be shared and pasted into any website, and will help tell the stories of our community to those who are searching for it.

Sonoma County Wire is a "good news" source, or rather, a source of good news. When people search for information on a place they will visit, it is often sensational headlines that lead the results. Sonoma County Wire is focused on creating media and stories around the positive, and placing that content in a growing library of videos for people to watch and use for years to come.

Risks & Challenges

Creating videos on this level takes time and expensive equipment. Eventually businesses using the Sonoma County Wire library will fund the project, but the SCW is only a year old and needs time to mature. Your generous pledge will help keep this concept up and running for another year. With 80 videos in our library by this time next year, Sonoma County Wire will be a well established media outlet.

Other Ways You Can Help

Everyone who watches our content, loves it, but not everyone has money to share. If you cannot make a pledge to SCW today we understand, and would love for you to share this campaign with your friends using your social media channels. We would also like you to like and follow our Facebook Page and Youtube channel. Every like helps. Thank you.

story:
Who We Are

Urbanautica represents photography from the source, curating interviews & features from our team-members respective cities/countries all around the world:

  • Interviews & stories with photographers, curators, collectors.
  • Reviews & Essay on photo books.
  • Portfolio reviews, exhibitions, workshops.
  • Constantly growing photography archive to be useful now & in the future, meant to record history as it's happening.
  • Push forward our network with schools, academies and students around the world.
  • Boost our photo exhibitions search engine and see the latest happenings.

Urbanautica came from humble beginnings, and is now a contemporary journal/archive spread in 4 continents and thousands of followers. We are all photographers and curators: Steve, Dieter, Peter, David, Tiago, Natalya, Sanne, Nicolette, Luciana, Eline, Kenneth, Lina, Francesca, Bärbel, Talia, Renata, Klaus, Georges, Irith, Sylvie, Krzysztof, Karl, Lisa. We have far outgrown our web presence & need to call on photography lovers of all kinds for support in order to continue to cover the dynamic field of photography!

Portfolio review at Zebrastraat, Ghent Belgium, 2015

A New Website for the future & history of Photography

Help us move forward with a totally redesigned platform for Urbanautica & become part of the worldwide network! 5.000 € is is the minimum amount that we want to reach to begin with. Any additional contributions will help us make this dream a better reality.

  • The world wide web is our primary platform, that connects our massive global network.
  • We require funding for a website that will reflect the incredible talent we feature as well as serve as a categorical search engine for our photography archive.
  • With a better website, we are a better Urbanautica! Our talented team & featured photography needs a place to better serve the photography community! 

'Decrescimento' Laboratory on Photography and Urban Investigation, Sao Paulo, Brazil, 2013

The Impact

Bringing all contemporary photography to your fingertips through a customizable & flexible searchable archive as well as daily updates from the world of photography today

  • We are people who love photography who want to uncover the latest work from all over the world and bring it straight to you all in one place.
  • Representing our peers: we create partnerships & networks by promoting what we are excited about in order to make an impact that is real.
  • Fueled by the passion of our visionary leader Steve Bisson, who began this project in 2010, Urbanautica has only grown via word of mouth & a common love for what we do!
  • With our new website we would be able to do all of this, but better than ever.

Exhibition 'Experience of Space. Landscape in Photography' at MSUV Museum of Contemporary Art Vojvodina, Serbia, 2014

Risks & Challenges

We don't sell out. As people with a passion, we rely on our valued partnerships & followers to keep the Urbanautica dream alive. Being that our curators were former followers/fans, Urbanautica is built to function for people who love what we do. To continue to grow, we need input from the people who we do this for.

  • With no ads, Urbanautica needs the support from our followers/fans/partners to promote growth.
  • You get back what you put in: The more support we receive, the more Urbanautica can give to our photography community!

Workshop 'Zero Fotografia': photography and rural landscape, Fondazione Benetton, Treviso, Italy, 2012

Awards

Supports our campaign and get your cumulative reward!
  • Reward #1: with 5 € get your name on our special friend list page on the new website! 
  • Reward #2: with 10 € get a free tribute post on Urbanautica! (+ reward #1)
  • Reward #3: with 50 € get your work introduced through a special interview on Urbanautica! (+ rewards #1 and #2)
  • Reward #4: with 100 € get a free copy of the #1 Urbanautica Exhibition Catalog 'Naturae'! (+ rewards #1, #2 and #3)
  • Reward #5: with 200 € get a free copy of the #1 issue (limited edition) of our new book series 'Urbanautica Collections' (+ rewards #1, #2, #3 and #4)
  • Reward #6: with 500 € get 3-year partnership promotion of your activities! (+ reward #1, #2, #3. #4 and #5)

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute, you can send us some love:

  • Follow Urbanautica on social media to get the latest stories & work from photography in 4 continents (soon to be more!)
  • Share our work: word of mouth is one of the many ways to support us! Like, share, follow & discover what we've found.

This is coming from a fan turned Urbanautica team member. I joined because I was excited about this dynamic & group-based photography forum/journal that makes Urbanautica so unique & exciting!

Any level of support is what our community is about. If you're a fan/follower/photographer/reader/teacher, you're part of Urbanautica!

Support. Share. Read.

By Veronica Gonzáles (Urbanautica PR Manager)
