story:
Flavour your mobile world !

Apps are often like pizzas - they can bring a smile to your face and make your life feel better - even bring you joy! Like the Margherita pizza changed the 19th century, our apps will change today.

From the rendezvous to the idea

We’ve always had a dream - to start a family business, like an Italian pizzeria - passed down through generations, with a history and tradition behind it. With an original taste, a family atmosphere, full of passion, smiling faces and support from regular customers.

Unfortunately, we have no idea how to make a pizza or run a restaurant, but… we do know the IT industry VERY well. That’s why we decided to start “Apperia” - a family startup that builds pizza...ehm, apps :)

Here we are - team of relatives with lots of IT relevant, innovative ideas:

Interactive Director - professional and sophisticated in wide front-end technology. Started coding websites after started reading and writing. Knows how people interact with applications and electronic devices. Interested in mobile world and promising new, unconventional technology. Passionate and dedicated his creativity. Worked with various companies, from small to huge what helped understand different way of thinking. Loved working with people and being a mentor. Sensitive on pixel perfect precision. Agile methodology believer.

Product Manager - qualified expert with continuous experience in broad range of product management and marketing roles. Specialised in mobile and cloud with strong technical background. Visionary of new products driven by market needs. Precursor of innovative solutions and founder of many prototypes which turned into real successful products used by thousands of users. Obsessed with making people much more productive in business and daily activities.

UX Designer - over 8 years of experience in user interfaces creation and products development by concentrating on users' needs rather than on particular pieces of interface or styles. Worked for various of companies - from small creative agencies to well known, international IT giants. Lived in, worked, and travelled to many countries across the world which helped to better understand cultural differences and user needs. Coach, mentor, startup supporter, academic lecturer and a very energetic person.

Technical Program Manager - dedicated and skilled program manager, with over 7 years in technical projects - from small internal tools to highly innovative cloud solutions for Fortune TOP500 giants. Excellent leader, coach and technical trainer successful in managing programs/projects budgets (over $1M) and schedules, in fast-paced, enterprise environment. Ingenious influencer with extensive hands-on background in cloud computing, virtualization and mobile solutions.

Ingredients we love

First things first - what is the most important thing when creating a pizzeria? A great menu of course!

So, we’ve done a lot of research, observed the world around us, talked with lots of people around the world, had over 100 brainstorming sessions and created “a menu” - a list of fresh mobile apps we want to build for everyone. To give everyone joy, to make every life easier and happier. Currently we have several innovative apps in mind that we want to create. The main, healthy “ingredients” are: a bunch of organic personal data, a cup of great user experiences, a few tablespoons of bio commercial, mixed with new technologies and a pinch of high quality passion, plus the essential secret ingredients (just a few !).

“Waiter! There’s a hair in my soup! Call the chef!!”

Ok, so, we’ve got a menu. What next?
Friendly, kind-hearted and happy staff that create a warm atmosphere. In our family, we’ve got a manager that will keep the business running, we’ve got waiters and bartenders (SEOs and marketers) and interior decorators (UX designer and graphic designer) but what we are missing is… ...an experienced pizzaiolo – the chef, maestro, pizza virtuoso. Actually, a software developer that will make those apps.

So here’s where You can help us.
Help us hire the best developers to bring our “pizzas” to life, so we can deliver them to the mobile world. Of course it’s not only about hiring the talent, it's also about their training, a good environment and the right atmosphere at work. Help us expand their talents in a good way, in a company that will help them grow and will take good care of them and their work.

So what can we serve?

We think that the best way to say “Thank You” is to give something back.
When our apps are ready, You’ll get them according to this model:

High five!
5$ donation - Blue Card - 1 free pro app version.

A baker’s dozen!
13$ donation - Silver Card - 3 free pro apps and a HUGE “Thank you” email.

Gold medalist!
20$ donation - Gold Card - 6 free pro apps and official credits on our website.

Of course You choose which apps You want the most.

The secret of secrets...
+100$ - Secret Card - every one of our apps for free and you will have a real impact on our products, from the early beginning to launching the app on the market.

We will provide updates about our work and beta versions of apps - to get feedback from every donor.

Pizza Delivery
+5000$ - Lunch with the Team Lunch with the Team anywhere in the world (transportation and accommodation not included)

To sum up - we definitely don’t want to build another mobile game/fitness app/image gallery/etc. We want to build innovative apps that we have in our minds and give them to all of you.

We’ve done a lot of research and none of these apps currently exist. They are designed to help everyone get the most out of life and to use smartphones as intended - seamlessly, effortlessly - as actual smart devices. Our recipes for cool apps are so good that we want to keep them secret till the end of the development process - just to make sure that no one will spoil our fresh and organic ideas ;)

Help us build a better future for everyone! Simple, easy and working as intended!

story:
Help the Mid-South Buccaneers become real "boucaniers”**

The first BBQers of the Caribbean!

The Mid-South Buccaneers (www.midsouthbuccaneers.com) is a not-for-profit group that helps fund raise for the Commission on Missing and Exploited Children (COMEC):

“For over 23 years COMEC has identified and instituted programs that help children and those who are charged with their care. Promoting the safety and protection of all children and connecting families is what our organization is all about.” (www.comec.org).

Dressed out in pirate garb, we can be found most anywhere. Entertaining children and adults alike, we put on a show for just about any amount of coin. We have a Cooking team which has participated in various cook off’s around the Mid-South, and our Chili Cook-off team has even won Best in Showmanship at the Polar Bear Plunge, which is held on Mud Island each February.

Our team would love to walk away with the grand prize one day, but in order for that dream to come to fruition…. We need the right tools to compete! With a pirate BBQ ship we could set sail in the right direction as we conquer the mighty Mississippi!

**The term buccaneer derives from the Caribbean Arawak word buccan, a wooden frame for smoking meat, preferably manatee. From this derived the French word boucane and hence the name boucanier for French hunters who used such frames to smoke meat from feral cattle and pigs on Hispaniola (now Haiti and the Dominican Republic). English colonists anglicised the word boucanier to buccaneer.

story:
Over the past 20 years, the Vermont Partnership for Fairness & Diversity has become Vermont’s “go to” organization helping state leaders find opportunity in a changing, progressively more diverse population.  Yet, in so many ways, our work has just begun.

NEEDED:  $15,000 to host the 2015 Vermont Vision for a Multicultural Future Conference and post-conference professional development (out of $87,000 total). The successful conference has nearly doubled in size since 2012, outgrowing the volunteer organizers availability. A part-time administrator is vital. $15,000 total = $6,000 registration fees, lodging and mileage for 15-20 community leaders; $9,000 conference administrator.

Vermont Vision has netted great success, increasing the number of Vermont institutions and businesses that work in practical ways to build inclusive and equitable communities.

Vermont Vision and Vermont Partnership assist leaders identify, plan for and take action to advance inclusion and equity. We nurture a network of practitioners with proven success achieving goals of multicultural populations and decision-makers in search of new ways to manage and operate in Vermont's rapidly changing social environment.

Our innovative approach brings together leaders across various sectors to learn and grow towards common, interdependent solutions to address common challenges. Overcoming these challenges will move us closer to an economically sustainable Vermont where residents live and visitors experience a land free of prejudice and discrimination of all kinds.

Listen to what Vermont Vision attendees have to say about their experience at this link:

http://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLQfS8tziKuss...

Please help us get there!

story:
Logramos la libertad parcial de Alexxa, ahora necesitamos terminar de recaudar 8.000 $  para obtener su libertad plena y absoluta.

Historia de Alexxa Martinez Dorante

Relato de una madre desesperada !

Mi hija se vino a EEUU el dia 29 de enero de 2014 , entro a este pais con su visa americana aprobada en la embajada de EEUU en Venezuela el dia 3 de Diciembre de 2013. Arrivo por el aeropuerto de Los Angeles California..Pudo hacer esto en linea aerea cuando todavia y apenas a unos dias de cerrarlas , ya no hubo manera de viajar de esa forma.

Obtuvo su permiso de estadia por 6 meses que vencia el 29 de julio .

Cerca de la fecha de vencimiento 24 de julio especificamente , ella que habia ido a Mexico y pasado por la frontera , luego de pasar y ya en camino a Los Angeles decide devolverse para preguntar en la oficina de migracion como podria obtener su sello de legalidad por un tiempo mas , pues cuando entras al pais y no vas mas alla de cierta distancia no te dan un permiso escrito. .

Las razones ? Vivir en un pais convulsionado y pensar diferente al actual gobierno , solo con tener ideas distintas pensar diferente y estar del lado de la justicia , te hace correr el peligro de estar encarcelado , torturado y en el peor de los casos Muerto.

Su lucha contra este regimen no es en redes sociales , su lucha fue siempre en la calle donde se libran las batallas , en el propio terreno , arriesgando como miles y miles de muchachos que no se conocen sus nombres pero que corren con la suerte de ser perseguidos por cualquier uniformado radical con pocas convicciones y movidos por un odio infundado y no entendido ni por ellos mismos. . Cuando le das poder a la ignorante lo conviertes en un tirano. Entonces queda tu vida dependiendo de encontrarte uno de estos en una esquina y que te desaparezcan y mas nunca supimos . Esa es nuestra realidad ! A mi nadie me la cuenta . . Yo la vivo!

El caso es que al entrar a la oficina de migracion comienza la conversacion entre el oficial y mi hija y desde el principio ella sintio una mala disposicion de este oficial ante ella. . El pregunta donde va ? ella contesta a Los Angeles , luego le pregunta en que se dirige hasta alla y ella le dice que ella tiene su carro afuera , el oficial le dice que el cree que ella esta viviendo en este pais y que va a mandar a revisar su carro , cosa que manda a hacer de inmediato y la aislan en un cuarto . . revisan el carro y al no conseguir nada ilegal regresa y le dice que le entregue sus pertenencias , ya ella estaba retenida y aislada .

Le quitan su cartera su celular y la revisan a ella !, ademas de la mala voluntad del oficial y ya teniendola detenida por pura presuncion y no tomando en cuenta que sus documentos estaban vigentes y fue los que ella presento ante el , ya ni siquiera se detiene a mirar y decide Anular su visa . . Visa que vence hasta el 2023 . .

Luego entonces el oficial se dispone a escribir los cargos y en los cargos solo dice que ella no tenia ni pasaporte ni visa vigente y que por esa razon la deja detenida . .Mi pregunta como puede ser eso si existe un pasaporte decomisado y una visa anulada es alli donde posteriormente se basa el juez de una de las audiencias para decir primeramente que no entiende porque ella fue detenida si tenia sus documentos en regla

Luego la mantienen aislada en la hielera asi se le llama al sitio donde la tuvieron por 4 dias sin permitirle comunicacion alguna. Al cuarto dia se la llevan de San isidro a Casa San Juan en San Diego donde todo el tiempo le decian ya te vamos a soltar y sin mencionar el frio, las dormidas en el piso, la falta de comida y la tortura sicologica .Ese tiempo en aislamiento le permitio organizar ideas para pedir su asilo cosa que estaba en sus planes pero no de esta manera .

Pasados 4 dias mas la regresan a San Isidro y al final de ese dia la suben junto con otros tantos a un bus que los lleva a un aeropuerto y sin saber destino , esposada y humillada como el peor de los delicuentes es llevada bajo una serie de maltratos verbales a un avion que los lleva a Arizona ! La recluyen en ELOY DETENCION CENTER .

Alli esta mi hija desde hace 8 meses , ha tenido varias audiencias y el dia 5 de febrero le fijan una fianza de 10000 dolares , cantidad que no tengo y que por esa razon estoy haciendo un llamado a la humanidad y a la buena voluntad y a su conocimiento de la situacion en Venezuela para ayudarme a recaudar esos fondos para sacar a mi hija de ese sitio y que pueda tener un juicio justo en un proceso que jamas debio existir.

Le pido que analize todo detalladamente, pues su detencion esta basada en una serie de hechos irregulares que los mismos hechos revelan por si solo , le envio los cargos que le imputan , son totalmente falsos pues se lo demuestro con lo que le estoy enviando . . Pasaporte y visa.

Le hago un llamado como madre apelando a su humanidad y al derecho de los seres humanos a vivir en libertad.

Cuando fui a verla la primera vez despues de muchos meses , porque tuve que salir de mi pais por la frontera en carro , llegar a Colombia tomar un avion desde cucuta hasta Bogota luego Bogota - Mexico y quedarme alli , hasta poder reunir el dinero ayudada por personas que creen como yo en mi hija y tomar un avion desde el DF hasta Hermosillo y luego rodar en bus hasta Tucson para finalmente llegar a Eloy. . No se imagina lo que senti al ver a mi hija , si tienes hijos si te lo puedes imaginar , al despedirme de ella le deje mi alma con ella .

Solo por querer una vida libre de represion mi hija se vino a este pais huyendo de la violencia buscando un buen vivir y mire pues donde esta !

Vuelvo a apelar a la humanidad a la conciencia que todo ser humano puede tener ante el dolor y la injusticia y espero en DIOS que es quien me guia me ha dado la fuerza y las palabras sabias y sinceras para poder expresar mi sentir que me escuche y me de la oportunidad de hacer justicia. .

Mi unica bandera LA VERDAD ! y esa nos hara libre !

story:
WHAT WE'RE DOING

Imagine you are a mother with a happy healthy child. Suddenly one day your child starts to have seizures and becomes unresponsive. The seizures become more and more frequent and your child is in pain and unable to do any of the things that used to make them happy.

Imagine you are a husband whose wife was in a terrible car accident and now suffers from debilitating and constant pain. 

Imagine you have worked hard your whole life in a 50 hour a week job and are now retired. You deserve to have your retirement be easy and laid back but you have a repetitive stress injury and laying back to rest causes you extreme pain.

Now imagine if someone came up to each of these people and offered them a solution to their pain, to their stressful lifestyle of caring for a loved one, offered them a natural solution to their family member’s pain? And imagine if the solution could be delivered to their door?

This is where our company, GoDoja comes in.  We understand that for many patients, accessing a licensed facility is difficult. GoDoja will make that process easier for these deserving patients.

We are creating an online marketplace where consumers can shop, compare, rate, and buy cannabis products from many different sources and dispensaries for pickup or delivery. In addition, we will phase in supporting services like aiding consumers in registering and renewing with their state, allowing independent doctors to video conference with and prescribe to patients, and enabling UBER-style independent drivers for delivering products. 

In addition to the front end marketplace, we have discovered that dispensaries are facing a wide variety of integration problems which are preventing them from fully scaling. Many of these problems are relatively simple to solve once we have all of the integration pieces needed for the GoDoja marketplace. To provide additional incentives for dispensaries to partner with us, we will provide an array of back office tools that dispensaries can utilize to streamline their operations.  

WHO WE ARE

The CEO - Chuck has software engineering background and specializes in agile methodologies, product development, and team leadership. He believes great products are not made by great engineers alone, they are made by passionate teams that have the clarity and context to solve real problems in the marketplace. Success comes from listening to the customer, understanding the breadth of the problem and having clear direction. With a deep passion for getting things done, keeping things simple, and solving real problems, he's leading this venture.

The Insider - Brian is currently the Business Manager for a holding company which includes a licensed dispensary for medical cannabis in Arizona. He's responsible for the long term strategic planning, policy and operational requirements for medical cannabis retail, cultivation, and extraction businesses for the Arizona patient market. He has extensive experience in grant, government, retail and non-profit management. Prior to his transition to the cannabis industry, Brian served as COO for a legal technical assistance provider for the Department of Justice and Special Liaison for the Prosecutors office for one of the largest federally recognized tribes in Arizona.  

The Developer - Tom is an accomplished web developer with over 15 years of professional experience.  He graduated magna cum laude from Minnesota State University, is passionate about elegant solutions, aesthetics, and API design.  He brings a tremendous amount of front-end experience to the development team and is currently developing the GoDoja website.

The Financial Guru - Kat is our Secretary and CFO and is currently a sales auditor for a national chain of coffee shops based in Minnesota.  She is detail orientated, focused, thorough, and she's passionate about driving our company results.  She is keeping us on the straight and narrow.

The Manager - Sarah has spent many years managing in the retail business and reliably sets new records in sales and customer satisfaction everywhere she goes.  She's a manager and trainer and has expertise in customer service.  She has a big personality and excels at foraging relationships.  Currently she is acting as our social media manager.

What We Stand Behind - We are in business to exceed the expectations of our customers, to earn a reasonable rate of return for our investors and to pay a living wage to our employees.

HOW YOUR CONTRIBUTION WILL BE USED

We need to get the project off the ground. We're on our way to launching our minimum viable product and we need to pay for basic services like web space and taxes. In short, we need keep-the-lights-on money. We need to get through the next few months so we can show we have traction. With your support we can go live, start processing transactions, and prove we're creating something people want and that we can have a positive impact on our community.

CHALLENGES

Our biggest challenge is funding which is why we're here!  We have fees, subscriptions, software licensing, web space, and general recurring expenses. We aren't in Silicon Valley and we don't have wealthy connections.  We are a family based, grassroots company.  We've identified the market, and we have a solution. We've planted the seed and now we need money to make it grow.

Another big challenge is legislation. We will go national, but each state has its own regulations and even within states different cities and areas may have additional rules, all of which are changing rapidly. We've considered several different states, and we're starting in Arizona partially because the legislation is favorable to this model. Recreational use on the ballet in 2016 so we want to get a foot hold on the market before that happens. In addition to a favorable environment we have a lot of connections in Arizona. One of the members of our team currently runs a dispensary in Tucson, we know several others in the industry, and we have other political, legal and business connections in the state.

Delivery is a challenge but it's not at the top of the list.  We are aware of some of the roadblocks, pun intended, for delivery.  For example, for delivery drivers in Arizona there are jurisdictions that you must avoid. To solve this, our trip plans that will accommodate those areas and make it easy for the drivers to get from point A to point B.

OUR VALUES

  • We value our clients, investors and employees.
  • We value and abide by the laws of the states and local jurisdictions in which we do business.
  • We value honesty and integrity.
  • We value creativity and innovation.
  • We value nature and the environment.

GUIDING PRINCIPLES

  • Do no harm.
  • Give every transaction full attention and care.
  • Respond to inquiries and complaints quickly and politely.
  • Strive for continuous improvement in all of our endeavors.
  • Work cooperatively and compete fairly.
  • Work with passion.
  • Imagine the future and act to improve it.
  • Resolve conflicts reasonably.
  • Respect others.
  • Respect yourself.

Imagine the future and act to improve it.
Resolve conflicts reasonably.
Respect others.
Respect yourself.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Anthony DeStefano and I graduated from a highly reputable dental school in 2004.  After graduation I entered a general practice residency where I received additional dental training based in a hospital setting.  This training more than prepared me for private practice.  Once in private practice, I have had the pleasure of working in a great variety of dental offices.  I have practiced in large corporate owned dental offices, as well as, small family owned dental practices.  All of which provided their own unique experiences.

These professional experiences opened my eyes to the many problems that dental practitioners can face in any setting.  One of the common problems that I identified with any practice, involved the referral process.  The process associated with sending the patient out to receive treatment with another practitioner.  Patient referrals are often hand written on a piece of paper and handed to the patient for them to take to the other office.  Often times the hand written paper referral would be lost either by the patient or the practice where they were referred.  The lost referral would cause a significant delay in the patient receiving necessary treatment because the referral would need to be rewritten and reissued to the patient.

In addition to lost referrals, hand written referrals are not a secure way to transmit protected health information.  A lost referral that contains your personal information, images, and treatment notes could end up in the wrong hands compromising your personal information. 

It is also very hard for the dental practice to track a patient that has been given a referral.  The dentist will wonder if the patient scheduled an appointment with the specialist or if the patient received the treatment that they needed?  It is near impossible to know the answers to these questions with the outdated referral system that is currently used by many dentists.

I have set out to conquer all of the problems associated with the current method of referring dental patients from office to office.

Relay Referral is an e-referral solution that will quickly transmit private patient information from office to office via a secure HIPAA compliant network.  Relay Referral will posses a simple intuitive interface that will allow the referring doctor to quickly select the destination office from a list of saved, commonly used contacts.  The patients private information, images, dental notes and additional pertinent information can easily be attached to the referral and quickly sent over the secure HIPAA compliant network.  The destination doctor would receive instant notification, through the secure application, that a patient has been referred to their practice.  The referral could then be reviewed along with the patients private information, images, chart notes and other pertinent information.

Relay Referral also makes two way communication a breeze.  Once the patient receives the necessary treatment, an update to the  referral can be sent back to the original dentist explaining the treatment received, any complications or outcomes of the procedure.

Relay will also give the user the ability to set automatic notifications.  Lets say a patient never schedules an appointment or receives treatment with the specialist where they were referred, a notification can be sent back to you explaining that there are no updates for the patient and that they should be contacted, via Relay Referral, to follow up with either office.

Relay Referral can be customized to meet the needs of any dental practice.  It will offer a quick and secure method for referring patients from office to office.  It will give dental offices the ability to track their patients and ensure they are receiving beneficial dental care.  It will greatly reduce the inefficiencies and lost time that the current, outdated referral system poses, which will increase dental practice efficiency, security, and provide improved treatment outcomes for patients.

Every contribution received will be instrumental in providing a solid foundation for Relay Referral.  We have already selected a reputable team that focuses all of their time and energy on creating amazing web applications.  All of these contributions will allow them to complete the initial research and definition of terms and functions.  They will also be able to complete the detailed outline for the project, define the database, and complete the wire framing for the entire web application.  This is the most crucial aspect of the project since any programming will be based on this blueprint.  A strong foundation will create a solid performing web application that will have exceptional functionality, unmatched aesthetics and be a breeze to use.


What We Need & What You Get

We have an initial goal of $15,000 for this project.  $8000 will be used to create the foundation for the web application which will include, initial research/definition of all terms and functions, scope writing, database definition and wireframes.

A portion of the additional funds will be used in a  marketing effort to raise awareness for this web application and its amazing features and benefits to the dental field.

Any remaining funds will be used to begin programming the web application.

If we don't reach our goal, any funds raised will still be used as planned.  The groundwork for the application will still be laid.  However, an additional marketing effort and SEO campaign would be created in order to raise the additional funds necessary to complete the project.


The Impact

This project will be invaluable to dentists and any person that has been involved with the referral process.  Relay referral will greatly reduce the many imperfections of an outdated referral system.  Gain back precious time from lost or misplaced referrals.  Protect your private health information with a secure HIPAA complaint network.  Track your patients to ensure they receive the treatment that has been recommended.  Increase the level of care and efficiency of your dental practice.  

I have worked for many different practices over the years and have gained an immense knowledge of patient care and practice management as a result.  I have taken this knowledge and experience to build a successful dental practice from the ground up.  I now want to focus my attention on solving the many issues that arise from the referral process.

The long term goal of this project has a much greater reach than the dental field, but I am starting with what I know.  I eventually want to solve the woes that are experienced by many occupations in regard to the referral process.




Risks & Challenges

There are always risks associated with introducing a new product into a field that is using an antiquated system.  We have taken the time to introduce our idea and receive feedback from many in dentistry.  As a result, we have received an amazing positive response and the confidence to move forward with Relay Referral.

We have added a few key team members that will provide the much needed insight and guidance that this company needs.  One team member has 15+ years of professional/sales experience in Healthcare IT.  He has helped clients achieve efficiencies and productivity gains through the use of technology.

Another team member offers years of IT/network experience.  He will be instrumental in building and maintaining the high security requirements associated with a HIPAA compliant technology solution.

Together, we can redefine the referral process and greatly improve dentistry.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute financially, you can still help our campaign by spreading the word to as many people as you know.  Share our story with your friends and family using social media, Indiegogo share tools and Ellen!


Thank you,

Relay Referral

story:
Respira, siente, libera! El sueño de Candela

¡Sí! ha llegado el momento en el que el anhelo de mi corazón es dedicarme 100% a este trabajo y compartir todo lo aprendido estos años con muchas más personas

Para ello me gustaría contar con la financiación necesaria para una campaña de comunicación profesional con la que dar a conocer algunos de mis servicios, especialmente las clases de Movimiento Dolka, al mayor número de personas posible. También poder adquirir material especial con el que enriquecer dichas clases.

 Y qué mejor forma de obtener el dinero que ofreciéndoos a cambio el servicio que tanto me gusta!

Podréis encontrar ofertas sobre algunos de mis servicios habituales y nuevas experiencias individuales, en pareja o grupo que he creado especialmente para esta campaña como La cena de los Sentidos y el Taller de Feminidad y Sevillanas.

¡Mirad a la derecha y echad un vistazo a todo lo que podéis disfrutar! 

También hay otra forma valiosísima con la que podéis contribuir a este sueño y es compartir esta campaña con otras personas. Si tenéis amigos, compañeros de trabajo, parejas, familiares que creéis que les gustaría trabajar conmigo y compartís esta campaña con ellos, yo seré feliz de charlar con ellos y explicarles más sobre el trabajo.

Para todas las formas de colaborar encontraré la manera de decir ¡gracias!

A los que ya me conocéis, amigos, clientes, familias, compañeros solo puedo decir gracias, gracias, gracias, por todo el apoyo y la confianza en mi crecimiento profesional. A los que no nos conocemos, también gracias por estar aquí leyendo y apoyando esta campaña,
Un fuerte abrazo

Candela


Más información sobre las recompensas

Las clases de Movimiento Dolka

Un espacio donde aprendemos a amar y a cuidar el cuerpo y a liberarlo de
tensiones y contracturas, un viaje a través de las capas musculares, mentales y emocionales hasta tocar nuestro centro. http://www.candelapoo.com/-movimiento-dolka.html

El Masaje energético nutritivo

Un lanzamiento en exclusiva para los participantes del crowfunding. Una experiencia de contacto con el cuerpo desde el cariño y el respeto, escuchando su necesidad y dando el espacio para la relajación de los tejidos y la nutrición del alma.

El Método Holístico de Autoconsciencia

El MHA es una técnica que facilita tomar consciencia tanto de nuestros patrones y actitudes perjudiciales como de nuestras fortalezas y capacidades internas, para la transformación y liberación personal. Esta recompensa es para aquellas personas que no han probado el MHA y quieren conocer en primera persona sus beneficios. http://www.candelapoo.com/mha.html

Taller Sevillanas y Feminidad

Un taller para mujeres, donde aprender de forma distendida los primeros pasos de la sevillanas mientras nos aventuramos en la preciosa aventura de nuestra auténtica feminidad y el apoyo entre mujeres.  http://www.candelapoo.com/feminidad-por-sevillanas.html

La Cena de los sentidos

Una experiencia gastrónomica y sensorial donde disfrutaremos de un antiguo ritual para la degustación con todos los sentidos. El bono es para dos personas e incluye la degustación.

Las Clases de Movimiento Dolka en asociaciones y centros de trabajo

Esta recompensa está pensada para asociaciones sin ánimo de lucro, entidades o centros de trabajo del área metropolitana de Barcelona. Una actividad especialmente beneficiosa para personas que por sus hábitos o actividad generan estrés, contracturas, tensiones crónicas o tienen dificultades para tener consciencia y cuidar de su cuerpo, así como para personas con dolor crónico, lumbago, fibromialgia, etc.

Para recibir esta recompensa es necesario contar con un espacio amplio adecuado para la actividad, así como esterillas o mantas o la posibilidad de que los participantes las traigan. Si estáis interesados y no disponéis de alguno de los materiales o si no estais en el área metropilitana pero sí en las cercanías de Barcelona, no dudéis en escribir para valorar la viabilidad de disfrutar de esta recompensa!

Si vuestra disponibilidad horaria es limitada por favor contactar con anterioridad para para asegurar la viabilidad de la colaboración.

Temporalidad y condiciones para las recompensas

Excepto las recompensas que tienen una fecha específica, las demás son válidas desde la finalización del crowfunding hasta el 31 de Julio de 2016, siempre confirmando la disponibilidad de horarios. 

A partir del 31 de Mayo habrá que confirmar la disponibilidad con al menos un mes de antelación para evitar que haya recompensas que no puedan ser satisfechas por cuestión de horarios. En caso de no contar con suficiente antelación, la persona se arriesga a perder el derecho de disfrute. 

Las recompensas no son retornables en caso de que se decida no asistir, pero sí que podéis regalarla a una tercera persona, avisando del traspaso.

Compras

Las recompensas pueden comprarse a través de la página y también puede hacerse una compra offline quien lo necesite.

Localización

Las sesiones presenciales, los talleres, los masajes y las clases (excepto aquellas para asociaciones y centros de trabajo) se recibirán en Gracia, Barcelona.

Las sesiones individuales de Método Holístico también pueden recibirse por skype o teléfono desde cualquier lugar del mundo.

¿Cómo voy a utilizar los fondos recaudados?

El total propuesto para recaudar es de 4000€

 2000€ para contratar los servicios profesionales de una agencia que desarrolle una campaña de comunicación en medios locales para dar a conocer mis servicios especialmente las clases de Movimiento Dolka

200€ para materiales que enriquecerán las clases de Movimiento Dolka

50€ gastos de gestoría y asesoría fiscal

840€ - IVA (21% del total recaudado)

600€ - IRPF (15% del total recaudado)

320 - 5% comisión Indiegogo + 3% gastos bancarios


Si necesitáis cualquier otra información

Podéis contactarme a través de esta página, en mi correo electrónico candelapoo@gmail.com o por teléfono en el 655109979, estaré encantada de facilitaros lo que necesitéis!




Las clases de Movimiento Dolka

story:
Short Summary

  • I provide small loans to individuals based on trust. Banks wont lend to tenants or home owners who may have a low credit score. I provide a much needed service for emergencies and financial help. 
  • I've been in financial services for  29 years, financial advisor, mortgage advisor, financial planner etc.. moving into my own business 17 years ago. I have a wide business experience. 
  • I am not liked by Banks as my last business took £8 million in compensation off them  and banks will not assist in expanding any type of competing business.
  • I would like to become the largest most ethical lender in the UK for non status people I believe Crowd Funding Contributors can help me achieve this goal.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need funding for expansion my personal outlay will be around £20,000 by May 2016. My maximum current personal funds will cap out at £50,000. After this level of investment I will be stuck in the cash-flow conundrum and will need outside funding to expand past my target of £100,000 in loans by the end of 2016.
  • Your contribution to this campaign means we can expand our model faster, you will be elevated to Business Angel Status. You will become part of an ethical growing business and you can participate whenever you wish.You will be included in all future offers and reward programmes.
  • This campaigns goal is to initiate contact with the intention of building trust with potential future Business Angel Contributors to enable us to develop our loan business at a faster pace.

The Impact

  • This project is valuable because the people I deal with are in the eyes of a bank not worth bothering with. I believe that the majority of people are still decent and honest and worth helping. Should you choose to get involved in this business your rewards are twofold 1. You will get a good rate of return on your money. 2. You will also get the satisfaction of knowing your money will be used to help individuals and families to provide cash for household emergencies, car repairs, getting rid off payday loans and high interest debts etc...
  •  I am a great believer in trust, yes my business model allows for a 10% default rate but this is the real world and sometimes even the most decent people hit financial troubles. I am also a qualified debt advisor so I always try to emphasise with my clients personal circumstances rather than be a faceless computerised decision.
  • Our loans are small £300 to £1000 and our terms short 20 and 40 weeks our rates are about 25% of the rates charged by pay day lenders. Our initial loan has quite high rates but these can be halved once we see a track record /good history. This then makes our rates very cheap in comparison to our competition.

Risks & Challenges

  • Every loan has a risk our model ensures a safe margin whilst being competitive (affordable) for the clients.
  • Ultimately my target is to become the biggest ethical non status lender in England. My first goal is my local area within 18 months.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

If putting your money into a loan business is not what you want to do but if you believe in helping decent honest people with their lives why not tweet or share this page it will cost you nothing but it means we may be able to help a few more people who have been discarded by the current financial elitist institutions.

I hope this project is interesting enough to warrant your time, effort and money.

Thanks

jeff

Should you choose to get involved in this business your rewards are twofold 1. You will get a good rate of return on your money. 2. You will also get the satisfaction of knowing your money will be used to help individuals and families to provide cash for household emergencies, car repairs, getting rid off payday loans and high interest debts etc...
 I am a great believer in trust, yes my business model allows for a 10% default rate but this is the real world and sometimes even the most decent people hit financial troubles. I am also a qualified debt advisor so I always try to emphasise with my clients personal circumstances rather than be a faceless computerised decision. Our loans are small £300 to £1000 and our terms short 20 and 40 weeks our rates are about 25% of the rates charged by pay day lenders. Our initial loan has quite high rates but these can be halved once we see a track record /good history. This then makes our rates very cheap in comparison to our competition.
   Risks & Challenges    Every loan has a risk our model ensures a safe margin whilst being competitive (affordable) for the clients.
Ultimately my target is to become the biggest ethical non status lender in England. My first goal is my local area within 18 months.    Other Ways You Can Help
 Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

If putting your money into a loan business is not what you want to do but if you believe in helping decent honest people with their lives why not tweet or share this page it will cost you nothing but it means we may be able to help a few more people who have been discarded by the current financial elitist institutions.
I hope this project is interesting enough to warrant your time, effort and money.
Thanks
jeff

story:
Dear friends,

I am Larisa and together with my family I've been living on the beautiful island of Rhodes, Greece for the last 16 years. My husband Victor is a very talented interior designer, craftsman and musician; our daughter Nefeli - a 16 years old, ongoing musician (playing flute, piano, cello and double bass), our son Aris - a 12 years old (playing drums and saxophone) and myself - a professional massage therapist, trying to be creative with ceramics and jewelry making.

Meet the family


The house that needs us all ...


Being always in love with the beautiful old buildings of Rhodes, we decided to save one from falling apart and with Victor's last savings we bought it this January. The house was built in the 1870s and it's part of the so called "Pyrgospita" - tower houses in the west part of the island.

Plants were growing all around and inside the house
Garbage and its friends were living full time here

Unfortunately most of these historical houses were left to ruin due to people's lack of funding and they are literally falling down.


The backside with the garden


Details on the house front

With your help we can finish renovating it to it's original form and use it as a guest house and creative hub for artists (e.g. musicians, painters, photographers) from all over the world.

What We Need & What You Get


After we bought the house we started making a plan with the help of local architects and now we have the approved restoration blue prints, water and electrical connections on site and bought part of the construction materials. 


Our project has two phases: the first one for which we need a contractor (restoring the walls, changing the roof and repairing the floors, installing new windows and doors) and a second phase which we will do it by ourselves (build the needed furniture and decorate the interior and exterior of the house).


Our contractor estimates the restoring of the walls, changing the roof and repairing the floors at approximately 35.000 euro and installing new windows and doors at about 15.000 euro.

The village goes by two names , one is Ialysos - together with Lindos and Kamiros being one of the 3 ancient cities of the island, and the other name is Trianda - it means 30 and comes from the number of tower houses (pyrgospita)  built in the area in the 19th century by the wealthy residents of the city of Rhodes (turkish, greeks and italians) as summer houses due to the cooler breeze on the west of the island. 

The house we are renovating is one of the last "standing" so it's of vital importance for the local community and as well for people all over the world visiting Rhodes.


Everyone will be able to enjoy it's beauty and serenity once the renovation process is complete as we intend to use it as a guest house and as a creativity meeting point for artists from everywhere hosting workshops and exhibitions of any artistic genre. 


The perks!


A signed photograph postcard of the house delivered to your mailbox worldwide.


Hand made key-ring, with the logo of the house "The plane-tree house" on one side and with your name on the other side. Plus a signed photo post-card of the house.


While having your holidays on the beautiful island of Rhodes, we'll make sure you'll enjoy a full hour of relaxation ! Plus a signed photograph of the house.


A long weekend (of 3 nights) accommodation and breakfast for two at the house you helped save from destruction so that you get to know the island and our family.

Or ...

A weekend (of 2 nights) accommodation and breakfast with two special sessions of aroma therapy relaxing massage to make you feel relaxed and invigorated.


This is our Premium Perk and your chance to spend your holidays together with your family in Rhodes, Greece! We offer you one week of accommodation for 4 persons in the house and we will give you a day tour of the island!

 

Other Ways You Can Help


Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help simply by getting the word out and making some noise about our campaign. Please share this link with your friends and family or anyone you think might be interested in supporting this project.


Thank you so much for your support!

story:
Battle Cat: Veganize My Town

Battle Cat Coffee & Tea Brew Bar is a small traveling pop-up that enrolls restaurants to have 3 vegan items on their menuand have the proceeds go to Woodstock Farm Sanctuary, Coalition for Healthy Food in Schools, Our Hen House, and Mercy for Animals

  • Owner Kevin Leal would like to Veganize Jersey City through his pop up project.
  • Battle Cat believes in a community that stands for each other and knows what is at stake with our nutrition and way we eat..
  • Jersey City is a growing community and with this project the magnitude has the potential to ignite a veganization movement supporting the fair treatment of animals and standing for our children's daily lives in schools.

We are asking a contribution of $7,000 to purchase a La Marazocco mobile espresso machine, so we can travel to place to place with it. One of our investors Orale Mexican Kitchen has supported us with grinders and useful cafe equipment. However this machine is our key component to our launch.

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • We need $7,000 for a La Marazocco GS3 machine. We need to raise these funds with velocity as we want to launch our project within the holiday season.
  • With donations, we are offering one year membership on all free coffee drinks and pastries. We offer recognition in charitable newsletters, as well as having Vegan chefs create home cooked dinner parties for you and guests.
  • If we do not meet our goal, our funds with then been donated to our charities that are standing to change the world so that they have the amenities to keep on moving on.

The Impact

Our project is to educate restaurants that pride themselves on farm to table cuisines with the support of charities. To create a community that knows better and has a choice in how they pursue the art of food as a healthy resort.

  • Becoming Vegan for one day, you will save: A life, 20 lbs of C02, 30 Sq feet of Forest, 40 lbs of Grains, and 1,100 Gallons of H20.
  • Battle Cat stands for humanity and fair treatment. We are very small, but are earnest in our ambitions support life...Let Rock!

Risks & Challenges

What we are trained to persevere will be enrolling others to volunteer long hours at a restaurant. A extensive training in coffee and in tea knowledge. Restaurant managers being cynicism that this will not make a difference. We stand in the face of our own "no agreement" 

  • Most of the hours will be divided by people who either enjoy helping in the morning and to those enjoy helping at night. Battle Cat is for fair treatment, so there is no make wrong - it is clearly a creative experience because this never existed before, so there is no right or wrong way..
  • Helping ones' business alleviates any sour apples, and being a stand for a community with the possibility that this now, is the place to be will allow others to help as well. 
  • With great training comes inspiration to be cause in the matter, and that will help with the care of our equipment. Our training will be very hands on, and will be super easy as our equipment is minimal and easy to handle

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that donations can't be made sometimes here is another way to help:

  • Write us a letter about your community that you love, and in 2 pages describe what would make it better, safer or more beautiful than it already is.
  • Spread the word to others that Battle Cat is a traveling cafe that helps young businesses increase profit by providing a morning coffee bar for customers.

story:
Short Summary

We are on a mission to create a first true Crowd Advertising campaign. A campaign where messages, talents and ads will be broadcasted to mass audience for just a small fraction of the usual price.

How we will achieve this? We will purchase the most exclusive advertising spaces and divide them in the pieces you can afford.

  • Are you an average Joe and you have an important message to share but nobody wants to listen to you?
  • Do you have a talent which is screaming out but you don't know how to be discovered?
  • Are you a small company with a new interesting product but nobody knows about it? You don't have resources to advertise, but you believe your product is so great that the world should know about it?

We want to give anyone an opportunity to be seen and heard. But not just that we want to give crowd a power to control advertising!

For its first campaign, Crowd Advertising will rent one of the most known digital billboards in New York City, a Nasdaq LED Tower.


The Nasdaq LED Tower

This iconic display stands over seven stories tall and commands the attention of the bustling vehicular and pedestrian traffic that makes its way in and out of the America's #1 Tourist Destination everyday, while also making tons of incidental appearances on TV shows.

Nasdaq LED Tower seamlessly integrate video, web, mobile and social media technologies and capture the attention of the 1.5 million passersby every day. It is also near several entrances to the busiest commuter stations in NYC with over 500,000 peopleper day commuting into and out of the MTA Times Square Subway Station and Port Authority Bus Terminal.


What We Need & What You Get

We need at least $150,000 to pay for the cost of everything that's needed to launch this campaign. The donations you give us will be used for the rent of the Nasdaq display (2 hours per day for a 4 week period), development of the online platform where advertisers can upload their videos/messages and all other associated costs with this campaign. Every penny will be used to pay for making this campaign into a reality.

In return, you will get priority access on our waiting list which means you will be first in line to advertise on the iconic LED Tower in the heart of Times Square! Every funder (that's you!) will get  a chance to advertise something of their choice. Please check out perks section for more details.


Lets Make Spectacle

Crowd Advertising wants to make a spectacle out of this new, groundbreaking way of advertising. We don't want to be considered just as a way to achieve profit or fame for companies and individuals. Crowd Advertising wants to be seen as something fun and exclusive so everyone would want to try it.

If a bunch of friends or travellers want to have fun we want them to come to us! For instance, say they want to take picture of themselves in Times Square while in the meantime a huge LED display in the back would run something fun (could be their pictures with appropriate content, of course). Similar could be done for other special occasions such as graduation, marriage or anniversary. Possibilities are endless and we think we have enough reasons to believe that Crowd Advertising could truly change the way this industry works!


    Other Ways You Can Help

    There are other ways to contribute! Even if you don't have the money right now, you can help us turn this campaign into a reality by sharing this Indiegogo campaign with your friends. Just click on any of the Facebook, Twitter, and other sharing buttons let the world know about our awesome advertising campaign.

story:
"Websites From The Heart" Overview

Hi there! My name is Irene Fulton, president of Sitealicious Inc, and I am seeking funding to support my project "Websites From The Heart".  As a web designer and developer for over 17 years now, I am often approached by charities and other non-profit organizations seeking help to get them online with a website and social media presence.  However, since these groups have limited resources and since I am limited as well in how much work I can extend for free or after-hours, I usually have to reduce the scope of what gets done for them in the short-term or turn these folks away until they can afford to purchase services. 

I've created "Websites From The Heart" in order to bridge this gap.  I want to try to realize this dream to ensure that any charity or non-profit that needs a website can get one.

With the ever-increasing importance of digital communications in our everyday lives, "Websites From The Heart" aims to ensure that the agents of positive change in our local communities and around the world have the means to participate in online dialogue.

When you donate to "Websites From The Heart" you'll be helping a charity or non-profit organization receive a quality website at no cost to their group or cause.  The website that they receive will be customized with their logo, be fully-featured to their requirements and connected to popular social media accounts on sites such as Twitter and Facebook.  If they don't have these accounts, we will create these social pages as well to match the look and feel of the website we make.  Their web pages will be editable by any lay person with a minimal degree of technical proficiency in order to promote self-sufficiency online. 

And very importantly, their website will include the ability to collect donations online, thus promoting future self-sustainability. 

Providing websites to charities and non-profit organizations will help ensure that the important work being done by these groups in our communities, towns and cities around the world can continue to enrich our lives!


Who We Want To Help

"Websites From The Heart" is looking to work with charities and non-profits endeavoring to improve the human condition. Our focus is humanitarian in nature. We want to connect with people who are helping people, with people being the main beneficiaries of the group's goals.

Focal Areas:
  • Arts & Culture - helping people grow through the arts
  • Health & Wellness - helping people heal through wellness programs
  • Social Progress - helping people gain all types of equality
  • The Environment - helping people steward our resources

"Websites From The Heart" does not work with projects that are allied with political or religious movements for the majority purpose of proselytizing that agenda. 

What We Need

As a pilot project, we are looking for enough capital to fund 10 websites. Each small website of this nature costs on average about $1470 to create. The total amount we hope to raise is $14700, but if we raise more, we will build more!

Each site typically takes between 30 - 50 working hours, from initial consultation, design mock-up, website set-up, graphic work. logo design and functionality testing to the final delivered product.  These costs are primarily labour-related, meaning it is time spent in front of the computer by a person working specifically on setting up the site and creating social media accounts.  This includes material donated by "Websites From The Heart" digital caregivers in order to keep our costs as low as possible.  Digital Caregivers are folks who believe in what we are trying to do and volunteer with us in their area of expertise.

Each Charity or Non-Profit Will Receive:

  • Wordpress Setup
  • Up To 8 Pages In Size
  • Custom Logo (If A Logo Is Needed)
  • Customized Web Look and Feel
  • All Relevant Plugins Installed
  • Fully Responsive Design (Works On Phones Or Desktops)
  • Search Engine Friendly
  • Integration with Social Media
  • Twitter, Facebook and Google+ page
  • Contact Form with Google Map
  • Capable Of Receiving Donations

What You Get

Our perks work on a "give and get" principle:

  • Give enough to help get a link to a charitable website, you receive a link from our site http://www.websitesfromtheheart.com
  • Give enough to support the creation of social media profiles, you get one new (or redesigned) social media profile page
  • Give enough to fund a whole website donation to someone else, you get a mini Wordpress or responsive one-pager website of your very own!  Give a site, get a site!  Awesome!

The Impact

The "Websites From The Heart" project is intended to address the very real problems charities and non-profit organizations face - how to get their message into the world when they can't afford to get their message into the world.  You will be helping these organizations continue and expand their day-to-day work, but most importantly, you will be helping them become self-sustaining.  Having the ability to raise funds from the www on their own enables ongoing growth and success and an element of autonomy for the long-term.  Having a professional web presence to share with others is one of the most vital elements to spreading the message!  Be a part of it!


Risks & Challenges

There are few risks to this project.  Every amount raised in multiples of $1470 funds one website.  We will make as many websites with our digital caregiving partners as funds we raise.  If we raise enough for 10 sites, we will create 10 sites.  If we raise enough for 100 sites, that's what's going to happen, and WOW are we going to be busy!  The progress of our fundraising efforts and the resulting websites created will be chronicled on our own website blog at http://www.websitesfromtheheart.com. 

  • If for any reason I am not able to coordinate these projects, I have a partner ready to take on the work of ensuring all funds go towards getting our charity partners online.
  • If we are able to fundraise enough to create WAY more sites than I can reasonably coordinate, I have a network of digital caregivers ready to outsource to and I'll still be overseeing all projects to retain high quality control.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, can you help spread the word?  Share in your social networks, share us with charities and non-profit organizations you know could use our help and services - and then those members can actually fundraise enough through our fundraiser to get their sites created too!

  • Make some noise for us and help us help the world!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools and be sure to visit our website http://www.websitesfromtheheart.com

THANK YOU for helping me help those who are in need of website assistance!

Give enough to support the creation of social media profiles, you get one new (or redesigned) social media profile page

Give enough to fund a whole website donation to someone else, you get a mini Wordpress or responsive one-pager website of your very own!  Give a site, get a site!  Awesome!


The Impact The "Websites From The Heart" project is intended to address the very real problems charities and non-profit organizations face - how to get their message into the world when they can't afford to get their message into the world.  You will be helping these organizations continue and expand their day-to-day work, but most importantly, you will be helping them become self-sustaining.  Having the ability to raise funds from the www on their own enables ongoing growth and success and an element of autonomy for the long-term.  Having a professional web presence to share with others is one of the most vital elements to spreading the message!  Be a part of it!
  
Risks & Challenges  There are few risks to this project.  Every amount raised in multiples of $1470 funds one website.  We will make as many websites with our digital caregiving partners as funds we raise.  If we raise enough for 10 sites, we will create 10 sites.  If we raise enough for 100 sites, that's what's going to happen, and WOW are we going to be busy!  The progress of our fundraising efforts and the resulting websites created will be chronicled on our own website blog at http://www.websitesfromtheheart.com.    If for any reason I am not able to coordinate these projects, I have a partner ready to take on the work of ensuring all funds go towards getting our charity partners online.

If we are able to fundraise enough to create WAY more sites than I can reasonably coordinate, I have a network of digital caregivers ready to outsource to and I'll still be overseeing all projects to retain high quality control.

   
Other Ways You Can Help If you can't contribute, can you help spread the word?  Share in your social networks, share us with charities and non-profit organizations you know could use our help and services - and then those members can actually fundraise enough through our fundraiser to get their sites created too!  Make some noise for us and help us help the world!
 Use the Indiegogo share tools and be sure to visit our website http://www.websitesfromtheheart.com

 

 
 THANK YOU for helping me help those who are in need of website assistance!

story:
Emerald Grove Intentional Community

We are a community group of about ten people who have been gathering for two and a half years to co-create a dream we all share: Thriving together on a beautiful piece of land out in nature with our friends and family.  We also share a passion for holistic healing and are creating a healing center where people can come to learn more about all aspects of healthy living.  This retreat center where many of the healers will live on-site will be the location for our wide variety of classes and workshops as well as longer retreats and conferences.  Our group also currently hosts activities in which we offer healing to the public, including those with limited resources.

In addition to providing the community with wellness resources, we will also offer permaculture and natural building certification courses.  We will be taking steps to learn all we can about living lightly on the planet and growing our own organic food.  Other ideas we envision for our future eco-village include a birthing center, a hostel, a bed and breakfast and a you-pick berry farm.  We plan to serve as a model for others to emulate, making sure to keep all of our village building information public for use as open-source documents. 

Once Emerald Grove is complete, the long-term goal is to replicate similar villages world-wide and link them all.  We are creating a huge network of like-minded individuals who feel passionately about natural, simple, peaceful living.  People will then be able to travel from one village to the next, contributing their expertise and skills as they go.

Our group shares an optimistic view of the current state of the world, knowing that we have the power to co-create our future together.  We are also taking practical measures to prepare for the realities of dwindling global resources and growing populations.  We would like to serve as a harbinger of change, inviting all those who resonate with our values and message to support us in this challenge. 

Planting the seeds of change

We excitedly anticipate raising enough money to cover the costs of starting a 501(c)3 federal non-profit corporation called the Co-Creative Living Foundation as well as those related to beginning the search for land to call home.  We have been working with a local lawyer who specializes in serving non-profits and we plan to have him oversee the process of incorporation.  We are looking to keep costs as low as possible, finding ways to save and accomplish tasks on our own whenever we can.

Building a village will obviously take much more than $3,000, so this is only the beginning!  We anticipate getting a little startup cash from you, our devoted supporters, to get us off the ground.  Once we have non-profit standing we will begin applying for grants and partnering with existing non-profits.  Donations will all be put towards these IRS fees and startup costs mentioned above, regardless of the final outcome of this campaign.

One of our founders has experience helping another local community acquire a 60-acre piece of lake front property with a conference center as a gift with no money down.  We, too, are confident that we may acquire the land needed for our eco-village in a similar manner, based solely on the purity of our collective intentions.  Hence, we are sharing our dream for the right investors to catch wind of it.  In the meantime we are rallying support from donors large and small to get the ball rolling! 

Each contribution will be rewarded, whether with good karma, a personal healing session with one of our esteemed community healers or a week-long retreat at our future healing center and eco-village complete with organic meals from our garden.  We appreciate all levels of support, since our community is designed to facilitate ways for everyone to get involved to the level at which they feel comfortable.

Check out these awesome perks!

$2 Good Karma

$5 FB Shoutout

$10 Emerald Grove decal & FB Shoutout

$20 Handmade thank you card with picture of our community & EGIC decal

$40 Distance Reiki Session (10 min) & EGIC decal

$50 Ambrosia (12oz bottle), thank you card & EGIC decal

$60 Distance Reiki Session (15 min) & EGIC decal

$75 Distance Reiki Session (20 min) & EGIC decal

$80 Ambrosia (2x 12oz bottles), thank you card & EGIC decal

$100 30-minute in person Reiki session (local only) & EGIC decal

$125 Handmade knitted socks & EGIC decal

$150 45-minute in person Reiki session (Iocal only) & EGIC decal

$200 60-minute in person Reiki session (local only) & EGIC decal

$300 Nutrtitional consultation & one-week meal plan & EGIC decal

$500 Founder's Dinner

$700 Reiki attunement class (local only)

$1,000 1-week stay at our eco-village/ retreat center

$2,000 2-week stay at our eco-village/ retreat center

Why an eco-village? The time is now!

The success of this project is essential for helping people to start taking control of their world once again.  Too long have we been controlled by mass media and corporations!  It is time to bring the focus back to ourselves, our families and our communities.  We can choose how we live and with whom we create community.  That is the beauty of intentional communities! 

We, the members of Emerald Grove, share a common vision of a green future.  What does that mean?  It means the world we envision functions sustainably with renewable energy and resources.  It means the people act as stewards of the earth, taking actions each day to lessen our carbon footprints, leaving this planet better than we found it.  It means people live peacefully on earth, always looking for ways to improve communication and interpersonal relationships.

We are coming together to co-create this world, creating a strong bond among community members.  We are healing ourselves and each other, making us better able to be of service.  We are learning to build homes using natural materials found locally.  We are experimenting with new forms of commerce including trade, barter and the gift economy. 

We are learning to grow life-affirming organic foods and use them to cook delicious healthy meals.  We are learning ways of planting that can utilize nature for pest control and nutrient building in the soil.  We are learning how to grow food using aquaponics and create a safe supply of mercury- and radiation-free fish for our community to eat.  

We are creating a community of inter-generational members.  We value everyone, from children to elders, and find that interactions between different age groups are beneficial for all. We envision our village having about 20 members to start plus however many children they bring along.  Everyone will be an influence to our youngest members, and will do their best to teach and learn with them about healthy living. 

Classes and workshops will be the central focus of the retreat center, as well as an in-town healing clinic (the clinic exists now.)  We will offer classes on many health-related topics, as well as permaculture, natural building.  This way, we can offer our knowledge and skills and also host instructors from all over the globe. Conferences will be held at our center, featuring some of the world's foremost experts on new-paradigm topics such as quantum physics, spirituality, holistic healing, midwifery, non-violent communication, sustainability, permaculture and bioremediation. 

Since this is just the first chapter of an epic adventure tale of one community helping to start a movement, the whole world can benefit!  We will take our village-building skills on the road, linking new communities to existing ones and creating a vast network of positive change hubs.  Your contributions will keep us moving as we do what we can to bring balance to the planet and it's people.

A long and winding road

There are many hurdles to jump in attempting a feat such as ours.  There are also many reasons to believe we can complete this project successfully. 

We have a consistent track record of dedicated community members coming together regularly for nearly three years.  We meet twice a month or more to discuss how best to move forward in achieving our goals.  EGIC Meeting Minutes can be found on our website . Over this time our members have developed strong bonds and have come to rely on each other for support.  We are living the community part already.  All we need is land and resources to complete the dream.  

We realize our limitations when it comes to specialized areas like real estate, law and taxes.  We plan to employ experts in these fields to help us make sure we do things right. 

We will be making all of our developments public, using social media to keep everyone appraised of our on-goings.  We will be doing things "by the book" to assure we don't encounter any problems with zoning regulations on property, or other legalities. 

You can rest assured that your hard-earned cash will be safely put to good use when you donate to our cause.  We have the determination and drive to see this project reach fruition, and we will stop at nothing less! 

We love all kinds of support!

In addition to supporting us monetarily, you can help us by sharing this campaign on your Facebook page, Twitter or blog. 

Spread the word about Emerald Grove Intentional Community and the Co-Creative Living Foundation!  You can find out more about Emerald Grove by visiting www.emeraldgroveic.org.  Co-Creative Living Foundation is found at www.cocreativelife.org.  Like and share us on Facebook too!

We are looking for new members and interested folks all over the world.  Could this be the community you've been searching for?  Drop us a line and let's find out!

story:
Who are we?

Hi, I’m Julie Swain, cofounder of Dog Not Gone.  From the beginning, our company has had a simple goal. . . keep dogs safe and secure.  Our focus has been on making high quality visibility products to keep dogs safe. 

I started making safety dog vests 15 years ago when a hunter came to my retail store and gave me her design of a dog vest that would stand up to the Maine woods without shredding or coming off the dog.  In return, she asked that I keep her supplied from then on.  We have been making them for her dogs and dogs all over the nation ever since.

Ecco wearing the first version of Dog Not Gone safety vest


Over the past 10 years, my husband Bill and I built our Maine based business, one customer at a time.  Two years ago, we quit our jobs to concentrate on growing the business.  Our primary focus has been to market the brand and increase distribution nationwide.  In order to reach this goal, we have attended national trade shows where we not only marketed our product but received input from trade experts on how to grow our business in this booming market. 


Many experts gave us the same advice; increase the product line to make us more attractive to buyers.  We took this advice and increased the line from 6 skus (items) to 72 skus (items).  As a result, we have added many new dealers and are now represented by a distributor.   Sales doubled in 2014 from the prior year and are on track to do the same in 2015.

How are we trying to keep dogs safe from Lyme disease?


We are launching our new line of tick repellent dog vests that feature No Fly Zone technology.  Lyme disease and other tick and insect derived viruses are a national problem and only getting worse.  No Fly Zone treated fabric is registered with the Environmental Protection Agency and recommended by the CDC and the World Health Agency to safely protect against ticks and other insects. 

Our line of No Fly Zone products are made from fabric that is treated with permethrin, a synthetic form of a naturally occurring insect repellant found in chrysanthemum flowers. This active ingredient is permanently bound to the fabric’s fibers and is designed to remain effective throughout the life of the product, even after as many as to 70 washings.


Registered with the EPA, No Fly Zone Insect repellent technology works as a contact repellent.  NFZ affects the insect's nervous system causing "hot foot", making the insect fly away before it may bite.  This technology works to prevent the spread of insect borne diseases by repelling insects away from the body through apparel or gear.


Why should you support us?

Based on our early success, we know our Made in USA products are well received and have kept dogs safe nationwide.  We have kept Dog Not Gone an efficient business model.  The company is run out of our home and the only employees are myself and my husband Bill.  All labor is outsourced to our own manufacturing facility where we are able to control quality and employ just in time inventory. 

We purchased our manufacturing facility last year when the owner told us he was retiring and closing the doors in the Fall.  Bill and I made the decision that we wanted to keep our products Made in USA so we made the investment and secured the employment of the 10 seamstresses, many of whom have been working there for 30 years.  



What we need now is help to put our new line of No Fly Zone dog vests into production.  Your support will help us with working capital to sustain this growth and better position our business in this competitive market.

If we can surpass our goal, we will apply the funds toward development of a new line of tick repellent products for people.  We have started the development process of gaitors that are worn above the sock to protect against ticks when walking through the woods or fields.  Other items that we plan on developing include vests, tshirts and hats.

Our campaign will contribute a percentage of monies raised during this campaign to our local shelter, Franklin County Animal Shelter.   We adopted our dog, Max, from this shelter and continue to support them in any way we can.

In return for your contribution, you will be one of the first to own a No Fly Zone tick and insect repellent dog vest at a discounted price.  We have a variety of our tick repellent products in the rewards program for your support.  We will ship your products out in June so that you can defend your dog against ticks and other biting insects.

Another way you can help is to spread the word about our campaign.  Word of mouth has been the foundation of building our business.

Your support will not only help launch our new product line, it will create real jobs for Americans and helps preserve Maine’s time honored textile tradition.  And I thank you very much for that.

story:
Who are we:-

WA Creative (founded 2010), is a Co-operative group for anyone interested in the creative arts and industries around Warrington with over 400+ members we are currently the largest creative organization in Warrington, featuring, Designers, Filmmakers, Editors, Photographers, Artist, Actors.

All run by you for you.

We are looking for funding, for the first year to setup up a Digital Hub, a building in Warrington Town Centre. The Digital Hub is a non-profit so after the first year the Coffee shop and Digital Agency will fund the Hub and its community work.

The Digital Hub will be a home for creatives, community groups and business.

Featuring:-

- Freelancers Desk,
- Green Screen Studio,
- Photography Studio, (already donated £1800)
- Camera Rental,
- Exhibition Area,
- Avid Media Composer Edit Suite, (Already donated £2000)
- Autodesk Flame Visual Effects Suite edu, (Already donated £10000)
- Resolve Grading Suites,
- Arts and Crafts Space,
- Free Courses from the British Film Academy,
- The Grind House Coffee Shop (with Library).

+ This year we will be running a Summer Hands on Film course, where we will be producing a feature film based in Warrington.

All this in one building in Warrington Town Centre.

We need support from local companies using our freelancers and Digital Agency our community to get involved and help us build this. all profit from the coffee shop and Digital Agency goes back into the Co-op.  So it is as simple as buying a coffee that makes this happen.

Companies and individuals have already pledged equipment and furnishings, We are especially looking for a building, so landlords please get in contact if you would like to donate anything or have any great deals for us.

This is your space to create and learn.

Let's make this happen today 

"This is a amazing project and I fully support it. I would encourage everyone to do what they can to help make this happen. It's as easy as buying a coffee." 

Councillor Dan Price, Chair of the Local Economy Committee.
