story:
Intro

My name is Katrina Gilbert and I am an entrepreneur that owns and operates a wedding and event planning company in Philadelphia, Pa. I would like to open a lovely event space to be enjoyed by local Philadelphians and used by non-profits, fellow entrepreneurs and local artists. 

I began my journey as an entrepreneur just three years ago. After working in Corporate America for ten years, I was unexpectedly laid off. Unfortunately I was not awarded severance pay and received very little unemployment due to new government regulations. It was a very scary point in my life and I was unsure of what was next to come. However, I refused to allow that setback to stop me from pursuing my dream of becoming an entrepreneur that would be able to give back to my community. 

I am proud to say that I was born and raised in Philadelphia. Being raised in a single parent home and living in low-income housing, I   faced many hurdles growing up. I am grateful for all my experiences; Philadelphia played a vital part in making me who I am today. I have always been passionate about giving back to the community. In addition I always wanted to help others and plan events. So I thought to myself, “How can I combine the three?” This is how Petite Fete came to be.

Not only will Petite Fete be an event space for my current clientele, I will offer this location to be enjoyed by local entrepreneurs and artists. They can come to the space during business hours and use it as an office and environment to meet like-minded individuals. In addition, they will be able to host networking events, launch events, book releases, art and fashion showcases at a low cost to help them grow their businesses. As for local non-profit agencies, they will be able to host meetings or events at a low cost. In addition, I will give one local non-profit agency the opportunity to host an event at no cost once every quarter for a total of four free events a year. 

What I Need

I have signed a 2-year lease on a beautiful 1,100 square foot space in University City section of Philadelphia. To date, I have invested my own money into launching the opening of Petite Fete. I need your help to raise the last bit of capital to open its doors. 

Socially conscious and up-and-coming businesses will be charged the lowest prices possible so they can afford to host events. Your contribution will make it possible for me to help Philadelphia's non-profits, social entrepreneurs and artists get closer to achieving their goals.

Some quick facts:

•The start-up costs to open our doors is $22,000. So far I have saved $10,000 and seek to raise the remaining amount. 

•All of the money raised from this campaign will go directly to opening our doors, including: desks, chairs, monitors, furniture, and start-up overhead. 

Please take a moment to look into my unique perks. Not only will anyone that donates be helping a great cause, they have a chance to receive recognition or host a fundraiser, launch party or social event up to one year after the grand opening.




Risk & Challenges

There are risks and challenges in everything you do in life. That being said, I believe I thought of this project for a reason beyond myself.  I thought long and hard about the money it will require to adequately fund a location that will enable others to enjoy the benefits of being charged low costs.

The main challenge is funding. I’d like to open this business and make it successful, while staying true to my initial plan to help others. Therefore, raising more money is extremely important. Fear of not reaching my goal is a bit intimidating, however, I'm a strong believer that my blessings will continue to flourish by helping others. 

In the event I do not reach my goal, I will continue to work extremely hard to bring this project I have worked so hard on to light. :)

The Impact

The services Petite Fete offers for free or minimal costs are not available anywhere else. The potential for cost-savings is tremendous  for our local non-profits, entrepreneurs and artists. I hope to give these individuals the opportunity to spend more time developing their ideas, building their networks, and sharing their greatness with our city while spending less time worrying about how they will foot the cost and still make a profit.

Other Ways To Help

There are so many ways you can contribute, even if you cannot show your support financially:  

•  WORD OF MOUTH!!!!!! Tell your friends, family and co-workers about this amazing project!

•  Post this fundraiser onto your social media pages like Facebook and Twitter describing why you believe in this project. (I can't tell you how much that would mean to me!)

•  Share this fundraiser in an email or newsletter to your friends and family!! 

•  Post comments onto THIS fundraiser page. This helps my fundraiser rise up Indigogo's pages and get seen by more people. (This would be a HUGE help!)

•  Even a $1 donation helps because it makes it more likely the fundraiser will move up Indiegogo's pages! The more action on this fundraiser the better! Seriously it makes a difference!!!  

•  Send out positive vibes to help us take this to the next level!

story: Try and give back! Local soup kitchens are in constant need here in Providence, RI. All funds will be used to directly supply food and drink inventory to Providence pantries and feed the homeless.

story:
ARIZONA EXTREME SPORTS CAMP


MAKING DREAMS BECOMING REALITY

Helping our kids now….  Will create a bright future.

EXPLORE HERE

PAVING OUR OWN PATH

Arizona Extreme Sports Camp is a non-profit extreme sports camp for kids.  Our goal is to crate a safe and constructive environment for kids.  The kids in our community need a place to learn. grow, and become motivated in a positive way.  We can help teach our kids to share, protect each other, trust one another, self motivation, determination, pride, setting goals, rewarding self improvement, and so much more.  I personally believe for every opportunity we provide for our kids is one more kid we keep safe and goal oriented.  The more we teach the better the kids will learn.  Activities such as camping, survival skills, rock climbing, mountain biking, hiking, river rafting, snow skiing, snowboarding, water skiing,  skateboarding, dirt biking, trust exercises, carpentry, and many more activities as we expand and grow.  Our wish is for a new future for our kids and ourselves.  With donations, volunteers, and sponsorships we will help all of our kids become the best, brightest,and the most motivated  and goal oriented individuals, in the first few steps to their bright futures.


MUCH MORE TO COME……….

THANK YOU TO EVERYONE

4/24/2015


We are proud to announce the official release from the state of Arizona to conduct operations, fundraising, and all other aspects for us to get the doors open as soon as possible. The website will be built as soon as enough funds are raised. A bank account will be open in the next few days.

If you would like to see our funding goals, look at all the recent updates in the past few months. In the next few days we will be organizing details and hopefully receiving checks for donations. The more funding the faster the property is purchased, developed, and open for use. Liability insurance is another big step in the right direction. Again, all depends on funds being donated for operations and purchasing or leasing land.

Look for updates about an address to send donations. We will also be accepting donations through credit card donations.

Life is good if we spread our love in every direction. Our future kids involved in our programs will be thrilled and excell in life through our experience and lessons. Hope to be hearing back from our followers.

Thank you to all whom reads the posts. I hope one day we will all be at the grand opening of Arizona Extreme Sports Camp Non-profit organization. Built for our youth and future of our communities.

Thank you again and God bless all of you.


EXCITING NEWS COMING SOON

4/9/2015


In the next two weeks we will be announcing our privledges of an official non profit organization in Arizona. We are so excited for updates in the near future. One day closer to taking donations.

We dream big and hope for a great start of a new year for our future kids. With enough donations our time line could come true. I hope everyone is still following the website. Enjoy your April month.

Blessings to all!

POSITIVE INFLUENCE

2/1/2015

The dream in life for our children is a positive influence. Friends, family, teachers, coaches, and especially the outside world help creat the influence our children receive everyday. Media and daily interaction helps shape the kids in our lives. The interaction needs to be an influence towards a positive reaction. The reaction in our future extreme sports camp will be unrivaled. The experience and trust within our staff and volunteers will help shape a new future for our children in our communities. The motivation and daily involvement with the kids whom belong to our program will bring such joy and appreciation to everyone involved. The future is here and we as a non profit organization will make a new life for our communities to strive and build off of.

In the near future there will be updates on how to donate and participate in our future ventures.

We hope everyone has been in good health and full of blessing this New Year.

SHORT TERM GOALS

12/17/2014

Our non profit organization is just starting to become a story brought to life.


We are hoping to raise enough funds starting after Christmas, we will be accepting donations. 

We are so excited for our future. We hope everyone keeping up with and in touch with Arizona Extreme Sports Camp are extremely excited. More updates to come in the near future.

We are expecting a flooding gate of sponsor and donations. As of now we just received our first donation of $1000.00 for the help towards the financial aspect of organizing the future of this amazing opportunity for every kid.

Thank you again for your attention and support.



Information and comments:

Azextremesportscamp@gmail.com


THE NEW WARM HEART FROM ARIZONA

12/16/2014


The new generation of inspiration has begun. The first step has been taken to create a new life for our kids in Arizona and across the country. The Arizona Extreme Sports Camp non profit organization is here to help our local kids be more productive in society and learn new lessons in life to teach other kids in the future.

Our goal is to inspire our youth to find different ways to explore their environment and positive activities. Most children do not have an opportunity to explore the possibilities of hiking, camping, outdoor survival skills, mountain biking, rock climbing, dirt biking, wake boarding, water skiing, snowboarding, snow skiing, and so many other extreme sports and positive activities to be explore.

The world is endless for a positive place for our future productive adults in our communities. We are here to help and provide a safe place for our kids.

There is only one way to change the future and we start with our youth and expand their possibilities of a bright future.

Sports and extreme activities take the edge off of the daily grind our kids go through everyday. Our kids find destructive and misleading activities when they are bored or just tired of listening to the world around them. Our goal is to change the less fortunate kids lives into a positive and enlightening world around them.

Once a month there will be three different activities for the kids to participate in. Hopefully with the combined efforts of everyone in our communities. We all can raise money to put our organizations dream in production to help create new dreams for our kids.

Our dream for your futures starts with all of us coming together and donating for this cause. Our future depends on you to donate today.

May your year and life be full of blessings.

Let's help make dreams come true.



Our production Goals

$150,000 of donations

-Property and equipment will be  purchased

$250,000 of donations

-Activities will start with one per month

$400,000 of donations

-Trails and outposts will be built

$750,000 of donations

-More activities will be added

$950,000 of donations

-At these levels we will be able to maintain and provide more sports and activities

$1,500,000+ donations

Will provide a cabin for overnight stays for activities. Volunteers will increase. The best part will be for the kids to be in a safe and successful environment.



We will help kids learn how to build and develope outdoor appreciated land and life. The more we raise the more opportunity and activities we will be able to provide.

Thank you to everyone for your thoughts, love, and support.

Sincerely

Thierry Benaim

Member


Check out the starter website at Arizonaextremesportscamp.weebly.com

story:
FIRE/WATER IMBALANCE

Wreaks Havoc

in Berkeley Springs, WV!



(FOR A STORY IN PICTURES, GO TO "GALLERY" FOR A BLOW BY BLOW, SHOT BY SHOT OF THE HEATED EXPERIENCE!)

Working as a Five Element Acupuncturist just across the street from the ancient 74º mineral springs, I have tended many a FIRE/WATER imbalance in my clients but alas, my skills are humbled in the face of Mother Nature's great flash of fire that swept through my office building on Tuesday, April 27th of this year.




My name is Tamme Rae Marggraf. I am requesting your assistance in re-locating and re-creating my business, Mountain Springs Acupuncture and Acupuncture CAFE, that was lost in the Fairfax Street Fire of April 2015.


I have practiced acupuncture in Berkeley Springs for 13 years and also served as the Executive Director at The Museum of the Berkeley Springs for over seven years. I followed my heart when I moved here and share my heart with clients who seek a healthier, pain-free life with acupuncture.

I had JUST invested to include a new model of acupuncture clinic that is rapidly gaining popularity in our country -- Community Acupuncture (CA).  At the Mountain Springs Acupuncture CAFE, C-A-F-E stands for Community Acupuncture For Everyone because EVERYONE should have access to the best health care available.

By providing acupuncture in a group setting, many more people can afford to find relief in the body, mind, and spirit without the use of addictive prescription drugs that often come with unwanted side-effects. I fear that acupuncture will be a forgotten effective alternative to western medicine since many people cannot afford to pay what individual acupuncture fees have been for decades.

My goal is to raise $5000 in order to re-create my business AND like a Phoenix rising from the ashes, make it even more splendid by purchasing the technology that would help me to learn to use the internet more effectively in promoting my practice and Community Acupuncture (CA) in Berkeley Springs, WV.

(A video will soon be made but since I currently do not possess an apparatus that can do this for me, I must forgo that option for now . And actually, that just wonderfully illustrates my need as everyone knows that a video would help make my campaign even more successful. Please help!)

Your generous contributions will be used for:

FURNITURE

4-6 Lafuma zero-gravity recliner chairs for clients in the CA clinic, a massage chair, several small end tables, comfortable chairs for intakes, medical stools with wheels, step stools, refrigerator, carpets

the BEFORE and AFTER


SUPPLIES

bolsters, head pillows, prop pillows, sheets, blankets, pillow cases, face cradle covers, needles, charts and posters, magnetic sticks to help pick up dropped needles, ACI measurement ruler, ear seeds, moxa and moxa sticks, magnetic point stimulator, human model, ear model, general office supplies *(including paper clips AND staples).

TECHNOLOGY

MP3 player to replace CD player and CDs, telephone. I would like to greatly improve in this area by updating my old cobwebsite (mountainspringsacupuncture.com), learn to manage it myself, and get a smart phone with a year contract so I may accept credit/debit card payments with a "square."

BOOKS


Worsley, J.R. Vol One Meridians and Points

Ross, Acupuncture Point Combinations

Flaws/Finney, Handbook of TCM Patterns and Treatments

West, Acupuncture in Pregnancy & Childbirth

Maciocia, Foundations of Chinese Medicine

Deadman, A Manual of Acupuncture

Wong, Neuro-Anatomical Acupuncture, Vol 2, Neurological Disorders

...and more but these were my most referenced.

The knowledge in books is useful for every day quick references but the greatest source of wisdom lies in our hearts. LOVE is the greatest mover of energy in the entire universe. I truly believe that everyone does the best they can in making the world a better place (whether or not I agree with their methods). Acupuncture helps support a person's "best" as a balanced flow and less pain helps people feel better. AND BETTER PEOPLE MAKE A BETTER WORLD!

Any amount you offer to help the Phoenix rise is greatly appreciated. *When you need a paper clip, a staple doesn't work so never underestimate your contribution's value or how much your generosity helps.

Check out the PERKS and IMAGES in the Gallery to learn more and I'll keep you updated on our progress! (I'll get that video thing worked out ASAP!)

Thank you from the bottom and over the top of my heart!

Tamme Rae

story:
For 4 years BBM has been serving customers as top priority and with respect.

Our comments & replies to users are always maintained with top quality customer service. We deliver promises and updates to our games daily of what users want.

From fixing bugs, to adding a whole new game mode, maps, levels, cars, powers and much more!

BBM serves games with the highest quality they can afford in their budget. But with that being said. We delivered games with the lowest advertisement shown which our games revenue were extremely low. It didn't matter as we just wanted users satisfaction than ours.


We bring games to the world to entertain through social media, multiplayer live games & real time turn by turn. All of this needs a server to handle and respond quickly which really cost us a fortune to run.

After an update to our games graphics. We worked closely with a Chinese developer name Pai Mingxun from China which upgraded our games to more entertainment as requested.


After a year Pai which needed money started to blackmail the company to purchase their own source code off him or he will run lines of codes to shut down the games. Which he eventually did do that and ruined the company portfolio.

All of our connections to the users disconnected, server was slow and not responding and sending unusual updates to users to upgrade. Which there was no updates available. It caused the company to start all over again its hard work it did for the past 4 years.

From building a private savings to hiring designers, developers and music producers. We were disappointing on the choice we went with as we lost 90% of the games that were lifting the company up.

Now we request and be humble to ask every amazing user to raise for us at least $1 as it will slowly again raise us up and bring users top quality games and apps.

We will also serve you unique perks which it will be really useful in the future.
Help us get to where we need to be again.

Thanks! and check out the awesome games we created!

story:
Denne saken/innsamlingen ligger også på www.bidra.no
http://bidra.no/kampanje/h%C3%A5pet-om-rettferdighet-for-min-kj%C3%A6re-s%C3%B8nn-3/4d8e9fa9-0092-4561-82c3-667e8962df47


Den norske skolen forvalter den største verdien nasjonen Norge har, nemlig barna våre.  Barna som skal bli selvstendige, trygge og bærekraftige voksne som skal være med å utvikle og berike samfunnet vårt videre. Hvem blir holdt ansvarlige og straffet når disse barna blir brutt ned til ingenting av de voksne som skal ivareta og utvikle de?

I over 3 år nå har jeg kjempet det som mest sannsynligvis vil være mitt livs største kamp. Kampen om oppreisning og rettferd for min kjære umistelige sønn på 12 år. Hans situasjon er vond og tragisk………og, dessverre ikke unik. 
Jeg har prøvd å beskrive saken vår så ukomplisert og forståelig som mulig da det er umulig å beskrive alle aspektene ved den i et slikt innsamlingsprosjekt hvor jeg ber om den hjelpen jeg ber om. Ta gjerne kontakt om du/dere skulle ønske mer info :)

Den 24 september 2015 blir Vår hjemkommune stevnet inn for Tingretten av meg på vegne av min sønn, og på vegne av alle barn som ikke får den hjelpen de etter loven skal ha. 

Jeg som mor og menneske kan ikke leve med at barn blir behandlet slik som min sønn har blitt i den norske skolen, og jeg kan ikke leve med at ingen blir holdt ansvarlig, hverken strafferettslig eller på annen måte. Rettsikkerheten til barna våre i skolen er svært mangelfull og det er foreldres ressurser, både økonomiske og psykiske som avgjør om barna våre får den hjelpen de trenger.


Da jeg ikke oppfyller de økonomiske kravene for fri rettshjelp og har fått avslag på dette hos fylkesmannen er jeg forberedt på å ta saken i retten for egen hånd, helt uten juridisk bistand da jeg som alenemor ikke har økonomi til å betale for advokatbistand. Men jeg har håp, håp for rettssikkerheten til min sønn og andre barn og foreldre i lignende situasjon, håp om at noen kan hjelpe.

En slik sak på vegne av min sønn vil koste, selv uten advokatbistand, så nå strekker jeg ut en hånd og ber om hjelp. Økonomisk hjelp til å kunne bruke kyndig juridisk bistand i kampen om rettferd og oppreisning. Denne situasjonen har allerede kostet oss, mye, både psykisk og økonomisk, men jeg nekter å gi opp, det kan jeg bare ikke.

 

Kort og brutalt:

Min sønn er en gutt på 12 år som har vært igjennom store traumer pga måten han har blitt behandlet på i grunnskolen. Han har over flere år blitt behandlet på en slik måte at hans psyke, selvtillit og egenfølelse og livskvalitet er brutt ned til omtrent ingenting.

Min sønn ble over lengre tid mobbet av andre elever og av voksne ansatte/lærere/rektor. Senvirkningene av denne mobbingen er ille. Han viser tegn på posttraumatisk stress, sliter med selvmordstanker og har utviklet kraftig depresjon og sosial angst. Noe som har resultert i at vi nå sitter hjemme med en sønn som er livredd for å nærme seg skole og klasserom og som har mistet over 2 år med skolegang, lek, sosialisering og læring. Hans funksjonsnivåer er ekstremt tilbakesatt og han har tilnærmet ingen livskvalitet pr i dag.

Dette kommer til å ta flere år å bearbeide, om han i det hele tatt blir frisk igjen. Senskadene ved slik behandling og mobbing generelt er massive, både for barnet som blir utsatt for det og familien rundt barnet. Ikke bare har vi foreldre lidd store psykiske belastninger og økonomiske tap i denne saken som følge av alt vi har vært igjennom, men lillesøster på 11 år har også vært igjennom mye og har måttet ofret mye av sin trygge barndom på bakgrunn av alt dette.

Mer utdypende informasjon rundt historikken finnes på bloggen min:  http://episteme.blogg.no/1369302799_pent_brev_til_landets.html

Vi foreldre er tydelige på hvem vi mener har ansvar for det vår sønn har vært igjennom på skolen, hans psykiske helse pr i dag og familien rundt sine belastninger som følge av dette. Uansett hvilken grunnproblematikk ett barn har, uavhengig av diagnoser, sosiale vansker osv, er det alltid de voksnes ansvar at et barn blir ivaretatt i skolen

Avtroppende barneombud i 2012, Reidar Hjermann, tok i et åpent avskjedsbrev til kunnskapsminister Kristin Halvorsen et kraftig oppgjør med innsatsen mot mobbing i skolen. Han viste til elevundersøkelsen som tyder på at 40.000 elever opplever at de blir mobbet i skolen. Halvparten av disse oppgir at de blir mobbet av voksne som arbeider i skolen. Fire av ti skoler i Norge har ikke fattet vedtak i mobbesaker slik opplæringsloven krever.  Vi foreldre står omtrent maktesløse i kampen for våre barn når skolen svikter på så grov måte 

 

I 2012 klaget jeg inn kommunen/skolen til Fylkesmannen. Tilsynssak ble opprettet og FM konkluderte med at opplæringsloven var brutt og skolen/kommunen fikk refs og pålegg om retting. I tillegg politianmeldte jeg skolen og rektor, men saken ble henlagt hos statsadvokaten. Det var ikke praksis å ta ut offentlig tiltale i slike saker før i 2013/2014. Så da, til tross for helt klare bevis på at både opplæring og straffelov er brutt, ble ingen holdt ansvarlige. Dette kan leses mer om for de som ønsker på min blogg: http://episteme.blogg.no/1378208799_romolslia_skole_fr_re.html

Det er et uskyldig barn som er part i denne saken mot en veldig tung motstander som Trondheim kommune er, og han har i praksis ingen rettssikkerhet når jeg som forelder ikke har økonomiske ressurser til å kunne føre saken på hans vegne og ikke får fri rettshjelp eller annen juridisk eller økonomisk bistand til dette.

Lovbrudd er utført av voksne mennesker ansatt i Kommunen, og kommunen må på en eller annen måte holdes ansvarlig. Ikke bare for min sønn sin del, men også av allmennpreventive hensyn. Ingen barn og dets familie skal måtte gå igjennom det vi har vært igjennom, og noen må holdes ansvarlig og man må få oppreisning for den urett som er begått. I denne saken er det ikke bare brudd på straffeloven og opplæringsloven, men også brudd på FNs barnekonvensjon, EMK, barneloven, og barnevernloven fra Kommunen sin side.

Spørsmålet mitt har hele tiden vært dette:

Hva skal til for at våre skoler og rektorer skal bli stilt til ansvar i slike saker? Hvem sin oppgave er det å sikre rettsvernet til barna våre?  Den norske skolen forvalter den største verdien nasjonen Norge har, nemlig barna våre.  Barna som skal bli selvstendige, trygge og bærekraftige voksne som skal være med å utvikle og berike samfunnet vårt videre. Hvem blir straffet når disse barna blir brutt ned til ingenting av de voksne som skal ivareta og utvikle de? Hvem skal sørge for at skolevesenet, lærere og rektorer får riktig og nødvendig kompetanseheving når det gjelder både adferdsutfordringer og mobbing? Hvem skal ta ansvar? Og ikke minst, hvordan skal dette skje?

 

Hva kan jeg gi tilbake?

Alt overskudd av denne innsamlingen vil bli donert til kampen mot mobbing til følgende organisasjoner:

http://mobbingiskolen.no/

http://www.mot.no/

http://www.stoppmobbingen.net/

Skulle vi vinne saken, slik vi tror og håper, håper vi på å kunne bruke noe av en eventuell økonomisk oppreisning til samme formål.

 

Alle former for støtte mottas med aller største ydmykhet og takknemlighet.

story:
Improving People's Lives

PurchaseBlack.com exists to make a difference in people's lives.  Our business is a social enterprise cleverly disguised as an ecommerce platform.  We are a curated marketplace offering products for sale from exceptional Black owned businesses.  We are raising money because people love the business and we need help to grow and make a bigger impact!

We are passionate about positive change.  We want to do all we can to help people live up to their full potential, and we know through extensive research that building stronger small businesses makes people's lives better.  We built PurchaseBlack to make that happen.

Rewards for Being a Hero!

$5 - High 5 from our Imaginary Friend, Garvey!
$10 - Ask The Founder....Anything! Using Blab.im
$25 - PurchaseBlack Gift Certificate + Hall of Heroes

$50 - "IM A HERO" T-Shirt + Gift Certificate + Hall of Heroes


$100 - Exclusive Product Reviewer + T-Shirt + Gift Certificate + Hall of Heroes
$300 - High Quality Technology Consulting for Business & Organizations + Gift Certificate + Hall of Heros
$1000 - Private Dinner during 2016 South by Southwest in Austin, TX for You and a Guest, March 2016 
$5000 - I will fly anywhere in the Continental United States, and DJ an event for you at your venue for up to 5 hours.  Have you ever had a Start Up CEO on the Turntables for you?  


How Does PurchaseBlack Make A Difference

The fastest way to improve a community is through sustainable economics.  We offer excellent products that we carefully select and we sell them through Purchaseblack.  Each purchase supports two businesses, PurchaseBlack and the vendor, allowing dollars to go further.  Research shows that Black owned businesses hire within the Black community, give to charity, and desire to make a difference.  
We have PurchaseBlack Gives Back, which is how we partner with impact organizations to generate funds for them, so they can make a bigger difference.  At every turn, we make an impact, and through growing Purchaseblack, we will become better at it!

What We Will Do with Donations

We're Raising Money for Three Reasons:

  • Spread the Word through Marketing and Advertising
  • Expand Our Team to Get Things Done as We Grow
  • Add More Excellent Products to the Website & Mobile App
Here I am giving you more details in this short (<3 min) video made just for the campaign!

Meet Brian AM Williams - The Guy Behind It All

Im a guy that loves to learn, loves to make a difference, loves to be dressed up, but doesn't take myself too seriously.  What I do take seriously is using the blessings of education and opportunity towards something greater than myself.  PurchaseBlack.com is how I do it, because I get to put real money into the hands of people who will use it to make life better for people with every sale on our website.
I have worked really hard all of my life, from poverty & homelessness to the honors college of engineering at Purdue University, to a full tuition scholarship to McCombs MBA program, to founding my own small business.  Through it all, I have never lost the sense of doing something that helps others.  I hope that this campaign will help me be more effective.


The Impact

Research shows that when Black Businesses have increased revenue, special things happen.  They give to charity, they hire within their community, property values increase, crime decreases, unemployment decreases, and the community is a happier place.

By supporting Black owned businesses, you are supporting the best of what America has to offer, simply by buying great products in an intentional way.  We support making this into a reality, and we need you to be a hero to get us there!

Risks & Challenges

Online retail is a tough business.  To make sure we are successful, we are taking a smart approach.  We use smart partnerships with great organizations, only sell products that we trust and that will deliver on their promises, and make it a point to do business with integrity.  We know that other companies have similar goals, but we believe that we have something special with our education, traction, awards, and pure passion to make a difference.  The road is rough to realize big dreams, but we believe!  We are here to change the world!

Other Ways You Can Help

There are a million ways to help!  The greatest is with a donation!  We can't grow without them!  

Next is spreading the word.

Share on Facebook 

Share on Twitter

You can volunteer your skills to PurchaseBlack as well.  We have lots of volunteers, and we'd be happy to have you!  

I'm Down to Volunteer

    Other Ways You Can Help There are a million ways to help!  The greatest is with a donation!  We can't grow without them!  
Next is spreading the word.
Share on Facebook 
Share on Twitter
You can volunteer your skills to PurchaseBlack as well.  We have lots of volunteers, and we'd be happy to have you!  
I'm Down to Volunteer

story:
About Us

Rozan is a Non Government and not for profit organization, officially registered in Pakistan,  working on emotional health, gender, violence against women and children and sexual and reproductive health and rights of youth. 

Rozan’s mission is to work with all people, especially vulnerable groups, to collectively strive for a society that is violence free, self aware and accepting of itself and others.

Current Fund Raise for Project “Rozan Ghar/House”

A space for empowerment, where every brick counts

Since Rozan’s birth 15 years ago, we have been steadily raising an endowment fund with the aim of building Rozan Ghar, a facility that can house Rozan’s work. This will include a counseling center, a community center and a residential training facility.

As in most developing countries, issues related to the emotional health of women and children have a very low priority when it comes to public spending.  Organizations like Rozan have to look to the private sector for supporting the projects like Rozan Ghar. This sector is represented by the industrialists, trade and commerce bodies and philanthropists, which share the collective social responsibility of securing a violence free future for the most vulnerable members of society in Pakistan.

The donations for building Rozan Ghar would help to provide sustained and life transforming assistance to women and child survivors of violence and contribute to promoting peace and harmony in Pakistan.

We have selected Malot area in Islamabad capital territory to domicile Rozan Ghar, and have already successfully raised funds to secure four kanals (21,598 square feet) of land in a central location.  Construction work started in January 2015 and we would like to open the center for full operational usage by the first quarter of 2016.

Funding Highlight and Breakdown

Total cost of this project is US$794,985 

We have already raised 70% of the total project cost, i.e. US$556,489.  The Grey structure has been completed and we now need to raise US$238,496 in order to pay for the finishing costs and complete the building for operational usage.

Rozan anticipates to complete the fund raising by first quarter of 2016.  

As a smaller component, the board has approved for US$25,000to be raised using the crowd funding innovation with a rewards based donation structure starting from a minimum pledge of US$10.

Rozan Objectives

1.   To facilitate the process of self-reflection and self-growth in order to foster good emotional health.

2.   To provide psychiatric and psychological support to women and children

3.   To provide psychiatric and psychological support to children/adolescents and especially those children who are victims of child sexual abuse and adults survivors of sexual abuse.

4.   To develop and maintain a resource centre on Child Sexual Abuse and Gender

5.   To facilitate and conduct research and studies on all program areas

6.   To provide trainings on Gender, Child Sexual Abuse and other aspects of emotional health.

7.   To educate and increase awareness, and sensitise the community especially key professional groups such as the police about gender issues and violence against women and children and emotional health.

What we do

Rozan responds, assists, educates, and trains as part of its services to reduce violence.

Response: Rozan has a helpline that victims of violence or anyone who is emotionally troubled can call. Over 60,000 calls have been received to date.

Assistance: Rozan' s trained psychologists offer counseling as well as psychosocial support to victims of violence or disasters. Over 50,000 individuals have been counseled so far. In addition, Rozan has worked with numerous communities, organizations and individuals affected by both natural and man made disasters.

Education: Rozan works with teachers, students and parents to reduce vulnerability to Child Sexual Abuse. Rozan's gender-based curriculum is being used in 20 Police colleges all over Pakistan for the education of police personnel.

Training: Rozan offers training to organizations to sensitize them to violence against women and children. Over 50 organizations have undergone the training to date. Rozan's collaboration with the Government has led to significant reforms in Centers and Shelters for women survivors of violence.

What we have achieved

To challenge violence and promote peace has meant that we work with women, children and men as well as with institutions to systematically address this problem in our society.

Rozan has achieved national and global credibility for its work. As the secretariat for the Child Rights Movement of Pakistan, it has the privilege of spearheading the Civil Society's Alternate Report on The State of the Children in Pakistan for the United Nations Child Rights Convention to be held in Geneva in September 2016.

Two of Rozan's programs are mentioned as examples of promising work in a recent World Bank report on Violence against Women and Girls in South Asia.

Provided counseling services to over 50,000 women, children and men.

Trained over 50 organizations across Pakistan on prevention and redressed of violence against women and children. Each organization outreaches 2000-3000 community members annually.

Introduced a curriculum focusing on gender-based violence within police training that is now being taught in 20 police colleges and schools all over the country, reaching out to 10000-15000 police trainees every year.

Partnered with the media, as well as state run shelters to provide more sensitive support to survivors of violence. Each shelter provides services to 50-200 women survivors every year. 

Media fellows produced over 500 stories, articles and packages.

Organized community campaigns to promote harmony and tolerance and counter prevailing prejudiced attitudes leading to division and violence in our society.

story:
Background

This upcoming week, on the 23rd of September, marks my 22nd year on this planet as a Korean, and as Tae Wan Kim. The previous 21 birthdays that I've received consisted of similar themes on the lines of extravagance and abundance.

We celebrate our birthdays to supposedly celebrate the life we lived so far and the beautiful world that houses us physically, spiritually, and emotionally. I was planning to carry my ongoing theme of celebration on by having a little gathering with my close friends and most likely getting too intoxicated to even remember the night of my celebration. Something, however, changed after a little midnight photorun I did with a good friend of mine, Hyeon Oh. 

Hyeon mentioned to me that there was a subway station located at the Ueljiro Entrance (을지로입구) where a lot of homeless people went to sleep before the subway opened up again. With my interest heightened, we agreed to check it out. Although I've seen pictures of people all around the world who've been through worse, being so close to these homeless people sleeping on the stone cold floor of a subway station left me speechless. They were in such a unity in action that it almost made it seem like they accepted their fate wholeheartedly. 

What petrified me more, however, was where this station was located. As soon as we stepped out, we suddenly realized that the place these people were seeking refuge in was in the dead middle of the Seoul financial district. They are shrouded by and hidden underground from all the fancy hotels, financial and business centres, malls, and skyscrapers that so many foreigners and Koreans are used to seeing when they think about Seoul. At this point, it was heartbreaking. 

Korea currently triumphs number one in the industrialised world when it comes to having the highest number of elderlies in poverty. Due to our immensely quick rise to economic prominence, we have forgotten the people that were essential for its growth. Korea's deeply rooted culture of taking care of your elders gives our government the perfect excuse to exempt itself out from using our tax money to help the disabled and the elderly. The Korean community and society believes that if their children take care of them, there would be no need of government intervention; however, not all elders are in a situation where they can be supported by their heirs. Some develop health, physical or mental, problems that disables them to live a normal life, especially without the support of the government and family. Hence, some opt out to living a life without a roof over their heads, just so that they can stop being a nuisance to their society and family. 

Whatever the reason for their momentary status of homelessness is, one thing that is clear to me is that we, as a community, should do all we can to help change their momentary status to a better one. 


Product of Donation

This is why I started this Indiegogo campaign so that I may ask all of you wonderful people to donate whatever you can to provide these people with a 담요 otherwise known as Damyo. To anyone that knows me and really really wants to wish me a happy birthday, please donate whatever you can spare to this campaign. I will be spending my birthday with my close friends giving these blankets out to any homeless people we will see around the said region. 

A damyo is a military grade blanket used by all soldiers in South Korea. The blankets are thick, versatile, warm, and comfortable. It can be used as a mattress or pillow for the summer, and source of heat and safety for the harsh winter Korea has. I think this is the perfect time to offer the blankets to them as fall is almost upon Seoul, and even then it can get very chilly. If ever the 1500$ goal is reached, we will use whatever extra money we have to buy heat packs and basic toiletry to go with the blankets, and maybe even dry food too. If the food portion of the donations get too tricky, the team and I will find a respectable and transparent NGO that helps the homeless in Korea to donate to. 


Transparency

Whoever will donate to this cause shall get numerous video and picture updates on where we are at the process of donating our blankets. After the drop has been made, and the money used to its ultimate potential, the team and I will release a minutely detailed expense report, with scans of the receipts included, to show our donors where their money have been spent. 

Media

There will be a final video depicting the entire process of the drop day, so that donors will know that it indeed did happen.

Process of Donation

When we make the drop of goods to the homeless, we will do this during 2 to 3 am, as that is when the majority of them are asleep. We want to do this anonymously, as this will eliminate any problems in terms of the homeless individuals accepting our donation. From what we know of the Korean culture, it seemed best that anonymity will have the highest success rate for the homeless individuals to take in our donations.

I find myself asking this often from time to time: if Korea's not capable of taking care of its own weak, how can we triumph over other nations by donating and validating ourselves as a charitable, first-world society? 

If the government won't do anything to take care of these people any time soon, I believe that we, the lay people, should carry the mantel and pave the way to a more humane society that better matches the economically advanced one, such as South Korea. 

Please everyone, if you are not in a financially stable state to donate any money to a cause, even a share of this page would be doing us wonders to spread the word. Thank you so very much to anyone who sacrificed their time to read and contemplate all this, and I know all of you will make my birthday one of the most unforgettable ones in my entire life. 

Thank you all!

story:
PRIKK.WORLD - DIE WAHRSCHEINLICH FREIESTE PLATTFORM DER WELT

Stell Dir vor,

es gibt ein alternatives, kostenfreies Social Media, wo kein Algorithmus Dir sagt, was Du lesen sollst und was gut für Dich ist; keine limitierte Freundschaftsanzahl; keine Extremisten und Hassreden; einfach free speech.

  • Teile mit Deinen Freunden oder der ganzen Welt Deine Nachrichten, Blog-Beiträge, Veranstaltungen und mehr.
  • Teile und Like was Dir gut gefällt.
  • Freunde finden und vernetzen.
  • Gründe eine Gruppe und lade Deine Freunde dazu ein.
  • Sende Nachrichten im Private Message Modus
  • Firmenprofilseiten direkt anlegen.

... und Du und Deine Freunde sehen immer Deine aktuellen Aktivitäten auf PRIKK: Von Deinem Crowdfundingprojekt, aktuelle Produkte die Du auf den Markplatz anbietest, Job oder neues von Deinem Userblog: Alles kostenlos (*bis auf Transaktionskosten bei Crowdfunding von 3%).


Bleib verbunden und tauche ein in die Welt von PRIKK






PRIKK BIETET DIR

5 KOSTENLOSE TOOLS*, um DEIN LEBEN ZU BOOSTEN:
  • News.WORLD
  • Crowdfunding.WORLD
  • Job-Plattform.WORLD
  • Social Media.WORLD (in progress)
  • Marktplatz.WORLD (coming soon)
(*Ausgenommen: Stellenanzeigen, von Unternehmen/Organisationen, Werbung, nur Transaktionskosten (3% btto.) für Crowdfunding.)

• Kostenlose Social Media ohne Hass und Extremisten, kein Algorithmus, unlimitierte Freundeszahl: Im Zweifel für die Meinungsfreiheit. Du kommunizierst frei und ohne unsichtbar führende Hand: They see, what you post.

Bereits online

• Kostenlose Good-News Nachrichten (redaktionell, Agentur, User) und Meinungen (redaktionell, Autoren, User). Soviel gutes wie möglich, soviel Kritik wie notwendig. 80 % unserer News erzählen Dir, was geklappt hat oder klappen wird.

• Kostenloses Crowdfunding. Kein Limit der Projektgröße, kein Limit des Investments. Keine Gebühren. Dein Geld, Dein Projekt. Nur 3 % Transaktionskosten. 97 % der gefundeten Summe kommen bei Deinem Projekt an.

• Kostenlose Jobplattform mit Recommendation-Tool. Finde Deinen Traumjob oder suche Deinen neuen Mitarbeiter.

Coming soon

• Kostenloser Marktplatz mit 16 Szenen-Welten - das „Pinterest“ der Produkte.

Um Social Media möglich zu machen, brauchen wir 23.000 Euro für die Programmierung und Schaffung eines neuen Arbeitsplatzes.



Für unseren empfohlenen Perk gibt es unseren Slogan auf T-Shirt.

story:
Help us bring more kids from our city into the woods and into their favorite imaginary places this summer!

MISSION

Adventures in Cardboard seeks to re-inspire creative outdoor play with city-bound youth in uniquely play-focused arts workshops.

These are workshops that demand the use of legs and feet as much as hands and head, where artist-instructors seek to unleash a zeal for creative role-playing, and where “wonder” is the preferred path to igniting a passion for design, construction and playful exploration of the natural world.

NEED

In Adventures in Cardboard, artists and children take inspiration from the natural world to create their own fantastic places to inhabit and explore. We know that natural spaces open the imagination, and in turn the imagination can open new respect and longing for the natural world. From the work of Richard Louv and others describing “Nature Deficit Disorder” we know children are smarter, healthier and happier when they have time for semi-structured play in natural places.

Adventures in Cardboard also seeks to instill children with a strong experiential notion that any group of kids with an idea is a resource for creative fun that can easily compete with any indoor media. Adventures in Cardboard has a track record of inspiring children to organize their own group summer adventures at home with little more than their combined imagination, a thicket of trees and perhaps a bit of cardboard.

SCHOLARSHIP EXPANSION

With our origins in Powderhorn Park, Minneapolis, Adventures in Cardboard has from the beginning provided scholarships for families who couldn't afford the tuition with transportation to and from Powderhorn Park, our home base. Although we are not currently organized as a non-profit, a percent of our profits is always redirected into scholarships for families in need.

This year we want to increase participation from families in need throughout the city by increasing the number of scholarships we can provide, and by offering free transportation to and from a range of neighborhoods across the Twin Cities metro area.

Adventures in Cardboard is placing a priority this year on diversifying participation in our summer camps, culturally, ethnically, and by family income. Part of a successful scholarship campaign for AiC will be to effectively market the availability of scholarships and transportation across a range of economically and racially diverse neighborhoods and municipalities in the Twin Cities area.

To start, if our campaign is successful, we would begin by increasing our scholarship participation to at least an average of 10%; at least 8 kids for every 80 that typically sign up for each summer session, more if we can exceed our fundraising goal.

Adventures will also match funds with profits by 12.5%. In other words, Adventures in Cardboard will use profits to fund an additional child for every 8 that are funded with your help in this campaign.

To find out more about what we do please visit our website at: http://julianmcfaul.com/castle-adventure-camp-s...
story_txt: Help us bring more kids from our city into the woods and into their favorite imaginary places this summer!MISSIONAdventures in Cardboard seeks to re-inspire creative outdoor play with city-bound youth in uniquely play-focused arts workshops.These are workshops that demand the use of legs and feet as much as hands and head, where artist-instructors seek to unleash a zeal for creative role-playing, and where “wonder” is the preferred path to igniting a passion for design, construction and playful exploration of the natural world.NEEDIn Adventures in Cardboard, artists and children take inspiration from the natural world to create their own fantastic places to inhabit and explore. We know that natural spaces open the imagination, and in turn the imagination can open new respect and longing for the natural world. From the work of Richard Louv and others describing “Nature Deficit Disorder” we know children are smarter, healthier and happier when they have time for semi-structured play in natural places.Adventures in Cardboard also seeks to instill children with a strong experiential notion that any group of kids with an idea is a resource for creative fun that can easily compete with any indoor media. Adventures in Cardboard has a track record of inspiring children to organize their own group summer adventures at home with little more than their combined imagination, a thicket of trees and perhaps a bit of cardboard.SCHOLARSHIP EXPANSIONWith our origins in Powderhorn Park, Minneapolis, Adventures in Cardboard has from the beginning provided scholarships for families who couldn't afford the tuition with transportation to and from Powderhorn Park, our home base. Although we are not currently organized as a non-profit, a percent of our profits is always redirected into scholarships for families in need.This year we want to increase participation from families in need throughout the city by increasing the number of scholarships we can provide, and by offering free transportation to and from a range of neighborhoods across the Twin Cities metro area.Adventures in Cardboard is placing a priority this year on diversifying participation in our summer camps, culturally, ethnically, and by family income. Part of a successful scholarship campaign for AiC will be to effectively market the availability of scholarships and transportation across a range of economically and racially diverse neighborhoods and municipalities in the Twin Cities area.To start, if our campaign is successful, we would begin by increasing our scholarship participation to at least an average of 10%; at least 8 kids for every 80 that typically sign up for each summer session, more if we can exceed our fundraising goal.Adventures will also match funds with profits by 12.5%. In other words, Adventures in Cardboard will use profits to fund an additional child for every 8 that are funded with your help in this campaign.To find out more about what we do please visit our website at: http://julianmcfaul.com/castle-adventure-camp-s...

story:
MAINx24

A 24 HOUR FESTIVAL - DECEMBER 5. 2015
MAINx24 is a 24-hour long festival celebrating Main Street and the burgeoning Southside, held every December since 2007. MAINx24 features all sorts of programming all day long, and is organized by a collective of individuals, neighborhood merchants, and friends.
Help us keep this wonderful community event thriving. Donate Today!

DONATE MAINx24

MAINx24 thanks you for your support! Your donation helps to cover the costs of insurance, printing, advertising, promotion, security and website maintenance.

Help us keep the festivities going for 24 hours! Your commitment supports making MAINx24 happen! In the spirit of funding every hour of this full day of fun on the Southside, we're offering you the opportunity to sponsor 1 Minute of MAINx24.

story:
Hi, my name is Matthew Tukaki and I am the founder of the world's fastest growing online news service for entrepreneurs, small business and start-ups. For a long time now I have been concerned that there are a lot of young people out there who have dreams and aspirations of becoming an entrepreneur but don't necessarily have the ability to access people or information that can help them. I hate to say it but often some young people face the challenge of living in a post code whereby they can easily miss out on opportunities. So, I want to change that for 1,000 young people from across Sydney and New South Wales by opening our doors and bring them in to help them bring ideas to life and gain soft skills to get them going. If this campaign is a success we will then use that success to get other corporations involved to fund a larger number of workshops across Australia and into New Zealand. 

To put it simply the plan is to make 1,000 places available to young people from dis-advantaged backgrounds to be able to attend our workshop that will give them some important lessons and soft skills to explore the world of entrepreneurship. The workshops will be run in Redfern, Sydney (Australia) and will focus on Indigenous kids, kids from backgrounds and suburbs where they otherwise would not have access to a group of inspiring entrepreneurs who will take them through a day of learning and insights and then team with mentors to help them bring their dreams alive. The workshops will not be restricted just to entrepreneurship they will also have a focus on providing some soft skills when it comes to job hunting and career development. 

Each of the attendees will get a free copy of our eBooks "The fifteen things you need to know about starting up" and "The ten things you need to know about finding a job". The workshops will be held at a community space called 107 projects and there will be a series of six that will run from January 2016 (during school holidays) and then on into February and March. 

So, we here at www.entrehub.org wanted to reach out to our network of readers and followers to see if you would like to get involved and support this great concept. In return you will receive free copies of the two eBooks mentioned above and recognition on www.entrehub.org as we share the outcomes of each workshop. 

The money we are aiming to raise will only be used for the purposes of running these workshops and I am sure you, like me, are every bit as passionate in seeing young people being able to access opportunity irrespective of the circumstances in which they may find themselves. 

Matthew Tukaki

CEO / Founder of entrehub.org @tukakimatt @entrehub

story:
My name is Rex De Guzman, 23 years old, I am a British born Filipino born and raised in London.  Since the end of secondary school education, I had the desire to study and learn about the culinary arts and my passion and love for food developed during my college years. After a few years working as a professional chef in the industry, my desire to run my own restaurant led me to create and run my very own pop-up restaurant events and I synonymously found myself dedicating my profession to pioneering Filipino cuisine and push it into the mainstream since 2014

This is a research expedition to the Philippines to learn about its culture, cuisine, local produce and how we can use the findings to promote Filipino food and culture forward to the The British Audience

As a young chef pioneering Filipino food in the UK, I require the missing element of cultural experience and knowledge to push the movement even further.

PROJECT AIMS

  • To push forward Filipino cuisine, share information and experiences to encourage awareness and interest in the Philippines to the British audience. I will do this by:

    • Creating interactive content for blogs, twitter, facebook, instagram, youtube and sponsors

    • After my research, I will endeavor to host more pop-up restaurants and events so that the British public may experience a Taste of the Philippines for themselves.

  • To gain a deeper insight into Filipino Cuisine and the connection with Filipino history and cultural identity. I will achieve this by:

    • Documenting and keeping detailed journal on all my experiences

    • Participating in relative activities such as Madrid Manila Fusion 2016.

  • To enhance my knowledge of cooking Filipino dishes and using Filipino ingredients in order to pioneer it here in the UK. I will do this by:

    • Running pop-up restaurants

    • Catering

    • Private Dining

    • Consultation

  • Educate and promote Filipino food culture and tourism to London & the UK

    • use the research and knowledge gained to act as a consultant

    • collaborate with partners to use research to produce a publication.

  • To encourage like minded individuals to take action in promoting Filipino culture in their own way by means of: blogs (wordpress, ‘morefuninthephilippines’), videos and activities.


What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • I have set up a total budget estimated at £7000, I have saved up some money myself (about half of the budget) to make sure this trip happens at the very minimum.
  • I need your help to raise at least £2500 or more to make this project really come to life. The Money raised will allow me to visit even more key food destinations in the Philippines and participate in Culinary and cultural activities / events such as "Madrid fusion Manila 2016".
  • The money will also assist me by helping to pay for food, transportation and necessities for my 3 months duration in the Philippines.
  • There are of course great perks as a way of saying thank you for contributing to my crowd fund, you can view this in the perks section of this page.
  • If i do not achieve my target budget, the research for my project will be very limited as I will have to compromise on my spending.

AREAS OF FOCUS

  • HOUSEHOLD & FAMILY (RECIPES): I believe that the Filipino Household plays a crucial part in the essence of Filipino Cooking as many Filipino dishes are typically one pot cooking and food that was designed to share amongst the family kitchen table. It is vital that I visit different family households (especially my own) to see the dishes that they live on and the ingredients that sustain their livelihood

    • I would like to design a questionnaire which will be answered by locals in different provinces and compare the data to see the differences and similarities.

  • STREET FOOD: I am interested  in learning about what is classified as Filipino street food , why it is so popular and how it is treated as a social part of Filipino livelihood.

  • MARKET / PALENGKE: As a main source of food, produce & materials. Its a Chef & foodies dream to see all the exotic produce that is commonly found in the Philippines.

  • RESTAURANTS: Visiting  the local Carinderias around the Philippines would give me a great idea of the most popular dishes in their region. Eating in Restaurants will also show me examples of how Chefs are innovating Filipino Cuisine in their own way.

  • SPECIFIC INGREDIENTS/ FLAVOURS - Varieties of Rice, Coconuts and their many uses, the utilization of Vinegar, Our Love for Sour flavours, Calamansi, The unlimited uses for Pork,

  • INDIGENOUS FOOD: A lot of the indigenous tribes have inhabited The Philippines long before the Spanish era of colonization would like to learn more about the Aeta and the Ifugao to understand more about the history of their origins and the food that they have lived on for so long and their methods of preparation.

  • AGRICULTURE - FARMING, FISHING

  • COOKING METHODS & PRESERVING


The Impact

  • By contributing, you are choosing to entrust me to become an ambassador for Filipino cuisine. As I embark on this incredible journey, I will do everything I can to record my experiences and knowledge gained to share with you.
  • How does this impact you and others? Whether Filipino or not, this culinary research expedition will be a leap in allowing me to pioneer contemporary Filipino Cuisine in London which brings us a step closer to making great Filipino food available to London and the British public.
WHY CHOOSE ME?
Although young, I have the drive and ambition to spearhead Filipino Cuisine into the UK. Here is a summary of work and achievements so far.

  • 7 Years professional experience as a Chef.

  • Launched pop-up restaurants serving contemporary Filipino cuisine under the brand ‘LeHappyChef’ which soon gained followers. I have successfully run 4 pop-up restaurants events since

  • Over 1000 Followers on Twitter

  • Over 1100 Followers on Instagram

  • Over 1400 Likes combined on two Facebook pages

  • A Combined total of over 20,000 views on my Youtube Channel

  • Raised £1000 for ‘Bantay Bata 163’ by running a fine dining event which included a 5 course meal, live music and Filipino Cultural Dancers known as ‘Anahaw dance artists’.

  • Worked with other organizations within the ‘Filipino Food Movement’ such as ‘Next Day Better’ and ‘Maynila’

  • Co-Founded contemporary Filipino restaurant concept known as ‘LUZON’ and ran a 3 month pop-up restaurant in Russell Square

  • Most recently, I was requested by the Philippine Department of Tourism (PDOT) to prepare, cook and serve canapes for up to 500 guests at the World Travel Market 2015 in London Excel.

RISKS & CONCERNS

  • Safety & Security - My trip will involve communication as well as commuting. I am partnering up with a close friend, Rina Atienza, who will tour the 3 months with me but she has advised that we tour as a “Crew” which should be a minimum of 3 or 4 people including myself and Rina. This creates a sense of security in numbers.

  • Budget - This project is quite ambitious as well as a long duration. The budget needs to be carefully broken down to cover all the necessary costs with extra funds for back up. The budget greatly affects all aspects of the project and will determine how much we can get done, what we can see, what we can spend on and how we can commute and document everything. We can reduce costs where possible but it would be a great deal of help to get assistance from others with discounts and accommodation.

  • Communication - While a lot of Filipinos speak and understand english the mother tongue Tagalog is more widely used. Unfortunately I do not speak Tagalog so i may find it difficult in trying to communicate and create relationships with others in the Philippines. However, I am trying my best to learn basic Tagalog and I will be assisted by friends to help me communicate.

  • Food Hygiene - Street food and Markets are commonly known to be more unhygienic due to less safer food preparation practices so I will have to be careful what I eat. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you believe in this trip but can't contribute money, you can still help!

  • Please like the video, and share this crowd funding campaign with your friends and family to help spread awareness.
  • You can do this with the indiegogo share tools provided!

Thank you for your time and consideration and I hope that you will contribute and support me in my effort to learn more about Filipino Cuisine and Culture to share with you.

story:
Short Summary

The Entrepreneur Power Hour is seeking $25,000 to help assist struggling entrepreneurs in their quests to succeed in the markets. The Entrepreneur Power hour seeks to help entrepreneurs accomplish their goals by providing an online community and training programs aimed at helping entrepreneurs to establish their brand

Who are we?

The Entrepreneur Power Hour is a community dedicated to connecting, educating, and inspiring entrepreneurs worldwide to pursue their dreams and seek their passions. The Entrepreneur Power Hour does this through weekly, masterminded group sessions, weekly podcast interviews on blog talk radio, weekly blogs, providing information on small business, products, books, courses, and software apps.  In the future there will be live seminars and trainings to attend by the creators of The Entrepreneur Power Hour.


The Impact

Entrepreneurs struggle to succeed on social media platforms due to lack of good connections, education, and affordable/available advertisings and branding. The internet has great potential for entrepreneurs to succeed if they have their own community and training programs to help brand themselves. Entrepreneurs can find the right education, the right connections, and the inspiration to succeed at their individual businesses here. 


What we plan to do?

·  Weekly mastermind group sessions

·  Weekly podcast interviews on blog talk radio

·  Weekly blogs on entrepreneurial topics and information on small business

·  Affiliate Educational Products

·  E-Books

·  Entrepreneur Courses

·  Software Applications Geared To Assist Entrepreneurial Endeavors

·  Awaken Your Inner Entrepreneur Network Marketing Program

·  Membership Social Media Site w/ Profiles, Forums, Content, E-Books
