story:
Simple, quality nutrition without compromising.

Seven and a half years ago, a decision was made that would at the time seem so irrational, yet it would become one of the best decisions I have ever made. That decision was to adopt a puppy named Rue, who happened to be a bit of a problem child in the health department. I had personally been very sick at the time, having just turned 19 and diagnosed with a chronic, debilitating autoimmune disease while in my sophomore year of college. Rue had chronic food and environmental allergies, and the number of hours spent reading pet food labels, trying new brands that held empty promises, and vet visits that only pushed heavy medications, was simply absurd. I watched the dog that provided me with unconditional love despite my own downfalls struggle daily due to my inability to provide her with a food that fit her needs. One day, I stumbled into a community of like minded individuals, all experiencing the exact same issue. On that day, SoCo Raw was born, and while it took a solid 5 years, it has blossomed. And my sweet baby girl Rue is 7.5 years old and not just surviving anymore, she is thriving.

After a year of business development, SoCo Raw officially began producing product in the small kitchen that resided in my boyfriend's and my personal home. The purpose of the company was simple: to provide complete and balanced raw diets, in which the ingredients were entirely sourced from local farms practicing the most ethical, humane and sustainable farming practices, that could be completely customized to fit each individual pet's needs, in addition to the pet owner's budget, needs, and time constraints. Our hope was to provide an affordable, convenient and customized raw product without all of the stress associated with properly balancing and ethically sourcing ingredients for each and every diet. This hope became reality within the first few weeks of accepting orders, and it has continued to grow each and every day as we fulfill orders and develop new exciting ideas on how to expand our product line and how to continue to provide the absolute best nutrition to as many pet's as we possibly can.

SoCo Raw Testimonials from REAL People

But, we have hit a bit of a hiccup, and we are seeking help from our amazing family, friends, customers and followers who have supported our company from the beginning.

 

How You Can Help

Being fully transparent, I am a 26 year old single female, and I have been told very bluntly that due to these reasons, regardless of maintaining rock solid business and financial plans, exemplary sales history and book keeping, that I am too much of a risk to invest in or loan to. We were advised to look towards the people in our life who have loved and supported this company just as much as we have for support in reaching that next step in the growth of SoCo Raw, and in the growth of knowledge regarding pet nutrition, proper sourcing, and proper overall care for your pet.

This is where you wonderful individuals come in.

In order to achieve this goal, there are three primary elements that this funding is needed for:

  • To cover initial rental and and construction costs for new facility and retail store front
  • The ability to purchase equipment that will fit the needs and the demands of the company now, as well as moving forward
  • To allow us to hire more wonderful staff to play a crucial role in expanding this company (as well as personally training and funding the Canine Nutrition certification courses for each employee)

Based on these three crucial elements, we will have the ability to provide even more to both pet owners and our community as a whole. Take a look at this time line and growth chart that further explains our plan:

 

What makes SoCo Raw different?

 

At the end of the day, we are animal loving, scientifically driven, passionate individuals who are fully fed up with the lack of change in an industry that very well can and will either provide your pets with the fuel they need to live long, healthy, fruitful lives or they will riddle your pets with disease and cause the deaths of millions of pets worldwide every year. It is time for change. And if not now, then when? If not us, then who? The thing is that this change cannot just happen with one company or one individual, it will take a village. And our hope is to build that village with people so strong and so determined that the big box companies who produce toothpaste and candy, who dominate the pet food industry, will no longer exist in a field they are not qualified to be in - one that has lives on the line. We hope you too see that need for change, and that you are willing to help us achieve it together. 

We are SoCo Raw, and we are so happy to meet you.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot donate, but want to help our cause, please know we are beyond grateful and there are so many more ways to help than just monetarily:

  • Reach out to us - we want to meet you, talk to you, and find a way for you to be a part of the SoCo family
  • Share our campaign - we cannot do this alone, getting the word out to as many animal lovers as possible will help more than anything!
  • If you are in the greater Houston area - we can use as many helping hands as possible, and if you are looking for an awesome animal loving company to work with, we may just know the perfect place for you ;)

Growing this company has been the absolute best ride of my life, and the greatest part is that it is just getting started. I am incredibly hopeful that through this campaign, not only will we be able to continue this amazing journey, but that we also spread the word and educate about the importance of pet nutrition. Whatever action you may take after viewing our campaign, we want to thank you.

From the bottom of our hearts, thank you.

- The SoCo Raw Team

And that's all there is to it.
story_txt:
Simple, quality nutrition without compromising.
Seven and a half years ago, a decision was made that would at the time seem so irrational, yet it would become one of the best decisions I have ever made. That decision was to adopt a puppy named Rue, who happened to be a bit of a problem child in the health department. I had personally been very sick at the time, having just turned 19 and diagnosed with a chronic, debilitating autoimmune disease while in my sophomore year of college. Rue had chronic food and environmental allergies, and the number of hours spent reading pet food labels, trying new brands that held empty promises, and vet visits that only pushed heavy medications, was simply absurd. I watched the dog that provided me with unconditional love despite my own downfalls struggle daily due to my inability to provide her with a food that fit her needs. One day, I stumbled into a community of like minded individuals, all experiencing the exact same issue. On that day, SoCo Raw was born, and while it took a solid 5 years, it has blossomed. And my sweet baby girl Rue is 7.5 years old and not just surviving anymore, she is thriving.

After a year of business development, SoCo Raw officially began producing product in the small kitchen that resided in my boyfriend's and my personal home. The purpose of the company was simple: to provide complete and balanced raw diets, in which the ingredients were entirely sourced from local farms practicing the most ethical, humane and sustainable farming practices, that could be completely customized to fit each individual pet's needs, in addition to the pet owner's budget, needs, and time constraints. Our hope was to provide an affordable, convenient and customized raw product without all of the stress associated with properly balancing and ethically sourcing ingredients for each and every diet. This hope became reality within the first few weeks of accepting orders, and it has continued to grow each and every day as we fulfill orders and develop new exciting ideas on how to expand our product line and how to continue to provide the absolute best nutrition to as many pet's as we possibly can.
SoCo Raw Testimonials from REAL People

But, we have hit a bit of a hiccup, and we are seeking help from our amazing family, friends, customers and followers who have supported our company from the beginning.
 

How You Can Help
Being fully transparent, I am a 26 year old single female, and I have been told very bluntly that due to these reasons, regardless of maintaining rock solid business and financial plans, exemplary sales history and book keeping, that I am too much of a risk to invest in or loan to. We were advised to look towards the people in our life who have loved and supported this company just as much as we have for support in reaching that next step in the growth of SoCo Raw, and in the growth of knowledge regarding pet nutrition, proper sourcing, and proper overall care for your pet.
This is where you wonderful individuals come in.
In order to achieve this goal, there are three primary elements that this funding is needed for:

To cover initial rental and and construction costs for new facility and retail store front
The ability to purchase equipment that will fit the needs and the demands of the company now, as well as moving forward
To allow us to hire more wonderful staff to play a crucial role in expanding this company (as well as personally training and funding the Canine Nutrition certification courses for each employee)


Based on these three crucial elements, we will have the ability to provide even more to both pet owners and our community as a whole. Take a look at this time line and growth chart that further explains our plan:


 
What makes SoCo Raw different?

 
At the end of the day, we are animal loving, scientifically driven, passionate individuals who are fully fed up with the lack of change in an industry that very well can and will either provide your pets with the fuel they need to live long, healthy, fruitful lives or they will riddle your pets with disease and cause the deaths of millions of pets worldwide every year. It is time for change. And if not now, then when? If not us, then who? The thing is that this change cannot just happen with one company or one individual, it will take a village. And our hope is to build that village with people so strong and so determined that the big box companies who produce toothpaste and candy, who dominate the pet food industry, will no longer exist in a field they are not qualified to be in - one that has lives on the line. We hope you too see that need for change, and that you are willing to help us achieve it together. 
We are SoCo Raw, and we are so happy to meet you.

Other Ways You Can Help
If you cannot donate, but want to help our cause, please know we are beyond grateful and there are so many more ways to help than just monetarily:

Reach out to us - we want to meet you, talk to you, and find a way for you to be a part of the SoCo family
Share our campaign - we cannot do this alone, getting the word out to as many animal lovers as possible will help more than anything!
If you are in the greater Houston area - we can use as many helping hands as possible, and if you are looking for an awesome animal loving company to work with, we may just know the perfect place for you ;)

Growing this company has been the absolute best ride of my life, and the greatest part is that it is just getting started. I am incredibly hopeful that through this campaign, not only will we be able to continue this amazing journey, but that we also spread the word and educate about the importance of pet nutrition. Whatever action you may take after viewing our campaign, we want to thank you.
From the bottom of our hearts, thank you.
- The SoCo Raw Team
And that's all there is to it.

story:
Project Overview:  

 

As a Nepal based project, we have gained vital support from a long-time supporter in Australia to assist in reaching a wider audience. This is why our campaign is in Australian Dollars.

 

Short Summary

Tara & Nirdesh met through a mutual friend and instantly clicked with the idea of opening a café that sells the Nepali dish Mo Mo’s and of course coffee. We have created 15 unique home-made Mo Mo’s. On the surface the mission of the café is to provide healthy, homely food to the customers and serve organic Nepalese coffee in a living room concept café, but there was more to it…. 

The café donates Rs. 5 per cup of coffee to educate those in the remote area of Upper Dolpo. (Approx. 350km N-W of Kathmandu on the Tibet Border).

Through many years of personally seeking out opportunity, we believe in empowering local youth and giving back to society. We give jobs and train those who have never worked before & have little likelihood of employment. They gain work experience and the required hospitality skills. 

Over the past 5-years we have created two cafés that operate in the bustling heart of Kathmandu, where we source all of our products locally, and profit share with the local people. Our wonderful hardworking people make all the difference. They have always been the heart and soul of our business.

All that is threatened due to Covid-19 and the closure of business. The Pandemic is only now gaining ground in Nepal. Prior to closure we supported 10 staffs and their families relying on staff wages.

 

https://myrepublica.nagariknetwork.com/news/40229/?fbclid=IwAR06pa61byeqUVxu50365MrXxx7kEqPh1hQ7ylXiZ4CLzVCY-Kkv2EAahW4

 please click the link to get to know more about us. My Republica newspaper covered our story hearing about us through locals.

 

Problem:

In February, as COVID-19 started to spread, our business declined, mimicking what was happening to small businesses, like us, around the world. Now Government restrictions have forced our closure with no options to innovate our service i.e. via take-away meals etc. We understand that the pandemic is challenging even the most developed countries. However, with a Government struggling with a myriad of country-wide issues that sees no opportunity to save our business in the short term. Landlords will not give rent relief, nor Banks defer loan payments. The immediate reality is that we will be forced to close and forfeit our fit out. As a defaulting tenant the option to start up again is unlikely.    

 

What We Need & What You Get

Currently, we are trying to raise funds that will give us the ability to service our current liabilities (rent and bank loan) and as a result sustain our business so that we can re-open once restrictions ease and no doubt in a stronger form with our existing staff still on-board. We created this campaign because we wanted something sustainable, created over many years. To close and see a close to the inspiring results we have achieved is heart breaking for more than just the two pioneers of the business. We want to see you as part of our future and created some perks to our fund supporters.

If we manage to raise our funds obviously, we survive, keep our staff and get to add our ideas to innovate the business that were planned for early 2020. 

 

The Impact

Since we opened the café we have been able to contribute to funding education in Upper Dolpo schools. We have trained our staff with skills and expertise which is very useful for them in the real world. Some of the staffs have been Tara's students from school who got the chance experience real life experience through providing them work in the cafe. Our main kitchen cook is Tara's former student who now has been with the company for 3 years. We feel overwhelmed to trained more than 20 kids to date and many of which have gone onto obtaining further employment.

We want to continue doing what we love and not make the money to be the real problem. In the past few years, we have planned, managed and built the business and the future looked bright. A lot of memories & moments have been created for our customers (foreign and local) which are priceless. As the situation is uncertain and that we do not know when things will get back to normal, closer is anticipated. This is a last resort move given its longer implications on our ability to reopen, the loss of our vision and the many fond memories created that deserved building upon. Also, we have created a beautiful connection between patrons and staff through the cafe which wouldn't have been possible if it wasn't there. Wee are not giving up and trust you can support our plans.

 

Conclusion:

Thank you all for being part of our growing community and joining hands
together to support us through these difficult times. Invest in future experiences with 
MO: MO la Palpasa coffee and let’s get through these difficult times together. 
The times are tough, but our resolve is strong. It's completely okay if you cannot support us this time as we are aware that this is a global crisis, you could still help us by spreading the word and letting others know who could possibly be part of our community.

Thank you.

Invest in future experiences with MO: MO la Palpasa coffee and let’s get through these difficult times together. The times are tough, but our resolve is strong. It's completely okay if you cannot support us this time as we are aware that this is a global crisis, you could still help us by spreading the word and letting others know who could possibly be part of our community.
Thank you.

story:
* To get full perk details on gift cards or gift sets, click on the item of interest to learn more.

*  Gift cards can be split into smaller gift cards.  I've gotten this request a few times.  Great for gifting!  Just contact me to let me know and I can work this out for you.

*You are welcome to purchase multiples!  To do so, each one needs to be processed separately.  

 

My name is Sonya Gallardo and I'm opening my very own brick and mortar, an artful and design conscious gift shop for locals and beyond, this fall in Torrance, CA. I’ve been working in retail (and small businesses in particular) for 20 years. I’ve worked with some of the best shops in Los Angeles and alongside some really talented business owners. I grew up helping my parents with their small business on the weekend as vendors at open markets. I LOVE small businesses.  They bring so much character and culture to their communities, along with their primary purpose of creating jobs and services. Having my own shop is something I have dreamed about for the last two decades and it isn't until now that taking the leap has felt like the right step to take.

Over the last few months, I have created a thorough business plan, negotiated a lease, devised a plan for funding, and designed the shop’s layout, displays, and product assortment. I am so excited to share what I am creating with you.

 



2140 Artesia Blvd.
Unit J
Torrance, CA 90504

Located at Van Art Square (formerly Del Wee Plaza) in North Torrance.

October 2021


Highlow Gift Shop, a 480 sq. ft. brick and mortar that will house my already-established jewelry business and will offer so much more.  It's somewhat autobiographical, as I am pulling a little inspiration from each place I've worked at over 20 years:  a pen store in New York City, a stationery and gift store in Redondo Beach, a design lifestyle shop in Downtown LA, and Art & Craft fairs featuring local makers.  Highlow Gift Shop will be dedicated to showcasing Highlow Jewelry, sharing a thoughtful curation of local goods, works from up-and-coming designers and artists, and some of best stationery and pens you can find. It's important to me to serve the local creative community as well, through the creation of opportunities to connect via pop-ups, launch parties, talks, and art shows.  I also plan to support BIPOC artists and makers through the inclusion in the store's product curation and through charitable donations to nonprofit organizations that support BIPOC artists.



To start, the pandemic closed the chapter on my last job as a buyer. Over the past year and a half,  I leapt into Highlow Jewelry full-time for the first time ever, and was able to increase my jewelry business by 250%. Spending more time at home, I've grown deeper roots in Torrance and the South Bay. I've never felt so close to where I live. After years of working all over Los Angeles, more than ever I want to contribute to my local community and bring something special for you all to enjoy.



Me, myself, and I – to start.  In the near future, my brother Oscar will be helping me at the shop when he can, and my mother Sara will help out with jewelry orders. Brian will very likely be called upon for thoughtful advice and IT emergencies. I hope to hire a sales associate later in the year, and build a team over the coming years. 

I want to give a big shout out to those of you who helped me out in the early stages.  You know who you are.  Thank you!


With my profound retail experience, design and art background, knowledge of bringing products to market, and relationships with small business owners and fellow creatives. Also, with some fundraising to get the business rolling. I’m currently going through the process of applying for a small business loan through the SBA (Small Business Administration). I’ve invested money from my personal savings, and additionally I’m hoping to raise money through a gift card fundraiser – details below!


It would mean so much to me to have your support in creating the most amazing shop! I have designed this space inside and out, starting with a complete rebrand for Highlow, custom displays and jewelry case, all the way down to blue vinyl tile floors. So much care and consideration has been taken to create a beautiful and inviting space.

I am looking to raise money for the most essential things needed to outfit the shop. With your purchase of a gift card, you will be giving me a cash advance for these much-needed items.  Any additional funds raised will go towards buying products.

  • Displays & Furnishings: $8,445
  • Lighting & Floor: $1,440
  • POS System: $1,375
  • Security Gate: $2,500
  • Store Signage: $1,600
  • TOTAL: $15,360

 

Below are a couple of process shots of the shop.  Left side is before, right side is current.

 

Timeline


I am using Indiegogo to create a more interactive experience for you all. On this page, you can leave me a message, see how the fundraiser is going, and easily share it with friends and family. 

*** Click on a perk on the right to read all the details that come with it ***

You will find all gift cards and perks on the right side of this Indiegogo campaign.  Below I've highlighted perks that have a value exceeding the price - a great deal!

 

To get an idea of what you'll find at Highlow Gift Shop, click here to see what's on order.



If you read this all the way through, thank you! And if you are buying a gift card, an even bigger THANK YOU! Highlow Gift Shop will be the local store you can rely on to pick up something special for all occasions. When you need something for your home office, the stationery and desktop selection will be able to brighten your work day. It will also be the place you can go to shop exciting brands, discover up-and-coming designers and artists, and to connect with your community.

I can't wait to see you there!

Sonya

TOTAL: $15,360

On this page, you can leave me a message, see how the fundraiser is going, and easily share it with friends and family. *** Click on a perk on the right to read all the details that come with it ***You will find all gift cards and perks on the right side of this Indiegogo campaign.  Below I've highlighted perks that have a value exceeding the price - a great deal! To get an idea of what you'll find at Highlow Gift Shop, click here to see what's on order.If you read this all the way through, thank you! It will also be the place you can go to shop exciting brands, discover up-and-coming designers and artists, and to connect with your community.I can't wait to see you there!Sonya

story:
The Corporate Social Responsibility, a change lever. Let’s mobilize companies!

The Sustainable Development event is more than a conference. This is a first step in a revolution that is changing the way companies run their business. The event will bring the business community, civil society, the public and the public sector together. It is a platform that will redefine the way people do and receive Social Responsibility.

How are doing that?

Our motto: Being a bridge between companies and communities


CSR is a relatively new approach in Madagascar and businesses often lack the means to formalize a CSR policy. Yet companies can be powerful engines of sustainable development. How? Keeping profit as the main objective, they can simultaneously create value and impact in the local community.

Adopting CSR requires time and a change of culture, especially in a country where the risk of corporate failure is very high (according to the Doing Business Report). However, companies can in the long term, go beyond its legal obligations and provide innovative solutions that produce social and environmental benefits.

Our ambition is to encourage companies to generate more impact, for both stakeholders and for themselves, by promoting dialogue and providing them with the necessary tool that foster the transition to action.

CSR is a change lever. It is:

  • A business contribution to sustainable development,
  • A tool for value creation and competitiveness improvement,
  • A response to stakeholder expectations,
  • A shared responsibility.

But achieving Sustainable Development requires the Sharing of Responsibilities.

This is actually a shared responsibility between different stakeholders, namely the regulatory authorities, civil society, communities. In short, all the persons, entities and organizations whose needs and interests are linked to the company.

The Sustainable Development conference, June 16-17 2016

This platform aims to share that vision and encourages the transition to action.

By facilitating meetings between companies, stakeholders and the general public; the aim is to reflect on how stakeholders can play their full role in the development and success of social and environmental business initiatives; initiatives that will lead to Sustainable Economic and Community Development.

Our vision: Develop a serie of conferences on Sustainable Development for years to come and draw public attention to global challenges such as resource scarcity, climate change, CSR...

The agenda: workshops and conferences with CSR specialists and practitioners, an exhibition held by the different actors wishing to demonstrate their services and investment in sustainable development. The Fair is open to everyone: students, professionals, NGO…

Step

More than 12 companies met and contacted that will be part of the panelists. We will be working with governmental organizations and public entities and make this event an impactful event.

Support this event! It is an opportunity for sharing and mobilization of companies and their stakeholders to the cause of Sustainable Development.

Your support will:

  • Create a meeting and exchange opportunity between corporate-general public and civil society,
  • Develop an opportunity for sharing,
  • Establish a showcase of CSR initiatives and Sustainable Development,
  • Raise awareness in CSR issues and perspectives,
  • Expose companies to CSR solutions enabling them to take action,
  • Expose participants to CSR and Sustainable Development experiences from abroad and Madagascar based companies,
  • Develop the concept of CSR in Madagascar.
We can help us to find experts as well. This will substantially reduce our budget.


4 reasons why you support this initiative

  • We are a motivated,  and a visionary team with experiences in community development and CSR. As young people, we take our responsibility and will make a difference in the business context in our country.
  • With your support, we will draw the public and companies attention on an important issue,
  • As partners, you will receive updates on the achievements and prospects. You will have a say, we will reserve spaces for our sponsors or you can share your thoughts and recommendations on this topic,
  • You will contribute to an important cause that will change the economic and social face of a country that has a strong development potential.

In case of not reaching the target, your fund will serve to:

  • Fund a series of meetings and workshops with professional groups and communities,
  • Develop guides and tools CSR for companies and their stakeholders.



        - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

La responsabilité sociale de l’entreprise, comme levier de changement. Mobilisons les entreprises !

Le salon du développement durable est bien plus qu’une conférence. C’est une première étape dans une révolution qui consiste à changer la façon dont les entreprises gèrent leurs affaires. Le salon va rassembler le monde des affaires, la société civile, le grand public et le secteur public. C’est une plateforme qui va redéfinir la façon dont les gens font et perçoivent la Responsabilité sociale de l’entreprise.

Comment?

Notre devise : Etre un pont entre les entreprises et les communautés

La RSE est une approche relativement nouvelle à Madagascar et les entreprises manquent souvent de moyens nécessaires pour formaliser une politique RSE. Et pourtant, les entreprises peuvent être de puissants moteurs de Développement Durable. Comment ? En  gardant le profit comme principal objectif, elles peuvent simultanément créer de la valeur et de l’impact au niveau de la communauté locale.

Nous sommes conscients qu’adopter la RSE nécessite du temps et un changement de culture, surtout dans un pays où les risques d’échec des entreprises sont très élevés (Doing Business Report). Néanmoins, les entreprises peuvent s’engager dans la durée, aller au-delà de ses obligations légales et fournir des solutions innovantes produisant un bénéfice social et environnemental. 

Notre ambition est d’encourager les entreprises à générer plus d’impact, autant pour les parties prenantes que pour elles-mêmes, en favorisant le dialogue et en mettant à leur disposition les moyens informations nécessaires pour instrumenter le passage à l’action.

Pour nous la RSE est un levier de changement qui est :

  • Une contribution des entreprises au développement durable,
  • Un outil de création de valeur et de compétitivité,
  • Une réponse aux attentes des parties prenantes.

Mais l’atteinte du Développement Durable passe par le Partage des Responsabilités.

Il s’agit en fait d’une Responsabilité Partagée entre différentes parties prenantes, à savoir les autorités de régulation, la société civile, les communautés, bref toutes les personnes, entités et organisations dont les attentes et les intérêts sont liés à la compagnie.

                                                                                 

Le salon du Développement durable, 16-17 Juin 2016

Cette plateforme est créée pour partager sur cette vision et instrumenter le passage à l’action.

En facilitant la rencontre entre la RSE, les différentes parties prenantes et le grand public ; le but est de réfléchir ensemble sur la manière dont les parties prenantes peuvent jouer pleinement leur rôle dans le développement et le succès des initiatives sociales et environnementales des entreprises ; initiatives qui conduiront à un Développement Economique et Communautaire Durable.

Notre vision : Développer une série de conférences sur le Développement Durable pour les années à venir et attirer l’attention du public sur les enjeux mondiaux tels que la raréfaction des ressources, le changement climatique, la Responsabilité Sociale de l’entreprise...

Au programme : des ateliers et des conférences avec des spécialistes reconnus de la RSE  et une exposition tenue par les différents acteurs souhaitant démontrer leurs services et investissements en matière de Développement Durable. Le Salon est ouvert à tous : étudiants, professionnels, simples citoyens.

Etapes réalisées

Nous avons à ce jour réussit à convaincre une dizaine d’entreprise à faire partie des panélistes. Nous travaillons avec des organisations non-gouvernementales et les entités publiques pour faire de cet évènement, un évènement de grande envergure.

Soutenez cet évènement, qui est une opportunité de partage et de mobilisation des entreprises pour les causes du Développement Durable.

Votre soutien contribuera à :

  • Créer une opportunité de rencontre-entreprises-grand public,
  • Développer une opportunité de partage entre les entreprises, la société civile et le secteur public,
  • Mettre en place une vitrine des initiatives RSE et  de développement durable,
  • Sensibiliser les entreprises et ses parties prenantes aux enjeux de la RSE,
  • Exposer les entreprises aux solutions RSE leur permettant de passer à l’action,
  • Exposer les participants aux conseils et bonnes pratiques RSE et du développement durable dans le monde et à Madagascar,
  • Développer le concept de la RSE dans notre pays.

Financez cette révolution ! Vous pouvez aussi nous aider a trouver des experts bénévoles. Cela réduira considérablement le budget.

Impact

Le salon serait une vitrine des bonnes pratiques, des cas pratiques et des solutions RSE. Il encourage le passage à l’action.

4 raisons pour lesquelles vous soutenez cette initiative

  • Nous sommes une équipe motivée, visionnaire et possédant des expériences dans le Développement Durable. En tant que jeunes, il est temps pour nous de prendre notre responsabilité et faire la différence dans le monde des affaires dans notre pays,
  • Avec votre appui, nous attirerons l’attention du public et des entreprises sur un sujet important,
  • En tant que partenaires, vous recevrez des mises à jour sur les réalisations et nos perspectives. Vous aurez votre mot à dire, on réservera un espace rien que pour nos sponsors ou vous pouvez partager vos réflexions et recommandations sur ce sujet,
  • Vous contribuerez à une cause importante qui changera le visage économique et social d’un pays qui a un fort potentiel de développement.

En cas de non atteinte de l’objectif fixé, votre contribution nous servira à :

  • financer une série de rencontres et d’ateliers avec les groupements professionnels et les communautés;
  • développer des guides et des outils RSE pour les entreprises et leurs parties prenantes.

   - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
story_txt:
The Corporate Social Responsibility, a change lever. Let’s mobilize companies!The Sustainable Development event is more than a conference. This is a first step in a revolution that is changing the way companies run their business. The event will bring the business community, civil society, the public and the public sector together. It is a platform that will redefine the way people do and receive Social Responsibility.How are doing that?Our motto: Being a bridge between companies and communitiesCSR is a relatively new approach in Madagascar and businesses often lack the means to formalize a CSR policy. Yet companies can be powerful engines of sustainable development. How? Keeping profit as the main objective, they can simultaneously create value and impact in the local community.
Adopting CSR requires time and a change of culture, especially in a country where the risk of corporate failure is very high (according to the Doing Business Report). However, companies can in the long term, go beyond its legal obligations and provide innovative solutions that produce social and environmental benefits.
Our ambition is to encourage companies to generate more impact, for both stakeholders and for themselves, by promoting dialogue and providing them with the necessary tool that foster the transition to action.
CSR is a change lever. It is:

A business contribution to sustainable development,
A tool for value creation and competitiveness improvement,
A response to stakeholder expectations,
A shared responsibility.

But achieving Sustainable Development requires the Sharing of Responsibilities.
This is actually a shared responsibility between different stakeholders, namely the regulatory authorities, civil society, communities. In short, all the persons, entities and organizations whose needs and interests are linked to the company.
The Sustainable Development conference, June 16-17 2016
This platform aims to share that vision and encourages the transition to action.
By facilitating meetings between companies, stakeholders and the general public; the aim is to reflect on how stakeholders can play their full role in the development and success of social and environmental business initiatives; initiatives that will lead to Sustainable Economic and Community Development.
Our vision: Develop a serie of conferences on Sustainable Development for years to come and draw public attention to global challenges such as resource scarcity, climate change, CSR...
The agenda: workshops and conferences with CSR specialists and practitioners, an exhibition held by the different actors wishing to demonstrate their services and investment in sustainable development. The Fair is open to everyone: students, professionals, NGO…
Step
More than 12 companies met and contacted that will be part of the panelists. We will be working with governmental organizations and public entities and make this event an impactful event.
Support this event! It is an opportunity for sharing and mobilization of companies and their stakeholders to the cause of Sustainable Development.
Your support will:

Create a meeting and exchange opportunity between corporate-general public and civil society,
Develop an opportunity for sharing,
Establish a showcase of CSR initiatives and Sustainable Development,
Raise awareness in CSR issues and perspectives,
Expose companies to CSR solutions enabling them to take action,
Expose participants to CSR and Sustainable Development experiences from abroad and Madagascar based companies,
Develop the concept of CSR in Madagascar.
We can help us to find experts as well. This will substantially reduce our budget.
4 reasons why you support this initiative

We are a motivated,  and a visionary team with experiences in community development and CSR. As young people, we take our responsibility and will make a difference in the business context in our country.
With your support, we will draw the public and companies attention on an important issue,
As partners, you will receive updates on the achievements and prospects. You will have a say, we will reserve spaces for our sponsors or you can share your thoughts and recommendations on this topic,
You will contribute to an important cause that will change the economic and social face of a country that has a strong development potential.

In case of not reaching the target, your fund will serve to:

Fund a series of meetings and workshops with professional groups and communities,
Develop guides and tools CSR for companies and their stakeholders.

story:
The El Dorado Neighborhood in San Antonio, Tx. is coming together to build its very own community garden at 12606 Prima Vista St. with the help from UTSA architecture students and Green Spaces Alliance. The community aims to unite its residents by providing a healthier organic solution to produce as well as teaching the community on how to grow it. The new garden will be located next to the clubhouse on the land of the previously existing tennis court. Our architecture class at UTSA has been asked to design and build a shade structure for the community garden. The structure will go through an extensive design process that will fulfill the needs of the gardeners and residents that will be using it and will ultimately be built by the students before the summer arrives. It will include harvest station for preparing what has been grown, a storage closet for the gardening tools to be used, a rain water harvesting system, and a shaded area to escape the Texas heat for a while when out in the garden.

       While the structure has a startup budget, it will not be enough to complete the finished structure and that's where you come in! We the students have created this fundraising page to help complete the beautiful structure for the El Dorado Community Garden and can use all the help we can get. Funds raised will be going directly to materials needed such as wood and bolts to build the beautiful harvest station structure for the garden and will be helping to make our design a reality. We want to thank you for all your help in contributing to this project and look forward to the community as well as all participants and contributors enjoying the beautiful new structure soon!

story:
Timber City Ginger Beer is a small business in the state of Washington run by myself and Kyle McKnight.

Kyle is a chef, and now brewer extraordinaire; most importantly he is the creative powerhouse behind our ginger beer recipes and production. So what I am saying is he can make one hell of a crispy chicken and pair it with a strawberry arugula ginger beer...mind officially blown...

Kara, that's me. I have focused my professional energies into the business and culture behind our food and beverages. It's a tough job, but someone has to taste and talk about all this fancy food stuff. I also drive the sales and marketing side of the business. And, I make a mean rye Manhattan, just saying...

There is a beautiful struggle involved in starting a small business, and these first two years have been tight. Getting a loan from any bank has been impossible, and starting a bunch of credit cards not an option. That is where this Indiegogo campaign comes in; saving the day like a financial Superman!

We are developing an alcoholic line, as well as ramping up our non-alcoholic line, so our production and capacity to hold all this goodness needs to increase. The only way build is going to be with; another chopper, a glycol chiller, more hoses,valves, and fittings for the new holding tanks, and more kegs/cans/bottles to hold all of our ginger brew varietals. With these tools we will be able to become a legitimate force in the craft beverage world. Crowdfunding platforms like Indiegogo are the grand machines making success and funding attainable for independently driven folks like us!


We Need

~ The hoses, valves, and attachments that will make our fermentation tanks run smoothly and dispense like a charm
~ 1 Hobart buffalo chopper for the processing of the pounds of fresh ginger we use in every brew
~ And we REALLY need more kegs! An increase in production and distribution means that we need 40 new keg shells, in every size from 1/6 barrel to 1/2 barrel 
~ Can size has been a hurdle for us, (our big 32 oz crowlers are a tricky retail sell), but we are now going to be able to produce enough to entice a mobile canning unit to come and visit 
~ 1 glycol system which will enable us to keep all of the ginger beer in our tanks nice and chilly


The Impact

We truly care about the impact that our business has upon our community's health and vitality. We have made every effort to not only buy locally, but also advertise and promote for the small farms and businesses we passionately support through direct customer sales and on all our media platforms. The financial risks we have taken by not going to large corporations for our supplies have only helped build trust, love, loyalty, and support from our customers and purveyors.


Risks & Challenges

Getting the licensing for our alcoholic line will not come without its challenges, but many small companies have been more than successful, we are just as persistent and motivated...it will be done. We have built our company from the ground up, without the help of large investors or loans. That has not paved the smoothest road, but each success feels well earned.

There is often a delay or hiccup with reward expectations, but we have taken every step to ensure all rewards will be available and ready to send. If there are any shipping issues or delays we will do our very best to efficiently remedy any unforeseen obstacles that may arise.

The spicy brew we make is filling a gap in the market that is screaming for ginger beer that actually tastes likes ginger, and this is what Timber City Ginger Beer is striving to do everyday. In the past two years our customer base has continued to grow and even depend on our products. This need alone will help our company motivate through any brewing, growing, logistical, or general life issues we may encounter; sometimes everything collides and creates the perfect storm and the strong always weather it with a smile, determination...and perhaps an occasional cocktail :)



Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute monetarily, there are many other ways to help us out! Please share our campaign with your friends neighbors, and coworkers. Your social media networks also provide amazing exposure, so please feel free to post up our campaign on your feeds. Any support and love for us is welcomed with open arms and gratitude. Indiegogo has the tools that make sharing on your platforms super easy, check it out and give us a boost!

Indiegogo has the tools that make sharing on your platforms super easy, check it out and give us a boost!

story:
Backyard Harvest Foundation and Vision
The vision of Backyard Harvest is based upon a deeper connection to where our food and medicine comes from and the desire to offer people support for natural healing that nourishes mind, body, spirit, and the Earth. We are focused on sharing our knowledge and passion of plant medicine with others while inspiring them to approach their healing holistically, reviving devotion to health and improving quality of life.
Backyard Harvest is dedicated to the reintegration of natural medicines growing in local lands and farms and returning to the roots of our ancestor’s healing traditions. With the reclaiming of ancient herbal wisdom, we have found a strong desire to inspire and support our community while creating sustainable and affordable access to healing and local herbal medicines through a mobile herbal clinic.

Backyard Harvest was created with the intention of sharing knowledge and herbal medicine preparations with our community while staying true to a holistic healing approach. As we delve deeper into the natural studies of medicinal plants and people, we feel inspired to encourage, support, and teach others how to take charge of their own healing processes.
What better way to achieve this then to bring the medicine to the people!


What the Mobile Clinic Will Offer

Fellow herbalists, holistic healers and I are committed to providing affordable services to those in need, finding the root causes of their imbalances and disorders through proper diagnosis, instructing them towards higher health and balance, and supplying them with herbal preparations and locally harvested medicines.

We believe that everyone deserves access to affordable, holistic healthcare, herbal wisdom, and the knowledge to understand one’s own health. We offer people the resources to achieve balance in their lives, to better understand the world of herbalism and holistic healing, and equip them with the personal tools to reclaim and maintain mental, physical, and spiritual harmony.

Our mobile clinic will not only allow us to bring our services to those in need, it will also provide the vehicle for wild-harvesting and gathering native herbal medicines in local forests, fields, and mountains. It will also provide space for the creation and formulation of medicines, storage for supplies and inventory, a platform for operation, educational workshops, and an inspirational healing center for encouraging health and wellbeing.

Our Project

The vehicle that will be the heart of the Backyard Harvest mobile clinic will allow myself and other herbalists and holistic practitioners to provide natural healthcare solutions and education in a diversity of communities. The mobility of the clinic will guarantee that a wider range of people and communities will benefit from a wealth of resources, knowledge and natural medicine. As we begin this journey, we will serve our local community, spreading outwards to reach neighboring towns and cities, helping individuals as well as offering medical aid and educational workshops at local gatherings and events.


Funding the Mobile Clinic

Our project is focused on purchasing a Westfalia Vanagon camper bus to act as the vehicle for Backyard Harvest. Insurance, parts, decals and minor service of the bus are necessary to get it in the best condition possible for operation. The bus we will purchase is fully equipped with electricity, a kitchen, and plenty of storage space that will provide for the clinic and all the people it serves.

We will also focus on purchasing supplies and inventory for the clinic, including first aid supplies, herb harvesting equipment and tools, herbal ingredients, knives and cutting boards, medicinal preparation supplies, medicine bottles and containers, educational materials, and other assorted supplies.

Dedication to Healing in Harmony

Dedicated herbalists and local farmers are helping us prepare this spring by planting and sowing medicinal plant seeds that will be grown into the medicine that fuels Backyard Harvest mobile herbal clinic. Known areas of native botanical medicines are beginning to sprout in preparation for spring and await our light footsteps, our respect for living ecosystems, and our careful, conscious harvesting methods. All we need in order to make our vision a reality is to put it on wheels and stock the cupboards!

On the other side of this project lies an opportunity for us to reclaim the ancient medicinal ways of our ancestors, to serve and educate communities in need and to empower individuals to take healing into their own hands with the aid of botanical medicine grown in their own backyards.


Risks and Challenges
We are confident that this mobile clinic will prove to be a very beneficial resource to the community, and are therefore dedicated to working through any challenges. With our dedication and the support of each other, our teachers and our community we are confident in the success of this project. Although we may encounter minor detours along the way, we have a plethora of resources to ensure our ability to arrive at our destinations and bring the medicine out to the people!

Other Ways You Can Help
Please share our project via social media and e-mail, using the Indiegogo link, as spreading this campaign will  support the success of the mobile clinic and make this resource accessible to more people!

We thank you for helping us to evolve and achieve our dream so that we may be in greater service to the earth and humanity.

Together we will bring the medicine out to the people!!!
story_txt:
Backyard Harvest Foundation and Vision The vision of Backyard Harvest is based upon a deeper connection to 
where our food and medicine comes from and the desire to offer people 
support for natural healing that nourishes mind, body, spirit, and the 
Earth. We are focused on sharing our knowledge and passion of plant 
medicine with others while inspiring them to approach their healing 
holistically, reviving devotion to health and improving quality of life.Backyard Harvest is dedicated to the reintegration of natural medicines 
growing in local lands and farms and returning to the roots of our 
ancestor’s healing traditions. With the reclaiming of ancient herbal 
wisdom, we have found a strong desire to inspire and support our 
community while creating sustainable and affordable access to healing 
and local herbal medicines through a mobile herbal clinic. Backyard Harvest was created with the intention of sharing knowledge and
 herbal medicine preparations with our community while staying true to a
 holistic healing approach. As we delve deeper into the natural studies 
of medicinal plants and people, we feel inspired to encourage, support, 
and teach others how to take charge of their own healing processes. What
 better way to achieve this then to bring the medicine to the people!

What the Mobile Clinic Will OfferFellow herbalists, holistic healers and I are committed to providing 
affordable services to those in need, finding the root causes of their 
imbalances and disorders through proper diagnosis, instructing them 
towards higher health and balance, and supplying them with herbal 
preparations and locally harvested medicines. 
We believe that 
everyone deserves access to affordable, holistic healthcare, herbal 
wisdom, and the knowledge to understand one’s own health. We offer 
people the resources to achieve balance in their lives, to better 
understand the world of herbalism and holistic healing, and equip them 
with the personal tools to reclaim and maintain mental, physical, and 
spiritual harmony. 
Our mobile clinic will not only allow us to 
bring our services to those in need, it will also provide the vehicle 
for wild-harvesting and gathering native herbal medicines in local 
forests, fields, and mountains. It will also provide space for the 
creation and formulation of medicines, storage for supplies and 
inventory, a platform for operation, educational workshops, and an 
inspirational healing center for encouraging health and wellbeing.
Our Project
The vehicle that will be the heart of the Backyard Harvest mobile clinic
 will allow myself and other herbalists and holistic practitioners to 
provide natural healthcare solutions and education in a diversity of 
communities. The mobility of the clinic will guarantee that a wider 
range of people and communities will benefit from a wealth of resources,
 knowledge and natural medicine. As we begin this journey, we will serve
 our local community, spreading outwards to reach neighboring towns and 
cities, helping individuals as well as offering medical aid and 
educational workshops at local gatherings and events. 

Funding the Mobile ClinicOur project is focused on purchasing a Westfalia Vanagon camper bus 
to act as the vehicle for Backyard Harvest. Insurance, parts, decals and
 minor service of the bus are necessary to get it in the best condition 
possible for operation. The bus we will purchase is fully equipped with 
electricity, a kitchen, and plenty of storage space that will provide 
for the clinic and all the people it serves. 
We will also focus 
on purchasing supplies and inventory for the clinic, including first aid
 supplies, herb harvesting equipment and tools, herbal ingredients, 
knives and cutting boards, medicinal preparation supplies, medicine 
bottles and containers, educational materials, and other assorted 
supplies. 
Dedication to Healing in HarmonyDedicated herbalists and local farmers are helping us prepare this 
spring by planting and sowing medicinal plant seeds that will be grown 
into the medicine that fuels Backyard Harvest mobile herbal clinic. 
Known areas of native botanical medicines are beginning to sprout in 
preparation for spring and await our light footsteps, our respect for 
living ecosystems, and our careful, conscious harvesting methods. All we
 need in order to make our vision a reality is to put it on wheels and 
stock the cupboards!
On the other side of this project lies an 
opportunity for us to reclaim the ancient medicinal ways of our 
ancestors, to serve and educate communities in need and to empower 
individuals to take healing into their own hands with the aid of 
botanical medicine grown in their own backyards. 



Risks and ChallengesWe are confident that this mobile clinic will prove to be a very 
beneficial resource to the community, and are therefore dedicated to 
working through any challenges. With our dedication and the support of 
each other, our teachers and our community we are confident in the 
success of this project. Although we may encounter minor detours along 
the way, we have a plethora of resources to ensure our ability to arrive
 at our destinations and bring the medicine out to the people!Other Ways You Can HelpPlease share our project via social media and e-mail, using the Indiegogo link, as spreading this campaign will  support the success of the mobile clinic and make this resource accessible to more people! 
We thank you for helping us to evolve and achieve our dream so that we may be in greater service to the earth and humanity. Together we will bring the medicine out to the people!!!

story:
The Joy of Working World Tour

‘The richest people in the world are those who end life with the most experiences lived and shared’.

We are going on a journey as we become a nomadic company in the spring of 2016. We will strengthen positivity, empathy and confidence world-wide. We do this by capturing and broadcasting beautiful stories of people we visit and support during our travels.

We are a start-up of five crazy Dutch creatives. We want to experience as much as we can to support people to create fulfilling and meaningful lives. This is why we are coming your way - first, to Sweden, then to Canada. All the other destinations are still undecided.

We want to meet and support you and capture your story. We will use all of our skills to support you in many different ways, because five crazy and passionate indivduals can do a lot! Let us know where to travel, support and capture you next.

As a group we are expanding our network and keeping everyone up to date when it comes to our encountered adventures and experiences. We do this via our social media platforms. 

Capturing the story of Bojan Bajic (2016)

With your help we enlarge positivity, empathy and confidence world wide. Join the World Tour movement. Want to know what The Joy of Working is? Visit our website www.joyofworking.nl/english. 


What We Need & What You Get

Trading

We are looking for (passion) projects where we exchange our active support as a team for accomodation, food and if possible money to be able to continue our work-style. You can find a list of our skills below.

You can help us by opening up your network, to find more people and places to visit and support. We are willing to stay for a certain period of time to make things happen and contribute to something bigger than ourselves. 

Capturing the story of Mr. Bigsby (2015)

To enlist yourself for a new project or destination please send an e-mail to: mail@joyofworking.nl. 

Donations

We are raising €8000,-. This funding is a kickstarter for this World Tour. The amount of money is based on what you need to provide five people for three months (food, water, necessities). After three months we want to be able to rely on the work-style it self. We need these three months to experiment with: how to work and live in this new environment. 

We have several perks for you if you wish to make a donation to the World Tour. Some examples: 

  • Inspirational stories in high quality film; 
  • For Dutch people we have a brand new card game that improves creative thinking and is a lot of fun; 
  • We offer adventure, nature and bushcraft courses in Sweden. 

Check out this film of Mr. Bigsby (our treat ;)):https://vimeo.com/149986739

By donating an amount of money you ease our experimental process. 

Visiting Masaaki Oyamada (2016)

If there are any other ways you would like to support us with, please contact us at: mail@joyofworking.nl

The Impact

Besides the stories we create and the movement that we build, we have a lot to offer as a team. We love to offer (passion) projects our active support as a nomadic team. We choose to focus on the more positive movements in this world and love to get involved in the passions of other people. If you are in for a fun and wild ride with five passionate and creative people: let's work together and make the world a better place!

Skills

  • Create multimedia solutions

    • Film and photography

    • Graphic designs (logo, businesscards, websites etc.)

    • Concept development (five crazy creatives can do a lot)

  • Create business solutions

    • Concept development

    • Service design and design thinking methods

    • The Joy of Working (creating a fun and inspiring business environment)

    • Innovation and change support

    • All kinds of Workshops

  • Personal development

    • Identity support: discovering your purpose, talens, skills, dreams and capabilities

    • Happiness skills and knowledge

    • Coaching

    • All kinds of Workshops

  • Team development

    • Teambuilding and community building

    • Team development and teamcoaching

    • Pressurecookers

  • Adventure support

    • Lifestyle development

    • Bushcraft

    • Eventmanagement

  • Educational development

    • Elementary school and college teaching

    • Giving (online) lectures about our nomadic and travel experiences

    • Innovating teaching methods

    • Innovating educational systems

    • The Joy of Working (creating a fun and inspiring learning environment)

Start With Why workshop for students (2016)

All the people in our team have finished at least one bachelor's study in college. We prefer to do a lot and have a positive impact on the world in a short amount of time. If you have faith in our abilities, we can do a lot more than mentioned. 

Our passion projects

These are a couple of projects we loved working on in the past:

  • The 'Let's Start a Fire Festival': organising an accecible and affordable festival for all people to get inspired in active ways through more than 25 inspirational workshops and activities, executed by artists and creative entrepreneurs;
  • The 'A Journey Into The Unknown' documentary: a dream of making a documentary became reality when we made a documentary about personal development and got to know a lot of our current friends and aqcuaintances. 
  • The 'FCXL teacher team development project': melting two teams together in a fun and exciting way? We gave it a shot. One of the things we did is use a pubquiz format to give feedback about their team analysis. 
  • Start up support for 'Garden of Sweden': we still support our good friend Indiana with his startup company Garden of Sweden. We organize travel experiences for Dutch people to Sweden who want to work on their personal development and who want to broaden their horison. The trips focus on adventure, lifestyle and reconnecting with nature. 

Hiking and dining in nature together with Garden of Sweden (2015)

Risks & Challenges

Our new nomadic work-style is an experiment. Every experiment has its challenges. These are ours:

  • How can we be a company without a pshysical location or a steady physically reachable network? Our concept solution for this is promoting this experiment via social media and digitally in our existing network. We create new connections and build new relationships online. From there we plan our new projects and travels. 
  • How do we live in a community setting when we originate from an individualised society? Our concept solution for this question is to just force ourselves into a community setting by travelling as a pact. The last five months we have been living closely together seeing eachother and working together every day. We got used to living and working together, whitout a lot of personal space. This way we learned a lot of new knowledge about working and living together contructively as a community. The World Tour will teach us even more. As we will face more uncertanties together.
  • What legal challenges do we face as a travelling company, changing locations and countries reguarly? Our solution for this is taking it one step at the time. We have tried to unfold the legal structures for travelling and working. So far we cannot find our answers easilly. Part of this is the fact that the common protocols and systems cannot answer our questions and find solutions for our challenges. What we do is something new and has a lot of uncertanties. People working at legal or goverment facilities so far were not able to answer our questions, because they did not know how to work outside of the protocols.
  • How do we connect and involve people that we meet and support in a more global setting, to help create the higher purpose that we seek? It would be great if all the people we visit, support and capture can become connected to each other to keep supporting eachother to keep up the movement even when we are not there. We havent found a way to realise this. We need to experience and research first trough our travels. That way we can also ask our contacts about what they would want and requier to make this possible.
  • How do we travel the world and keep a nomadic company on a low budget? So far we havent specifically build up our savings. We are a start-up on a low budget. We have only made enough money to keep a low maintenance lifestyle going for the past couple of months. We will offer our services in exchange for what we need to stay alive and keep travelling. This campaign is also part of easing our experimental process.
  • How do we (physically) reach ‘purpose’ driven people that wish to requier support and work together with our team? As soon as we find the right people and projects we need to be able to physically reach them. We have no plan to always be able to achieve this. If we have enough money or the contact can pay for our travels, than this wont be a problem. If we don’t have enough money we will have to come up with more creative solutions or work for a while to save up.

Energising teachers with the power of music (2016)

The idea is that these questions can never really be figured out if we don’t just try them out. This is why we leave our lifes behind in search of answers and a large network of common purpose seekers. Join the movement if you want to work out the answers to these questions together. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We love all the help we can get. If physically working with us, or donating money is not your thing, please contact us: mail@joyofworking.nl. We love to hear about your alternative ideas. Thank you for reading our story. Who knows: we might be seeing each other soon!

story:
Short Summary

  • My Name is Antoine Licordari born in Rome the 9 Dicember 1976. Something about me? The sea and the Oysters are my life, this project is born from my passion for them.
  • The aim of this project is to build and develop a 360° Oyster company, from the production to the distribution and the tourism linked to oysters.
  • Contributors can help me to create the first Oysters Aquaculture Farm and the first Oysters Museum in Italy and help other oysters lovers to discover the "Oyster Road" and also an Artisan’s Laboratory where create and produce mother of pearls and pearls  jewels coming from the Oysters Aquaculture Farm.

What We Need & What You Get

  • I need 25,000 € and I can access to European funding to create an Oysters Aquaculture Farm ,  an Oyster Museum and also an Artisan’s Laboratory at least publicize and share with everybody the "Oyster Road". 

  • 20 €: welcome letter in our oysters family. 

    ·50 €: Oyster taste plate of 6 and a visit to the Oysters Aquaculture Farm on our boat , are you ready to have a look how oysters live in the sea?

    · 100 €: Oyster taste plate of 6 and a visit to the Oysters Aquaculture farm on our boat , a fishing session and I will then cook the fish for you.

    · 250 €: 3KG of Oysters plus the fishing session and the Oysters Aquaculture farm visit.

    · 500 €: 10 KG of Oysters, the Oysters Aquaculture farm visit with a person of your choice and a session of fishing,

    · 1.000 €: You will be able to adopt an oyster and your Oyster will give you a pearl after 1/2 years , you will be able to come to the Oysters Aquaculture farm whenever you want , and I will grow your oyster for you 

    ·5.000 €: An amazing exiting experience , you will visit the "Oyster Road" an amazing journey with me starting from Venice and then straight to France and Netherlands, then Denmark , you will taste the most amazing variety of oysters you can imagine of.

    The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • A.M.A., the Mediterranean Fish farmers Association, an organization recognized by MIPAAF in 2013, with D.M. 225/2013, is a member dell'AEPM / EMPA, the European Association of Producer Molluscs, recognized by the U.E., Supports the new business that Oyster Italy intends to carry out in a stretch of sea in concession off the coast of Anzio (RM), for oyster farming. Italy is among the leading manufacturers of bivalve molluscs in the European scene, with about 100,000 t / year, but with two productive items, mussels and clams, that cover 99% of production. Oyster farming in Italy, provides an excellent opportunity for diversification and income for businesses. For these reasons, the oyster farming activities that Oyster Italy intends to start can only be a viable business opportunity for the following reasons: 1) Is it a new plant, with ad hoc design for oyster farming, which has taken account of the most recent long-line technology in the industry and with particular attention to the sustainability of production and product quality. 2) The chosen site is particularly suitable for shellfish farming both hydrodynamics and quality of marine waters and the presence nearby of other production company specialized in shellfish. 3) Given the environmental and technological characteristics of the plant, the production will be characterized by quality labels and organic certification, under Regulation EC 710/2009. 4) The project is part of a context of supplementary initiatives to the production itself, one is the sale at Km 0 and also the realization of an Oyster Museum. 

Risks & Challenges

The risks and obstacles are few, like for example environmental pollution, but the area selected is far from sources of pollution; other risk could be the predation but also this easily solvable with fishing nets around the perimeter, and surveillance cameras.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • I need your help ! if you love oysters as much as me if you can see how this project will be unique and extraordinary I need you to share this with friends communities… .
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you Folks

Antoine Licordari

story:
Artists For Charity, which has served HIV positive orphans for more than a decade in Addis Ababa, Ethiopia, has broadened its reach with the establishment of a Community Center to meet the needs of HIV positive children living with relatives or foster families in one of the poorest districts in Addis Ababa. The Community Center Project is currently serving twenty (20) children and their caregivers with monthly living stipends, school support, health services, mentoring and counseling. The goal is to increase  the number of children and families served, and to increase the services provided to these beneficiaries.  To this end, AFC has leased a building in Kolfe that is easily accessible to these families and has plenty of space for potential programs and services. But to make it a real, functioning community center we need furnishings, equipment, books, games and supplies.

Many of the HIV positive children who are and who will be served by the Community Center did not have adequate access to school or healthcare before AFC, and found themselves coping with the challenges of living with HIV without support. With AFC’s support, they do go to school, they receive tutoring, counseling and mentoring; and they have a safe place to go to strengthen their minds and bodies, a place to safely spend time among peers and helping adults - a place to be kids.  

AFC is taking on a project that it cannot complete without help. We need supporters who believe in the power of love, education, mentoring and structured play to help us complete this mission.  

What we have:

  • A facility in a safe, accessible compound in Kolfe, one of the poorest districts in Addis Ababa;

  • A small but dedicated staff and a diverse team of twenty (20) volunteers;

  • An influential local advisory board to help identify needs and the best way to respond;

  • Many orphaned and vulnerable children with enormous potential.

What we need:

  • $4,000 to provide furnishings, equipment, books, games, toys and supplies.

Why AFC?

Since its beginnings, AFC’s programs and services have been overwhelmingly successful. Every child has overcome the threat of HIV and every child who has aged out of the orphanage has completed school – no mean feat in Ethiopia - and a significant number have gone on to university. Others have completed vocational training programs or started businesses and become self-supporting, successful adults. The playground completed at Yekatit hospital last year has been widely celebrated and held up as a model for other hospitals and communities in a city of more than four million people and no other accessible hospital playgrounds.  

Artists For Charityis a 501(c) (3) non-profit organization, and all donations towards this project are tax-deductible. Learn more about AFC and ways you can become involved by visiting us at: www.artistsforcharity.org! 

Help by sharing!

No matter how much you are able to give to our campaign, you can also support this project by spreading the word!  Please share this link with friends, family and colleagues.

Greetings from the Farm

Reroot farm lives on 70 acres of paradise in Wellington County, Ontario, Canada, where we grow organic vegetables and raise pastured livestock. One of the first things you notice when you arrive at the farm is our 150-year-old heritage bank barn. Our barn provides winter housing for our cattle, sheep, pigs and hens, hay and straw storage, a place to park farm equipment and even a spot to cure the onions and garlic we grow in our market garden. The barn is not only a beautiful piece of rural heritage and architecture, but also a functional central part of our farm.

Reroot Farm is celebrating it's tenth anniversary this year! That's 10 years of growing and raising healthy, happy food, feeding our community and training more young farmers to help grow the local, sustainable food movement.

 

A Barn Worth Saving

Our barn is a relic of a time when all farms were small, family-run, diversified operations. Sadly, over the past century, many of these beautiful bank barns – made from locally sourced stones and wood, crafted with hand-hewn beams and stone and mortar foundations – have been replaced by more specialized steel barns, or simply crumbled due to years of neglect.  

While our barn was in need of some repairs when it first became ours just over six years ago, the required repairs became urgent earlier this summer when a tractor we were using to put hay in the barn crashed through the floor, breaking boards and beams and crumbling the foundation along the bank wall.

The rush is on to get these urgent repairs done before winter as we've been told if the frost gets behind the bank wall it will surely heave and buckle and cause the barn to fall taking with it not only a part of our livelihood but also a piece of rural heritage.

 

We Need $20,000 to Save the Barn

Farmers are by nature self-sufficient, resilient and stoic folk. It's hard for us to ask for help!

We've consulted with a local expert in bank barn restoration and have received estimates to repair the damage and correct other issues before the barn suffers more catastrophic damage. 

The labour and materials required to repair the foundation, replace the boards and beams, and reinforce the walls total approximately $20,000.

In addition to the daunting barn repairs, this season has been incredibly challenging:

  • One of our greenhouses was destroyed, and another damaged in pre-tornado winds earlier this year
  • Our hay crop was poor due to lack of rain, forcing us to buy in hay to feed our animals this winter; and
  • The planting season has been fraught with troubles stemming from the season's drought, making it our worst growing season in 10 years.

Being a small farm, we don't have a lot of expendable income. Everything we've made over the last 10 years has been reinvested back into the farm: a farm store in 2013, new greenhouses and farm equipment, and constant investment in the health of our soil.  

Needless to say, we could really use your support! We are reaching out to our broader community of friends, customers, local food lovers, history buffs and farm fans to help lighten our load.

 

Become A Permanent Part of Rural Heritage

We're not asking for a hand out: we have lots to offer in exchange and of course we'll sing your praises from the highest barn roof we can find!

In exchange for your kind and generous support we will honour all donors on a donor wall in the barn once repairs are complete. This is your chance to become a permanent part of rural heritage.

We also have a number of great perks to offer including farm experiences and products, beautiful works of art featuring our heritage barn by our friend and talented artist Wesley Bates, and Reroot swag such as engraved walnut cutting boards and postcards featuring photos from around the farm.

 

The Impact

By supporting our Heritage Barn Restoration you will not only be helping to repair and restore a beautiful piece of history on our farm, you'll also be supporting a small, sustainable farm and the young farmers who make a living from and life on this farm.  

We hope to be growing and raising good food for many years to come here at Reroot and your support will enable us to do just that.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word to others who love farms, farmers, barns, history, and food!  

Share our campaign on social media and by email with other folks you think might be interested.
