story:
Our ArtAsian project is run by young people full of courage. Our dream mission is to help talented artisans from Kyrgyzstan, Tajikistan and Uzbekistan to promote and market their unique handmade products globally. Together, we are passionate about spreading the Central Asian culture.

It is no secret that Central Asia has been elusive from history books and encyclopedias. Members of our team sought education in developed cities as Moscow, London, and Melbourne, and experienced how little was known of our culture beyond borders. Besides, most of the people had no clue about where it is located. For us, Central Asia is home to history and earthy cultures, from its assortment of nomads in its territory. As patriotic Kyrgyz youth, we decided to promote our culture beyond borders, and propagate of its rich history and artifacts through our organization. Our handicrafts are a first hand story of our country, and many talented artists in remote villages have the product, but not the market. So putting these two factors together, ArtAsian aims to help these artists monetarily while promoting their art and Central Asian culture.

Totunkan is not the only artisan facing same issues. In Central Asia there are about 6 million  talented artisans creating outstanding handicraft products without having a chance to market them online, due to language barriers and lack of infrastructure. Our team has already initiated solutions for such Artasians.


We have launched a website (artasian.co) with international reach, where artisans and the world’s customers can come together. Artasians can easily register, tell their stories and sell their products and with every purchase, customers from all over the world can learn an artisan’s story and own a unique work of art. The profit of our online shop goes back to the artasians and their communities.


 Alongside, we are developing an Android Mobile application  called ‘Sell on Artasian’, which enables artisans  to upload their products using only their phones.

With your support, Social Entrepreneurship project “ArtAsian” will set  the new standard in Central Asian social entrepreneurship!

Currently, ArtAsian is working with more than a 150 handicraft artisans and has already managed to smoothen some of their problems.
Through our online platform artisans have successfully sold their products to customers from London, Zurich and San-Francisco, and as a team we worked hard to ensure safe and well-monitored delivery of the handicrafts.

The Social Impact of YOUR contribution is huge on our developing countries!

Special perks from our Artasians <3 

$10     

$25  

$50   


$60    


$80

$200 

$500 

$1500

$3000  

Meet our #amazing Marketing Team

From left to right: Burulai, Aiganysh, Aiturgan, Timur
WOOOHOOOO We are really happy this campaign is ready!!!!!
Thank you for your time and support!
We would really appreciate if you could spread the love and share our campaign through your networks.
Peace!

                                                                          
We will love to hear from you:

Facebook  

Instagram 

Gmail

story:
Overview

Our plan is to open a destination  production brewery in our home town of Murfreesboro TN

We don't plan to just be IN Murfreesboro, but rather to BE Murfreesboro!!

The area we are targeting is a current project called the Bottoms, which plans to turn a section of Murfreesboro near the square. This area is to be a Gultch of Nashville type district. With eating, entertainment, night life, and with your help, our brewery.

 

We plan to incorporate all of these aspects to just our brewery alone. Our motto is its All About the Brews. Even though beer comes first, we want you to be in the right atmosphere to enjoy those brews. With a beer garden, live entertainment, comfortable areas with separate rooms for game activities and rentable space for your personal parties. 

 

Here at Panther Creek Brews, we have been constructing our recipes for over 10 years from our homes, with the plan of going commercial in mind the whole time. We have been waiting for recipe perfection and the right time to indulge in our dream. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • Now that we are closing in on a location with an investor, we need help to move forward with the brewery side of things. We are raising money for the legal help and fees towards the licensing required to take on the huge efforts to opening our brewery.    

  • Also to get our brews on the market in the process, we have a contract on the table to contract brew at a successful brewery nearby to show that we are needed in the community and can produce these wonderful brews on a large scale.

  • The rest of these proceeds will donate to this cause.

  • We have some amazing perks to give you for your generous donations! Of course we want to give you something for helping us realize are dream, but also to help make this a dream of yours as well. This will give all of you a way to get our brews you've been craving and also a place for you and your spouse, family, and friends to enjoy a wonderful atmosphere, music, and brews right here in the wonderful town of Murfreesboro, TN.

 

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

What happens if we don't make our goal? Well, we will still use the money you give to make some of our purchases. Our first priorities are getting licensed and purchasing the brewing equipment. 

Sometimes $30,000 seems like an overwhelming goal. Because, hey, it's a lot of money. However, when we talk about Panther Creek Brews with our friends, family, brew masters, community members, and government agencies, we receive so much excitement and reassurance that we're doing a great thing that $30,000 becomes a very real, attainable goal. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that not everyone who would like to contribute money are able to. There are other ways that you can help:

Make some noise! Share this campaign with your friends, family, and networks. 

Let us know about any connections you think would be good for us to make.

story:
Welcome to The Wild Grocer.

We are a New Brunswick-based food company using our passion for high quality food to make social, economic, and environmental change. We want to make good food accessible to everyone, provide meaningful, well-paid employment, and promote environmental health and biodiversity. We are starting this process in summer 2016 with the production of wild botanical sodas.

Bienvenue chez L’Épicier Sauvage MC

Notre entreprise alimentaire établie dans l’Est du Canada a pour mission et passion d’élaborer des produits de haute qualité, et de ce fait, promouvoir un changement social, économique et environnemental positif.

Nous voulons rendre l’excellente nourriture largement accessible, procurer de bons emplois bien rémunérés, et favoriser des initiatives saines pour l’environnement et la biodiversité.

Nous entreprenons cette démarche dès l’été 2016 avec la production d’une gamme de boissons gazeuses élaborées à partir de plantes sauvages.

Wild Botanical Sodas

We carefully select the best ingredients to produce incredible flavours— citrusy sumac, bittersweet yarrow, tangy spruce, delicate wild rose, and wild cherry root— available here to preorder for the first time!

  • Wild Rose - Delicate yet powerful, this floral rose soda tastes as good as it smells.
  • Sumac - Tangy, citrusy sumac is reminiscent of pink lemonade.
  • Cherry Root Beer - Floral and root notes add zest to the traditional flavour of root beer.
  • Tonic Water - Delicate and bittersweet natural herbs supplant the traditional quinine.
  • Spruce Beer - Featuring resinous spruce, this French Canadian favourite is sweetened with maple syrup.

Each flavour brings you the sweetness, spice, and complexity that you only find in the finest luxury food, all produced close to home. And all from wild and native varietals!

The best part is that all of The Wild Grocer’s products—from our botanical sodas to the additional beverages and foods we’ll be producing in the future— can be enjoyed guilt-free! Our sodas contain only fairtrade cane sugar and natural ingredients with absolutely no chemical additives or preservatives.

Boissons gazeuses aux plantes sauvages

Nous sélectionnons avec grand soin les meilleurs ingrédients naturels qui soient pour produire des saveurs incroyables — le sumac au parfum d’agrumes, l’achillée millefeuille à saveur douce-amère, l’épinette au goût corsé et légèrement acidulé, la délicate rose sauvage (rosa acicularis) et, la racine de merisier.  Ces boissons sont disponibles ici même et nous vous invitons à être les premiers à les précommander!

  • Rose sauvage — Avec des arômes à la fois délicats et riches, cette boisson gazeuse a un goût qui s’accorde à merveille avec son agréable odeur florale.
  • Sumac — Ses riches notes d’agrumes rappellent le goût de la limonade rose.
  • Racinette de merisier — Avec ses notes florales et des zestes de racine, cette boisson gazeuse aromatisée ajoute une belle sensation en bouche à la racinette traditionnelle.
  • Soda tonique —Les fines herbes à la fois délicates et douces-amères utilisées pour la fabrication de cette boisson gazeuse viennent supplanter la quinine comme ingrédient de base traditionnel.
  • Bière d’épinette — Mettant en valeur l’épinette résineuse, cette boisson gazeuse prisée au Canada-Français est sucrée avec du sirop d’érable.

Chaque saveur de boisson gazeuse vous procure une douceur exquise et riche  en bouche que vous ne retrouverez que dans les meilleurs produits alimentaires de luxe.  De plus, chaque boisson est produite localement à partir de plantes sauvages du terroir!

Mais, le meilleur, c’est que toutes les saveurs de L’Épicier Sauvage  — que ce soit les boissons gazeuses aux plantes sauvages ou les autres breuvages que nous embouteillerons bientôt — peuvent être dégustées sans que vous deviez trahir vos valeurs et principes puisqu’elles sont toutes préparées avec des ingrédients naturels et du sucre de canne bio-équitable, sans additifs chimiques ou agents de conservation!

How It Will Happen

We are starting out by producing delicious wild-crafted botanical sodas, sourced from ethical and local ingredients, produced sustainably and close to home. A drink you can feel good about in every way.

Your contributions will allow us to purchase the necessary equipment and inventory to start production on the scale we need, to immediately start hiring employees, and to ship our products to wherever you are.

  • Bottling Equipment (Counter Pressure Filler, Pneumatic Capper, Bottle Washer)
  • Labeler and Labeling Material
  • High-Quality Bottles and Caps
  • Three full time employees

Exceeding our funding goal would allow us to bring you a larger selection of unique, high quality food items from the very beginning, hire more people, and propel us further on the path to realizing our goal of opening grocery stores across the maritimes.

Quelles sont les étapes ?

Notre première étape consiste à produire des boissons gazeuses élaborées localement à partir de plantes sauvages du terroir et d’ingrédients bio-équitable, et ce en suivant des méthodes écoresponsables.  Voilà des boissons que vous pourrez déguster sans trahir vos valeurs et principes !

Votre contribution au financement participatif nous permettra d’acheter l’équipement et l’inventaire nécessaires pour atteindre la capacité de production souhaitée pour l’embauche immédiate d’employés, et pour distribuer nos produits là où vous êtes :

  • Équipement d'embouteillage (tireuse iso barométrique, capsuleuse pneumatique, laveuse de bouteilles, machine à laver les bouteilles)
  • Machine à étiqueter et étiquettes
  • Bouteilles de haute qualité et capsules
  • Embauche de trois employés à temps plein

Le dépassement de l’objectif de cette campagne de financement participatif nous permettra de vous apporter une plus vaste sélection de produits alimentaires uniques et haut de gamme dès le départ, créer plus d’emplois bien rémunérés, et de nous propulser plus loin sur la voie de la réalisation de notre objectif d'ouvrir des épiceries dans l’Est du Canada que vous aimerez fréquenter.

Our Values — Making Good Food Accessible To Everyone

Living in the rural Maritimes, we’ve noticed that good food is hard to come by.

  • Most of what is available is highly processed and mass produced, and is often full of unhealthy ingredients and fillers
  • There are very few healthier local alternatives
  • Much of the food available in stores is middle of the road— not bad, but not good either— with truly quality food hard to find except at markets and speciality stores.

We want to change this. We want to make it easy for you to buy food that is healthier, tastes better, and can be bought guilt free.We will produce unique, high quality products while partnering with farms and other food producers across Atlantic Canada.  We have direct links between earth, farm, and market, meaning you will always know exactly where your food comes from, and it’s good. Our goal is to--  within three years--  open a series of grocery stores across the province that provide local varieties of staple foods and household supplies.

Nos valeurs — Produire des aliments d’excellente qualité accessibles à tous

Dans notre milieu rural de l’Est du Canada, nous avons remarqué qu’il est difficile de se procurer de l’excellente et saine nourriture.

La plupart des aliments qui sont disponibles en magasin sont le produit d’une haute transformation en usine.  De plus, ils contiennent trop souvent des ingrédients ou additifs alimentaires malsains.

De façon générale, les aliments sont de qualité moyenne — ni mauvais ni très bon —  et la nourriture de haute qualité est difficile à trouver, sauf dans les marchés publics et les magasins spécialisés.

Nous voulons changer cela. Nous voulons qu’il soit désormais facile pour vous d’acheter des aliments plus sains, qui ont bien meilleur goût, et qui peuvent être consommés sans que vous deviez trahir vos valeurs et principes.  Nous produirons des produits uniques et de haute qualité en partenariat avec les fermiers ou autres producteurs de sains aliments dans l’Est du Canada.  Nous assurerons un lien direct entre le terroir, la ferme et le marché.  Ainsi, vous saurez en tout temps et avec exactitude d’où proviennent vos aliments, ce qui est une excellente chose.  Notre objectif est — d’ici trois ans — d’ouvrir dans tous les coins de notre province des épiceries où l’on peut se procurer une excellente variété d’aliments, de denrées de base et d’articles ménagers produits écologiquement et localement.

Our Values — Provide Meaningful, Well Paid Employment

We see some real problems with many of the employment opportunities available to people.

  • There are too many low paying jobs
  • People are often subject to poor working conditions
  • Many available jobs are harmful to the environment

In response to these issues, we do the exact opposite. As a company, we pay our employees a wage they can actually live on. We foster a healthy work environment that’s mutually beneficial for us and our employees. We provide jobs that people can be proud of: employment where people create craft goods while protecting and enhancing their environment and communities.

Nos valeurs — Offrir des emplois valorisants et bien rémunérés

Comme vous, nous voyons de réels problèmes dans la plupart des possibilités d'emploi offertes aux jeunes et moins jeunes :

  • Il y a trop d'emplois pas bien rémunérés
  • Les salariés subissent souvent de piètres conditions de travail
  • De nombreux emplois disponibles sont dans des secteurs néfastes pour l'environnement

Nous réagissons à cette problématique par une approche complètement différente.  Comme entreprise, nous payons nos employés un salaire minimum convenable (Living Wage).  Nous favorisons un environnement de travail sain qui est mutuellement bénéfique, tant pour nos employés que pour nous.  Nous fournissons des emplois dont les personnes peuvent être fières d’avoir.  Des emplois où les personnes créent des produits de qualité artisanale, tout en protégeant et en améliorant leur environnement et leur collectivité.

Our Values — Promote Environmental Health & Biodiversity

Atlantic Canada is faced with some very serious environmental challenges.

  • There is an unhealthy focus on monoculture in agriculture and forestry
  • Natural resources are being exploited and forests are being destroyed
  • There is widespread use of chemical fertilizers, pesticides and herbicides

We believe that a healthy, vibrant environment and a healthy economy are not mutually exclusive. 

We want to realize the incredible diversity available to us in the fields and forests of Atlantic Canada. By introducing forest farming and wild-crafting as viable alternatives to current forestry practices, we will protect our natural resources. By using only natural and sustainable agricultural and wild-crafting practices we can ensure a healthy environment for generations to come.

Nos valeurs - Promouvoir la biodiversité et un environnement sain

Notre province est confrontée à de sérieux défis en matière d’environnement :

  • Une concentration particulièrement malsaine sur la monoculture dans les secteurs de l’agriculture et de la sylviculture
  • Des ressources naturelles mal exploitées et des forêts détruites
  • L’utilisation répandue d'engrais chimique, de pesticides et d'herbicides

Nous croyons qu’un milieu naturel en santé et bien en vie n’est pas incompatible avec une économie prospère et saine.

Nous voulons miser sur l'incroyable biodiversité qui est disponible dans nos terres et forêts de l’Est du Canada.  En développant l’agroforesterie et en utilisant les plantes cueillies dans la nature comme approche alternative et durable aux méthodes d’exploitation actuelles, nous allons protéger nos ressources naturelles.  En ayant recours qu’à des pratiques agricoles naturelles et durables, dont la cueillette de plantes dans la nature, nous sommes en mesure d’assurer un environnement sain pour les générations à venir.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that finances are tight for lots of our friends. But even if you can't give us money (or you can't give as much as you would like to) that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • We know from initial research that there is a great market for our products, but we need your help to get the word out. We choose to put our money into high quality materials rather than facebook ads. Show us that we made the right choice by telling your friends about us and our campaign.
  • We would really appreciate it if you'd use the Indiegogo share tools to let the world know you support us!

D'autres façons de contribuer

Nous reconnaissons que pour plusieurs d’entre vous, les moyens financiers peuvent être limités.  Malgré tout, même si vous n’êtes pas en mesure de contribuer monétairement (ou de contribuer autant que vous les souhaiteriez), sachez que vous pouvez nous aider d’autres façons.

Nos premières études démontrent qu’il y a un marché extraordinaire pour nos produits et nous avons besoin de votre précieuse et généreuse aide pour diffuser notre message.  Par exemple, nous choisissons d’investir notre argent dans la production de produits de haute qualité plutôt que dans des publicités Facebook.  Faites-nous la preuve que nous avons fait le bon choix en diffusant notre campagne de financement participatif.  Nous vous en saurions très reconnaissants.

Bref, utilisez les outils de partage sur Indiegogo ou dans vos médias sociaux favoris pour exprimer votre appui à notre projet !

Will you join us in making something wonderful?

Allez-vous appuyer ce merveilleux projet ?
story_txt:
Welcome to The Wild Grocer.We are a New Brunswick-based food company using our passion for high quality food to make social, economic, and environmental change. We want to make good food accessible to everyone, provide meaningful, well-paid employment, and promote environmental health and biodiversity. We are starting this process in summer 2016 with the production of wild botanical sodas.
Bienvenue chez
L’Épicier Sauvage MC
Notre entreprise alimentaire établie dans l’Est du Canada a
pour mission et passion d’élaborer des produits de haute qualité, et de ce
fait, promouvoir un changement social, économique et environnemental positif.
Nous voulons rendre l’excellente nourriture largement
accessible, procurer de bons emplois bien rémunérés, et favoriser des
initiatives saines pour l’environnement et la biodiversité.
Nous entreprenons cette démarche dès l’été 2016 avec la
production d’une gamme de boissons gazeuses élaborées à partir de plantes
sauvages.Wild Botanical SodasWe carefully select the best ingredients to produce incredible flavours— citrusy sumac, bittersweet yarrow, tangy spruce, delicate wild rose, and wild cherry root— available here to preorder for the first time!

Wild Rose - Delicate yet powerful, this floral rose soda tastes as good as it smells.


Sumac - Tangy, citrusy sumac is reminiscent of pink lemonade.


Cherry Root Beer - Floral and root notes add zest to the traditional flavour of root beer.


Tonic Water - Delicate and bittersweet natural herbs supplant the traditional quinine.

Spruce Beer - Featuring resinous spruce, this French Canadian favourite is sweetened with maple syrup.
Each flavour brings you the sweetness, spice, and complexity that you only find in the finest luxury food, all produced close to home. And all from wild and native varietals!The best part is that all of The Wild Grocer’s products—from our botanical sodas to the additional beverages and foods we’ll be producing in the future— can be enjoyed guilt-free! Our sodas contain only fairtrade cane sugar and natural ingredients with absolutely no chemical additives or preservatives.Boissons gazeuses aux plantes sauvages
Nous sélectionnons avec grand soin les meilleurs ingrédients naturels qui soient pour produire des saveurs incroyables — le sumac au parfum d’agrumes, l’achillée millefeuille à saveur douce-amère, l’épinette au goût corsé et légèrement acidulé, la délicate rose sauvage (rosa acicularis) et, la racine de merisier.  Ces boissons sont disponibles ici même et nous vous invitons à être les premiers à les précommander!


Rose sauvage — Avec des arômes à la fois délicats et riches, cette boisson gazeuse a un goût qui s’accorde à merveille avec son agréable odeur florale.


Sumac — Ses riches notes d’agrumes rappellent le goût de la limonade rose.


Racinette de merisier — Avec ses notes florales et des zestes de racine, cette boisson gazeuse aromatisée ajoute une belle sensation en bouche à la racinette traditionnelle.


Soda tonique —Les fines herbes à la fois délicates et douces-amères utilisées pour la fabrication de cette boisson gazeuse viennent supplanter la quinine comme ingrédient de base traditionnel.


Bière d’épinette — Mettant en valeur l’épinette résineuse, cette boisson gazeuse prisée au Canada-Français est sucrée avec du sirop d’érable.




Chaque saveur de boisson gazeuse vous procure une douceur exquise et riche  en bouche que vous ne retrouverez que dans les meilleurs produits alimentaires de luxe.  De plus, chaque boisson est produite localement à partir de plantes sauvages du terroir!
Mais, le meilleur, c’est que toutes les saveurs de L’Épicier Sauvage  — que ce soit les boissons gazeuses aux plantes sauvages ou les autres breuvages que nous embouteillerons bientôt — peuvent être dégustées sans que vous deviez trahir vos valeurs et principes puisqu’elles sont toutes préparées avec des ingrédients naturels et du sucre de canne bio-équitable, sans additifs chimiques ou agents de conservation!How It Will HappenWe are starting out by producing delicious wild-crafted botanical sodas, sourced from ethical and local ingredients, produced sustainably and close to home. A drink you can feel good about in every way.Your contributions will allow us to purchase the necessary equipment and inventory to start production on the scale we need, to immediately start hiring employees, and to ship our products to wherever you are.

Bottling Equipment (Counter Pressure Filler, Pneumatic Capper, Bottle Washer)


Labeler and Labeling Material


High-Quality Bottles and Caps

Three full time employees
Exceeding our funding goal would allow us to bring you a larger selection of unique, high quality food items from the very beginning, hire more people, and propel us further on the path to realizing our goal of opening grocery stores across the maritimes.
Quelles sont les
étapes ?
Notre première étape consiste à produire des boissons
gazeuses élaborées localement à partir de plantes sauvages du terroir et
d’ingrédients bio-équitable, et ce en suivant des méthodes écoresponsables.  Voilà des boissons que vous pourrez déguster
sans trahir vos valeurs et principes !
Votre contribution au financement participatif nous permettra
d’acheter l’équipement et l’inventaire nécessaires pour atteindre la capacité
de production souhaitée pour l’embauche immédiate d’employés, et pour
distribuer nos produits là où vous êtes :


Équipement d'embouteillage (tireuse iso barométrique,
capsuleuse pneumatique, laveuse de bouteilles, machine à laver les bouteilles)


Machine à étiqueter et étiquettes


Bouteilles de haute qualité et capsules


Embauche de trois employés à temps plein


Le dépassement de l’objectif de cette campagne de financement
participatif nous permettra de vous apporter une plus vaste sélection de
produits alimentaires uniques et haut de gamme dès le départ, créer plus
d’emplois bien rémunérés, et de nous propulser plus loin sur la voie de la
réalisation de notre objectif d'ouvrir des épiceries dans l’Est du Canada que
vous aimerez fréquenter.Our Values — Making Good Food Accessible To EveryoneLiving in the rural Maritimes, we’ve noticed that good food is hard to come by.

Most of what is available is highly processed and mass produced, and is often full of unhealthy ingredients and fillers


There are very few healthier local alternatives

Much of the food available in stores is middle of the road— not bad, but not good either— with truly quality food hard to find except at markets and speciality stores.
We want to change this. We want to make it easy for you to buy food that is healthier, tastes better, and can be bought guilt free.We will produce unique, high quality products while partnering with farms and other food producers across Atlantic Canada.  We have direct links between earth, farm, and market, meaning you will always know exactly where your food comes from, and it’s good. Our goal is to--  within three years--  open a series of grocery stores across the province that provide local varieties of staple foods and household supplies.
Nos valeurs — Produire des aliments d’excellente qualité accessibles à tous
Dans notre milieu rural de l’Est du Canada, nous avons
remarqué qu’il est difficile de se procurer de l’excellente et saine nourriture.
La plupart des aliments qui sont disponibles en magasin sont
le produit d’une haute transformation en usine. 
De plus, ils contiennent trop souvent des ingrédients ou additifs
alimentaires malsains.
De façon générale, les aliments sont de qualité moyenne — ni mauvais ni très bon —  et la nourriture de
haute qualité est difficile à trouver, sauf dans les marchés publics et les magasins
spécialisés.
Nous voulons changer cela. Nous voulons qu’il soit désormais
facile pour vous d’acheter des aliments plus sains, qui ont bien meilleur goût,
et qui peuvent être consommés sans que vous deviez trahir vos valeurs et
principes.  Nous produirons des produits uniques
et de haute qualité en partenariat avec les fermiers ou autres producteurs de
sains aliments dans l’Est du Canada.  Nous
assurerons un lien direct entre le terroir, la ferme et le marché.  Ainsi, vous saurez en tout temps et avec
exactitude d’où proviennent vos aliments, ce qui est une excellente chose.  Notre objectif est — d’ici trois ans — d’ouvrir
dans tous les coins de notre province des épiceries où l’on peut se procurer une
excellente variété d’aliments, de denrées de base et d’articles ménagers
produits écologiquement et localement. Our Values — Provide Meaningful, Well Paid EmploymentWe see some real problems with many of the employment opportunities available to people.

There are too many low paying jobs


People are often subject to poor working conditions


Many available jobs are harmful to the environment

In response to these issues, we do the exact opposite. As a company, we pay our employees a wage they can actually live on. We foster a healthy work environment that’s mutually beneficial for us and our employees. We provide jobs that people can be proud of: employment where people create craft goods while protecting and enhancing their environment and communities.
Nos valeurs — Offrir des emplois valorisants et bien rémunérés
Comme vous, nous voyons de réels problèmes dans la plupart
des possibilités d'emploi offertes aux jeunes et moins jeunes :


Il y a trop d'emplois pas bien rémunérés


Les salariés subissent souvent de piètres conditions de travail


De nombreux emplois disponibles sont dans des secteurs
néfastes pour l'environnement


Nous réagissons à cette problématique par une approche
complètement différente.  Comme entreprise,
nous payons nos employés un salaire minimum convenable (Living Wage).  Nous
favorisons un environnement de travail sain qui est mutuellement bénéfique,
tant pour nos employés que pour nous.  Nous
fournissons des emplois dont les personnes peuvent être fières d’avoir.  Des emplois où les personnes créent des
produits de qualité artisanale, tout en protégeant et en améliorant leur
environnement et leur collectivité. Our Values — Promote Environmental Health & BiodiversityAtlantic Canada is faced with some very serious environmental challenges.

There is an unhealthy focus on monoculture in agriculture and forestry


Natural resources are being exploited and forests are being destroyed

There is widespread use of chemical fertilizers, pesticides and herbicides
We believe that a healthy, vibrant environment and a healthy economy are not mutually exclusive. We want to realize the incredible diversity available to us in the fields and forests of Atlantic Canada. By introducing forest farming and wild-crafting as viable alternatives to current forestry practices, we will protect our natural resources. By using only natural and sustainable agricultural and wild-crafting practices we can ensure a healthy environment for generations to come.
Nos valeurs -
Promouvoir la biodiversité et un environnement sain
Notre province est confrontée à de sérieux défis en matière
d’environnement :


Une concentration particulièrement malsaine sur la
monoculture dans les secteurs de l’agriculture et de la sylviculture


Des ressources naturelles mal exploitées et des forêts détruites


L’utilisation répandue d'engrais chimique, de pesticides
et d'herbicides


Nous croyons qu’un milieu naturel en santé et bien en vie n’est
pas incompatible avec une économie prospère et saine.
Nous voulons miser sur l'incroyable biodiversité qui est disponible
dans nos terres et forêts de l’Est du Canada. 
En développant l’agroforesterie et en utilisant les plantes cueillies
dans la nature comme approche alternative et durable aux méthodes
d’exploitation actuelles, nous allons protéger nos ressources naturelles.  En ayant recours qu’à des pratiques agricoles naturelles
et durables, dont la cueillette de plantes dans la nature, nous sommes en
mesure d’assurer un environnement sain pour les générations à venir.Other Ways You Can HelpWe know that finances are tight for lots of our friends. But even if you can't give us money (or you can't give as much as you would like to) that doesn't mean you can't help: 

We know from initial research that there is a great market for our products, but we need your help to get the word out. We choose to put our money into high quality materials rather than facebook ads. Show us that we made the right choice by telling your friends about us and our campaign.


We would really appreciate it if you'd use the Indiegogo share tools to let the world know you support us!


D'autres façons de
contribuer
Nous reconnaissons que pour plusieurs d’entre vous, les
moyens financiers peuvent être limités. 
Malgré tout, même si vous n’êtes pas en mesure de contribuer
monétairement (ou de contribuer autant que vous les souhaiteriez), sachez que
vous pouvez nous aider d’autres façons.Nos premières études démontrent qu’il y a un marché
extraordinaire pour nos produits et nous avons besoin de votre précieuse et
généreuse aide pour diffuser notre message. 
Par exemple, nous choisissons d’investir notre argent dans la production
de produits de haute qualité plutôt que dans des publicités Facebook.  Faites-nous la preuve que nous avons fait le
bon choix en diffusant notre campagne de financement participatif.  Nous vous en saurions très reconnaissants.Bref, utilisez les outils de partage sur Indiegogo ou dans
vos médias sociaux favoris pour exprimer votre appui à notre projet !Will you join us in making something wonderful?

story:
Welcome to Trust Nanny.

And what exactly is Trust Nanny you might ask?

It’s an on demand babysitting service in the form of a smart phone app, where with the push of a button, a certified, background checked and fully capable sitter will arrive at your home in no time to take care of your loved ones.

(Customer Interface)

Much like other on demand services, the service providers will be independent contractors who will form a commercial partnership with Trust Nanny, one providing the service, the other, the platform. Therefore nannies will determine their own schedules and working hours.

(Nanny Interface)


Check out the survey we conducted where 36.3% of voters agree that at some point they would be interested in said services
Trust Nanny on demand babysitting acceptance survey

Also, please feel free to access both customer and nanny wireframe interface so you can experience and get to know how the app will look like.
Customer Wireframe
Nanny Wireframe

There are two ways to use Trust Nanny and book a service


Schedule Nanny

Use this option when you want to schedule a service for a determined date

State date and time for scheduled appointment

State address for scheduled appointment (map)

Choose time-lapse for set appointment


Choose care receivers (new or previously saved)


State care receivers' special needs and schedules, if any
The app will determine the number and type of nannies needed based on number of children, age range, and special needs.

                                                                                                                                      

Please keep in mind Trust Nanny's algorithm will always throw the most convenient (economic) result based on care receiver characteristics, always looking to client's  best interest. You can always upgrade experience (say 1 nanny per care receiver), but you can never downgrade service since we cannot expose quality and care receiver safety.

The app will also determine the type of nanny needed 

There are three types of nannies

Basic: less than 2 years’ experience; can take care of children 4 years old and up.

Professional: more than 2 years’ experience; can take care of new born babies and up.

Medical: more than 2 years’ experience; can take care of anyone (including special needs and adults) (has nursing experience)

Note: all Trust Nanny Babysitters are certified in CPR/first aid training.


                        

In this case, a Basic Nanny is more than enough to take care of provided care receivers, but as we explained earlier, you can upgrade for a higher fee.



                         

In this case, only professional and medical are available (perhaps a new born is involved in the mix)You will be provided with a list of all nannies that meet the minimum requirements for said care receiver(s). 


   


User can look at nanny’s profile (personal info, experience, screening results, user ratings, CPR/first aid certificates)

User must choose which nanny or nannies to send invitation to.

User may send invitation to many nannies, or can look up for a specific nanny

Scheduling sends push notifications to the selected nannies, whichever responds first will be confirmed to perform the service on the established date.



Urgent Nanny

Use this option when an emergency arises and you need the service ASAP

State address for scheduled appointment (map)

Choose care receivers (new or previously saved)

You will be provided with a list of all online (immediately available) nannies that meet the minimum requirements for said care receiver(s). They will be sorted by ETA.


(from this point on, process is fairly similar to Schedule Nanny)


User may send invitation to many nannies.

This sends push notifications to the selected nannies; whoever responds first will be confirmed to perform the service and must be on user doorstep as soon as possible (as stated by their ETA)


Actual Appointment

A nanny from Trust Nanny should appear on your doorstep at the precise time you requested. Nannies must identify themselves.

At that moment, nanny will start service timer, user must confirm.

Show nanny the premises and give them precise instructions

You can leave knowing your loved ones will be safe with Trust Nanny.

During service, both chats and live feed (video) are available for you to check on your loved ones at any time you deem fit.




On your return, as soon as you make visual contact, nanny must stop service timer.

Nanny will then inform you of any events you should know of, and leave the premises.

The total cost of service will appear on screen, where it will be automatically deducted to your previously provided credit card


A small survey will appear in your app where you’ll rate your nanny according to service satisfaction


Screening process

Needless to say, the Nanny screening process will be hard and arduous, it will consist of:

  •  ON LINE INTERVIEW
  •  PSYCHOLOGICAL TEST
  • RESUME CHECK
  • DRUG TEST
  • BACKGROUND CHECK
  • CPR and FirstAid Certification

Only applicants with perfect scores will make the cut.


What we need from you

Yeah, we kind of need $55,672.00 USD to develop the app
If you don't believe us, here's the link to the actual contract proposal
Contract between Socomo and Trust Nanny


Coverage and Kickoff

Our coverage will kickoff in the state of Texas, where we expect a considerable amount of members to join in the first weeks after app goes online. From there, we'll start expansion throughout the whole US territory 

    

We should kickoff operations in the major cities of Texas by the first days of December (2016), and from there start expansion plans.

Please support our cause, we believe this app will help many people in their everyday lives.

If you can't support us, please share with your family and friends, we're sure more than one will find the idea really interesting.



                                 


“Trust Nanny, you can trust us with your most beloved possession.”

story:
Short Summary

Help me get to the Online News Association conference in Denver, Colorado this September so I can meet the people who can help support us to make tools for journalists in Georgia, our small, Caucasian country.

In 2014, our team at JumpStart created a simple tool to enable us to create modern, media-rich stories without having to code each one. StoryBuilder, built on our own dime to meet a local Georgian demand with an open-source and free solution, is now serving hundreds of journalists all over the world in over 16 languages. We built it for ourselves and have received a lot of positive, albeit critical feedback from StoryBuilder users that have their own needs. We'd like to meet their needs and improve the tool.

What We Need

What I need is 2,000 USD to cover:
  • membership: $75
  • registration: $549
  • flight costs. $1376

I have already been promised lodging.

The Impact

Participation in the conference will enable me to meet the people who can support our work with ideas and funding.

Risks & Challenges

The risk is that I attend and unable convince colleagues of my cause, which I think is unlikely, but it is a possibility. That being said, any opportunity to even meet and discuss the awesome journalistic work of the JumpStart team will only be beneficial, so despite the main risk, this would really be a win-win.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to help financially, get the word out that a small organization in Tbilisi, Georgia is doing amazing journalistic and storytelling work using data, design, & technology!

StoryBuilder, built on our own dime to meet a local Georgian demand with an open-source and free solution, is now serving hundreds of journalists all over the world in over 16 languages. story:
What We Need

We need $10,000 to:

  • ​Expand our capacity to meet local demand
  • Become more energy efficient and environmentally sustainable
  • Build out a packaging area
  • Bring new products to market
   ​​ At Gro-op we put People and Planet first. We only grow veggies and herbs that are Non-Genetically Modified Organisms (GMO) with no chemical pesticides, herbicides, or fertilizers. We make our all natural fertilizers from organic waste that is created from the fish we grow for food and fun. In order to close the loop of waste to food we are going to use part of this funding to create our fish food from food scraps that would otherwise go into a landfill. We will also use the funding to switch all of our old grow lights over to energy efficient LED's that use half of the energy with double the yield!

​   We want to bring fresh local food to the greater Buffalo area in New York State with the smallest toll on the planet as possible. As we grow we will use only renewable energy to produce our fruits and veggies but we need to sell more products to be able to afford solar panels and local wind co-ops. We need to expand our production capacity to reach the level of revenue that will enable us to go off the grid. A portion of this funding will provide us more grow towers so we can reach our renewable dreams .

​   The ability to offer our own packaged products with our brand on them is the next step to entering into new markets that will grow our business. We will also use this funding to build out a certified packaging area where we can take our business to the next level!

The Worker Owners

Gro-op was founded by Mike Zak, a social and environmental justice advocate who has spent most of his life fighting for a more equitable society and a well respected planet. Mike has spent the last 15 years working on campaigns ranging from Toxic Pesticide Prevention to the Fight for $15 Minimum Wage to Universal Heath-Care and has a learned from each endeavor. With Mike's experience running an Eco-Friendly Contracting business for 12 years he decided to start a Worker Owned Vertical Farm to combine the ideas of workers rights and eco-friendly practices into a unified movement that changes the way we think about food while creating careers with a purpose.  

Josh Miller has been feeding friends and family with vegetables grown in hydroponics systems he built since high school. He has worked in the culinary industry as a chef for several years which inspired him to grow the highest quality produce to replace the current sub-par status quo. In 2012 he opened a business selling fresh micro-greens, herbs and lettuces to local restaurants.  Now he's focused on growing organic and utilizing Aquaponics systems to provide the freshest local food for our Western New York community.

Mike and Josh think that the workers who put their heart and soul into making the best products possible deserve to share in the profits while having democratic control of their business and livelihood. They made Gro-op a Worker Owned Cooperative because people are more productive when they all benefit equally and have a stake in their careers. They hope to hire more Worker Owners in the near future as they increase their revenue so they can spread the democracy at work revolution - 1 Person : 1 Vote.

The Impact

Buffalo and Western New York import approximately $150 million annually of green produce from outside the local area during the spring, fall and winter months.  Most of this produce comes from traditional warm climate growers in areas such as Arizona, California, Florida and Mexico. The types of conventional farming methods that are presently being used are destroying our soil, water, and animal habitat. Additionally, the human global population is increasing, and is predicted to expand from 7.0 billion to 9.5 billion people within the next 40 years.  A parallel increase in the demand for food is needed, and estimates claim that food production will need to be doubled in order to compensate.  Coupled with rising fresh water scarcity and climate change, an alternative food production model is necessary to keep agriculture an economically and environmentally viable industry.

Gro-op is implementing a new solution to local food scarcity by operating as a hybrid business model where related business types join to create a sustainable alternative to conventional agricultural practices. The combined resources of this business allow us to grow fresh produce year round in the temperate climate of Buffalo, NY. By employing Controlled Environment Agriculture (CEA), we will forever change the local food production market. This highly lucrative model will attract a new generation to farming in a climate of steadily declining small family owned farms. 

We can create measurable results for our planet by growing aquaponically. This type of growing method uses 90% less water and 80% less nutrients than conventional agricultural practices to achieve the same yield in a quarter of the space. This method also enables us to grow in the vast empty manufacturing buildings that cover our rust belt home. We are using this cocept to re-purpose our old vacant industrial buildings to create democratic careers that help solve our impending food and environmental crisis.

Other Ways to Help

Even if you can't afford to donate please help us spread the word by sharing our Indiegogo link on social media or email. Tell a friend or family member how they can help or if you live in Western New York ask your local food supplier to carry our products. Keep in touch and like or follow us on Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter. Thanks for all of your help in starting the urban food r[e]volution!

story:
My name is Rebecca Powazek, owner, and head baker at Bee’s Cakes in Portland, Oregon.

I started making cakes and baked goods for my family and friends in the early 2000’s, watching my little hobby grow into something people started talking about. Over time, baking for other people and watching them smile became something I found I love. Throughout high school, I continued to bake and spend time in the kitchen with my parents as much as possible. In 2010, I started my at-home business, Bee’s Custom Cakes. I began creating  small buttercream cakes for people, and by word of mouth and social media, I started to get a feel for what Bee’s Cakes could really be.

In 2012, I made the decision to further my education in the industry, and graduated from San Diego Culinary Institute with a degree in Baking & Pastry. I learned French pastries, breads, cakes, cookies, candy, and even sugar work! 

I then moved to Seattle, where I did an internship at Bakery Nouveau, learning classic French techniques and bakery basics. From there, I decided that cake decorating was the way I wanted to go. I solidified my skills as a cake decorator while working at  Whole Foods in Seattle for 3 years.

In 2015 I moved to Portland Oregon, where I took a small hiatus from being a full time Pastry Chef, and worked for a conservative Jewish youth group. On the side I began the process of expanding Bee’s Cakes to the next level. I started meeting new people, giving everyone I possibly could samples of my creations, along with my business card.

In January 2016, I quit my job at the youth group, and started working as the Pastry Chef of the Multnomah Whiskey Library where I made a bi-weekly menu of desserts that revolved around fresh and local ingredients.

Bee’s Cakes began to get so busy with orders, I decided to start working for myself full time.

From there things just started to boom.

For the past 7 years I have been working hard to make my dream of a small bakery a reality, and I am so happy it is finally here. I am eager to bring fresh, local and unique pastries to Portland.

Bee’s Cakes is an innovative, small-kitchen bakery in Portland. We’re always up for trying new things and love to make weird, delicious concoctions with beautiful decoration to keep ‘em guessing. Our mission is to reinvent the way people think about cakes and sweets, as well as allowing us to shake up their taste buds. We strive to introduce new products that can be enjoyed by people of all ages.While working with local markets, florists, farms and businesses, we will be keeping a sense of community in everything we do. We are committed to having efficient, respectful employees who conduct themselves with the utmost integrity and respect. Bee’s Cakes will be a beautiful, comfortable and welcoming space for all.


 

Making quality custom cakes, desserts and sweets, Bee’s is best described as elevated comfort food, with a sense of the familiar and a touch of discovery. With skilled bakers and decorators, we’ve raised the bar for locally made cakes. In our hopeful new location, we will be offering sweets such as cakes, tarts, brownies and cookies. In addition we will be adding breakfast pastries and an espresso bar!

Our dream is to bring a bakery to Portland that can make your cake dreams come true. We want to make a place that is warm and inviting with amazing customer service, allowing our guests to feel important and cared for. We envision creating a special community gathering space, to connect over good food and drink and good people.

After 7 years as an in-house operation, we’re hoping to open our business inside an Airstream trailer located in a local food cart villa in early spring!  We found a perfect spot, where we can grow as a business and have a store front where people can come in and enjoy pastries and coffee!   (See the picture below to see what an Airstream trailer looks like!)

We pride ourselves on using local ingredients. We’re already scheming and dreaming with other awesome local businesses, and we can’t wait to move into a space where we can only further our outreach!  We also will be working with Longbottom Coffee and Tea to bring excellent, local coffee to our community.

. I cannot wait to show people what I can do and prove that you can get quality baked goods, drinks, and fabulous customer service all in one place!

We’re nearly ready, and we want you to join us in making Bee’s Cakes a reality. With your support we can bring our dream to life!  Our business plan is complete, our possible location is locked in, and our website [www.beescustomcakes.com]  up and functioning!!!!

With your support we will be able to purchase our Airstream trailer and make the necessary updates needed, as well as purchasing our espresso and coffee equipment! 

In the perks you will notice two different Categories, PDX and Not Local. If you are going to be able to come into the bakery to get your reward, please feel free to choose the PDX option. However, if you are out of Portland, we do have an option for perks for those out of towners!

If you are receiving a perk with food, please send any allergies to Rebecca.Beescakes@gmail.com, all custom cakes must be ordered with a two week notice! 

Thank you all for taking the time to visit this page, and even consider donating! We look forward to sharing Bee's Cakes with Portland!!

story:
Heavy Metal Playground and Making a Difference 

Hi! My name is Mark Stevanus and I am owner and operator of Heavy Metal Playground. Heavy Metal Playground is unique place where people can come and do something they have always want to do...play on heavy equipment! We launched this business as an entertainment venue but found out that there was so much more that we could to do to help people and give back to the community. Partnering with local educational institutes, we have developed certified training classes for heavy equipment. This is a much needed opportunity for people that want to learn a skill and have a better chance of getting a job. And with your help, we will be able to put people through classes to give them that chance. 

By contributing to our cause we will be able to use the funds to broaden our reach to individuals, provide training and skills and give them an opportunity to pursue a career in the construction field. Many people cannot afford college or continuing education classes and we want to help these motivated individuals. A career in the construction field is a growing need. We can help better the chances of job placements for many people.

We also will be working with local groups and non-profits to find the right individuals that need a chance to succeed.

What You Get

We developed some fun perks including shout outs, t-shirts, Heavy Metal Playground coffee and kick butt party at our Playground. Plus you can contribute to pay for motivated individuals to become certified in heavy equipment training.

If We Do or Don't Reach Our Goal

All funds, whether we reach or goal or not, will be used for class and materials, marketing and to pay for students to become certified in heavy equipment training. We want to pay for all expenses for as many people as possible.

Please Help Any Way You Can

Any amount of funding will make a difference but you can also help by getting the word out about our campaign. Please share any way you can!

story:
I’m Israa Hilles. I am Palestinian, but I was born and raised in the United Arab Emirates. At the age of 18, my family and I returned home. There, I witnessed three consecutive wars. I experienced unimaginable terrifying moments, yet I was luckier than many others as I worked for the USAID. This provided me with the opportunity to join a US international training program for entrepreneurship. Lucky me!

A year after my arrival to Montreal with no luck in finding a job, I decided to follow most of the new immigrants path. I followed my passion and started working on an idea for developing a co-working space that is affordable and accessible for other freelancers like me who struggle to find a space that they can call ‘office’! I’m proud to say that because of this space idea, I won two competitions; the first one Osentreprende Quebec, and the second competition is the entrepreneur of the year 2018 across Canada.

My mission in creating such a space aims at bringing a community of entrepreneurs together through networking, communication and collaboration. Without family here in Montreal and young woman, single and without a strong knowledge of the French language, I’m so proud to say that in one year, I have created a great space.

The main challenge I have now is to move my business to the next level. I would like to enhance my marketing strategies, hire one new staff and create a new product to add event hosting to my services. I need about $60,000 to make that possible.

Your generous support will help me to move forward with this mission to ensure the greatest community impact and contribution.

story:
OSO COFFEE CO.

OSO Coffee Co. is a new coffee shop that is so close to officially opening it's doors in Houston's East End, aka 2nd Ward or Eado. This area of town is on the immediate East side of Downtown.  We began build out in the Summer of 2019 and have completed about 85% of build out and construction.

We had hoped to be completed and ready to open our doors by the Fall of 2020, but Covid-19 put a halt to a lot of shop progress and funding.  This Indiegogo Campaign, is our effort to make up for the remaining funding, asking friends, family, and the community for any help or donations.  Donations will help OSO with the following:

  • Final build out of prep-kitchen and other minor repairs to the house
  • Kitchen plumbing & grease trap installation
  • Kitchen fixtures, 3 compartment sink, hand wash sink
  • Commercial Fridge and Ice machine
  • Misc Kitchen equipment
  • Misc shop furniture, i.e. custom bar height table & chairs, retail fixtures, custom patio furniture / lounge furniture
  • (2) Commercial Espresso Grinders.  Mahlkonig K30 grinder
  • (1) Commercial batch grinder.  Mahlkonig EK43
  • (1) Commercial Dual Coffee Brewer.  Fetco CBS-2132 XTS Twin
  • 2 Group Espresso Machine (La Marzocco Linea PB, Victoria White Eagle, or La Marzocco GB5)
  • 3 - 4 months of operating capital
  • Various occupancy & city permits

OSO Coffee Co. is located at 2603 Navigation in Houston. The shop's founder, Hector Garcia, named the shop after his mom, Yolanda, who's nickname is "Oso".  Oso means "bear" or "mama bear" in Spanish. As the oldest of 4 sisters, she helped raise them all, and this shop is being built in her honor.  Yolanda turns 82 years old October 31st, 2020 and we plan on revealing the shop to her before this date.

 

WHAT DOES "OSO" MEAN?

"OSO" is the Spanish word for "bear" or in this case "mama bear".  It's the nickname of the Founder's mother, Maria Yolanda Garcia, who will be celebrate her 82nd birthday on October 31, 2020.  Yolanda is the oldest of 11 brothers and sisters and has always been the matriarch of the family.  She was forced to become the "mama bear" at an early age, to care and watch over her baby sisters and brothers after their mother left them with an aunt.

To this day, her nickname has been "Oso" and this coffee shop is built in her honor.  She isn't aware of the shop yet and our plan is to surprise her with a shop reveal before her October 31st birthday.  Pics and video of that reveal will come soon.

 

HOW MUCH DOES OSO NEED?

Our fundraising goal for this campaign is $60,000. 

This is a conservative number, but it helps cover everything listed above and gives us a little "cushion" for the first 2 months of operation. 

Our largest perk is set at $5,000 and if you'd like to contribute more than that, please contact us and we can discuss and provide more information. 

 

THE PERKS

We have created a variety of perks that reward a wide range of donation amounts.  Whether you donate $25 or $500, you will see that each perk has been carefully curated to represent your donation amount. 

Note that the OSO perks are not "equal trades" for each dollar amount, but we show our appreciation by providing more collateral as the donation amounts increase.

 

SPONSOR SPECIFIC ITEMS

In addition to OSO Perks, we have provided a few items in the list as specific pieces of equipment that you can sponsor.  For example, if you'd like to provide the funds needed to purchase one of the grinders or brewers on our list, you can choose that option in our list of perks. 

We won't have every item listed as a "sponsorship" item, but if you'd like to know what other specific needs we have, please contact us at info@oso.coffee.

 

OSO'S IMPACT TO THE COMMUNITY

Though we are not officially open for business, we have been hosting weekend "pop ups" on either Saturday or Sunday from 9am - 1pm.  These popups have allowed us to meet our neighbors, build some hype, and give visitors a sneak peak of the shop.  Every popup is packed and we can already see how busy and popular OSO Coffee shop will be. 

OSO will be the only coffee shop on Navigation Blvd, which is a several mile stretch of high traffic road between Downtown and the Ship Channel.  The shop is surrounded by a variety of restaurants and a booming neighborhood, which contribute to OSO's traffic on the weekends. There is also a Sunday morning farmers market that takes place in the Navigation esplanade, across the street from OSO, that contributes to our shop traffic.  New home develop is constantly growing and new businesses are rising up along Navigation Blvd.

 

GIVING BACK

OSO Coffee will stand out as a business that will always be giving back to the community and we'll do that through two of our biggest loves:  dogs & bikes. 

With the owner being the creator of two of Houston's largest and longest running dog festivals, DogPop and Puppies for Breakfast, OSO will continually use a portion of profits to give back to dog rescue and help homeless dogs in the various Wards that surround the shop. 

We also have a passion for cycling and anything bike friendly, so we hope to serve as a hub for the cycling community.  We will also give back to youth in the greater downtown area through our very own bike charity movement called The Byke Project, which started in 2000 and continues to date.  Through this project we provide free bike repair and new bikes to those less fortunate. 

With this said, know that your donation will go to a business that will go above and beyond simply providing food and drinks to the neighborhood.

 

WHAT DOES "OSO" MEAN?

"OSO" is the Spanish word for "bear" or in this case "mama bear".  It's the nickname of the Founder's mother, Maria Yolanda Garcia, who will be celebrate her 82nd birthday on October 31, 2020.  Yolanda is the oldest of 11 brothers and sisters and has always been the matriarch of the family.  She was forced to become the "mama bear" at an early age, to care and watch over her baby sisters and brothers after their mother left them with an aunt.

To this day, her nickname has been "Oso" and this coffee shop is built in her honor.  She isn't aware of the shop yet and our plan is to surprise her with a shop reveal before her October 31st birthday.  Pics and video of that reveal will come soon.

 

ABOUT THE FOUNDER

Hector Garcia is a Houston native and has been an active member of the community for over 25 years.  Through his love for people, animals, and cycling, Hector has always looked for ways to give back to the city through the things that he loves.  He continues to do that today and is now adding coffee to his list of passions.

Hector developed his passion for coffee after being surrounded by other enthusiasts, roasters, baristas, and other coffee shop owners.  He immersed himself into the industry several years ago and in the process of working on a bike shop / coffee concept, he discovered the little bungalow on Navigation Blvd.  This little space birthed the idea for OSO Coffee and Hector still has future plans to launch the BykeShop Coffee concept.

As mentioned, Hector has worked to give back to this city that he loves through his passions and he's created a variety of memorable brands and events in the process.  Below are a list of accomplishments and passion projects:

PUPPIES FOR BREAKFAST:  Houston's largest and longest running dog festivals, created in 2010.  Will celebrate 10 years in the Spring of 2021. 

DOGPOP:  the little brother dog fest to Puppies for Breakfast.  DogPop has quickly grown to be Houston's second largest dog festival, each giving back to dog rescue and dog charities in Houston.

HTX BIKE FEST:  Houston's only bicycle festival, created in 2012 with cycling partner Cisco Nira.  This bike fest has been the city's largest bicycle festival, making its run from 2012 - 2016.  This event was designed and created to bring the cycling community together and give back through the industry.

THE BYKE PROJECT:  In 2000, Hector and friends created this charitable project as a way to give back to low income areas of the city through free bike repair and new bike donations.  The project continues to date and OSO coffee will give back through this project once officially open.
story_txt:
OSO COFFEE CO.
OSO Coffee Co. is a new coffee shop that is so close to officially opening it's doors in Houston's East End, aka 2nd Ward or Eado. This area of town is on the immediate East side of Downtown.  We began build out in the Summer of 2019 and have completed about 85% of build out and construction.
We had hoped to be completed and ready to open our doors by the Fall of 2020, but Covid-19 put a halt to a lot of shop progress and funding.  This Indiegogo Campaign, is our effort to make up for the remaining funding, asking friends, family, and the community for any help or donations.  Donations will help OSO with the following:

Final build out of prep-kitchen and other minor repairs to the house
Kitchen plumbing & grease trap installation
Kitchen fixtures, 3 compartment sink, hand wash sink
Commercial Fridge and Ice machine
Misc Kitchen equipment
Misc shop furniture, i.e. custom bar height table & chairs, retail fixtures, custom patio furniture / lounge furniture
(2) Commercial Espresso Grinders.  Mahlkonig K30 grinder
(1) Commercial batch grinder.  Mahlkonig EK43
(1) Commercial Dual Coffee Brewer.  Fetco CBS-2132 XTS Twin
2 Group Espresso Machine (La Marzocco Linea PB, Victoria White Eagle, or La Marzocco GB5)
3 - 4 months of operating capital
Various occupancy & city permits

story:
Is your dog your best friend? Your furbaby? The source of unconditional love when you come home? What would you do for him or her? Almost anything I bet.

  • Do you find no availability when you need daycare?  
  • Have to book a grooming appt weeks in advance?  
  • Waiting endlessly at pick up or to check in?
  • Need to book Christmas boarding in July?

I’ve used most of the services around town and finding them lacking so I decided to start The DUNCAN Dog Hotel & Day Spa.

What is The DUNCAN?

Hey there! I’m Tucker Gallagher, neighbor, entrepreneur, volunteer and dog parent. I’ve lived in DC for 15 years and have seen the city change dramatically. As the neighborhoods grow, I see residents investing in schools for their children and dog parks for their loyal companions, but there is a lack of reliable services for dog parents.

Six years ago, I started a liquor store because I was sick of overpaying for liquor in crappy, bulletproof stores. G&G Fine Spirits focused on great service in a pleasant space and allowing customers to bring their dog in during their evening walks. That is where I came up with The DUNCAN.

The DUNCAN wants to upgrade customer service for pet care. By meeting you curbside when you drop off your dog, giving an option of texting your arrival time, and hiring more staff at pick up and drop off, we want to cut wait times and have your friend ready and waiting for you. We promise all this while ensuring your buddy has a safe and pleasant stay with us.

What is the Day Spa?

Fido need a bath? Clean Puppies to the rescue! Toyia Robinson has been grooming dogs out of people’s homes for 5 years. She has a special touch with even the most difficult dog. She and her team are ready to help you with a basic wash & cut but also nail clipping, teeth brushing and other routine services - all with a sharp bowtie or bow.

Why are you raising money?

We want YOU to be part of the experience. We are looking to raise $15,000 to help us create a first class facility for your pet. With the money we raise with Indiegogo, we will buy:

  • $6,500 - Comprehensive Video Monitoring system - Our cameras will be online 24hrs a day monitoring play and keeping your pet safe. We’ll have 12 cameras and a 2 week database so we can look up issues.
  • $5,000 - IT Equipment – We want to purchase scanners to check in your pet at the curb and save you time. iPads to take pictures throughout the day and send them to you! Plus an online customer portal allowing you to make reservations, pay your bill, add vaccination reports and make notes for the care of your buddy.
  • $3500 – Dog Bedding and Play Equipment – We want the best blocks and ramps for your dog to play on. Then when it’s time for a nap, we want top of the line beds for that mid-afternoon nap.

What do I get?

In exchange for your support, we want to give you the chance to try out The DUNCAN’s services at a discount. All our packages offer DUNCAN services at 10-20% off our opening rates plus a cool T-shirt!*

  • For $25 you will receive our DUNCAN t-shirts with the classic quote by Harry Truman “If you want a friend in Washington, get a dog.”
  • For $40 you can receive our DUNCAN t-shirts by Christmas (Dec 20 pick up in DC)
  • For $50 get a t-shirt and a day of daycare
  • For $70 get one night of boarding plus a t-shirt
  • For $80 get a free grooming appointment and t-shirt
  • For $150 get 3 nights of boarding and a t-shirt
  • For $350 get 7 nights of boarding and a t-shirt
  • For $425 get 7 nights boarding in one of our deluxe suites and a t-shirt
  • For $500 get 7 nights boarding in one of deluxe suites over a holiday period (reservation required)
  • For $1000 The Last Minute Traveler Package – We offer 10 nights boarding with no reservation even if we are booked, suite upgrade, pick up and drop off at your home or office in the District plus 2 tshirts.

* - Limit 5 per customer. To redeem, you must have evidence that your dog is up to date on all his vaccinations. All Indiegogo gifts will be redeemable in the first three months. After 3 months Indiegogo purchases are redeemable up to 50% of Duncan daily capacity. All Indiegogo gifts expire 1 year from opening.

How will you succeed?

With help from you! There are over 2500 apartments within 2 blocks of our location at 22 M Street NE. Anecdotally we know 40% of the residents have a dog – that’s over 1000 dogs just in our neighborhood! We have reached out to all the buildings nearby and plan on doing more as we get closer to our opening.

We launched this Indiegogo to show our commitment to the neighborhood and allow customers to be a part of a new NoMa institution. Opening a new business can be risky but we are leveraging Indiegogo to allow customers to show their support for us and our idea. We also want to allow early supporters to benefit from discounted packages.

story:
Bringing Adventure Back To The South Coast

We are a family business based on the Isle of Wight with a vision.

We want to bring adventure back to the South Coast of England in a way that celebrates our maritime history whilst having a serious amount of fun. Since they began Pirates have been romanticised by the media, full of swashbuckling renegades and daring rogues. Life full of adventure on the high seas called many to the horizon, ports were full of beautiful ships, crowds bustled with energy on every dock. It was a site to behold, infectious to anyone who saw it and those who were stuck on land often dreamed of a life full of sun, sea and treasure.

It is a notion that has stuck with us throughout history and why Pirate tales are still widely enjoyed to this day.

Wouldn’t it be wonderful to be able to experience it? To stop dreaming and start living?
That’s what we want to offer, and together we have a great team to do just that.

About Us

From Left to Right: Vicki Hunter, Laurenson Hunter, Alastair Hunter's Hat, Alastair Hunter and Helen Hunter 

Vicki Hunter

Project Manager and Most Organised Wench
Vicki looks after the events and day to day management of our online pirate shoppe and service offerings. Give her coffee and things get done. She is the most organised of all of the Professional Pirates.

Laurenson Hunter

In Charge of Cunning Plans
Loz ‘BOOM’ Hunter adds excitement to our pirate adventures and creates our LARP experiences. He also designs and produces some of our amazing pirate merchandise. Keep an eye out for our desktop Nerf Canon, soon to be available in our shoppe.

Alastair Hunter

In Charge of Making Things Float
Alastair is the cleverest pirate. He has a degree as a Naval Architect of Ship Building and is mostly responsible for our ship builds. He also gets involved with the design and production of our more unusual and bespoke pirate merchandise.

Helen Hunter

Makes ‘Pieces of Eight’
Helen organises our team and quite frankly we all do as she says. Most importantly, she looks after our finances and makes sure we are on target to reach our fundraising milestones. The
pirate that keep us on course.

Once In A Lifetime Experience

Once on aboard you will be completely immersed into the life of an eighteenth century pirate. You will be provided with authentic costume and any other items that you will need to become the ferocious Pirate that you were born to be, it will then be time to choose your Pirate name. Learning to sail, you will be part of the crew as you fight for control of  the South Coast. You’ll be on the hunt for treasure, keeping an eye out for any enemy pirates and maybe even fighting an enemy ship with our one of a kind, environmentally friendly, paintball canons! If you decide to stay with us overnight or on an extended cruise, you can be sure of a evening full of raucous energy with good food and plenty of grog!

Our ships will have a programme of events set out over a year that you will be able to view on our website, we will be offering shore-based events, day trips, weekend cruises and extended voyages. Simply choose which one you would like to join and claim your place on your very own adventure. Nowhere else in the world can you find a pair of authentic ships with such an immersive experience. Learn to sail in a truly unique environment and if you already know how to sail, here else can you get sea miles as a pirate?! Join us and travel back into the 18th Century. Could you survive?

The History

The idea arose from a combined passion of sailing and the Live Action Role Play worlds. We live in a high speed, technology led life and these types of activities are a counterpoint to this. We wanted to create a unique blend of an historic sailing experience allied to adventure and escapism. There is a certain mystique regarding the golden age of sail and the adventurers of the 18th century and so this seemed like a rich vein to tap into.

We looked hard into the sort of sailing vessels that might be suitable and found the 18th century English Naval Cutters. These are small enough to be affordable, maintainable and not too ambitious in terms of finding enough clients in the early trading periods. It appears that early in 1763, at the close of the seven years war, the Admiralty took in 36 cutters of between 39 ft and 57 ft on deck. We looked for drawings of a suitable vessel that would have had 4 guns and found in the National Maritime Museum original drawings for HMC Endeavour. We have copies of the original drawings ship both before and after conversion to a Naval Cutter. These small ships were used by the smugglers as they were powerful and very fast cargo ships. The Admiralty used the same vessels for catching the smugglers. Ideal….

Above is a copy of the drawing of the cutter, ‘Endeavour’, penned in April 1763, of the ship on which we are basing our two ships. This drawing can be viewed in the National Maritime Museum in Greenwich, London. This was one of some 36 vessels taken into the service by the Admiralty to combat the rampant smuggling taking place along the South Coast. Many of these vessels were captured Smuggling ships! She had a crew of 24 and was armed with four 3lb cannon, six 1/2lb swivel guns as well as the hand guns etc used when boarding. We aim to faithfully replicate the rig and armoury as well as the living conditions experienced by eighteenth century seafarers. However, we can only take up to twelve of you at once per vessel, so good luck!

Our Plan

We intend to build the hulls in steel but with ‘lapstrake’ to make them look correct. From the main deck upwards we will re-create the vessels with timber. Laid timber decks, timber bulwarks, timber spars and so on. Any modern equipment will be carefully placed so as not to spoil the experience. She will have four 3lb guns which are designed to fire paintballs. The operation of these will simulate the way in which the originals would have been loaded and fired. Initially this will be in the form of ‘canister’ shot i.e. 12 conventional paintballs fired in unison. We intend to develop canon ball sized paintballs but this will follow on at a later date. Each vessel will carry two ‘Yawles’ which are correct period replica sailing-pulling boats. This will enlarge the activity repertoire.

You will note that we will carry up to 12 paying ‘Pirates’ and each vessel will have two qualified professional crew to manage the ships and organise the gameplay. With two ships we will have a third crew in rotation to allow for rest periods. We will be able to operate the vessels with smaller numbers from four paying Pirates upwards, however this will restrict the type of activities possible. The Business Plan is based on a 50% utilisation to cover Capital, Interest and all operating costs.

Our goal of £750,000 will cover the cost of developing and building one our ships and getting her in the water. Once operational, your experience will cost from £175 per person per day, all inclusive.

Once the build has begun we estimate that it will take approximately a year before she will be ready to engage the enemy.

All monies raised, even if we fall short of, or exceed our goal, will go into the business and towards the ambition of seeing magnificent Pirate vessels dominating the South Coast once again.

 

Boom!

The canons. Oh, the canons! Based on the 3 pound canons commonly used on vessels of this size. These things could pack a punch! But don’t worry, no one will get hurt with ours, because they’re going to fire paintballs, (initially this will be in the form of ‘grapeshot). Designed to be environmentally friendly so there is no impact on ocean life, you’ll be taught how to safely fire a real-life canon. Plus…. Wait for it…… you’ll be firing them AT the other ship! Now there is no better way to relieve stress than firing a paintball canon, at an enemy ship! But don’t forget…. They’ll be firing back…so pick your crew wisely.

We Just Need You!
