Most importantly, she looks after our finances and makes sure we are on target to reach our fundraising milestones. Thepirate that keep us on course.Once In A Lifetime ExperienceOnce on aboard you will be completely immersed into the life of an eighteenth century pirate. You will be provided with authentic costume and any other items that you will need to become the ferocious Pirate that you were born to be, it will then be time to choose your Pirate name. Learning to sail, you will be part of the crew as you fight for control of  the South Coast. You’ll be on the hunt for treasure, keeping an eye out for any enemy pirates and maybe even fighting an enemy ship with our one of a kind, environmentally friendly, paintball canons! If you decide to stay with us overnight or on an extended cruise, you can be sure of a evening full of raucous energy with good food and plenty of grog!Our ships will have a programme of events set out over a year that you will be able to view on our website, we will be offering shore-based events, day trips, weekend cruises and extended voyages. Simply choose which one you would like to join and claim your place on your very own adventure. Nowhere else in the world can you find a pair of authentic ships with such an immersive experience. Learn to sail in a truly unique environment and if you already know how to sail, here else can you get sea miles as a pirate?! Join us and travel back into the 18th Century. Could you survive?The HistoryThe idea arose from a combined passion of sailing and the Live Action Role Play worlds. We live in a high speed, technology led life and these types of activities are a counterpoint to this. We wanted to create a unique blend of an historic sailing experience allied to adventure and escapism. There is a certain mystique regarding the golden age of sail and the adventurers of the 18th century and so this seemed like a rich vein to tap into.We looked hard into the sort of sailing vessels that might be suitable and found the 18th century English Naval Cutters. These are small enough to be affordable, maintainable and not too ambitious in terms of finding enough clients in the early trading periods. It appears that early in 1763, at the close of the seven years war, the Admiralty took in 36 cutters of between 39 ft and 57 ft on deck. We looked for drawings of a suitable vessel that would have had 4 guns and found in the National Maritime Museum original drawings for HMC Endeavour. We have copies of the original drawings ship both before and after conversion to a Naval Cutter. These small ships were used by the smugglers as they were powerful and very fast cargo ships. The Admiralty used the same vessels for catching the smugglers. Ideal….Above is a copy of the drawing of the cutter, ‘Endeavour’, penned in April 1763, of the ship on which we are basing our two ships. This drawing can be viewed in the National Maritime Museum in Greenwich, London. This was one of some 36 vessels taken into the service by the Admiralty to combat the rampant smuggling taking place along the South Coast. Many of these vessels were captured Smuggling ships! She had a crew of 24 and was armed with four 3lb cannon, six 1/2lb swivel guns as well as the hand guns etc used when boarding. We aim to faithfully replicate the rig and armoury as well as the living conditions experienced by eighteenth century seafarers. However, we can only take up to twelve of you at once per vessel, so good luck!Our PlanWe intend to build the hulls in steel but with ‘lapstrake’ to make them look correct. From the main deck upwards we will re-create the vessels with timber. Laid timber decks, timber bulwarks, timber spars and so on. Any modern equipment will be carefully placed so as not to spoil the experience. She will have four 3lb guns which are designed to fire paintballs. The operation of these will simulate the way in which the originals would have been loaded and fired. Initially this will be in the form of ‘canister’ shot i.e. 12 conventional paintballs fired in unison. We intend to develop canon ball sized paintballs but this will follow on at a later date. Each vessel will carry two ‘Yawles’ which are correct period replica sailing-pulling boats. This will enlarge the activity repertoire.You will note that we will carry up to 12 paying ‘Pirates’ and each vessel will have two qualified professional crew to manage the ships and organise the gameplay. With two ships we will have a third crew in rotation to allow for rest periods. We will be able to operate the vessels with smaller numbers from four paying Pirates upwards, however this will restrict the type of activities possible. The Business Plan is based on a 50% utilisation to cover Capital, Interest and all operating costs.Our goal of £750,000 will cover the cost of developing and building one our ships and getting her in the water. Once operational, your experience will cost from £175 per person per day, all inclusive.Once the build has begun we estimate that it will take approximately a year before she will be ready to engage the enemy.All monies raised, even if we fall short of, or exceed our goal, will go into the business and towards the ambition of seeing magnificent Pirate vessels dominating the South Coast once again. Boom!The canons. Oh, the canons! Based on the 3 pound canons commonly used on vessels of this size. These things could pack a punch! But don’t worry, no one will get hurt with ours, because they’re going to fire paintballs, (initially this will be in the form of ‘grapeshot). Designed to be environmentally friendly so there is no impact on ocean life, you’ll be taught how to safely fire a real-life canon. Plus…. Wait for it…… you’ll be firing them AT the other ship! Now there is no better way to relieve stress than firing a paintball canon, at an enemy ship! But don’t forget…. They’ll be firing back…so pick your crew wisely.We Just Need You!

story:
:: EDITED WITH UPDATED AGENDA :: 

Our Small Business doesn't have the margins to keep wages up during impending closures due to the COVID-19 Health Crisis, especially after catering cancellations & lost contracts due to the pandemic (So far, 10s of thousands/mo for the unforeseeable future) 
Currently, we are trying to keep everyone (who feels comfortable) working (at super-high sanitation/social standards), reserving everything we can towards supplementing lost wages. We aren't keeping anyone tightly obligated to their shifts if they aren't comfortable, and doctoring up obtainable immediate relief support-plans for our community. 

Our concerns run wide, and 40 people deep. Your continued support is invaluable. 

Thank you

 

>>> The following is still in our future, but taking a backseat to the current emergent need of our  treasured service industry professionals.

Our Story

Wakin' Bakin' is a uniquely-classic breakfast restaurant with 2 locations & a lil' sister restaurant in New Orleans. Family owned & operated, founded in 2010. 

Founder Conrad Chura stumbled into passion for the restaurant industry and set out to fill a neighborhood need for fresh, quality breakfast. He and friends saved tip money from their cooking jobs to cover start-up costs, pooled resources, and managed to thrive as a delivery only "pop-up” restaurant in various shared kitchens before finding their Midcity home  in 2012. In 2015, we were welcomed into The Holy Ground Irish Pub where we opened our sister restaurant, Mother Mary’s, serving late-night pub grub. In 2018 Wakin’ Bakin’ had the opportunity to expand to Uptown New Orleans! 

Our mission to provide fresh, delicious food in a sunny & relaxed environment would not be possible without the support of the people on our team. We currently employ around 35 people across all three locations. We are working to re-organize our family-owned & operated business to open-up ownership opportunities for some of the priceless members of our team. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is $250,000 in funding to improve business branding and health in pursuit of our goals. We are working to finance the legal & accounting expenses necessary for proper re-organization, and invest in quality-of-life upgrades for all employees, such as health insurance, sick leave, and an Emergency PTO reserve. 

One of the reasons we chose Indiegogo as our platform for Wakin’ Bakin’, is that we can offer some genuinely unique perks; our biggest are different event services we can offer utilizing our restaurant space to its fullest including event space rental &  one-of-a-kind Mardi Gras Parade Packages! 

 

Where the Funds Will Go if We Don't Reach Our Entire Goal

First, we’ll fill all appropriate merchandise and event commitments. Next, we would complete the transition to our newly designed logo ordering branded merchandise for staff and retail (all proceeds will be re-invested!), (finally!) completing the signage upgrade, and a website facelift. While we can continue to sustain our incredibly aggressive plan to pay off debt from 2018's expansion ( back to debt free within the next year! ), with your support we could simultaneously get the legal leg-work started on our ownership offerings.  The closer we get to our goals, the more we can pursue other efforts to increase our employee-support capabilities.

 

The Impact

Wakin’ Bakin’ has grown tremendously as a local, family-owned operation. We started as a pop-up with 3 sweat-equitors, and grew over 10 years into a 3-location operation, employing around 35 people. We also thrive on local partnership. Wakin' Bakin' uses as much local product as we can get our hands on (from the honey & produce farmer, to the local tofu artisan), and use locally-owned purveyors for the rest.  We always call the neighborhood guys for maintenance and repairs, and trade with the corner mechanic to keep operations running. We believe in supporting the roots of commerce and maximizing the resources at hand. 

We’re fortunate to have the support of a dedicated network of management and long-term employees who deserve a piece of the pie. They’ve carried us through some of our hardest times, and we want to support that merit with a tangible investment that they can grow with. We value our team's time, and strive to nurture their strengths. This like minded team values healthy and progressive quality-of-life standards for the oft under-appreciated service-industry professional, and we want to fuel that fire. 

Your support means opportunity to a New Orleans service professional. Our industry's backbone tends to suffer a stressful and thankless career, often left without opportunity for growth or support in times of hardship. We do our best to support our people on a case-by case basis, but in an industry with notoriously tight margins we know that a savvy investment in their health and stability is key to strengthening our workforce.

 When the time comes, we plan to support future campaigns to sponsor the ownership of the individuals eligible for buy-in. 

 

Risks & Challenges

While opening our new location in 2018, we were faced with about $70k in unforeseen challenges, such as having to replace the entirety of a promised-functional kitchen, expensive broken pipes under the building (despite appropriate inspections!), a storage shed collapse due to termite damage, one brick thru the window (complete with missing safe), and a fair amount of heartache to follow.

As a husband & wife team with 3 restaurants and two toddlers, we’ve relied heavily on this team that has supported us tirelessly through all of the pits and valleys. There's no price tag on this level of dedication, as it can really only measure up to the manic passion of entrepreneurship. We've carried ourselves so far with so little that we know Wakin' Bakin's opportunities are endless with this talented and eclectic team, and a touch of your support. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We appreciate more than just monetary support! The time you’ve taken out of your day to read about Wakin’ Bakin’ and its hopes and dreams wasn’t for nothing. Please share!

Maybe you know someone who plans to visit New Orleans soon? Or someone who just enjoys punny word-play and the local workaholic? The more people we reach, the better chance we stand to reach our goal! 

If you're in the neighborhood, we welcome you to dine in our restaurants, pick-up some merch, and let the team know you’re rooting for ‘em!

Follow us on Facebook https://www.facebook.com/WakinBakinNOLA/

Instagram https://www.instagram.com/wakinbakin/

 and Twitter https://twitter.com/WakinBakinNOLA

story:
Somos Angie y Jacobo. Ella es francesa y él es mexicano; hemos iniciado un restaurante-galería de arte llamado La Emisora Gourmet. En la Emisora buscamos ser eco-sustentables y responsables en el espacio semi-urbano que es San Andrés Cholula, en el estado de Puebla, México. Primero creamos la parte del restaurante, en la que proponemos una combinación de comida franco-mexicana y cocina de autor, usamos productos orgánicos, locales, artesanales y que sabemos son de la mejor calidad. Tras haber puesto en marcha el restaurante decidimos que íbamos a tener una galería de arte.

En este espacio se exhibe el trabajo de diferentes artistas locales durante un periodo de 2 meses. Durante este tiempo el restaurante genera una compensación para el artista gracias a las propinas.

Cuando empezamos el proyecto, la casa entera necesitaba ser remodelada. Poco a poco hemos trabajado en la casa, a la par de abrir todos los días el restaurante. Hasta ahora hemos pintado paredes, hecho muebles y repisas, montamos una palapa con material reciclado, tiramos paredes, etc. Usamos lo que encontramos en los lugares de reciclados, lo que nos regalaron y nuestra imaginación para aprovechar al máximo los recursos que tenemos.


Necesidades

Sin embargo, ahora necesitamos ayuda extra. Pronto vamos a cumplir un año a finales de abril y queremos terminar nuestro proyecto de sistema de producción de alimentos. El sistema de producción de alimentos consiste en:

  • Un huerto en el que se sembrarán semillas y plántulas seleccionadas por su calidad.
  • Un compostero que a base de nuestros residuos vegetales produce una composta capaz de nutrir correctamente la tierra.
  • Una biopiscina cuyó ecosistema filtrará y oxigenará el agua y a su vez servirá para regar a través de un sistema de riego por goteo la huerta complementando su aporte en nutrientes y nitrógeno.

    


Cómo vamos a usar el dinero

Como meta queremos completar el ciclo y conseguir producir del 25 al 30% de nuestro consumo de vegetal en el restaurante. Ya tenemos el compostero en funcionamiento, ahora nos hace falta la huerta, la biopiscina y el sistema de riego por goteo

Para esto necesitamos:
  • Geotextil que impedirá que las raíces perforen la biopiscina.
  • Geomembrana que impedirá que el agua se filtre por los subsuelos.
  • Plantas y algas acuáticas que ayudarán a crear el ecosistema así como peces
  • Bomba sumergible con panel solar para sacar el agua de la biopiscina.
  • Manguera y goteros para el sistema de riego
  • Semillas y plántulas de calidad orgánica
  • Así cómo materiales para hacer los acabados y detalles: maderas, piedras volcánicas, árboles, etc. 

¡Este trabajo nunca se termina! Si llegamos a nuestro objetivo y lo superamos también podremos trabajar en lo siguiente:
  • Cambiar parte del techo del patio delantero para que entre más luz.
  • Cambiar la parte superior de la puerta de entrada para poner una ventana con herrería.
  • Proporcionar lo necesario a un artista local para hacer un paisaje con punto de fuga, donde estará la huerta.
  • Una página web.

Impacto
Sabemos que es difícil para un proyecto como el nuestro compensarte como deberíamos, nos encantaría que vinieses al restaurante y probarás alguno de nuestros platillos. Sin embargo, recuerda que además de ayudarnos a crear un espacio agradable, estas contribuyendo a demostrar que el reciclaje es una muy buena alternativa y también apoyas al comercio local mexicano (nos proveemos de las ciudades de San Andrés Cholula, Zacatlán, Libres y más) ya que al contribuir a mejorar este espacio automáticamente también apoyas a nuestros proveedores.


EN FRANCAIS 

Nous sommes Angeline et Jacobo. Moi française et lui mexicain, il y a presque un an nous avons lancé notre restaurant-galerie d’art appelé La Emisora Gourmet (L’émetteur gourmet). A La Emisora nous cherchons à être éco-responsables et durables dans l’espace semi-urbain qu’est San Andrés Cholula (état de Puebla dans le centre du Mexique).

Nous avons d’abord créé la partie restaurant dans laquelle nous proposons une cuisine franco-mexicaine et cuisine d’auteur. Nous utilisons une grande partie de produits bio, locaux, artisanaux et que nous savons de la meilleure qualité.

Apres avoir mis en place le restaurant nous avons décidé que nous allions avoir notre propre galerie d’art. Dans cet espace nous exhibons le travail de différents artistes locaux durant une période de deux mois. Pendant cette période nous générons une compensation pour l’artiste grâce aux pourboires du restaurant.

Au début de notre aventure la maison entière avait besoin d’un sérieux coup de jeune, petit à petit et les deux nous avons peint, écroulé des murs, fabriqué des meubles et dans le jardin nous avons construit une pergola faite de matériaux recyclés ! Nous avons utilisé ce que nous avons pu trouver dans les vides greniers mexicains (ici on parle plutôt d’endroit type décharge amélioré plutôt que brocante des quartiers chics de Paris), ce qu’on nous a gracieusement donné et surtout nos imaginations pour tirer au maximum profit des ressources disponibles (pour les intéressés nous pouvons fournir les recettes des peintures à la chaud, peinture à la farine pour extérieur et intérieur puisque nous avons repeint toute la maison grâce à ses astuces).


Le projet a besoin de vous

Nous allons bientôt fêter l’année d’existence de La Emisora et nous voudrions terminer notre système de production d’aliments et pour cela nous avons besoin d’aide extra ! Le système de production comprend :

  • Un potager pour lequel nous sélectionnerons graines et plantules de  qualité.
  • Un composteur qui grâce aux déchets végétaux du restaurant et de la maison produits un composte capable de nourrir correctement la terre.
  • Une biopiscine ou piscine naturelle dont l’écosystème filtrera et oxygénera l’eau (on ne met plus aucun produit chimique dans la piscine, tout est naturelle) et qui à la fois servira pour arroser le potager par un système d’arrosage goute à goute complétant ainsi les besoins en nutriments et nitrogène du potager.

 Comment nous utiliserons l’argent recolté

Comme objectif nous voulons produire de 25 à 30% de notre consommation de produit végétaux du restaurant. Nous avons déjà le composteur fonctionnel et une partie du potager, il nous faut donc terminer la biopiscine, le potager et le système d’arrosage.


Pour cela nous aurons besoin de :

  • Géotextil (type de tapis qui empêchera les racines de transpercer la biopiscine)
  • Géomembrane (qui empêchera a l’eau de s’infiltrer dans le sous-sol).
  • Plantes et algues aquatiques qui formeront l’écosystème ainsi que des poissons.
  • Pompe submersible solaire pour prélever l’eau de la biopiscine.
  • Tuyaux et gouteurs pour le système d’arrosage
  • Graines et plantules de qualité organiques
  • Et divers matériaux qui serviront pour les finitions des abords de la biopiscine : bois, pierres volcaniques, arbres, etc. 

Et le travail continue ! Si nous arrivons a notre objectif et le dépassons nous pourrons travailler sur les points suivants :

  • Changer une partie du toit du patio de La Emisora pour que plus de lumière puisse entrer.
  • Changer la partie supérieure de notre portail pour en faire une fenêtre et ainsi obtenir plus de visibilité depuis l’extérieur.
  • Faire venir un ou des artistes locaux pour réaliser une perspective en point de fuite dans le fond du potager et sur la devanture principale de la maison.
  • Mettre en place une page web.

Impacte

Rappelles toi qu’en plus de nous aider dans notre projet tu contribues a démontrer que le recyclage est une très bonne alternative et tu soutiens le commerce local mexicain puisque en nous soutenant tu nous permets de continuer à nous fournir en produits locaux d’excellente qualité.

Impacto


Sabemos que es difícil para un
	proyecto como el nuestro compensarte como deberíamos, nos
	encantaría que vinieses al restaurante y probarás alguno de
	nuestros platillos. Sin embargo, recuerda que además de ayudarnos a
	crear un espacio agradable, estas contribuyendo a demostrar que el
	reciclaje es una muy buena alternativa y también apoyas al comercio
	local mexicano (nos proveemos de las ciudades de San Andrés Cholula, Zacatlán, Libres y más) ya que al contribuir a mejorar este
	espacio automáticamente también apoyas a nuestros proveedores.

















EN FRANCAIS 

Nous sommes Angeline et Jacobo. Moi française et
lui mexicain, il y a presque un an nous avons lancé notre restaurant-galerie d’art
appelé La Emisora Gourmet (L’émetteur gourmet). A La Emisora nous cherchons à être
éco-responsables et durables dans l’espace semi-urbain qu’est San Andrés
Cholula (état de Puebla dans le centre du Mexique). 
Nous avons d’abord créé la partie restaurant
dans laquelle nous proposons une cuisine franco-mexicaine et cuisine d’auteur.
Nous utilisons une grande partie de produits bio, locaux, artisanaux et que
nous savons de la meilleure qualité. 
Apres avoir mis en place le restaurant nous
avons décidé que nous allions avoir notre propre galerie d’art. Dans cet espace
nous exhibons le travail de différents artistes locaux durant une période de
deux mois. Pendant cette période nous générons une compensation pour l’artiste grâce
aux pourboires du restaurant.
Au début de notre aventure la
maison entière avait besoin d’un sérieux coup de jeune, petit à petit et les
deux nous avons peint, écroulé des murs, fabriqué des meubles et dans le jardin
nous avons construit une pergola faite de matériaux recyclés ! Nous
avons utilisé ce que nous avons pu trouver dans les vides greniers mexicains (ici
on parle plutôt d’endroit type décharge amélioré plutôt que brocante des
quartiers chics de Paris), ce qu’on nous a gracieusement donné et surtout nos
imaginations pour tirer au maximum profit des ressources disponibles (pour les intéressés
nous pouvons fournir les recettes des peintures à la chaud, peinture à la
farine pour extérieur et intérieur puisque nous avons repeint toute la maison grâce
à ses astuces). 

Le projet a besoin de vous
Nous allons bientôt fêter l’année d’existence de La Emisora et nous
voudrions terminer notre système de production d’aliments et pour cela nous
avons besoin d’aide extra ! Le système de production comprend :



Un potager pour lequel nous sélectionnerons graines et plantules de
      qualité. 
Un composteur qui grâce aux déchets végétaux du restaurant et de la
     maison produits un composte capable de nourrir correctement la terre.
Une biopiscine ou piscine naturelle dont l’écosystème filtrera et oxygénera
     l’eau (on ne met plus aucun produit chimique dans la piscine, tout est
     naturelle) et qui à la fois servira pour arroser le potager par un système
     d’arrosage goute à goute complétant ainsi les besoins en nutriments et nitrogène
     du potager.

 Comment nous
utiliserons l’argent recolté
Comme objectif nous voulons produire de 25 à 30% de notre consommation
de produit végétaux du restaurant. Nous avons déjà le composteur fonctionnel et
une partie du potager, il nous faut donc terminer la biopiscine, le potager et
le système d’arrosage. 

Pour cela nous aurons besoin de : 



Géotextil (type de tapis qui empêchera les racines de transpercer
     la biopiscine) 
Géomembrane (qui empêchera a l’eau de s’infiltrer dans le sous-sol).
Plantes et algues aquatiques qui formeront l’écosystème ainsi que
     des poissons.
Pompe submersible solaire pour prélever l’eau de la biopiscine.
Tuyaux et gouteurs pour le système d’arrosage
Graines et plantules de qualité organiques
Et divers matériaux qui serviront pour les finitions des abords de
     la biopiscine : bois, pierres volcaniques, arbres, etc. 

Et le travail continue ! Si nous arrivons a notre objectif et le dépassons
nous pourrons travailler sur les points suivants : 

Changer une partie du toit du patio de La Emisora pour que plus de lumière
     puisse entrer.
Changer la partie supérieure de notre portail pour en faire une fenêtre
     et ainsi obtenir plus de visibilité depuis l’extérieur.
Faire venir un ou des artistes locaux pour réaliser une perspective
     en point de fuite dans le fond du potager et sur la devanture principale
     de la maison. 
Mettre en place une page web. 

Impacte
Rappelles toi qu’en plus de nous aider dans
notre projet tu contribues a démontrer que le recyclage est une très bonne
alternative et tu soutiens le commerce local mexicain puisque en nous soutenant
tu nous permets de continuer à nous fournir en produits locaux d’excellente
qualité.

story:
Bel Essence Skincare is getting a facelift!  Bel Essence is a growing natural skincare brand receiving high marks on review websites (4+), and has recently grabbed the attention of national media for an upcoming television appearance.   This campaign is to bring our customers new, beautiful packaging and new products that will make your skin healthy and youthful.

We want to thank all of our customers who have enjoyed our products and helped our growing success.  We are partnering with Linger Magazine, an award-winning, high fashion and art online publication to launch this campaign.

Together we want to give our customers and subscribers - and those who don't yet know us - a touch of luxury:

  • Stock up or try skincare products at a discount
  • Receive a sneak preview of our newest product
  • Enjoy Linger Magazine's online and print publication
  • Experience Moda 360: LA 2017 as a guest of Linger Magazine and Bel Essence
  • And more special perks added as we go along!  

Bel Essence (www.belessence.com) is a natural skin care collection with a difference. Based on a simple idea, Bel Essence gives skin the nutrition it needs to heal, regenerate and rejuvenate itself, combining ingredients just as nature herself manufactures them to give the full benefits of each ingredient.  Bel Essence combines natural and organic oils that are the richest sources of vitamins, antioxidants, omega 3's and fatty acids, the essential components for healthy, youthful skin.  Bel Essence gives skin what nature intended and selects and combines oils with beneficial properties for maximum results without harmful chemicals; nourishing skin to give both instant improvement and long term transformation.

OUR PRODUCTS:

Anti-aging Cream:  Our Best-Seller

You are never too young to protect your skin from the signs of again!  Our anti-aging cream is a mix of 9 oils all with high nutritional content, containing antioxidants to prevent and reverse the signs of aging, sterolins that help in collagen production and reduce age spots, essential fatty acids that hydrate and moisturize the skin, and vitamins and minerals such as A, C, D and E that increase cell turnover, brighten skin and protect the skin from sun damage.  Argan, Sesame, Almond and Avocado oils are well-known for their ability to reduce wrinkles, even skin tone, hydrate skin, and help reverse sun damage.  This is a gentle, effective cream to help your skin look its best at any age!

WHAT OUR CUSTOMERS SAY:

“Since I could no longer obtain my face moisturizer...I decided to give Bel Essence a try….What I thought was a greasy feel in all reality was a dewy feel on the skin.  AWESOME....truthfully, I am ordering more and you will not regret buying this cream also. I am very proud to give this product a 5 star rating.“  NELDA,  VERIFIED PURCHASE

"After just a few applications, my skin is almost wrinkle free. I'm in my early forties and the wrinkles were present, especially on my forehead, between the brows, under the eyes, and on the throat...While I will still use Lancome products to clean my face, I have switched to Bel Essence for wrinkle relief. I am very happy to save lots of money on a safe and effective moisturizing, wrinkle fighting product." J.K. VERIFIED PURCHASE

"I have only been using this for three weeks but my skin is soft. I really notice the difference. It is not greasy and only a little is all you need. I am 75 yrs old and love the product. I even think the dark spots are starting to fade. Can't wait to see what happens after using it for several more weeks. Very good product so far."Dorothy C., VERIFIED PURCHASE

Anti-Aging Oil Treatment: 

For a 100% natural skin care routine, this oil combines 5 powerful oils:  Grapeseed, Argan, Avocado, Almond and Sesame to give you maximum nutrition for healthy skin.  Grapeseed oil is high in antioxidants which fight free radicals that cause damage to the skin, flavanoids that can inhibit allergic reactions, and may help fight skin problems such as eczema or psoriasis and protects your skin's natural collagen.  Argan oil is high in vitamin E, essential fatty acids and antioxidants, which help with many skin conditions, from dry skin and wrinkles to psoriasis, eczema and acne. Rich in vitamin E and antioxidants, it protects against the visible signs of aging. Saponins and triterpenoids in argan oil promote healing and hydration, and the unsaturated fatty acids omega-9 (oleic acid) and omega-6 (linoleic acid) help improve the condition of your skin and hair, and the sterolins support cell turnover and help retain moisture.  Avocado oil is absorbed by the deep layers of the skin and because of its ability to retain water, it acts as an emollient, promoting soft and supple skin. The sterolins help produce more skin collagen and reduce age spots.  Sesame Oil is nutrient rich, containing Vitamins E, K, B6, as well as phosphorus, copper, calcium, zinc, magnesium, omega-3 and phytosterol. It is antibacterial in nature, and has anti-inflammatory properties. It also contains sesamol, shown to prevent fine lines and wrinkles from appearing, and the oil has the ability to attract and trap toxins soluble in oil and aids in the detoxification of the skin.  Almond oil contains high amounts of Vitamins E and D, magnesium, and calcium.  It moisturizes and nourishes the skin, helps your skin retain or restore its glow, and lightens dark circles under the eyes.

Added bonus - The oil treatment is also great for hair, so it will help improve your eyebrows and eyelashes!

WHAT OUR CUSTOMERS SAY:

"My wife is now also using the Bel Essence "Organic Anti-Wrinkle Oil Treatment." My wife is a face and figure model and relies on her lovely skin. She knows cosmetic, skin nourishment quite well, having more organic treatments than I have ever seen. She now uses this every day. I can tell you that she was starting to get a little sun aging on the driver side of her face from all the hours driving to/from modelling gigs. That has all but disappeared." Danmirage, VERIFIED PURCHASE

"I just ordered my second bottle of this (first lasted several months). I am extremely prone to acne breakouts, whiteheads and blackheads even at my advanced age of 65+. I use it every morning after applying a saclicylic acid and then apply an oil free moisturizer on top of the Bel Essence.  I notice a definite diminution difference in my nose/chin lines and my skin feels wonderful and soft. Other products I have used that were much more expensive, often clogged my pores or felt greasy; not this one!  I definitely recommend this product."  Crystal S., VERIFIED PURCHASE

Skin Restoring Lotion:  Launched this year, our lotion is quickly becoming a popular product!  Hemp and Argan oils lead the pack and give your skin a powerhouse of vitamins, antioxidants, fatty acids, omega 3's and 6's that are essential to regenerate healthy skin cells for hydrated, firm, smooth and soft skin.  Also great as a facial day cream, it is a spectacular lotion for your entire body!

WHAT OUR CUSTOMERS SAY:

"This is a must-have for my daily skincare routine.  The cream works well for me as a night cream and I was so happy to find this to use during the day.  It is wonderful as a facial cream, and has reversed the dry cracked skin on my hands and elbows.  My legs have always been dry and I haven't wanted to go bare-skinned, I have to wear panty hose to cover them up, but after only a couple of applications, my skin is so soft and hydrated, I don't hesitate to bare my legs!"  Dolores D., VERIFIED PURCHASE

NEW! Intensive dry skin relief:  Our latest cream takes the best of our lotion and anti-aging cream and combines it with additional oils that are centuries-old treatments for severe dry skin conditions including eczema and psoriasis.  Combining hemp, argan, almond, sesame and other oils, this cream helps heal dry, cracked skin and renew the health and youthful condition of your skin.  This new product will launch after our campaign, but you can get a sneak peak and first try now!

Products in the works:  With additional funds from this campaign, we will develop products that treat and nourish all the different skin types.  There are a number of oils (yes, oils!) that actually help reduce oil production while giving your skin the same healthy, youthful benefits of our other products!  Supporters of this campaign will be given special offers for our new products.

Anti-aging cream and oil for oily and breakout prone skin
Firming skin toner
Deep cleaning mask

And more!

OUR PARTNER:  LINGER MAGAZINE

Linger Magazine (www.lingermagazine.com) is a luxury publication built for aficionados with a fondness for fashion, beauty and the arts. Over the past six years, Linger Magazine has established itself as a resource for luminous beauty discovery, divulging content and intriguing editorials.  Linger Magazine has gained validation as a respected media platform with a nomination by Niche Media as one of the Top 20 Best Niche Magazines. The celebrated publication has been supported by PYP Summit, Pencil Me In Cosmetics, Bel Essence, and JAMAH Handbags. 

Linger Magazine offers a different perspective on fashion, beauty and art not found in any other publication.  Linger continues to be recognized as a quality, insightful magazine and the Linger team is regularly invited to attend prestigious fashion, film, art and beauty events. 


Bel Essence and Linger Magazine are sponsors of Moda 360, an event fusing fashion, art and film.  With their support of the event, independent fashion designers, artists and filmmakers from around the world have a platform to present their work across three creative industries.  Our customers and subscribers enable us to help other emerging creative artists achieve their goals.  This crowdfunding campaign will also allow us to increase our support for other up and coming creative entrepreneurs participating in Moda 360.


Share our campaign with your friends!

story:
About Us

     About a year ago we purchased an 87 acre parcel of land to start our dream farm on.  We intended to build a small homestead for the function of providing for ourselves, but it didn't take long to take on bigger dreams of a legitimate farm that provides for the community, not just ourselves.  We sunk all our savings and even cashed out our retirement to start the infrastructure of the farm.  We have accomplished a lot in a year.  But we have so much more we want to do!  
     Here at Olde Haven Farm, we believe in knowing where our food comes from.  We believe that our animals deserve a happy healthy life with the ability to do what comes natural to them.  Chickens forage for bugs in the fields.  Sheep graze on lush green pastures with the goats near by.  Ducks have access to ponds any time they want.  We also believe in using the resources that our land provides for us, and being good stewards of our land.  We do not want to destroy the land but build it up, improving soil, trees, and fields.  We practice rotational grazing to allow land to recover from animals and to provide the animals with the best grazing and nutrition available.  

Why you should care

The number of farmers in America keeps declining and the farmers that are left are getting older.  The average age for a farmer in the US is 58.3 (2012 Census statistics).  That number has continually risen over the past 30 years.  While it may seem like farming is trendy right now, the statistics show that the number of new farmers dropped 20% from 2007.  It’s not clear what contributes most to the lack of younger farmers.  Perhaps it’s the notion of hard work that scares people, or how difficult it seems to be to make a profit off a farm, or maybe it has more to do with the big farming corporations that exist today.  But unless younger people get involved in farming, we risk losing farms all together.  

Project Hay 

     We have a hay shortage in our area right now.  People just can't find the hay they need.  Suppliers and farmers alike are sold out of what they can provide to others.  And hay is such a vital resource to any farmer with animals.  We have heard many stories of farmers having to downsize herds simply because they cannot find the hay they need to get through the winter months.  
     Our plan all along has been to do our own haying.  We have purchased all the equipment we need.  Right now we have just been cutting a smaller front field.  But we have dreams of getting a larger 20 acre hayfield in the our back field up and running. 
     This is a picture of our back field right now:

     It needs to be destumped (which will require renting an excavator and/or bulldozer) and cleaned up, then plowed, fertilized and seeded to create a 20 acre field that we can hay.  The hay field is our top priority right now so we can provide hay for our animals during the winter months as well as provide hay for the community.  
          Costs:
                         Equipment Rental/Fuel Costs  $3000
                         Manure  $2000
                         Lime  $3000
                         Seed $4000

Project Raise The Barn

     We have slowly been building a new barn to house animals and store hay.  This is exactly where we are at right now:

     The roof is on, and we have started the framing on the back.
     We want to be very honest about this, we do already have a bunch of the materials for the framing and we plan on siding with wood cut and milled from our own lot.  So while we still need to do a lot of work, a lot of the materials are already taken care of.   But things add up so fast, here's what we still need to finish the barn:
         Costs:
                        Screws & Hardware  $1000
                        Additional framing materials  $1000
                        Gravel   $1000
                        Equipment Rental (for grading)  $500
                        A Helping Hand     priceless.

Project Paddocks A'Plenty

     Here at Olde Haven Farm we believe in rotational grazing.  We have sheep and goats in one fenced in paddock for a time, then before the paddock gets overgrazed we move them to the next paddock.  We'd like to add at least 3 more fenced in paddocks for our sheep and goats.  
     An example of our current paddocks:

And this is an area that we would like to create paddocks in:

Simple as that.
          Costs:
                        Fence Posts $1500
                        Field Fencing  $2000
                        Gates (4)  $600

Project Hog Alley

     We've already talked about how we like rotational grazing, well it's even more important for us with our pigs.  We raise our pigs in a wooded part of our land.  We have paddocks to rotate the pigs through because pigs can be wonderful for the ground, but let's face it, they can also do a lot of damage if kept too long in one area.  

     We want to have a path that that goes pretty far back that is just lined with pig paddocks on each side of it.  We've got a few already, but we are hoping for at least 10 more paddocks!  That may sound like a lot, but like I said, pigs can do damage if they stay in the same place too long.  Plus we have noticed that they love being able to explore new areas.  

        Costs:

                        Fence Posts  $2000

                        Wire  $400

                        Insulators  $1000

                        Gates (11)  $1100

                        Shelter Hardware & Roofing  $1600


Project Water System

     We currently do all of our watering by hand, meaning we carry buckets and buckets of water down the hill, and have hoses strung all over the place.  Which in the Summer months may not seem that bad...we are getting good exercise, right?  But as things freeze, watering seems to become this impossible task.  We are lucky enough to have a well already dug right beside our new barn.  But we need to set up a system to get the water out of the well and to the animals that need it.  That will involve building a small well house that can be kept above freezing in the Winter that will contain the pump and equipment for a running water system.  
     Because of Maine's severe Winters, the piping to the paddocks must be installed a minimum of 4 feet deep to avoid freezing.  We have a small backhoe attachment for our tractor but we still need to get a power beyond that will adapt the hydraulics of the tractor to operate the backhoe.  Unfortunately that is not a cheap piece.  Parts and labor, we are told, will be around $1000. So you will see that listed in the costs.  
         Costs:
                    Well House materials  $2000
                    Pump and Piping  $5000
                    Tractor Modifications  $1000

Who should contribute

     We want people to contribute to this campaign because they are passionate about farms or our personal farm values.  We want to reach those people who can be excited about providing more space for sheep grazing, who love hearing of chickens that run all over the farm instead of being cooped up in small spaces, and who enjoy hearing of farmers who value the land and the soil as much as the animals.  You can be a part of this farm, even if you never step foot on it.  But for some, you just want to support our family, and we thank you for that as well (even if you think we may be a little crazy).  We are dreaming big, and you can be a part of that.  Thank you!  

Other Ways You Can Help

     If you cannot give money at this time, there are other ways to help out!  If you are local, we have many jobs around the farm you could give us a helping hand with.  But if you are not local, there is one important way you can help: you can help spread the news of this campaign.  Tell your friends who may be interested.  Share the link on Facebook.  I cannot even express how thankful we are for you sharing about our farm.  That is what is going to get the farm up and running.  
**Another way to help:
Christmas week, somebody came in and stole over $5000 worth of tools.  Tools we need.  We can't continue progress on the barn or much of anything else without our tools.  We've had a request to put up a list of tools on Amazon, and if people want to buy a tool instead of give to the campaign, that would be welcomed as well.  Unfortunately, the thieves stole high end tools, so they are not cheap pieces, even the batteries are expensive.  And not all of the tools are on Amazon.  But, you can view some of the tools on the amazon wish list here: 
http://amzn.com/w/2C4OA2W8CZXQT

We are so excited to be able to give you updates about our farm through the campaign and on our farm Facebook page.  I hope for lots of updates to give.  

Update:
The shirt and mug will have something like this on them for design:
story_txt:
About Us
     About a year ago we purchased an 87 acre parcel of land to start our dream farm on.  We intended to build a small homestead for the function of providing for ourselves, but it didn't take long to take on bigger dreams of a legitimate farm that provides for the community, not just ourselves.  We sunk all our savings and even cashed out our retirement to start the infrastructure of the farm.  We have accomplished a lot in a year.  But we have so much more we want to do!  
     Here at Olde Haven Farm, we believe in knowing where our food comes from.  We believe that our animals deserve a happy healthy life with the ability to do what comes natural to them.  Chickens forage for bugs in the fields.  Sheep graze on lush green pastures with the goats near by.  Ducks have access to ponds any time they want.  We also believe in using the resources that our land provides for us, and being good stewards of our land.  We do not want to destroy the land but build it up, improving soil, trees, and fields.  We practice rotational grazing to allow land to recover from animals and to provide the animals with the best grazing and nutrition available.  

Why you should careThe number of farmers in America keeps declining and the farmers that are left are getting older.  The average age for a farmer in the US is 58.3 (2012 Census statistics).  That number has continually risen over the past 30 years.  While it may seem like farming is trendy right now, the statistics show that the number of new farmers dropped 20% from 2007.  It’s not clear what contributes most to the lack of younger farmers.  Perhaps it’s the notion of hard work that scares people, or how difficult it seems to be to make a profit off a farm, or maybe it has more to do with the big farming corporations that exist today.  But unless younger people get involved in farming, we risk losing farms all together.  
Project Hay 
     We have a hay shortage in our area right now.  People just can't find the hay they need.  Suppliers and farmers alike are sold out of what they can provide to others.  And hay is such a vital resource to any farmer with animals.  We have heard many stories of farmers having to downsize herds simply because they cannot find the hay they need to get through the winter months.  

     Our plan all along has been to do our own haying.  We have purchased all the equipment we need.  Right now we have just been cutting a smaller front field.  But we have dreams of getting a larger 20 acre hayfield in the our back field up and running. 
     This is a picture of our back field right now:

     It needs to be destumped (which will require renting an excavator and/or bulldozer) and cleaned up, then plowed, fertilized and seeded to create a 20 acre field that we can hay.  The hay field is our top priority right now so we can provide hay for our animals during the winter months as well as provide hay for the community.  
          Costs:
                         Equipment Rental/Fuel Costs  $3000
                         Manure  $2000
                         Lime  $3000
                         Seed $4000

Project Raise The Barn
     We have slowly been building a new barn to house animals and store hay.  This is exactly where we are at right now:

     The roof is on, and we have started the framing on the back.
     We want to be very honest about this, we do already have a bunch of the materials for the framing and we plan on siding with wood cut and milled from our own lot.  So while we still need to do a lot of work, a lot of the materials are already taken care of.   But things add up so fast, here's what we still need to finish the barn:
         Costs:
                        Screws & Hardware  $1000
                        Additional framing materials  $1000
                        Gravel   $1000                        Equipment Rental (for grading)  $500
                        A Helping Hand     priceless.

Project Paddocks A'Plenty
     Here at Olde Haven Farm we believe in rotational grazing.  We have sheep and goats in one fenced in paddock for a time, then before the paddock gets overgrazed we move them to the next paddock.  We'd like to add at least 3 more fenced in paddocks for our sheep and goats.  
     An example of our current paddocks:




And this is an area that we would like to create paddocks in:

Simple as that.
          Costs:
                        Fence Posts $1500
                        Field Fencing  $2000
                        Gates (4)  $600

Project Hog Alley
     We've already talked about how we like rotational grazing, well it's even more important for us with our pigs.  We raise our pigs in a wooded part of our land.  We have paddocks to rotate the pigs through because pigs can be wonderful for the ground, but let's face it, they can also do a lot of damage if kept too long in one area.  




     We want to have a path that that goes pretty far back that is just lined with pig paddocks on each side of it.  We've got a few already, but we are hoping for at least 10 more paddocks!  That may sound like a lot, but like I said, pigs can do damage if they stay in the same place too long.  Plus we have noticed that they love being able to explore new areas.  

        Costs:
                        Fence Posts  $2000
                        Wire  $400
                        Insulators  $1000
                        Gates (11)  $1100
                        Shelter Hardware & Roofing  $1600


Project Water System     We currently do all of our watering by hand, meaning we carry buckets and buckets of water down the hill, and have hoses strung all over the place.  Which in the Summer months may not seem that bad...we are getting good exercise, right?  But as things freeze, watering seems to become this impossible task.  We are lucky enough to have a well already dug right beside our new barn.  But we need to set up a system to get the water out of the well and to the animals that need it.  That will involve building a small well house that can be kept above freezing in the Winter that will contain the pump and equipment for a running water system.  
     Because of Maine's severe Winters, the piping to the paddocks must be installed a minimum of 4 feet deep to avoid freezing.  We have a small backhoe attachment for our tractor but we still need to get a power beyond that will adapt the hydraulics of the tractor to operate the backhoe.  Unfortunately that is not a cheap piece.  Parts and labor, we are told, will be around $1000. So you will see that listed in the costs.           Costs:                    Well House materials  $2000                    Pump and Piping  $5000                    Tractor Modifications  $1000
Who should contribute
     We want people to contribute to this campaign because they are passionate about farms or our personal farm values.  We want to reach those people who can be excited about providing more space for sheep grazing, who love hearing of chickens that run all over the farm instead of being cooped up in small spaces, and who enjoy hearing of farmers who value the land and the soil as much as the animals.  You can be a part of this farm, even if you never step foot on it.  But for some, you just want to support our family, and we thank you for that as well (even if you think we may be a little crazy).  We are dreaming big, and you can be a part of that.  Thank you!  

Other Ways You Can Help
     If you cannot give money at this time, there are other ways to help out!  If you are local, we have many jobs around the farm you could give us a helping hand with.  But if you are not local, there is one important way you can help: you can help spread the news of this campaign.  Tell your friends who may be interested.  Share the link on Facebook.  I cannot even express how thankful we are for you sharing about our farm.  That is what is going to get the farm up and running.  
**Another way to help:Christmas week, somebody came in and stole over $5000 worth of tools.  Tools we need.  We can't continue progress on the barn or much of anything else without our tools.  We've had a request to put up a list of tools on Amazon, and if people want to buy a tool instead of give to the campaign, that would be welcomed as well.  Unfortunately, the thieves stole high end tools, so they are not cheap pieces, even the batteries are expensive.  And not all of the tools are on Amazon.  But, you can view some of the tools on the amazon wish list here: 
http://amzn.com/w/2C4OA2W8CZXQT


We are so excited to be able to give you updates about our farm through the campaign and on our farm Facebook page.  I hope for lots of updates to give.

story:
Our Vision

True Respite Brewing Company is bringing a brand new craft beer destination to Bethesda, Maryland. We’ll brew the Washington DC region’s best beer and serve it in an open, communal, tap room meant for long stays shared with great company.

This project is ambitious; we know that. Bethesda is expensive, urban, and relatively unfamiliar with the destination brewery and tap room concept. However, it's also wealthy, densely populated, and nearly barren of delicious, local craft beer. We see an opportunity to become the beating heart of a newly burgeoning craft beer scene in Bethesda and throughout the Washington D.C. region.

What We Need

We are humbly asking you to help us achieve our crowdfunding goal of $225,000 so that we may reach the Small Business Administration's liquid cash requirement for loan approval.

The SBA has required that we show proof of possessing 30% of our entire project's projected capital costs in liquid cash before we may be approved for an SBA loan to fund the remainder of the project. We are currently $225,000 short of reaching that critical goal. Once we've acquired enough cash and the SBA has decided to approve us for the loan, the project will move full steam ahead.

It is important for you to understand that we, the founders, will be personally guaranteeing 100% of that True Respite loan. We are quite literally putting every single dime we have and every asset we own on the line to acquire this loan. We believe in this business and we believe in ourselves.

Please help us finally make our dream come true as we bring the people of Bethesda, Maryland, the destination brewery and tap room they deserve.

What You Get

In addition to our sincerest gratitude, we are honored to reward cash contributors with the following:

  • Merchandise!
  • Private Tours!
  • Private Parties!
  • A brew day with the Brewmaster in the True Respite brewery!
  • The right to name a fermenter!
  • Invitation to join our secret society, The Chilluminati
  • I dunno, bees?
  • So much more!

Check out the "Perks" section for more specific details on the contribution tiers and their perks. If we hadn't already poured so much cash into this thing, we'd be all over those contribution tiers. Maybe not the bees, though.

The Impact

You could be our hero; our legend, even. This could be your legacy. This is that big. Today, our business plan, some legal documents, and a pretty neat logo and crest are all we have to show for the past year and a half of endless hard work and thousands of dollars spent. But with your help, we could be breaking ground on an iconic destination brewery in very short order.

This isn't just for us, though. Sure, it's our dream. It's our passion. It's our raison d'être. But this is also for our customers. Bethesda, Maryland's only brewery is a small setup inside the Rock Bottom restaurant located in town. For those unfamiliar, Rock Bottom is a national restaurant and brewpub chain owned under the same corporate parent as the Gordon Biersch brewpubs, the Denver ChopHouse, the Walnut Brewery, and that neat little brewpub at the Boardwalk hotel in Disney World. Although they make pretty good beer, the business is hardly local and certainly not unique.

Meanwhile, craft beer is growing by leaps and bounds all across America. Denver, Colorado, alone has over 90 breweries and is still growing. Yet despite its meteoric growth nationwide, Bethesda, Maryland, a city with over 450,000 people living within just 5 miles of its central downtown area, has somehow managed to play host to one single brewery stuck inside a national restaurant and brewpub chain. That's it. This, in the city ranked the #1 most educated place in America by Forbes and the top earning town in America by Time in 2014 alone.

It's not a coincidence.

Montgomery County, the county in which Bethesda resides, previously prohibited the sale of beer from producers to on-premise customers and off-premise retailers. That all changed in July of 2014 when a new law was passed that finally allowed breweries to sell their wares directly to customers and retailers alike. However, in the wake of this monumental law change, only two craft microbreweries have subsequently managed to open their doors in the entirety of the county.

It's time to fill that void. We can stand up and usher America's craft beer revolution straight into Bethesda. Its residents are primed and ready. We are primed and ready. All we need is your help.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest risk lies in the SBA's formal underwriting process. We are raising these funds to meet the liquid cash requirement that our SBA rep team has quoted to us after providing them with our personal and business financials. Our rep team indicated that with our current financial status, we would need at least 30% of the total project costs in liquid capital to go forward with underwriting. This fundraising campaign will get us to that mark. At that point, it is in the hands of the SBA's underwriting team to approve the loan.

As with any underwriting process, there is always the risk, however small, that the loan is not approved and cash is not disbursed. To the best of our knowledge, we do not know of any reason why this might happen and we have the utmost confidence that our SBA rep team is leading us towards success. However, it is important to note that SBA loan denial is possible and is the primary risk to the project. In the case of SBA loan denial, we will evaluate where we stand and make an informed decision on how to proceed. We will keep all of our contributors in communication as we move through the process. We do not take your generous contributions lightly.

The other risk for this crowdfunding campaign is that we do not meet our cash fundraising goal, thereby preventing us from entering into the underwriting process in the first place. In order to mitigate this risk, we are continuing to pursue alternate routes of raising cash in parallel to this crowdfunding campaign. One avenue we are pursuing is the sale of equity in the business to private investors. Please contact Bailey or Brendan O'Leary at True Respite if you are curious about purchasing an equity stake in the business. For reference, the minimum cash requirement for equity investment is $9,000.

In the unfortunate case that we do not meet our crowdfunding campaign's fundraising goal by the campaign deadline, we will still continue our efforts to sell equity in the business privately until such a point that we are either fully funded, capable of reapplying for an SBA loan, or no longer believe that our business plan is feasible as it exists. Should the latter occur, we will be reevaluating all facets of the business including the option to cancel the project and reimburse the funds contributed back to the contributors, less any costs, fees, etc. that we have incurred only as a direct result of the crowdfunding process. We will not spend the money unless we have raised enough to complete our project.

This potential reimbursement is not required of the platform nor any laws that we are aware of, but we feel it is the right thing to do for our supporters. However, let's hope that the day never comes.

Other Ways You Can Help

Sharing is caring! We'd really appreciate your help in getting this fundraising campaign absolutely as much exposure as possible. We know sometimes it's hard to think of who you might share us with, so we've compiled a short list to help get your brain kickstarted:

  • Your friends
  • Your parents
  • Your siblings
  • Your estranged niece (and her rich uncle)
  • Your dog
  • Rick Steves
  • Notch
  • Your college roommate
  • That strange person you met on the bus that one time
  • Your ex (even though you've totally moved on)
  • Your fantasy league
  • Your dungeon dwelling peers
  • A pragmatic urban explorer (yes, any one will do)
  • Your SCUBA instructor
  • That cute Starbucks barista at that ultra-convenient corner location
  • EVERYONE!

It takes a healthy combination of personal messages to close friends and family along with shares on social media for projects like this to realize their greatest potential. Whatever you can spend a moment doing to make a difference will really help us. We know it's tough, but this is our dream and we can't do it without you.

Thank you, and...

CHEERS!

story:
Summary of the Campaign

furnT started as a concept of custom, hand-crafted decor and furniture and with the help of a few friends, who all specialize in different aspects of art and design, furnT is no longer just an idea, but still not quite a reality. To make this reality permanent, we have a bit of housekeeping to do, and this is where you come in. No, we aren't asking you to come over and clean the house (but if you want to...). Instead, we need help raising money to get our shop up and running. Once we are able to function in our shop, we will be able to introduce compelling, innovative, and naturally beautiful pieces of custom decor and furniture into the lives our clients. Please read through the summary of our needs below and check out pictures of all the incentives! (Larger pictures of all of the incentives can be found in the gallery tab above.)


What We Need 

Our goal is to raise $5,000 which will fund repairs on the shop and purchase of necessary tools, all of which are listed below:

  • Repair of the roof and floor. (Water damage is a pain in the butt)
  • Table Saw
  • Compound Saw
  • Drill Press
  • Router Table
  • Bench Sander
  • Miscellaneous Tool Accessories (Drill Bits, Clamps, etc.)
  • Dust Collection System

We are fortunate to have a space to work in but it needs some TLC. Without an orderly and functioning shop, it will be nearly impossible to meet client standards or deadlines. With your help, we're confident that we will be able to produce quality products that everyone will want in their homes.


Incentives

The incentive received depends on the donation made.
For those that are able to donate $50+ will receive raffle tickets towards 1 of 8 hand-crafted game sets which include:
  • Dominoes
  • Yahtzee
  • Chinese Checkers
  • Connect Four
Each game set (with the exception of Connect Four) comes with a hand-built wooden box to store all game pieces. 
At the end of the campaign, 8 names will be pulled and those will be the winners of the 8 hand-crafted game sets. 


Other Ways You Can Help

The success of this IndieGoGo campaign is contingent upon spreading the word to as many people as possible. Sharing this campaign with your community is invaluable to us, especially if that means we can reach someone who is looking for solid, honest and beautiful decor and furniture. The more people who see this, the more likely it will be that we can reach our goal, so share on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, or all of the above! Thank you for the opportunity to share our story. Be sure to follow our journey on Instagram @furntdecor.

    Incentives
The incentive received depends on the donation made.
For those that are able to donate $50+ will receive raffle tickets towards 1 of 8 hand-crafted game sets which include:

Dominoes
Yahtzee

Chinese Checkers

Connect Four


Each game set (with the exception of Connect Four) comes with a hand-built wooden box to store all game pieces. 
At the end of the campaign, 8 names will be pulled and those will be the winners of the 8 hand-crafted game sets. 


    Other Ways You Can Help 
The success of this IndieGoGo campaign is contingent upon spreading the word to as many people as possible. Sharing this campaign with your community is invaluable to us, especially if that means we can reach someone who is looking for solid, honest and beautiful decor and furniture. The more people who see this, the more likely it will be that we can reach our goal, so share on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, or all of the above! Thank you for the opportunity to share our story. Be sure to follow our journey on Instagram @furntdecor.
